If you manage to get an outside seat views are great so I would suggest you book before you go.  No table service either.

title: Saturday Brunch ...
comment: Location and view wise this has to be one of the best rooftops in London. We booked an early pre theatre brunch, and had a delightful couple of hours. It wasn't cheap, the food was good not great, and the service bordered between attentive and forgetful, but overall it's well worth a visit.

title: Amazing!
comment: Booked this for a friends birthday! absolutely beautiful! the views and drinks are great! Try their triple cooked chips! wow!

title: Amazing views and drinks!
comment: Been wanting to come here for ages and finally did and can't wait to go back. Views were amazing but would recommend booking as we didn't and no tables outside but all the doors are open and you can go outside for views still. Waitress come to your table too and bring your drinks cocktails were lush! Played music too so could stay from daytime into the night.

title: Awful service
comment: Each time I visit here the service is so appallingly shoddy that I swear to never return but those amazing views do tempt me back. However, I can safely say never again. The staff attitude and service is awful. Agree with the earlier comments that they deliberately keep an huge queue outside then when you eventually get in find it half empty. When we queried this we were told we should've made a reservation...well we tried for two hours but clearly answering the phone is beneath them. We left as quickly as possible and went to the Skygarden bar (without a reservation) where we were accommodated without any fuss and the service was wonderful. For other rooftop bars with an outdoor area instead of here I can recommend the service and atmosphere at both Madison and Forest on the Roof at selfridges.

title: Appalling customer service!!
comment: Do not chose this venue for an event! The staff are very rude and unreliable. Worst customer service I've seen in a long time, particularly 'carla' who refused to let me speak to a certain member of staff. Very disappointing

title: Great view - service can be better
comment: Went here for a drink (afternoon). Has a great wiew - as you can see major known Places in London from here. Great selections of drinks, but as only 2 kinds of beer and NO tap beer.  Service can BE a lot better. First of all it was not crowdy so the time spent serving 3 beers should be a lot faster. Second, we tried ordering 3 times before the could bring the beers...  Great place - service should be better !

title: Food amazing, service awful
comment: Went here for afternoon tea with my girlfriend for our one year anniversary, there afternoon tea was amazing, probably the best I've ever had...  The service though-Awful!  You will have to ask for something at least two times for it to get done. They kept saying sorry and offering champagne as some sort of compensation for there awful service.  Food was really good, and that's the only reason they got 3* instead of 1* cause that service did surely deserve 1* Thanks

title: Fabulous darling!
comment: Wow what a great afternoon! We had a fab time and our 2 hour lunch lasted 5 hours in a hazy mix of champagne and cocktails. Sun was out and the view is fascinating. We had the use of a cabana and very friendly hospitable staff. That said the actual service wasn't great as we had to ask for drinks/food items several times and the bill was incorrect. All easily resolved but could have been better. Not a cheap place for drink but the cocktails were lovely and we will definitely be back soon!! if like to try the afternoon tea.

title: Fab place
comment: Cocktails are fab - kiss of a rose and remember me were the ones I had. Tapas good and views amazing the only thing I would say as a negative was the music and how loud it was and also the genre wasn't great. This place could be amazing but was pretty good.

title: Very cool bar
comment: This very cool bar with sharply dressed cool cat staff. The day we went was very quiet and wet outside but that didn't ruin our experience. We had afternoon tea, all I can say is try it out! The food is well presented and very tasty with a lot of thought behind it and you will be leaving with cakes that you just can't squeeze in.  The staff were very attentive and friendly and the manager came over and said hi to ask about our experience which is always nice. The only thing that could have made this better would be the weather but we will have more luck with that next time we visit.  Try this place out before it becomes too popular.  It is quite expensive but well worth it I say...

title: Fabulous views, great atmosphere
comment: ​I really recommend this as a great venue, especially in the summer. They have a great cocktail list, and an extensive wine list, with wines sold both by the glass and the bottle. They do 'tapas' style food as well. The atmosphere is really lively and fun, with amazing views over London's skyline. The service is friendly without being over the top. Highly recommend as a fun place for an early Summer evening in London.

title: Overall this was a disappointing experience
comment: I booked a table on the terrace over the phone and was asked for a credit card and told there would be a minimum spend. This kind of felt unusual, given it was a Tuesday evening. On arrival we were told our table was not ready asked to wait in/around the reception area - Why they didn't 'let' us use the bar is beyond me as loads of people were just coming in, seemingly without reservations and heading straight for the bar. It took about 10 minutes to get our table ready (how long to wipe a table?). The views are absolutely amazing and the food was good. Table service was OK - I really don't like having to wait more than 5 minutes to get a refill (I think that's acceptable in these places that purport to be of a high quality. About an hour into our snacks and drinks, a party of 4 came and stood directly next to our table. They then started using our table to leave their empties etc, which was a little annoying, however the straw that broke the camels back was that one of this party found a chair from somewhere else and pulled it up right next to me! How weird. I won't be going back

title: Average location with decent food
comment: Although I had a lot of anticipation for this bar, I think the view was average (pales in comparison to the Sky Garden). I liked the food, however it was nothing exceptional. Overall a 3/3.

title: Rude
comment: I have been to this bar many a times and enjoy sitting on the terrace for an end of day drink with clients and colleagues. Working for a very large firm in London, it's a popular stop off for us, or was. We have never had to book for drinks, even in the height of summer. Today we were faced with a particularly rude and very unhelpful hostess at the bottom of the lift. The hostess said we could only go up with a reservation, I asked if she could kindly call up and make me a reservation for us....she said that was not possible even though she had a radio and was chatting to the staff in the bar over said radio. I then called the reservation line to be told that there was indeed room in the bar but she was unable to make a reservation for 45 minutes. Frustrating having wasted a cab fare to get there. Seems daft that the bar has capacity but can't take bookings, seems daft the hostess can't go up or call up to make a reservation and seems daft to turn away good business. If this is now the new protocol I can assure you there are friendly bars with much friendlier and helpful staff. Disappointed.

title: Amazing!
comment: Went up for a drink on a sunny Wednesday, everything from the views, the service and the drinks were amazing. Highly recommended! Big shout to Francisco the bar tender, not only knew his stuff but was amazingly fast service - Thanks fran!

title: Bad service
comment: Great music, but the bar service was extremely slow and it was very early so not very busy yet. The waitress was very snooty, disinterested and stand-offish, when we finally managed to get service. Food very expensive for what it is. Certainly won't rush back.

title: Fabulous but pricey
comment: Great location. Stunning view You definitely feel special coming up the secret elevator Cocktails around £14 Beers £6 Champagne £80 + Classy, modern , special Staff attentive little bit stuffy  Best roof top bar in London though

title: Disgusting rude bar staff!
comment: Came to visit here for first time yesterday and it will be the last! Spent the day/evening here for a friends birthday, spent quite a bit of money in here as was here from lunch time till about 11 at night, having a good night enjoying ourselves until I get told I'm too drunk and I won't be allowed to be severed anymore! I was just standing there, wasn't being overly loud, or causing any harm to anyone and then she asked me to leave! Not too sure why! I could understand if I was laying all over the floor or couldn't walk! I don't know weather she just didn't like the look of me as I find it s bit strange how she singled me out and I was the only one , vile woman! I won't be coming back again until you change your bar staff!

title: Worth a visit
comment: We visited with a few of my friends, got to say the drinks were delicious, the view was beautiful, the place had a relaxing, chilled atmosphere. You pay for the place your visiting, so it be better to go without having a budget and I would 100% recommend the kiwi mocktail and raspberry mocktail

title: Excellent Views
comment: Visited for first time with my partner in May 16. Great selection of cocktails and tapas on offer. Will defo be returning to see those views again.

title: Relaxing drink
comment: Group of us booked a table for sunday brunch. Very good welcome and showed to our seats outside. Breath taking views! Cocktails were amazing and the food was delicious. They aren't massive portions but are rich so for us girls were perfect. It was a relatively quite day so a lot of attention was paid to us, so I would choose off peak times if you want a more personal service.

title: Amazing views / great atmosphere
comment: Reserved a table from 4 pm on a Sunday afternoon  Reception was superb staff very friendly  Nice touch with express lift to rooftop  Very good selection of drinks / cocktails  Proper DJ made great atmosphere  Little expensive but to be expected  Service could be improved but over all excellent  Will be back

title: Worth it for the views
comment: So after dining at STK earlier, we decided to go upstairs for a round before heading home on a school night. The door host, I believe her name was Nat or Natalie.. Cannot remember... She was most friendly.. I don't think she was supposed to let us up there as there was some sort of a semi private event but she let us through anyways.. I guess we didn't look like gangsters that day so she approved!! We all had different cocktails, all tasty and colourful. I actually came here YEARS ago for a birthday celebration and the cocktails have always been yummy. Unfortunately we couldn't go in the balcony with the awesome views that night as that whole area was closed but you could still see the views from within the bar but without the cold so it was a win win really!  This bar is a little on the 'like to be seen' places but if you mind your own, you wouldn't even notice those people and you can enjoy the evening with chilled music. Certain nights, this turns more clubby and a more upbeat vibe.

title: Lovely place, amazing staff
comment: Been here several times and it's always a very pleasant experience. Last time I decided to take my best friend here since she's new to London. It was simply amazing and she loved it, the staff made us feel special, despite the lady at the door downstairs who always seem to be very pretentious, which is quite sad for such a fine place. However, we will definitely come back as it is one of my favourite spots in London for nice cocktails.

title: Lovely atmosphere..
comment: Lovely atmoshpere here. We stayed in the hotel so had a table with drink here! the only downfall was no table service. You pay or what you get but would definitely come back!

title: Magnificent views. great tapas
comment: Superb views and location. Fabulous views to the south and over to the city of London. has large terrace with heaters and plenty of room inside.  Wonderful tapas. You'll need to reserve to get a table outside.

title: Good Tunes!
comment: First time visit to this venue and lovely time had by all in my party. Reserved a table and kicked off the evening with a cocktail or 3 to start contributing to the minimum spend for reserving said table! Our Waitress was ok although not as attentive as others in the bar. Drinks were presented nicely and selection good. Tapas food ordered was tasty but like the drinks seemed to take forever to arrive! Once our allotted time was up at the table (2 hours) we were politely requested to vacate and left to fend for ourselves which I did think was a little cheeky given we'd spent at this stage £700!  Overall experience, nice venue, excellent views, great tunes!

title: Great views... disappointing service
comment: Came here with six friends on a Wednesday evening. No doubt about it, the views are excellent as the bar has a wrap-around terrace so you can get full views to the north, south and west. From the south facing balcony you can see right from Canary Wharf, The City, along the Southbank, past the London Eye etc which is the best viewing point in the bar in my opinion. Comfortable seating throughout and heaters outside. However the service was so slow despite the bar being about 1/3 capacity. And not only that, you get charged 15% (yes fifteen per cent) for service (more than most restaurants in London) to wait about 10 minutes for a guy to pull a few bottles of beer out of the fridge and take the cap off. This brought the cost of one bottle to £7.10, which is pretty lumpy to say the least. One of my friends also arrived late, and had a bit of trouble getting in with the bouncers, despite the bar being no where near full. Enjoyed it, and probably even nicer in the height of the summer, but wouldn't rush back due to the substandard service for the price.

title: Great views is just about it
comment: We went with friends on a Tuesday  It wasn't too busy but it took an age to get a table The music was monotonous and if anything took away from the ambiance  The deserts were poor. The sundae had too much cream and not much strawberry The drinks were run of the mill and comparable to a premixed tin one could get from M&S Not great except for the views

title: Great atmosphere
comment: I have been to Radio Rooftop last Saturday night and I really loved it.  Bar team was very Friendly and my Negroni was perfect.  We have been seated outside most of the time and the atmosphere was magic. Great tunes were played all night long. Definitely coming back

title: Best views on North Bank
comment: Visited with my partner on a fairly wet and cold evening in March. We mainly came here for the views however. Safe to say it blew my partner away how stunning the views were, and we washed them down with a bottle of wine. The drinks are ridiculously expensive here, about £45 for the cheapest bottle of wine. Was extremely shocked that the bartender put a gratuity charge on the bill for simply opening a bottle of wine and handing me two glasses. I didn't have the opportunity to complain about it as it was so busy that he immediately went to another customer after slapping a plate with my change and receipt on down next to the wine. The outside seating area was under cover to shield us from the rain, and there were blankets and heaters which made it comfortable to sit out. I'd recommend going once for the views, but that's probably all I'd recommend it for.

title: AWFUL bar connected to a great hotel
comment: Awful service, poor staff, over priced drinks. Must avoid at all costs. It's a real shame as the hotel ME London that it's roof it uses is incredible along with great staff. Hotel guests must certainly avoid.

title: Disappointed by the attitude and the welcome
comment: I booked a table for Brunch on Sunday at 12.30 pm for 5 people. As the weather was sunny we decided to walk before and some of us put trainers with casual clothes as we were going to a BRUNCH. Before leaving home, I called the radio rooftop reservations to ask if converse were ok and the lady assured me that "converse are okay, see you at 12.30 PM". When we arrive we were told that because of the trainers we could'nt get in for the BRUNCH and the lady even suggested to and buy some shoes in some shops around which was very rude !! Attitude of the staff was impolite and rude and Im shocked as I've been to nice and better places were a lot of people were in casual clothes for brunch on a sunny sunday !! First and last experience !

title: the worst in costumer service.. awful awful...
comment: My friends and I have been to a few roof top clubs/bars around town. Some, good or not so good, some pricey but worth it but Radio Rooftop has been the worst - pricey and bad costumer service. Arrived at the club 920pm, i could not shake the feeling that we were being kept an eye on. Very uncomfortable (mostly asian in our party) time.  Anyway, at 10 or 1030pm, half of the rooftop seating had been shut and everyone has been squeezed in to a little space (smokers, drunk people) you can imagine how uncomfortable that was. No explanation given, people were told to empty their seats and move to the other side. So the rooftop experience is non existent. Im 29 years old and have partied in ibiza, amsterdam, spain, portugal, bangkok, singapore, france, and more. I have never seen such appalling attitude from bouncers. They're rude, unwilling to take any explanation, when they have their eye on you, you're out, all of you. Here's what happened. 1130 pm, admittedly, we have one friend who has probably had a bit to much to drink. 1145 pm, the waitress asked us to pay for the table and so we did, this 'drunk friend' of mine, got his card out and paid straight out £350, done. Then he said let's go for a cigarette, halfway to the doors, we were stopped by two men and hurried us to the lift. Both said you need to go. I said, chill, we're going. While waiting for the lift to come up, I realised that i have my other friend's mobile in my pocket. Asked the bouncer if i can just return this quickly, he rudely said, "no! all your friends will be joining you in a minute now'.  I still followed as im never a trouble maker. Im a deputy manager who works in london and I manage 55 staff under me, I know how costumer service works and believe you me, if you want to have a good time, this isnt the place. Money is not the issue here, but what's wrong is if you all get treated badly because you look different from the crowd. The manager couldnt be any more helpful, they looked at all of us then shouted, "Out!' To cut this story, we arrived at the venue 920pm, paid the bill 1145pm (around £1200), got kicked out straight after that (all of us 11: 5 british, 6 asians). We occupied 3 tables because there was plenty of us, and as we went out the main entrance, there was a queue of at least 10 people waiting to get in. I just thought, these bloody people can sell those 3 tables again for 1k each because we've all been chucked out.  This place has poor ratings for a reason. Never again.

title: Buzzing bar!
comment: Worth a visit for the great service and buzzing atmosphere. Restaurant is good too. You need to pre book or join the queue for the rooftop bar.

title: Always love it up here - minus the rude bar man
comment: This is always my "go to" place when the sun comes out. I popped here on Friday after work for a couple of drinks before my dinner reservation. We had to wait for about 5 minutes to get let up, which was fine as I knew it would be busy because of the weather. When we got to the bar I asked for a peach bellini. The bar man looked confused and said "what's that?" I said a "peach bellini?" "Sorry we don't serve those here". I ensured him that they do, as that is what I have every time I go up there. He then asked me "who makes them?" I'm sorry, I didn't realise I had to remember each bar man who had served me previously and served me such a well known drink? He then asked what was in it and said he would then make it. I did not want to explain to him the simple ingredients so asked if he knew what a pornstar martini was.. He smirked rudely and said "yes". He was so rude it was unbelievable. My partner and I went outside and found a table. He must have been new as he let my partner outside with a bottle of beer, which they do not normal allow. He definitely ruined the start of my evening so hopefully I wont get him again next time I visit!!

title: Quite upsetting
comment: We had to have a minimum spend of £75 per person in 2 hours to be sat in this place... Are you kidding me ? We needed to spend £225 in 2 hours to even be allowed in?  So many other more amazing places to go to that aren't so pushy...

title: Amazing Cocktails, perfect view, friendly staff
comment: My first visit and first impression here was WOW. I have to say, each time I go, it still makes me smile. The atmosphere, cocktails and that view at sunset. I have been rain and shine and love it regardless. Pricey but not ridiculous. The mini burgers are incredible! Staff are friendly, helpful and accommodating! The last time we visiting, we arrives at 1:30pm for lunch and left at 8pm! Will remain as one of my firm favourites.

title: 30th Birthday Surprise with a View
comment: I brought a friend here for a 30th birthday drink and nibbles and she loved it. I loved it, everything is lovely, the nibbles are delicious and the views are outstanding. However it is a very busy busy bar, and it is best to book a table in advance so you can get table service. I would also advise that you should not come here if you are impatient in nature because the speed at which the service is delivered is not as fast paced as some people would like it too be. But I think the atmosphere that has been created is brilliant. The outside balcony/area is awesome and I can imagine beautiful in summer - I do definitely recommend this for a special date or occasion as it is a bit pricey for a normal week day, but the views are worth it

title: Lovely fizz and fab service
comment: We asked our concierge at Melia White House to book us a table for lunch and were made to feel like royalty at the Melia on the strand reception. How lovely and what a nice start to a fabulous time at radio rooftop.  Dora, the manager was super efficient and friendly and our waitress Mercedes was fantastic. I can honestly say that both these girls raised the bar by giving us a friendly, welcoming and lovely service that I rarely experience in London. Thank you both for making our visit so special!!  Brunch was great - we chose the pulled pork and side of greens (which were amazingly crisp and tasty!). My step-daughter had the poached egg and spinach which she declared very tasty. Had a couple of bottles of fizz which were kept well topped up, All in all a lovely time and I would recommend you visit.... Oh and the views are pretty spectacular as well!!!

title: Great view.
comment: A smart bar with fabulous views. All very clean. The waitress that served us was friendly and attentive. Although the other waiters were slow and ignored us when we arrived. The cocktails were not as well presented as I would have expected from such a smart venue. It was quiet and a good place to catch up with friends.  A good place to visit but it could be better.

title: Lovely view
comment: Visited for a wedding anniversary glass of bubbles, Saturday afternoon and we hadn't booked so queued for 20 minutes to get in. Very busy, a beautiful sunny day and two glasses of champagne with great views of London sky line. If your going to visit maybe worth booking

title: Lovely brunch with cocktails
comment: I visited with a friend on a Saturday lunchtime. The brunch was excellent, delicious cocktails and the service was good. The views are great. All in all I would definitely return and recommend a visit on a lunchtime.

title: Ok not amazing. Didn't see views much from inside and service slow
comment: Title summarises it.  We booked a table in advance and was £75 min spend each. When we arrived they let us in without queuing but unless resident you have to use the separate entrance and specific lift.  Thy gave us a table inside and I must admit I didn't even bother going to see the view and from where we were we could have been in any hotel bar. They had a DJ on Thursdays night which was decent dance music. Loud but able to have a conversation still.  Service was VERY slow. Suprising as busy but lots of staff. They missed a trick as we would have had at least 2 more rounds and more food but got fed up waiting after while.  We had some food. Basic tapas bits. What you would expect. Nice enough. Not great.  It was a good night I wouldn't avoid returning but wouldn't specifically rush back as expensive bar with average service and not much of view if inside.

title: Disappointing
comment: I was looking forward to a lunchtime visit to this bar as it looked so good in the promotional material. What a let down!. Arriving in a rain storm there was nowhere to leave coats or umbrellas. The table reservation had not been made and we were offered an inside table (even though some people were eating outside undercover). Staff were not helpful but finally we were seated outside but had to ask for the heaters to be put on.  There were very few people and no atmosphere - luckily we were with a nice group so were able to enjoy the occasion. The food was quite good but nothing exceptional. There were a number of special dishes but because the waitress did not speak English very well it was difficult to decipher what they were. Overall it was a disappointing experience and we would not go to this venue again.

title: Management and customer service ... Dreadful
comment: So, on Saturday night me and a group of friends headed down to the Radio bar. Got there, started up a tab and everything was great, views were amazing and so was the atmosphere until later in the evening a group of men who were sat behind us started being derogatory towards us. They were asked to leave as we explained their comments ... NEXT the manger approached our table and asked us to settle our bill and leave taking into account we had been there since 5pm, it was now 12am (the establishment did not close until 3) .. None of us were drunk, unsettled or causing trouble. The manger said 'this is a five star establishment' .. So we were punished for another groups actions. Taking into account we had a tab coming up to £900, we were hounded for the payment by an older blonde waitress in black. They were not very impressed when I asked for the service charge of £120 to be deducted. I would still recommend the bar but if your looking for good customer service and good management this is not the place to go.

title: Good views, good service
comment: I was there with my friends having some drinks, and it was cooland relaxing. It was a sunny london day and we sat in the terrace by a hostess. we were waiting 25 minuts for our drinks but the wait was worth it. A bit expensive but once again, you pay for the amazing london views!! COOL

title: Great fun, lovely helpful staff, good food, good wine.
comment: We arrived as walk-ins at 12.30 lunchtime,on our wedding anniversary and my husband's birthday. We were greeted courteously and seated outside as requested in some shade. We had several waiters, all friendly, chatty and professional,especially Mercedes, who went to the trouble of getting my husband a complimentary dessert for his birthday. We weren't big-hitters by any means, sharing a bottle of decent Rose and a coupe of Tapas but were not treated any differently from those ordering champagne and the works. We would not hesitate to return, especially at night when the view must be extra-special. Considering the position, this is good value for money.

title: Amazing views and good service
comment: The views from the Radio Rooftop are stunning. You can see right across south London and across to the east. The staff were very attentive and friendly. There's a very wide choice of wines and cocktails. Be prepared to book in advance, it's not easy to get a reservation. The biggest bonus by far is the view.

title: Appalling
comment: I have been to Radio bar a few times however tonight I had one of the most appalling experiences I have had in a long time.  I decided to go for a few drinks with friends to celebrate my birthday, we had barely been there 20 minutes when we decided to quickly use the ladies room - once out of there I was pulled to the side by a security guard claiming he had been told I was too drunk (I had barely had half of my first drink) and that I had been getting sick in the toilet so they had to escort me out. After speaking to him for a while he quickly realised I was not drunk in the slightest and apologised however no member of management showed up to offer a proper apology or anything to make up for their clear mistake, all I heard was that some lady who was part of the bar management happened to be in the toilets with us and for some reason took a dislike to me and clearly made up a lie - which is just beyond unprofessional.  I can honestly say I have never been treated with such disrespect and maliciousness in a bar/restaurant in my life and completely regret spending my birthday in such an unprofessional environment. Overall: Expensive, overrated, tiny, long queue even though it was almost empty inside and just awful service. I can honestly say I will be never going back and am embarrassed on their behalf for the awful treatment we received.

title: Luxury. Is the perfect word to describe.
comment: The best view, the nicer place in London and a professional service. Me and my husband were excited. Definitely we' ll come back. Was amazing!

title: Rooftop bar/restaurant
comment: We only went to the restaurant/bar on the roof. We were quite impressed. They have comfortable couches for you to lounge on as well as tables. And for those cool days and nights, they have heat lamps positioned everywhere so it is warm enough to be outside even on cool nights. The views from the roof were stellar, and the hotel is right downtown and free!! Just purchase a drink and enjoy the atmosphere. The downside is it is outside and everyone in London seems to smoke. It was hard to find a location where the smoke would not find us.

title: Horrible - should have followed the reviews when we read them!
comment: It is obviously not an excellent place, but judging from the reviews here, we decided to experience it for ourselves.  The night started out okay, similar to those who have rated this as "Excellent" or "Good." However, as soon as our bill was settled, they started kicking us all out one by one, making excuses for each of us. One was too drunk, we were a bit too merry, the other female was drunk as well so she has to go... blablablah, trying to create a reaction from us which we did not.  We cannot prove if there is some sort of modus between management and staff or they have a certain "image" to maintain, but it felt like there was some hint of "profiling" involved.  So, no, believe us when we say that it was horrible. A completly different ballgame compared to other bar/clubs in London.  Overly priced, awful drinks and music on a Saturday night. Never coming back. You shouldn't as well.

title: Good view but nothing else
comment: Having pre booked a table we visited on a Sunday lunchtime. Once seated at the table we were then just left. We then needed to catch the eye of the waiters who were more interested in serving the wannabe footballers and WAGs. After a faff about what menu we could order from brunch or tapas we ordered tapas. All the plates came out individually with large time gaps in between and then when we chased up the food the snooty waitress huffed and puffed and went back to the kitchen in search of it. It also turned out that one of the dishes was not even available. 45/50 minutes it took for 4 small dishes of tapas to arrive and one of those was a dish of roasted almonds. It's so easy to take a 15% service charge and not deliver any level of service - we left, never to return, very disappointed and hungry... ...but ended up in an excellent little restaurant by Covent Garden - Augustus Harris which I would thoroughly recommend.

title: Pretentious rubbish.
comment: There are so many great bars and restaurants in London that why people flock to this place is beyond me. The minimum spend is off putting from the start, the furniture was tatty with rips, the drinks were of average quality and therefore over priced. If you ignore the view, you could imagine yourself at a party in an airport lounge.  The saving grace was the view, but there are plenty of places in London from where the view can be enjoyed either for free or with much higher quality attached - Duck & Waffle, for example. In summary, a poorly executed glamour bar, capitalising on its views with little support from its decor, drinks or service.

title: "This is a high quality, unpretentious, fun loving sky bar".
comment: I really love this place !!!  If you are visiting London and want a light and airy bar to relax in you should go here.  I would highly recommend it to solo, couples and/or small groups (adults of any age). The customers tend to be a mix of Londoners (some like me, who return time and time again), to overseas travellers and business people (staying/meeting at the hotel).  For me, what really makes it perfect is the high calibre friendly and passionate staff.  The staff have come together from all different parts of the world but are bringing with them a very special hospitality feel both into their work and into this cocktail and lounge environment.  At the bar, I am always delighted at being served so quickly (even at peak times).  The barman are all young guys, all full of energy and all passionate about giving the best possible experience to their customers, They never fail to impress and deliver professional high quality cocktails and beverages. I've also ate many times from their kitchen. The food was perfectly presented, very hygienic and delicious.  And for a five star establishment there are some very reasonable priced food and drink alternatives, so it does not have to be an over expensive visit for you.  Finally, although I have seen it many times, I still enjoy the sensational view over London, sometimes combined with a fantastic Sunset viewed from my bar stool.

title: Insane policies
comment: Myself and a group of friends are meeting pre dinner and we're looking for somewhere to have pre drinks . I mailed radio rooftop looking to book a table for 12 outside for drinks . The email I just received has left me so angry. They have a min spend of 75 per person !!!! Two of our group are pregnant are they too requested to spend 75 pound !!  The most most most ridiculous policy is yet to come .. Groups of 5 or more must consist of male and female !!!! In shock at this in this day and age ... Jesus just wanted to go somewhere for drinks !!!

title: Super view
comment: Really enjoyed this bar. The view is wonderful and saw a fab sunset. The staff were really helpful and moved our table outside on request. Having had a great time earlier in the evening, we went back after dinner for a night cap.

title: Seat Outside with a Blanket in the Winter
comment: Nice place to share a bottle of wine with a friend and some snacks. If it gets to cold there are always the blankets available to snuggle up to....

title: Great view!
comment: Yes it's a bit pricey but no more so than any other bar in a smart hotel right in the centre of town. Definitely worth it for the view, and if you can sit outside. Was less keen on the loud music inside, bit much for a mid week drink. Cool venue.

title: Great view, nice ambience
comment: Went there on a wednesday for drinks with few friends. Really liked the views, enjoyed the atmosphere. Like others said there were blankets in case you feel cold, since weather was great we didnt feel the need. Staff was courteous. Cant believe i passed many times but never noticed this place.

title: Awful. Genuinely the worst customer service experience ever
comment: So my clients were stuck in a lift for an hour and ten minutes. They didn't tell us because they didn't want us to "panic". I was worried, my clients are normally so punctual, I called them, text them and face booked them and still couldn't get hold of them. It turns out the reason they were stuck in the lift was because the hostess stuck her clip board in there just as it was moving. They had to effectively get themselves out of there by using the crow bar that was passed to them by the lift engineers so finally the lift moved.  The manager was so rude to me when I found out to ask how long it would take, he told me to go and sit down to not make a fuss and that there was no problem for me only the people in the lift. He said we could cancel the booking it was fine. It wasn't his fault there was a maintenance issue despite it being a clip board issue.  When they finally got out they were offered water, that's it. We ordered food it took ages, a bottle of wine took 40 minutes. The table next to me had to go and get their own water, everyone was moaning. It's such a waste. The manager and reception women with clip board should be sacked, the other bar staff and severing staff were lovely and the venue would be good if it wasn't not run by a rude idiot. Biggest disappointment ever.

title: Must Visit
comment: Can't be beaten on a sunny day . Great views over London , cool vibe. Brunch on Sunday , Tapas after 4pm. We booked , I think that's worth doing . Be prepared to spend atleast £15-£20 on brunch not incl drinks .

title: Worth paying for the views
comment: I took my daughter here for a cocktail before the theatre for her 18th birthday. I paid a penny less than £30 for 2 and we went outside to sit on the sofas and wrapped ourselves up in the blankets to enjoy the view. It was spectacular!!! Better than being at the top of the Shard as you could actually see things. The drinks are very expensive but I was happy to pay for the experience

title: Not my kind at all...
comment: This is a place to go if you have too much money, too little clothes and you enjoy not hearing a word anyone is saying because it is so loud. If those things don't apply to you, you most likely do not enjoy this place. The positive side is the view over the roofs of London to The Thames and all the landmarks like Big Ben.

title: Bets place in summer
comment: best place to go in summer for food and drinks Amazing view brilliant private areas for private events

title: All View, Not Much Else
comment: The view is no doubt spectacular. The bar itself was very crowded and uncomfortable. They were holding people up at the door, yet had closed off most of their seating with the best views. Drinks were standard and pricey.

title: Rats the size of dogs
comment: I'm of course exaggerating - the view was astonishing, the crowds were dressed beautifully, the drinks were extraordinary. The wait was a little lengthy, and a bit crowded but well worth the visit if even just to share a jaw dropping evening night scape

title: How the other half live
comment: Went with friends. .We had pre- booked were slightly perturbed by the minimum spend of £75 per head..which we were not prepared to pay..However we were assured that at that time (mid afternoon) it did not apply. It has truly stunning views and have to say staff were very good, had to ask to order second drink and was quite slow but it's hardly a hardship hanging out up there. .It's pricey but you are paying for the views and the experience of feeling a little bit like a celeb for a couple of hours.

title: Rooftop review
comment: Stayed at the me hotel, and went to this place on top of the hotel! Service average... Service charge added even if you wait at the bar! Please don't go here age 60plus on the weekend a few people in the lift going up don't know what the expected it's not a place to go on a Saturday night for a quiet drink.. Very young lively ... If you like that fine but if your after a nice chilled out drink with views go in the day time... Waiting time on arrival for table long... Some staff efficient others no so! Great music... Just not amazing ... Average.

title: Paying a premium for a good view
comment: Surprisingly good views of the London skyline from this trendy bar - outside seating area is a winner. Drinks menu and price lets it down though - £7 for a bottle of standard lager and double figures for a g&t. Watch out for staff automatically adding 12.5% service even when stood at the bar - they will refund this if asked!

title: Great views - but missing something!
comment: The views of London from here are fantastic, especially on a nice summer's evening. But if you really want to ooze class and sophistication, I don't think serving a £12 G &T and a £6 bottle of Estrella in plastic "glasses" is the way to do it. To be fair, the barman (or should I say cocktail maker) apologised and said proper glasses would be coming in May - but surely they should have them from the day the bar opened. A bit pretentious too

title: The best bar in central london by far
comment: The views are beyond fantastic and the service is always extremely good I visit between 2-4 times a month,  Dress code is smart casual (no trainers) and they run a 21+ policy after 6:00pm which really keeps the classy vibe throughout.

title: Useless
comment: Went to go with clients after an email conversation with the reservations manager, who said to just walk in, turned up and were told there is no space, then contacted again and was told to book a reservation and nothing was available until 19.00, we arrived at 3, not worth the hassle, ruined my day. £50 per head minimum spend on a 2 hour time slot... anyway. Don't waste your time, you're in London.

title: great bar with good views and table service
comment: very nice bar with great views, outdoor seating, smoking area etc... attentive table service for food and drinks although portion sizes very small for the price. Also - would prefer lighting in day/early evening to be a bit less bright - white bright lights were harsh on the eyes!

title: Worth a visit :)
comment: Popped up for a brunch early on a Sunday afternoon. All the staff greeting us were friendly and we were given the option to sit outside with some lovely views, but as it was a tad chilly we chose to sit inside. Beautiful bar & indoor/outdoor dining area...spacious & light with a modern and good feel to it. The brunch menu isn't extensive (which is probably a good thing), so my friend and I opted for the crab omelette.  The omelette is about £14 and quite small with a side of toasted sourdough, but you are paying for the crab & the venue I guess. The omelette was nice but not amazing, slightly dry...would've been nice with a small salad on the side - I would try something else next time  The Bloody Mary's were good, although the service was rather slow and we had to grab a waiters attention each time we wanted a drink, plus my friend had a long wait for service at the bar That said, we were not overly bothered as it was a chilled Sunday and were fine to have a more relaxed dining experience. However 2 or 3 other diners we spoke to were not happy about the wait All in all we did have a lovely day and were there for hours drinking and nibbling on a cured meats platter we ordered later, which was really tasty. The staff were great, we didn't make the most of the view, but it was lovely and would definitely go back. Just go and relax if dining on a Sunday.....

title: Staff could be friendlier
comment: My husband and I visited just for cocktails on a Saturday lunchtime. Staff on ground level were wonderful, arriving at the 10th floor bar the female staff were so arrogant and rude. Cocktail was gorgeous but decided to leave after just one due to being made to feel so uncomfortable by the waitresses. Everything felt so rushed, not relaxing and very disappointed by the experience. Would love to return but the female staff need to improve their customer skills first. The gents were far more chilled and made everyone feel welcome. There was a Brunch menu served until 3pm, would be nice to have a better choice for lunchtime though. Problem with the lift upon leaving, this situation was handled poorly but that alone wouldn't stop a return visit.

title: Not worth to go
comment: I expected a lot of the roof bars but we been quiet disappointed with the service ambiance and on top the price range. Don't mind to pay premium rates if all is in order but it's not. It looks like a cheap joint in a 5 star hotel.. hope this will change.

title: Very disappointed. Rude staff
comment: I visited on a Saturday afternoon, so was expecting it to be busy. The bar itself is very cool and has great views over London. The atmosphere was good until it came to leaving. Leaving shouldn't be a problem as there is a strict maximum capacity in place so they, in theory should be glad of people leaving so they can welcome more customers. Unfortunately for them their lift broke, which meant we were put in the service lift with no apology. I know this was not their fault but being shut in a lift with no direction on which floor to get out or anything was a bit daunting. We stopped in the basement at first and were told that we should not be there. Then when we finally made our way to the back door exit, the doorman a) shut the door in my face and b) was incredibly rude to me and my partner after we raised out concerns about the lift. It is an expensive bar with a seemingly good reputation but don't be fooled. The staff are very rude.

title: So Lovely!
comment: I was so surprised by how attentive the waitress' were all night, service was really lovely! And it wasn't in a pushy 'are you going to order way', it was a really nice vibe. Everyone seemed really bubbly and happy, it wasn't over crowded either how a lot of places were which was nice too. Only downfall would be the music wasn't so good (unknown) as the night went on but we did leave at around 10pm so maybe it would have got better and more commercial. The lady on the door was the most friendly/ happy door woman I've ever seen! Usually with these places they're grumpy and look you up and down as they decide to let you in or not, but she was so sweet (her hair was amazing too), staff we made contact with were just like enjoy your night! - Really nice (View was a bonus, will return in the summer!)

title: Great rooftop bar and restaurant in central London
comment: When in London Radio Rooftop at The Standard is one of our trusted hangouts. You can go there just for a drink, or to have a tapas lunch or dinner. On a good weather you can sit outside on the terrace and enjoy central London atmosphere with tapas. On our latest visit we had confit tuna, seafood salad, prawn skewers, dates, bannoffee pie and creme catalana. Food was just fine and we enjoyed our sunny brunch in the sun.

title: Lovely on a warm day
comment: Wonderful service, wonderful cocktails, perfect view on a clear day and even better on a warm or hot day.

title: Great location, great service - highly recommended
comment: I've been in London for years and never knew about this place until last weekend... Great spot - even though it was a little cold the outside areas are well heated and well appointed. We only stayed for a drink (as we had young children with us) but i will be back - for sure...

title: Hang out with the cool people
comment: Called in without a reservation for a pre-dinner drink on Saturday evening. It was wet outside so there were no free seats but still plenty of space to enjoy a drink for 45 minutes. They have an excellent choice of drinks (Monkey 47 gin served with lime and juniper berries...) and great bar staff with the showmanship skills you'd expect in a destination bar. Pricey. Fantastic views from the terraces - such a pity it wasn't sunny.  The DJs were already playing and the cool young things are delightful to watch enjoying themselves - you can't help but wonder how they can afford it? Great fun.

title: As amazing as always ....
comment: Still as amazing as always. Enjoyed sitting outside in the sun till it clouded at which point we moved indoors. Great service and ambience.

title: Amazing View, Lovely Cocktails...
comment: From the moment we stepped out of the lift we knew we wanted to stay at the bar all night..... The staff were friendly and welcoming, and showed us to our pre-booked table on the south side of the bar - WOW what a view - one of the best in London, and with the outdoor heaters and roof cover even in March we could sit outside and enjoy watching London change from day to night.  We ordered cocktails and food - Mini burgers a must along with the chips and enjoyed the bars laid back atmosphere, chilled music and lively conversations on a Saturday night. Having the bars table service was great, it meant we could enjoy the bar and views without wasting time queuing for the bar. the staff were happy to chat and were extremely helpful in the knowledge of both the food and drinks menus and their recommendations did not get wasted.  There is no doubt, we will be heading back soon

title: Fun for drinks
comment: I visited on Saturday evening with my sister and cousins for a few drinks to end our evening out. This bar has a wonderful atmosphere, fantastic views and even better cocktails. We had a fun evening, with a good crowd (often hard to find in London). My only gripe is having to pay a 15% service charge when ordering only one drink, but other than that its a fun place to go!

title: From Ok to GREAT
comment: I have visited on a number of occasions and though unimpressed in my first visits I have seen major improvements specially in the service and quality of drinks. Cocktails are among the best I have tried and the manager is super kind and attentive. It is a pleasure and it feels more luxurious to be there now. Not to be missed and especially not when the sun is out!

title: Best croquettas in town!
comment: Went last night to have a drink with some friends, and was pleasantly surprised to find a laid-back atmosphere and super friendly and attentive staff (Giovanni took such good care of us) plus a simple tapas menu that was just too good. The padron peppers and croquettas are perhaps the best I have tried in London...this was my first visit and I can only imagine how it will be when the weather warms up and we can take advantage of the beautiful terrace!

title: Amazing
comment: Out of the chart ! When you go up there ask for a guy caller giorvani he is italian and the manager he is one of the greatest guys i've seen . As soon as we came in they gave us free drinks on the house and the manager soon introduced himself to me. Probably one of the best clubs in london. We went with a group of 3 people and we paid 200 £ each for a big bottle of grey goose (best vodka) a bottle of one (very good wine, second most expensive ) and at least 10 drinks with 7 kind of tapass that we ordered twice

title: Beautiful
comment: Very nice and amazing views. Cocktail very tasty and lots of different flavors and very colorful and well decorated. Worth to see and book a table outside. Modern decoration and worth to see for a drink with friends

title: What a difference!! My new favourite cocktail bar! Bring on the summer!
comment: I recently visited the Radio Rooftop bar with two girlfriends and I was surprised to find that the place has transformed since my last visit. The service was exceptional thanks to the new manager Giovanni who greeted us with a dazzling smile and recommended the perfect drinks to compliment the exquisite views... The staff were super attentive, the service generally was spot on. We Londoners expect the best service wherever we go and i can now safely say that this is the best place for it! I recommend this place to anyone who likes to feel that they are the only person in the room.. and for once, I did! Thanks Radio - see you again very soon!!

title: Lovely views but quite expensive with (effectively mandatory) service charges
comment: Went for a few drinks with friends last night. The views are great and in the sunshine it's lovely; however, once the sun went in it cooled down quickly on the terrace. Later in the evening the DJ was pretty good the people were all friendly. The only real downside was that it appeared that service charges were being added to every round I was buying, even though I was ordering them at the bar and waiting. As the drinks are quite expensive the service charges soon added up: 3 vodka sodas and a G&T was causing me an additional service charge of around £8 each time.

title: one of the best in London
comment: To spend quality time, in great view and perfect service on the top of this modern hotel. you will difinatley like it.

title: Awesome place amazing staff
comment: I've visited here twice recently with friends and I have to say on both occasions it's been an awesome experience, the staff are really attentive and can't do enough to help you have the best possible experience, even the GM makes sure he is available for guests. I would strongly advise booking a table inside at this time of year due to the cold weather. The prices are reasonable for the city and the food is good too.  If you're looking for a great venue with a great atmosphere for a night out then you really should give this place a look.

title: great space spoilt by service
comment: such a shame as the setting is brilliant! As seems to be the case with bars in london these days the experience was spoiled by the door staff and the bar staff. Kept waiting outside even though we had booked in advance. The girl with guest didn't have our booking on her list when we showed her own copy they finally let us in. They turned away another group who had paid a deposit for no reason! Once inside we discovered the bar was half empty, took ages to get a drink and there was no where to sit. All the tables were for VIP even though no one was sat down. This could be a great place but I fear it will go the way of lots of trendy bars and will disappear soon. Maybe the new owners will learn from these mistakes.

title: Surprisingly disgusting
comment: Incredibly rude staff. I am surprised they are still in business. Do not patronise unless you like being patronised in return by someone with minimal education and an attitude. Holborn could do with some decent bars - a shame this is not one.

title: Wonderful view and atmoshere
comment: Been there a couple of times. The best time to go is before sunset, so u get to enjoy the view of London in daylight and then see it at night, The atmosphere is nice. The bar bites food menu is limited. Would like to see more variety of vegetarian snacks as well as desserts.

title: Great bar, great views
comment: A Great place for early evening rendezvous with friends and to spend an enjoyable hour drinking cocktails as a pre cursor to a night of theatre and dining. It had a vibrant upbeat atmosphere as well as stunning views and a feel good factor thanks to a big orange sun low in the sky. This was our first visit. We didn't book and it is true that all the tables were marked reserved. However, this did not present a problem and we found a table straight away. It has now been added to my list of venues and we look forward to our next visit..

title: Top service, friendly staff and great cocktail
comment: Arrived at Radio just before 8.00pm Frdiay. The door staff were exceptional. They whisked us up the lift to Renalto and his team there. Bar staff were quick, friendly and just brillent with the cocktails. Stayed 3 hours and it was an amazing evening with great music and beautiful people

title: Fantastic Views and Cocktails
comment: We went up for a drink after visiting the local London attractions. I was amazed by how good the service was from the entry of the lift to the cocktail making behind the bar. Even though the drinks were expensive the views were phenomenal and there was a great atmosphere outside on the terrace.

title: Visited 12/3/16
comment: Fantastic service, food good, especially the triple cooked chips & the single malt whisky served with ball shaped ice & an orange swirl delivered by attractive prompt attentative staff certainly hit the spot..... Looking forward to going back for another frog & the toad... Best views in London ..

title: Mixed
comment: We went there after an event in the function rooms. The view is good, but the atmosphere inside could be better - it's a bit basic? Outside will be great when the weather warms up. The cocktails were delicious, but the service charge of 15% is OTT as it adds about £2 on the cocktail AND it is served in a plastic glass. The clientele was from young to mature.

title: A bar with attitude (the very bad kind)
comment: This bar is so let down by its service and bad attitude. When you get up there, the views are superb, but they need to watch out for how many customers they put off by their snobby, rude, patronising staff. I live and work in London and many of my young professional friends have experienced the same appalling service and would avoid this place like the plague. The door staff are the worst, making it unbelievably hard to get up to the bar and when you do, it's empty! London snobbiness at its worst. There are bars with rivalling views and far better service.

title: Radio Rooftop Bar
comment: Visited specifically for drinks and the view. If visiting in warm weather and/or evenings the bar is very busy due to its open outside space. Expensive due to its outside space and location.

title: Just awful
comment: From the reluctant way we were allowed in, to the annoying way we had to move half way through the evening (from our table to sitting on sofas outside the elevators!), to the way our drinks were smashed on the floor by the waiter who barely looked twice and didn't remove them from the bill, to our weak G&Ts and tasteless cocktails, to the stingy and overpriced snacks, to the look on the face of the staff, to the dreary atmosphere, to the 15% service charge for THAT service... I did not much enjoy this place.  Maybe try in the summer (I won't. I'm not going to waste my time here again when there are so many other decent alternatives).  Or just give it a miss. You won't be missing much.

title: RADIO-Bar
comment: I Went for The very First Time & felt Directly In LOVE, Amazing View , Super Service,Drinks , Clean and a Very Nice Atmosphere . We've met A Host called Francesco, Who was very kind and Looked After us very well. I will be back Soon

title: Lovely view, not worth the price..
comment: We visited on a 2 day trip to London and it was a mixed bag if I'm honest..  The worst part I must say was the agro getting up there, the lift broke down and it took roughly 20 minutes till we could take the trip up!  The view was great! But the photos here don't match up to it atm, they have roof extenders covering the sides of the terrace and fake grass, as well as some worn and dirty furniture, so not as 'pristine' as the photos make it out to be Plus, as has been said, the service wasn't the best, it took about 10 to 15 minutes to get our drinks on a very quiet afternoon, plus the lack of beer choice and price (£7) for 330ml bottles isn't really justified, even for London standards!  All in all would visit again, but could be improved for what it is :)

title: Pre-theatre brunch here
comment: Met family here for a nice brunch, before taking the grandkids to the Lion King (theatres are all around). Although the website advertises the brunch as only available from 1pm, they start serving it from 11:30. Spoilt for choice! Verandah is covered and has patio heaters / blankets for cold days and there is a great view. Children not allowed after 5pm.

title: Selling the view
comment: As it very often happens with bars and restaurants offering spectacular views, food and drink come very distant second when it comes to the experience, and very little effort is being made to complement the stunning views with equally stunning fares. Radio Rooftop falls into this category fairly and squarely. The first thing you'll notice is how brief the drinks and the food menus are. And if you have any expectation based on what is being said in their online versions, forget it immediately: the actual menu is quite different from the online one and very much shorter. The cheapest bottle of (mediocre) French wine will be £33, the cheapest champagne will be almost £80, cocktails are about £15, bottled water is about £5. This is not outrageous by central London standards but is still on an expensive side. What is disappointing is the price/quality combination rather than the price itself: one expects better wines, better executed cocktails, and better choice for this money. Food is served as small bites, nibbles, and mini-tapas at about £5-6 per portion. Two tiny skewers of beef or chicken, two miniburgers, about 30g of jamon - these are the portion sizes. Of course, it is a bar rather than anything else, and one shouldn't expect a full-blown food feast. Having said that, both the quality of the food itself and the prices are wrong: fares are disappointingly "fast-foodish" by looks and flavour and can't justify the prices. Service is very much hit and miss there. You'll have lengthy periods of waiting between the orders (which is even more disappointing as the "slots" for the customers are 2h only and you should expect to be kicked out of this place as soon as your time comes up). Waiting culture is very uneven. Some waiters are efficient, quick, and polite. Others are brusque and unwelcoming. Don't be surprised to get a drink that you've never ordered by be banged in front of you by a rishing waitress without a word. However quick you are, she is quicker and will disappear in a flash, so you'll never have a chance to ask what was it all about. The obvious attraction of the place is its location - on top of a dull and unimaginative hotel building that stands on a site of a long-defunct Gaiety Theatre. The views are very nice though you have to remember that it is 10th floor only, so don't expect any bird's-eye views of the capital from there. Obviously, having an outside terrace adds to the customers' experience on so many levels, and is the best feature of this place. Yes, you can smoke there. Yes, it is heated. No, the smokers won't disturb you there as there are designated smoking areas with significant chunks of the terrace being smoke-free. The crowd is very mixed there. Being just on the border of the Theatreland and the City, the place attracts respective crowds with the age mix being of wide spectrum. A word of warning though. The place isn't exactly family-friendly. Moreover, it will suit a single drinker or a male drinking company better than a happy couple. Overall, I haven't regretted spending my designated 2h there (you have to remember that the time-slots are being respected very strictly there, so do expect to be asked to leave at the end of your designated time) but I won't be rushing back anytime soon.  Another word of advice - be very careful while walking there and look under your feet. The tiles by the main bar are very slippery, and if there is a spillage by a punter or a waiter, accidents do and will happen. While we were there, one of the ladies had a nasty fall on the tiles and injured herself rather badly. 5 out of 10.

title: Stunning views & excellent service
comment: I love this bar its my favorite in London. Stunning views and great ambience. They have an outdoor area which is great for summer time and winter its heated. Fri/ Saturday nights they have great DJ's playing amazing ibiza style house music. Franceso Russo is an amazing host and makes sure all his guests are well looked after.

title: Scrummy food and good wine with a lovely view
comment: I took my mum in the week for a 12.30pm lunch and the service was great (considering that they open at 12 and we were one of the first people there!). We got a table with probably the best view in the place and the food was quick from the kitchen and was absolutely delicious (please try the bacon and blue cheese dates, they are sublime!!), if not slightly pricey for the tapas portion size, but that's London. The waiter and manager were both attentive until it started to get busy and it took us a while to receive our bill. They were brilliant with my mum though, bringing her a complementary birthday desert. I can imagine that it gets very busy and the waiters get stressed in the evenings, but the view and the restaurant itself are great. Would thoroughly recommend.

title: One of my favourite places
comment: One of my favourite places in London, stunning views, great staff, good music, decent crowd and the drinks menu is fabulous. I must say it's not an easy place to get into and tables must be booked in advance but if you want to check it out ask for Francesco Russo, he always looks after me and my friends. Iv had birthdays there and he always makes sure everyone is looked after. If you are visiting from outside London its deffo a place to visit on the list.

title: Drinks with a view
comment: Radio rooftop has great views over London and a good, fun atmosphere. The cocktails are lovely although it takes an awfully long time to get served at the bar on a Saturday night because of how busy it gets. Nevertheless, the bar staff are friendly and charismatic. Love the music too.

title: Rude staff make this an unpleasant bar !
comment: My friend and I stayed here in the ME and found all of the staff to be friendly and helpful with exception to all of the staff in the Radio Rooftop Bar !!! The bartenders here are just rude. They're young, immature boys. Unfortunately if you're not flaunting money or yourself over the bar - you don't get served. My friend and I stood and waited at the bar for 20 mins ... We were overlooked several times by 3 bar boys. They seemed to be more interested in the girls that were flirting with them than serving customers with respect. We finally waved a hand asking for some service in which we were dissed again and made to wait another 5 mins - with a wave of his hand in our face as if to say"I'm ready now" !! Shocking service. For the amount of money we paid to stay in this hotel you would expect proper service through out but The Radio Rooftop bar sadly is a let down. Very pretentious and not a bar I would recommend. Being American there is no way this would be acceptable in such an establishment. The views during the day are amazing. That's the only thing this bar has going for it.

title: 360 degree stunning view over London and the Thames
comment: The Radio rooftop bar on the 9th floor of the ME London has a open 360 stunning view over London and the Thames, with a funky dj, and buzzing atmosphere in the evening. Also serves good tapas.

title: Virtually 360 degree views of all the London Landmarks
comment: Really lovely venue with a luxurious feel. Great views, considering you are only 10 floors up and there is an enclosed lift - so if you do feel a bit odd about glass lifts and floor to ceiling windows 50 floors up this is the rooftop venue for you! Staff were friendly but service was very slow. All the "normal" lagers we wanted were out of stock but we settled for one from a small selection they did have, however when served it was not any where near cold enough. A member of staff chatted to us and explained that the views at night were good as the cranes disappear from the landscape so we will go back one evening, although the views on a bright crisp winter's afternoon were also amazing. The cocktails looked good so we will try one of those next time!

title: Good atmosphere
comment: A lovely bar with great views reasonable prices for drinks considering location. Perfect if staying in the hotel

title: Rooftop Rip Off!
comment: Can't decide whether it is a con trick or bad service. And definitely Italy warrants a complaint to the SIA. I should have checked and trusted TripAdvisor, you might as well be asked to be mugged. The worst service I have ever had in London.

title: Rank
comment: Poor reviews should have listen to the trip advisors previous reviews prior to visiting Poor service and it seems on going as lots of write ups are very negative .The management respond buy obviously no action taken to improve the staff attending the guests nor the customer service their clients desire or deserve. Ps great views but not the only place in London who can offer this .Hotel Barr the roof bar is stunning .

title: Awful place. Would suggest no one visits
comment: Arrived for a lovely dinner with friends. Paid the best part of £300 for dinner then went to visit the rooftop bar at the waitresses suggestion. My friend and went up only to be told our boyfriends had been turned away. I went to collect them and when I went to take them back upstairs I was sent via a route that took out straight to an exit. We weren't told we were being rejected, they just sent us straight out! Would have been okay except I'd just paid £40 for two drinks! Seems pretty overpriced at the best of times but to be turned away after having paid for an expensive meal and drinks left me pretty annoyed! Bouncers were incredibility rude. Told us management had rejected us, but when we asked to speak to this 'management' the bouncers seemed remarkably quick to say they weren't available! Next time I'll wear a short skirt as that seems to be what will allow you in! Appalling place in every way!  Totally understand you can turn away who ever you wish it's your place. But at least your bouncers should have the honesty to say that's what they're doing instead of taking your money and they sending your straight out of the back door. Never visit, it's an awful place!

title: Beautiful view and beautiful people
comment: I stayed at the ME for a week and visited this bar a couple of times. Amazing views, especially at night. The fire pits and heaters were welcome on a chilly night. The drinks were really good, as was the tapas. Lovely place for drinks with colleagues. Yes, it's expensive. Yes, there were a lot of beautiful people. But it is at the top of a luxury hotel.  Service was a bit slow and I could have done with out the super loud DJ, but I'd definitely visit again.

title: Plastic cups for a £15 cocktail - disappointing
comment: Broadly speaking bar is in a brilliant location of course and the drinks are served by bar staff who are clearly well versed in cocktail making.  The fact that an Old Fashioned was served in a plastic beaker was a bit disappointing when other drinks were presented in glass.  We ordered directly at the bar so a word of warning despite doing this you will have service charge added to the bill. (~£4/5 in this case for two drinks).  Bar staff are pretty friendly if a bit slow but for a Friday night they were doing well. Not sure that warrants paying service though just for ordering at a bar!

title: Lovely venue, excellent cocktails, slow service
comment: We came at 4pm on a Saturday and got the last table for cocktails. Whilst the drinks are expensive, they are very generous. Great venue for meeting friends but slow, disorganised service.

title: Excellent venue and Fantastic view of London!
comment: Finally managed to visit last night after hearing raving reviews for the rooftop bar from friends since it opened. Great venue for a few drinks with friends, music is good as well as the atmosphere. When the evenings are clear the view across the Central London skyline is absolutely stunning. Highly recommend and will certainly be heading back at the first opportunity.

title: Such a bad experience
comment: I feel I should start on a positive note as my issue was largely with the roof top bar. The Rib-eye steak was quite simply one of the best I have had in London. The wagyu burgers to start were also very good and the wine was delicious. Our waiter was friendly and observant and the meal in general was a good experience despite the 'style' of the place not being to my taste. If only the same could be said for the roof top bar.... We visited this for a pre dinner drink for my sisters 30th birthday and there was 12 in our party ranging from my siblings to my parents and in laws. The place reminded me of being at a beach club in Ibiza and not one of the good ones. More like Essex's version of Nikki beach - maybe cool for an 18 year old straight out of school but in the real world the whole place stunk of pretentiousness. My opinion was confirmed after my experience with the bar man. Due to the size of our party I ordered 6 gin and tonics to which he prepared fine. As I ordered the remaining drinks I was greeted with a grunt and a sigh and asked to order all at once in future. Granted he may have a point but I thought it was being helpful ordering 6 at a time and the manner in which he spoke and sighed was extremely rude and unprofessional. None the less I got on with it and ordered the remaining drinks.... he got the order wrong putting tonic in a vodka and soda drink. I felt a slight feeling of satisfaction considering he initially wanted the whole 12 drinks ordered at once and the recipient of the drink wasn't bothered so again we just got on with it. As he was finishing up the final drinks my 70 year old father who had to wait for another lift as we couldn't all fit in one approached me for his drink.... a gin n tonic, Probably irritating for 'Mr 12 drinks at a time' but in the grand scheme of things hardly a huge problem and I certainly wasn't going to leave my father without a drink. What I witnessed next was truly shocking even by London standards! As I apologised (out of courtesy rather than believing an apology was needed), and ordered the final gin and tonic he turned away and said 'no I'm closing the bill' Initially I thought he was joking and laughed along.... he wasn't. I politely explained the situation (even though I shouldn't need to) and he responded with the same answer saying he had to move on. Of course I immediately asked for the manager. The manager arrived and was pleasant. He listened to my complaint, apologised and personally went and poured the drink himself. The icing on the cake which for me summed up this place was when the manager said he would do something with the bill. A nice gesture I thought to maybe give the extra drink for free or perhaps a discount on the £140 round.... He informed me that to apologise for the service we had received he had taken off the service charge! both myself and 2 other guests listening in burst out laughing in unison. The fact service charge is added to a round of drinks served in a plastic cup with tonic dispensed out of a gun by a stuck up barman is bad enough but the fact there is a compulsory service charge on top of an £11 drink is saddening. For reference the excuse the manager gave was the bar was extremely busy. 1) I was not some drunk in a wetherspoons faffing around with his order. 2) there were a handful of people waiting to be served, maybe 5 at most. If this is 'busy' then maybe a reality check is needed or more staff need to be employed. I run a bar company supplying outdoor bars to sporting events and festivals. The majority of staff are part time students and If I had witnessed any one of them behaving like this to a customer I would be horrified. These guys have to deal with serving 50,000 pints in one afternoon of trading... now that is busy, but they do it with a smile on their face which we absolutely insist on. Unfortunately, more and more barmen, especially in 'top' London cocktail bars seem to think they are the most important person in the place. All too often they forget why they are there which is to enhance a customers experience. Unfortunately a self inflated ego was quite apparent and it is such a shame because the view from the balcony is quite simply phenomenal.

title: Amazing !!!
comment: An amazing place to spend your midday to evening moment. A perfect place to hang out with your love one or your friends. Cocktails are excellent and the view is WOW :)

title: Stunning sunset view
comment: Nice music, nice crowd, nice cocktail and vriendly staffs but needs some more deco set at the bar area. Outside view is excellent. We have enjoyed the sun set with our cocktails. Beautiful. Surely we ll come back !

title: Nice location but far to pricey
comment: I must say we disagree with lots of reviews by other people about rude staff. We attended in the middle the afternoon and found the door staff and waiters very polite and friendly. The views were not as good as I expected plenty of other places are far better. The drink and food prices I thought were far to expensive there fore we won't be going back again,a shame but I sorry the views don't warrant the high cost. Cheapest bottle of wine £37,small glass of the cheapest beer £7. No thanks. The sky garden has better views and £5 a PINT. Sorry you won't be getting any more money from us.There are many more place that are cheaper then this,so I wouldn't bother unless you have money to throw away.

title: Valentine's evening drinks
comment: We booked a table (essential) for drinks on valentines eve. The service was terrible and the Champagne isn't cheap but then you don't go there for either... the view was absolutely amazing! Blankets and outside fires are available on request. Staff were a little up their own... but still enjoyed the evening.

title: Nice
comment: Good view, great cocktails. The view is better during the day than in the evening. The bar is ver clean, with excellent staff.

title: Awful service, unfriendly staff
comment: Stopped by without a booking for a weekday evening drink. Staff on the door were friendly enough, but once we arrived upstairs that all came to an end. We were initially greeted by a very unfriendly man, and were made to feel that we were definitely not welcome. He fetched yet another unfriendly man, who basically said all the indoor tables were booked but seat yourselves outside. The four of us chose a table and sat down, and were then completely ignored. After 10 minutes or so, we left. Never to return ! The whole thing felt very pretentious and unfriendly.

title: Best best best roof top bar in london if you can get in
comment: Great place to hang out, eat small bites and drink with friends, the staff can get a bit pushy but once you're spending they back off

title: Coolest roof-top bar!
comment: We've been to this bar on a January night and a July night. It was buzzing both times.  It manages to be cool without being pretentious.

title: What a complete let down!
comment: My poor embarrassed friend who thought it would be a lovely idea to come here for a girly catch up and a little birthday treat was totally let down!  Came for a few cocktails, never been before. Stood at the bar to be looked down on only to be asked if we could go find a seat as they take your orders there. We find a stunning area outside with a view to die for only to be ignored for over 25 minutes.
