The table next to us were also complaining of the extremely slow service and to order there's then and now. Another 15 minutes pass and at this point I'm telling my friend we should just leave. But she was so upset that we had come so far that she wanted us to just wait a couple more minutes. As the rude waiter goes back over with there cocktails luckily the customers point over to us to tell him they're still waiting to be served. We had no apology just a "what would you like to order" as we send off our order it takes another 15 minutes for a different waiter to approach us to see if everything's okay on an empty table with nothing in our hands. Absolute joke. He checks on our cocktails and to find out if they've even been made. I can not express enough how bad the service is and the cheek to add on a service charge is just diabolical. £16 each for a cocktail. I will never come back here again. I cannot believe it took as long as it actually took. This may I add is on a Sunday evening with only 5 tables with only a few people on them??? You do the maths? Never will I return to this overpriced place. It's given Mehotel a very bad name! What a shame as the hotel it self looks amazing. I'll be letting others know of my experience and I can only say it won't be pretty.

title: Dual Birthday Celebrations
comment: Booked a table for 2 birthdays that were happening a day apart from each other. On entry - you are escorted through to an exclusive elevator that is key operated to take you up to the rooftop, where on arrival the maître d will take you to your table. We had a great table with stunning views of the London skyline.  We ordered several magnums of Laurent Perrier Rosé - however - the first bottle that was attempted to be served was warm! Easily sorted and we cracked on with our evening. Across the night we also sampled a few of the cocktails - which were fully loaded and got you merry very quickly! For eats we ordered a number of lite bites, Peri Peri Prawn Skewers, Battered Cauliflowers, Croquet Potatoes, Chicken Skewers & Beef Sliders. Our waitress was good fun and attentive to our needs, always topping up our glasses as and when required. Not a cheap night out - but we had fun. 4 of us and the bill was just over £1200. Will certainly come here again, and probably eat at STK on the ground floor to start the evening.

title: Great place for summer drinks
comment: Always very buzzy in the summer, great atmosphere, perfect for a pre theatre drink or a night out with a great view. Have eaten here twice and the food was okay - not the selling point of the place, but saying that you have STK and Cucina Aselina on site for decent food!

title: Poor service, extremely disappointed!!
comment: Great views of London, the bar is nice and modern. Drinks were overpriced and weren't great! It was a complete let down by all staff, poor service and no attention to guests! Definitely, they were not short of staff, many but not caring.  1. Reservation made, on the day we called to delay the reservation by 30mins. Lady on the phone said she would check as she believes it's fully booked and will try keep a table inside and not out on the terrace.  2. When arrived the place had plenty of vacant tables. Guy took our name and even asked if preferred inside or outside seating! (Contradicts to the phone call? Doesn't sound like table was assigned nor fully booked). We decided outside in the end but then the guy just pointed us out to the terrace rather than taking us to the table! (Where's the service????) 3. Walked to the terrace, no staff around but there were several couples having lunch and drinks. We sat down at a table with dirty glasses, waiter removed it without acknowledging us such as welcome, show the menus etc! Sat for 10-15mins still no one came to table (plenty of staff wandering around inside!). We walked up to the bar to order drinks, still had to wait for 5-10mins (1 bar man) then finally another bar man came asked if we been served! FYI no other guests around the bar waiting! When tried to order, the bar man told us to take a seat and someone would come over, we explained that we have been waited but no one cared.  4. Whilst waited for the drinks, we called waiter to ask about the menu and if someone could wipe the table as it was dirty and complaint to him that we weren't happy with the service as no one had acknowledged us and we even had to order drinks from the bar ourselves when it's a table service. Clearly the waiter did not care and not have passed any words to his supervisor/manager not even bothered to wipe the table or came back to take our food order! 5. When drinks came, wrong order came to our table where it supposed to be on another table. No apologies given and instead the waiter thought it was funny and laughed with his colleague so unprofessional.  One of the Spanish waitress was good at least more responsible with her job.  Been looking forward to visit this place but it was so disappointing! We even visited on Valentine's Day for lunch but after we experienced the above within 30mins, we did not want to stay for lunch.

title: Great views, nice atmosphere, average food and poor service
comment: Came here for a valentines day brunch and came away disappointed. Whilst the view is great and the outdoor terrace is lovely, the food and service let it down. Had to remind the waiter twice about the drinks and the food came before the drinks. Asked for a side of fries which came 25 minutes after the meal. To add insult to injury a service charge of 15% was added to the bill. Would recommend this place for drinks only.

title: Amazing view, lame service
comment: We went in the Radio Roof Bar to have some drinks. After looking for a table to sit being ourselves hostess, we needed to wait for more than 30' untill somebody came to greed us and take our order. We asked the waitress to check if she could move us to a lower and more confortable table considering that we've just ordered a bottle of wine and some food, so were spending some time in. We had to suggest her to double check in the system cause she didnt have the intention to do it and there were a few empty tables around us.The bar is small, but even so the guest service level is very poor and considering the bar was not crowded, it took a long time untill we've got a lower table (one close to the lift with no view) with all the people leaving around us. I guess than when you have people willing to spend money and time in your location you should have and open eye for them.

title: Radio rooftop
comment: I visitors London on a business trip for four days, I had been out for dinner and was advised by colleagues London to visit radio rooftop for drinks.  The views are nice great atmosphere with excellent service.  It had a good crown and served really nice drinks.  I would recommend this place.

title: Staff exceptional
comment: We stopped here for cocktails and the staff were great. V friendly and professional and attentive. The tapas was good too, especially the spanish cheese board! I would recommend, it had quite A 'business' feel but good all the same.

title: Great terrace views over the capital
comment: Located within very cool looking ME hotel on the strand. Walk through a swish reception and take the lift up to floor 11 where you are greeted by very friendly staff.  Worth booking if you want to get a vantage point on the roof terrace.  Brunch menu till early afternoon was plenty for us two, pulled pork burger and mushrooms on toast, sweet potatoes, all cooked to perfection. Glass of wine and some water on the table and there you have it.  Views over a 3 mile stretch of the Thames were excellent. Service was great, it's a secret location worth the trip.  £60 for the experience

title: Amazing Views
comment: Terrible Crowd; really average service...bartenders are slow but the waitresses try to help which is appreciated.

title: Slow service, drinks under average! View very good
comment: I experienced the service very slow, drinks came not together, quality rather poor.  Recommendation: go there for one drink (coke, water,...) enjoy the view and leave

title: Poor service on the roof.
comment: Pretty people, pretty expensive and pretty poor service. Standing at the bar for eons before being served. Very disappointing service :-(

title: Birthday Brunch
comment: Excellent service, drinks suitably expensive given the view, brunch menu excellent quality, and not over priced.. I'm informed I have to say more...an entertaining list of 15 gin and tonics

title: Random visit not impressed
comment: My wife and I attended this venue with some friends for a friend's birthday as we were directed by the door staff of the hotel our friends were staying in. Initially we were greeted by a slightly abrupt member of staff who didn't seem interested in letting us into the venue,we t gf en advised them that we had come from the waldorf they let us in. We were ushered to a lift and whisked to the 11th floor. Out into the bar itself imediatly a woman stood at a lecturn approaches and asks if we have reservations, this through my friend off guard initially as it was not expected we advised the woman we wanted a drink her response was abrupt and rather rude along the lines well if you don't have a reservation you will have to stand outside. Which I felt was a bit rude she could have explained the policy which I have since found out is table bookings in advance with minimum spend per person. Nice venue lovely views but massively over priced drinks 2 x cocktails and 2 x jack and coke for £56 is a little bit strong even for London.

title: So disappointed
comment: I had previously had a pleasant time for a friends birthday at radio rooftop bar, and so decided to take my boyfriend for a drink on his birthday before dinner across the road. Whole experience was poor. The roped off entrance is pretentious but could get over that, we stood at the bar for 10 minutes, then told to sit down to get served. Managed to order after another 10 minutes... Then 20 minutes later drinks hadn't arrived, so we walked out thirsty... But saved me some money!

title: Great view
comment: We had a table booked here for 9.30, all went to plan.  The venue is really nice and obviously amazing views/ outside heated seating.  Drinks choice is really good, our service was fantastic. Our waitress was constantly over to top up our champagne glasses. The music was varied and so was the crowd. A nice venue to visit when in London.

title: Only worth the trip for the view!!
comment: This is a really nice place, with fantastic views and a great outside terrace, however that's where it ends. We waited almost 20 minutes to get served and it wasn't that busy. To add insult to injury the 'service' charge, for standing at the bar watching staff aimlessly wander/chat to each other, was almost £5. I also don't expect to get tonic from a gun when paying £35 for 2 gin & tonics and a small bottle of Estrella Damm!!. Such a shame, could have been really impressive.

title: Nothing special
comment: Good for views of London, but other than that nothing special. Drinks are as everywhere (glasses are plastic though). Sliders were good though - triple cooked chips and mini burgers.

title: Superb location and excellent food
comment: We were very lucky to have a beautiful clear day in december for lunch. The staff were very friendly and attentive and the food was excellent. Considering the location the cost of the lunch was very reasonable. I would definitely visit again.

title: Lovely, posh dining event
comment: Before our most recent visit to London I'd done a bit of research on places I wanted to visit while staying in the city. I discovered Radio Rooftop at the ME London Hotel offered a nice bar with tapas and an outdoor view of the city. The views did not disappoint! The menu included a variety of creative drinks and some very tasty snacks. Many of the seats were outside, but on the night we visited it was quite chilly, and everyone sitting outside was covered with blankets provided by staff. We chose an indoor seat. Definitely a posh stop that should be added to your list - particularly when the weather is warm!

title: Best bar in town with a great view it buzzing
comment: If your in London this is a must. One of the best places in town at the moment great atmosphere, with some smart people and what a great view. The music is buzzing just the like the crowd one of the chic places in London. Don't bother to go in your trainers etc they are quite strict at the door if you don't fit they aren't letting you in so if your not a regular book. Hey guys see you Friday !!

title: Nice night
comment: Came here after the theatre my partner had reserved us a table. Atmosphere was great, do was brilliant and cocktails were lovely and flowed very well  Would defiantly come again and we stayed in the ME hotel so went down 2 flights and fell in to bed which was lovely!

title: Amazing London Views
comment: The location and views of Radio Rooftop are great! The food is pretty standard, yet still good. Must try the watermelon cocktail - one of my all time favs!

title: Great Space, Great People
comment: This has great indoor and outdoor space overlooking the City and the Thames. However even better than the space and the views are the great people who work here. Dora, the boss on the evening of Jan. 2nd, Anna and Alesandra were all wonderful. All have terrific personalities and made everyone feel very welcome. We were even able to play a trick on Alesandra's bartender boyfriend at our hotel. We were there on a cold wet night and it was still a lot of fun. In the warmer weather I can only imagine. I strongly recommend the Radio Rooftop. And, on second thought, we should have had the magnum!!

title: Nice ambience, nice view
comment: Have been to this place twice, once for drinks and once for brunch. Like the drink session, nice to hang around in the terrace and enjoy the British sun as much as you can. For brunch, we were a big group, they handled us good. The service was really nice, the food was not good enough to remember though. (Maybe i should try again) I'd prefer this place more for chilling in a cool place with a drink.

title: Great views
comment: Crisp, January afternoon but blue skies. Sat outside which was pleasant in the sunshine. Had a bite to eat from the Brunch menu which didn't think was so overpriced. Found the staff very friendly. It's a lovely view of the Thames from up here and you can see a few landmarks. A stones throw from theatres so if you're taking in a show, treat yourself. Will definitely be back in summer next time in town for a different perspective.

title: Worst service ever
comment: Lovely place and amazing drinks...but worst service ever! Was here for 2 hours but only managed 2 drinks! Be prepared to wait an hour per drink... Refused the 15% service charge as although we were kindly given a shot due to wait for first drink...we then waited just as long for second drink!

title: Great views, good service kept warm even in winter
comment: Went for a pre-dinner drink with the wife on a cool December evening. The heaters were more than good enough to drink outside, the service was quick and attentive, the ambiance was good.  A really great place for a bottle (or two). M

title: Awesome view
comment: Radio bar is a most magnificent place to enjoy a drink with friends soaking up the stunning views of all London has to offer. Not the cheapest place for a drink but I would suggest that's reflective of the location and the view. Service is efficient, I would recommend a visit.

title: Drinks after STK
comment: We came here with some friends after a evening at STK. The place is nice and the atmosphere is good with amazing views, but some of the staff let it down. One of the bar staff was rude and the door staff would not let me back in at first after I went to get my coat from STK. aggressive and only gave in when another staff member said I had been in and I showed receipts. Overall good views and nice atmosphere

title: Great bar!!!
comment: The place newly open is a must to do in London. The hostess will make you feel special, the bartender can make you any drink you like and Vladimir will make sure everything goes well for you evening. Then, you need to book a table and enjoy your time at one of the most fashionable bar of central London!

title: New Year's Day
comment: Cool start to our new year. Hot chocolate n blankets to allow us to take in the fab views from this bar. Some of us even had a little baileys on the side.  (Not me... Dry January ) Lovely polite staff too ..

title: Superb views, good vibe, place for hang out!
comment: We had a business party at Radio, and it was the most memorable fun time we had. From the views, services and the ambiance, it was exceptional. We are impressed the attention of details on services. Big thanks to Vladimir who been so helpful and friendly. he looked after the party very well. Make every single of us feel welcome. We had good time and looking forward to pay more visit. The ambiance was good. And good value for party.

title: Overpriced and slow
comment: It took forever to get drinks, Waiter must have needed to go to off-license for more jack daniels! I would expect service to be slick to justify the extremely high prices, view alone is not enough.

title: great views
comment: Love this place- the cocktails are very expensive, but they are very alcoholic and you are paying for those stunning views. I wouldn't hesitate to go here again.

title: Fabulous views
comment: Went to the radio Bar on a sunday evening - great vies as it was a nice clear night. Service is attentive Cocktails were very good. Word of warning half the outside terrace closes around 10pm ( best views side) due to a neighbour complaining of noise.

title: The best view of London - day or evening.
comment: Everything is great ... the music, the food, the drinks, the service and the general relaxed atmosphere. We were there a couple of times - once to enjoy the afternoon sunshine and then to see the sun setting over London. Worth the price. Remember to book.

title: Lovely views
comment: This place is very nice for the high roof top views of London. That's mostly what you'll be paying for! The inside isn't very great! So it's best to visit when the weather is good as you would want to sit outside.

title: Worth it for the views
comment: We popped in after lunch nearby, we were asked if we had a reservation, which we didn't, but was still able to be seated outside. We didn't have the best view from our table but I guess that is what the reservations are for. The service was fine, the cocktails were fine. I wasn't blown away but if you're looking for a decent outside bar i'd give this place a shot.

title: A buzzing place
comment: The out door views are excellent in night and we were lucky that the floor manager gave us a full guided visit, probably as our host was a high end spender and with a big daily budget in the bar. So we received excellent service levels . The place was busy and buzzing with people. Elevators are a bit slow, and u do find some stupid people in the elevators. Highly recommended for a chilled social night out with friends.

title: Perfect luncheon place with a view and nite club for evening.
comment: good food. perfect bloody mary. open air with sun shine, smoking section allowed and a view to a river.

title: Great views......but difficult to get in.....
comment: Trendy bar with amazing views. Needs a map to get in via the hotel lifts...... Once in its a high priced bar with views over London.

title: Wow! What a find!
comment: Certainly one of the top roof top bars in London. Great service and very cool and lively atmosphere even on a Tuesday night. If visiting with a group it is worth reserving a table.

title: Fantastic views, food and service
comment: Finding the way into this place is tricky we have tried before and failed. This time we booked a table on the terrace and were given a lovely seating area with heater to keep us warm. We had still gone to the wrong door but a member of staff pointed us in the right direction, which is literally on the Strand and the entrance to a hotel and other venues. You walk through the hotel bar to the elevator to gain access and a member of staff makes sure you go to the right floor. The bar and restaurant seems quite exclusive and numbers seem to be restricted. So if you are going, you are probably best to book. We ordered platters of cured meats and cheeses and a dish of very delicious green peppers. The service was excellent and I would definitely return. It must be incredible in the summer. We were there on a pretty grim afternoon in November and it was still brilliant.

title: Amazing night time view of London
comment: Not cheap at £13 a cocktail but refreshingly different selection with none of the old favourites - ie. forcing you to step outside your comfort zone. You have a choice of tables/sofas/chairs inside set around a triangular bar or an outside spacious 2 sided patio area with heaters and a mixture of tables, chairs and more comfortable corners. Stunning view especially at night (through very blustery when we went). I would definitely love to re-vist on a sunny summers afternoon as an ideal spot for a bottle of bubbly whilst sunning oneself. Not sure its an all nighter but perfect for a couple of hours and far better than a windowless den. Visited many roof top bars around the world and this is as good as any.

title: birthday drinks
comment: great crowd, atmosphere, usual London hotel prices for drinks but for the fab views a must. Gets very bust on Fridays and Saturdays so booking a table is always recommended

title: Great Views, Glam, Pricey
comment: Fabulous views and a very modern and glamorous bar, we hadn't made a reservation but they kindly managed to find us a table as we only wanted to stay for one drink. A very stylish crowd fill the place certainly in a Saturday night, I certainly felt underdressed! Not the biggest selection of drinks I seen, but they arrived quickly and were pretty good, though for the prices they charge they really needed to be. Great location for a treat, but too pricey for me as a regular drinking location,

title: Good view, painful entry system
comment: The view is outstanding from this bar but I really cannot stand the 'your name's not down' system for entry. They do get busy but really sometimes they seem empty upstairs and are still awkward on the door downstairs.

title: Suggestive view!
comment: Great view and really stylish bar. It must be amazing in Summer! Drinks were average but it's worth visiting.

title: Great view over london
comment: Amazing bar and very different day and night. Early evening was my preference, we enjoyed wonderful cocktails that weren't even on their menu so don't be afraid to experiment!

title: Highly Recommend
comment: I went there for cocktails with my girlfriend and we had a brilliant time. The staff were well presented and professional at every stage (door, elevator, reception, bar, floor). We were seated at a nice table which had views all across London which set a nice tone for the cocktails, which were made well with correct measurments and nice presentation. The manager, I think Vladimir was his name was really attentive in making sure the place was running smoothly, and he even had time to join us for a quick chat which made us feel really welcome and appreciated. I cant fault this place for anything, we shall return!

title: Good Views
comment: Excellent venue, good tunes & fantastic cocktails. Views good, albeit roof-toppy. Need to book a table in advance

title: Trendy not fun
comment: Staying at the ME hotel we got a table reserved for us - however when we arrived at 10.30pm for the booking they seated us outside with the smokers and in the cold - they did move us inside to a table on the at the front of the club - the manager did look after us from there on in. Music was good but nobody dances not even bobbing - the beautiful people too cool to dance, staff all lovely and the venue is very trendy - worth a visit but personally not fun enough for us.

title: Very expensive
comment: Even if you go up to the bar to get your drinks they still expect a massive tip. Its a nice atmosphere being outside although its very noisy inside with music blaring out, so not romantic. Great for friends though. They reserve a lot of tables which I dont think they should do, as you can never find a seat and there are loads of tables around with reserve on them.Just let the people who are there and have paid a lot of money for their drinks sit down.

title: Lovely place and view of London
comment: Nice cocktails , nice vibe, a bit pricey ,service was ok but not what we would have expected ... It is a nice place to go tho.

title: Great views great atmosphere
comment: Went for after party drinks. Stunning views over the city and great atmosphere to match. Good music and a chance to chat on the terrace. Great !

title: Cool and classy
comment: Had a table here on Saturday night. It's a bar on top of me hotel on the strand. Great drinks. Cool tunes. Just booked again to go for my birthday.

title: A nice spot, worth a visit... Fairly pricey.
comment: I work on the 7th floor of the building just across the way, in fact my desk window is almost at eye level with the terrace area. Because of this it's become a staple after work favourite, late afternoon meetings often end up there - it's probably one of the better postcard views of London. Tends to be some fairly decent DJ playing Wed/Thur evenings. A few negatives: can be very pretentious indeed, tables are seemingly reserved for no reason. It's is rather predictably expensive being a hotel + when the weather is fine the management seem to try and create a buzz by making people queue and generally asking a lot of nonsense questions and flicking through their clipboards of paper before letting you in. Popularity over the summer months meant I was turned away on one occasion, sighting some excuse they were full and only accepting hotel residents - this also happened to my boss, who actually checked-in to the hotel to ensure our first time London visitors weren't disappointed. Not really what I expect given I've probably spent in the region of £1-2k there this year on client entertainment alone. To guarantee fuss free admission, get there just before 5pm and access via the hotel rather than the street. My advise to management would be, try and look after your neighbouring clientele. Nobody wants to be turned away in front of clients! Given you seem to have a relatively low-level of staff turnover, perhaps recognising visitors who are there as much as once a week and dropping the nonsense door policy.

title: London's finest rooftop bar
comment: No one can deny this... The view is absolutely stunning - without a doubt the best view in London. What makes this place stand out is the excellent service with attentive and polite staff. All were very courteous and helpful. It was not just one person but an overall attitude by everybody. I commend the management for their leadership and training of the staff. My friend Francesco took me here and I am so happy he did! Although summer is over, this place is till perfectly suitable for get together with friends.  Tip: Do your part and make sure you dress up.

title: Great view great food great drinks great time
comment: Radio Rooftop bar is Me London's rooftop bar with a nice view of the themes, good cocktails, relaxing chairs and beds and everything that lets you forget you are in a big city.  Service is great as well.

title: Great View
comment: Lunchtime drinks at the top of ME London at Radio Rooftop was really unique. Although many of the tables were reserved it was quiet and we had a corner sofa for birthday drinks. The view was amazing and even on an October day you could see all the sights around the strand and River Thames. Drinks weren't cheap but they were freshly made cocktails and even the non alcoholic Raspberry Blush was lovely. The bathrooms were weird as all black and mirrored and strangely spooky but nice. Good place for drinks.

title: Average
comment: Probably my least favourite of all the rooftop bars I have been in London Nice venue and bar however the views are not as good in comparison to others  I found the drinks menu quite limited, it wasn't anything special. We walked in without making a reservation and were offered stools at the bar inside. There were a large number of tables free all with reserved signs even though there was no intention for them to be occupied for hours Other bars would usually let you sit there until before the reservation. Whilst the staff did their job they were not particularly friendly  We stayed for two drinks and decided to go elsewhere

title: Nice cocktails and impressive views
comment: Went on a Wednesday evening and was surprised how busy it was. The cocktails where really nice a little sloe to come out but we were enjoying the views! A great date place a little prices but very impressive so worth paying the premium for the views. It was also great as it had a heated terrace with which means that we could sit outside.

title: great views and attentive service
comment: the 5 stars really is for the views and the lovely decor.the service was attentive but,as you sometimes get at trendy places.i got the impression the staff thought they were a bit too attractive to smile and be polite.still,they were attentive so not all bad,ideal for a celebratory drink or to impress a loved one

title: Good view and music
comment: Great location and music . Trendy , BT relaxed . Gin cocktails are awesome and tapas delightful .definitely a landmark

title: GO JUST TO ENJOY A DRINK AND TAPAS OUTSIDE
comment: Interesting atmosphere and very popular at night with a younger crowd. Nice first night place for a drink, tapas and the view

title: Soulless. Slow staff and overpriced drinks
comment: We booked this as a treat for our friends visiting us in London and I was embarrassed that we did. It's pretentious, noisy and like being on a bad cruise ship. The staff were SLOW and borderline rude. A cocktail is £14 which is pricey. The view is fine but not so amazing that it is worth being treated like human cattle.

title: Night out with my girlies!
comment: Amazing time at Radio Rooftop with my lovely Francesco! Always a great host and very kind to us. We love radioTheThethecocktails

title: The Two Stars Are For The View
comment: Firstly, the view of London from the bar is great, the venue itself is modern, clean and the terrace seating is indeed swish. However ... The doorman was rude The lady operating the elevator was rude The hostess was rude The waitresses were especially rude To be fair, the barman who served us when we first arrived was friendly while making our drinks, but the the core customer service reeks of pretentiousness from the moment you arrive and simply wasn't for us.  This is a place people will go simply "to be seen" and if you're not obviously going to be spending a fortune then you can be made to feel uncomfortable, as we were. There were plenty of empty tables when we arrived at 4pm on a Sunday afternoon, inside and outside, but we were not allowed to sit down at any of them as they were booked. None of these empty tables were filled in the 45 minutes we were there. You'll pay £8 for a bottle of beer and £14 for a cocktail ... and of course, you're paying for the view. We've seen that view now and so have no reason to ever return.

title: What a view !!!!
comment: First time in radio with my husband and we really loved it. The view is amazing, the service is great and Tatiana was very nice to us. The bar was busy but she managed to sit us. We will be back soon!

title: Meh !
comment: I had been recommended a visit here by a few friends who had been on a few occasions. Got to the ME hotel and they sent us outside to a side door, which was locked so had to walk back and go straight through the hotel to lifts. When we got in, nice greeting and walked to an outside table. Our main view was plant pots but I suppose i can see it would be nice on a beautiful sunshine day. The vodka wasnt good, appeared watered down and the bill was horrendous. £15 a drink is just mental, even if it is supposed to be a cool place to be. Usually like this type of place and its normally up my street but this one failed to hit the mark.

title: Drinks
comment: Had an excellent time visiting the Radio rooftop bar at the weekend. The staff were pleasant and polite, as we were. The service was slick and efficient. We reserved in advance and received a telephone call to confirm the reservation the day before. Dress smart. It is expensive, but you wouldn't go there to get hammered, you go there to enjoy the atmosphere and the views.

title: Birthday night out & thank you to Dora.
comment: This was mine and my partners first time at radio rooftop, as he chose this venue to take me for birthday drinks. We can say that the service was of 5 star quality. This was due to the waitress named Dora who was so polite and attentive towards our requests. She definitely is a credit to this place. The view was very beautiful also. A truly lovely night, will definitely be returning in the near future. A big thanks again to Dora.

title: Lovely place to chill
comment: Went there for birthday drinks on a Friday evening. Staff were very polite. The cocktails and nibbles were really good, especially the smoked almonds. Great atmosphere!

title: Amazing view
comment: Good service and great views of London. The staff is very kind. Make sure you make a reservation if you want to enjoy the terrace and the views.  A bit pricey, though.

title: Nice place but highly portentous.
comment: Nice place but highly portentous. Staff seemingly think they are better than the customers which makes the experience slightly uncomfortable.

title: Gorgeous place for drinks and food.
comment: This is one of the most stunning restaurant/bar/hotels that I have ever been to. The entrance on the ground floor is huge with black marble and white lights. When you step out of the lift at the Radio Rooftop you feel as though you are being welcomed into someone's home. The staff are so friendly and it feels as if you have known them for years. The atmosphere is sophisticated and trendy but low key. Views are sensational and the seating is luxurious.

title: Amazing experience
comment: Went there with a couple of friends. The weather wasn't the best but the views from up there are amazing! You can see all the best parts of London! The drinks are good and the price fair for the view you get. Really nice staff, our waitress Alexandra was always there asking if we needed help and helping us choosing the best drinks. Looking forward for my next visit!!

title: Enjoyable but stroppy waitress
comment: We visited here with some friends for my birthday. We'd read about the staff being aloof but we didn't find this. Had a lovely tapas meal but when the bill came, there was a 15% 'discretionary' tip which was nearly £50. We decided that this was far too much for 5 people so we reduced it to around £25. When the waitress took our money, she counted it twice in front of us and informed us we hadn't paid enough to cover the bill. We explained that we had reduced the tip and she tutted and stomped off leaving a very awkward atmosphere! I don't think she understood the concept of discretionary. Having said that, the food was good and it was a lovely afternoon.

title: Great cocktails!!
comment: My girlfriend and I went here for Valentines drinks (before dinner) and found the décor, the music and the views great! Yes it is a bit expensive and I have seen a lot of people getting turned away but that is because they get so busy and don't want to overfill it! The doormen are massively over-miserable though..!  I would recommend for a few drinks before dinner... Even if it is a bit pricey.... The view makes up for it!

title: Drinks with a view
comment: Drinks with friends after work, with a spectacular view of London. At the door, we were greeted hesitantly as we did not have a reservation. Upon arrival, we were advised to sit where we preferred provided there was no reservation tab on the table which was slim pickings. Irrespective, the choice of drinks were good, expensive though.. But I guess to be expected for a hotel bar with views such as theirs. Service was tardy. Will go back, though be prepared for a leisurely evening.

title: Fantastic views! Amazing cocktails!
comment: We had the most amazing time at the Radio rooftop bar! This was the perfect start to our evening with fantastic views across London. We were lucky enough to have no rain, however it was a bit cold so bring a coat if you're planning on standing outside for a while!  Can't wait for our next evening at Raido bar!

title: Fabulous sunset view
comment: Chic rooftop lounge with the best views of London. Make a reservation so you can bypass the line. The Gold One cocktail is highly recommended.

title: Amazing Views
comment: A very nice bar with very good service. The drinks are a bit pricey and so is the food but it's worth every penny.

title: Awesome bar
comment: Radio has some of the best views of London along with great tapas and cocktails. We stayed at ME London and enjoyed lunch and evening drinks. In the evening there was a good dj playing cool funky house. Apparently it's worth booking a table on weekends! We were there Monday - Thurday and didn't need to book.

title: Radio Rooftop
comment: Great vibe at night! View of the Thames and Tower Bridge! Service was great and food was perfect! Tapas style with a solid wine selection to go with it. Services were well versed on wine tastes.

title: Oh dear, don't believe the hype.
comment: We had heard about this place and decided to go in for lunchtime drinks and a bite to eat. We hadn't booked so we were told we could only sit inside however it was very clear that subsequent arrivals were just coming in and seating themselves outside. We were given menus instantly and some cocktails were suggested by a very 'touchy' waiter. We wanted wine rather than cocktails which seemed to disappoint him. He then failed to return to take our drinks order. We also wanted to eat so had to go and find our own menu. We watched our waiter being very attentive to two groups of young women and eventually managed to attract the attention of another waiter. We ordered our wine and tried to order some food but were told only the brunch menu was available. We could clearly see other customers with bowls of chips etc. We drank our over-priced wine and left. The young woman and her mother who were at the next table got up and left too, never having their order taken. Nice view, everything else rubbish. And Devesh, stop touching the customers.

title: Waste of time and money
comment: I was in London with work and my colleague and myself decided to treat ourselves to a few drinks here. We reserved an outdoor table for a minimum spend of £150.  Upon arrival, I felt the venue was very stylish, atmosphere seemed great and good music. We waited briefly until our table was confirmed, then shown by a polite waitress.  The table was terrible, a high table squeezed in a corner under a heat lamp, we had a rubbish view, immediately felt uncomfortable and regretting the reservation. It felt like a pub smoking area, no music, no lounging tables or chairs as advertised.  The service was absolutely shocking, the general waitressing was polite, but very slow and unattentive. I complained to the original hostess with ombré hair and requested another table to be told the venue was full, inside and out, the balcony with good views closes at 10pm. There was nothing they could or would do. The heat lamps couldn't be turned off either. No empathy, no apology, absolutely no desire to attend to our needs or expectations. They already had my credit card at this point, a very sly trick, they took that before they'd shown us the rubbish table.  There was 2 lower tables right beside us without reservation signs. These were quickly occupied by random smokers. So I tried to stay optimistic and make most of my one night in the city, decided the cocktails and service could improve with the night. It didn't. When the other balcony closed it meant our table area was crammed with people smoking. I booked the outdoor table for views! There was two couples stood using our table, which I had paid for. As far as I'm concerned tables should come with table service. Meaning that people cannot walk in from the street and join booked tables.  I absolutely hated my night, spent my minimum spend because I had to then went straight home to my hotel after a terrible evening. I didn't enjoy a second of it, the cocktails were average. I had to take my drink to the bar twice because it was made incorrectly, the waitresses were too slow and infrequent to grab their attention. Then to top it off had to pay a service charge for the worst service I have ever endured in London, actually at any high end bar. After working as hostess myself for many years before my profession now I was absolutely appalled at this venue. I have realistic expectations and a gesture of good will or apology should be instilled on the staff here. The staff get their service charge so don't need to earn it themselves. Don't waste your time paying or booking anything. Maybes pop in for a drink to enjoy the atmosphere, at a push. I didn't even order any food because I was so furious. I spent my tab allowance and left.

title: Nice location
comment: The Views of London were excellent and the seating area outside. The Bar and seating inside was very nice but shame about the rude staff!

title: Rude staff. Overpriced drinks
comment: I would not recommend this bar. We were asked to move from our table very rudely by the staff, who couldn't explain why we needed to move nor did they offer us another table.  The prices are ridiculous !

title: Great spot
comment: Often go here on Sundays for drinks with the girls - always have a table for walk ins, although if you try to book before hand they are really fussy and act like they wont fit you in. The drinks are really good and reasonably priced. The service is really friendly, the views are great. They usually have a DJ on which is a good atmosphere. Highly recommend.

title: Possibly one of the most racist places you'll visit in London
comment: I've visited the radio bar on a number of a occassions, views are unreal, watermelon cocktail is my favourite, BUT the door policy could not be more overtly racist. I'm of indian background, professional guy who understands how it works in town with the door staff and Radio have may some ethnic minorities on the door but it is honestly shocking. I understand that top end places in London are generally pretentious and picky on the door and think groups of asian guys just cause trouble, 50% of the time they probably do, but as a group of 4 (2 couples mixed) being refused entry for no reason is beyond me. Wanna check out a great rooftop bar, sushi samba, Madison and aqua are amazing, great staff and fantastic vibe. This place could be the best in town but it just needs to get over itself.

title: Amazing views over London
comment: Amazing views over London. Its partially heated next to the outside seating area. Modern and luxurious.

title: Fab location although hard to get a table on a sunny day!
comment: We popped along on a sunny Saturday for afternoon cocktails, we were surprised how busy, we had to wait about 20mins at the bar- most people were getting cocktails and it was a slow process. Once served we went out side and the views were fab, I would recommend to reserve or book arable but of course weather dependant in the UK. Great setting and location, just maybe more staff at bar.. Would return and recommend

title: Great customer service
comment: Lovely experience last night booked to celebrate my graduation. The manager was very kind and friendly, flexible about where we wanted to sit, even gave us all a complimentary glass of champagne. Absolutely lovely experience wished the evening would never end!

title: Great summer Drinks
comment: Great place to entertain in the summer. great view from the top. the Food and service was good and sevice attentive.

title: Stylish and Cool Venue
comment: This is a great venue and one of my current favourites in London. It's a lovely place to come for lunch on a sunny day and stay on into the afternoon when the DJ starts and the music kicks in. Quite expensive but it is Central London so it's expected. Beautiful cocktails and great food.

title: One to visit everyday....
comment: My girlfriend took me for a drink at radio bar, we didnt know what to have. The bartender Tibor guided us through the whole process what to have and whats on the menu. He was very polite and very professional. Would love to come as often as possible. A place to hang out for a drink or two.

title: Great views
comment: Visited for drinks on a friday night. Cocktails very nice. We were able to sit out on the terrace and take in the views, was lovely. It is a relatively young glam crowd. Music is loud.

title: greta venue
comment: As expected, minor queue to enter, early evening drinks with friends before going on for food. Needless to say, everyone within are very well dressed, almost like being in a venue of models. Prices, madness to what it is, being served beers in plastic glasses, which seems ridiculous when paying there bottle rates. Not a major complaint though as it was different.

title: What A View
comment: Excellent venue with fabulous 360 degree views. Located on the roof of the Melia Hotel opposite Somerset House in the Strand. Lots of staff and waiting service so no haggling at the bar to get served. I would recommend booking a table as it gets busy. There are tall tables and some big lounge sofas and coffee tables towards the back of the bar. There was a service charge added to the already quite expensive drinks (£12 Gin and Tonic, cheapest white wine was £32 a bottle). however it was still worth it. They served Tapas and the service was quick.

title: they don't care about the guests of the bar!!!
comment: this is my second visit in this place and unfortunately not better than the first one. i was with two friends of mine and they told me some kind of stupid things about policy of the bar we have to be mixed group, not only men. any way, we came inside and part number two of the nightmare "Radio Roof Bar Experience" became. there is no tables available!!! thanks god there is one Amazing woman on the reception Monika and she sort out this problem with the table and we went to table on the terrace . than the waitress came after 10 min. and i don't know why she think that she is a princess but not a waitress. anyway. another 15 min waiting for the drinks... and after less then hour one italian girl told me that we have to leave the table because someone else waiting for it... REALLY???? so basically our contact with more than 10 people in this venue was so bad, the only person that did his job properly was the host Monika. and the view, but everybody else just no words for them... i hope that the management of this place will make the changes because this is the wrong way and i really do believe that i am not the only one who is unhappy of the experience there!!!

title: mixed emotions great view bad stuff
comment: I have been there a few times! And to be honest I've met a very nice girl, her name is Monica and she is a hostess in this bar. Actually she helped me every time - first time with a table and cigarettes, the second time they moved me from the table- some girl with very bad English and then Monica find us another table. I am really impressed from her. She really knows what she is there for. Nice drinks, not bad waitresses, amazing view. I think that they have a lot to do, so this place could become a really nice bar. A lot of issues to solve. Very dark toilet, very difficult access to the bar. Dirty glasses. But the most horrible thing is that they were moving us from table to table -2, 3 times. This can drives you crazy. Make a booking guys for this place.

title: Great place
comment: A fabulous roof top bar with fantastic views over London very quiet when we went for lunch. The food was excellent and the wine was good and not too expensive. One minor point was the excessive service charge on the final bill. Overall a very pleasant way to spend an afternoon.

title: Brilliant
comment: A lovely afternoon. Brilliant food and very attentive staff. The view was nice. Although 15% service charge is a little excessive

title: Good place to drink and see London's landmarks
comment: Great view of London and perfect on a summer's day. Relaxed atmosphere with good cocktails and nice service.

title: Panoramic views, but the clientele aren't as beautiful as they think.!
comment: This bar certainly has the wow factor and the panoramic views on a sunny evening are as good as anywhere in London.  The staff weren't particularly friendly though and the bar tends to attract a rather pretentious crowd. Drinks are expensive, but frankly you're paying for a very cool bar with amazing views.  If I'm paying those kinds of prices I expect the best spirits and the best mixers. I was therefore a bit surprised to see my G&T served with a soda gun.  Go there for drinks with a date you want to impress and watch the sun set - then I'd say move on somewhere more friendly.

title: if you go to this bar reserve a seat or else be prepared to stand
comment: we thought this bar would be for hotel guests only it wasn't all reserve seating security guards everywhere not a relaxed atmosphere

title: Too cool for school...
comment: Visited for brunch on a Saturday as party of 6. Reserved table in advance, this is a must. Views are super as is the outside terrace area. Nice vibe & not too busy. Quite expensive eg a glorifed toastie (no sides - that's it) = £15. We had cocktails & enjoyed a hefty service charge with our bill. But it is London and it is a lovely experience. Would go back.

title: Cocktails in the (wet) summertime!
comment: Visited on a wet Saturday in August for cocktails with friends. Fabulous views of London. Expensive (and delicious) cocktails - to be expected I guess. Wish we'd called to book a table as we spent quite a while at the bar waiting for a table to become available. There is a real mix of people in this bar - quite entertaining actually!

title: Great views and nice bar!
comment: Always full of people, it is really cool and trendy. Serving really nice cocktails. Awesome views of London from the rooftop too!

title: Highly recommend.
comment: Beautiful cocktails - amazing view!!! Afternoon drinks with a group of girls and it was perfect! some say expensive but no more so than other places in London and the view made it worthwhile. Highly recommend.

title: Cool and trendy drinking spot
comment: An expensive, exclusive wonderful treat. Dress well and book ahead, Sunday's not so busy. People watching galore in cool, chilled out surroundings. Views are breathtaking especially late afternoon/sunset and music is trendy but chilled

title: Not impressed
comment: £75/ person minimum spend is a bit too much considering we booked for drinks only.Specially when I booked the table I've been told the minimum spend £75 per table.Waiting staff is nice and friendly maybe a bit pushy with taking the orders.The cocktails are pre-made, not impressing at all.Food is ok. All overall I would rather go somewhere else.

title: Awesome views of London- Good drinks spot
comment: Visited Radio Rooftop with a friend of mine visiting from Qatar/Doha. Great place to get drinks and sit out with nice views of the City with it being near the river. Make sure you make a reservation if you want to be seated especially during a busy summers day or evening regardless of whether it is a weekend or not.  Otherwise its standing room at the bar which is just as pleasant! Subtle piece of advice if you want some change left....watch your bar tab. The cocktails can be £13-15 a pop and its easy to run up a tab of a couple of hundred quid very quickly.  The champers/wine and beers/lagers are suitably priced.  Cant comment on the food as we didn't order any.  Overall a trendy drinks spot with a great vibe!

title: Great view and amazing service
comment: Popped in for a drink on Friday to kick off the bank holiday weekend. It was amazing to see how the place fills up and after sunset the view was amazing. The drinks are nice - priced for a 5star location. Good service, will be back for sure.

title: Great Night out
comment: Went as a walk in as a group of 4 and managed to secure a table for the whole evening, great night, atmosphere with spectacular views across London. Pricey but expected. Pornstar Martini's a must, best in London

title: Brilliant
comment: Get R over to to serve you he is one in a million. This bar is on the roof top and the views are amazing. A little pricey but it is London. If you are a guest at the hotel you do not need to book a table. Loved it

title: Work Meeting with a View
comment: Met with some work contacts for a drink and bite to eat. We were very lucky as it was pouring rain at the start meaning the outside was free and we decided to brave it. Lucky we did as soon after it fined up and we had amazing views of the Thames and City as our reward. Overall the drinks were fine and the food was fine but ultimately the draw card here is the view. If the day is not nice or you have to sit inside then it is probably not worth the extra cost of the drinks but if you get a place on the balcony then this is a great experience.

title: Went for birthday drinks and loved it!
comment: I went here for birthday drinks and it was a good view, the cocktails were nice but the service wasn't amazing and for the price you are paying I think it could be better. Regardless I still had a good time! TIP: If you can, try and get to the sofa-like seating right at the back of the terrace if there's a medium sized group of you! It's lovely and a little more like you're own private area!

title: Tremendous
comment: This is a beautiful place, good food, lovely cocktails, great service and a really nice atmosphere, would recommend it.

title: View Wasted on Management of this premises
comment: The view and venue is lovely...just need to change the attitude of management. Very poor service and they have too inflated opinion of themselves. You are serving the customer...not the other way round! To add service to the bill every time someone orders a drink at the bar is shocking. I would understand if it was table service. Incidentally, we switched to bar service because the table service was terrible. There are lots of other rooftop bars. I am going there instead.

title: Awesome drinks and service
comment: I went here a couple of weeks ago to entertain two clients and we had an amazing time. The views are phenomenal the champagne is fairly reasonably priced for London and the cocktails were also lovely. I would truly recommend this rooftop bar as a must place to go to.

title: The AMAZING Manager JULIE DOUMER strikes again - pure brilliance
comment: I have held various corporate and private events at the Radio Roof top. EVERY one has been a success because Julie Doumer is a GEM of the management team who has natural star quality and strives to deliver the perfect experience to the customer. Last night our waitress Dora was an absolute poppet - she was wonderful. I held a group birthday event and it was made SUPER SPECIAL by Julie ensuring every attention to detail was just perfect. Clearly Julie has a proven natural ability to get the best out of her team. Linda Bagci

title: rooftop bar
comment: Went for drinks to the rooftop bar ,very contemporary and exiting place to be early evening .Excellent service good range of cocktails definitely worth a visit if you want something a bit different and fun.

title: Rooftop bar
comment: Loved the vibe here. We sat outside taking in the stunning view of London. The staff were friendly and hospitable. The drinks were reasonably priced. Ambience chilling and relaxing. Loved the music they played very relaxing. Perfect location to meet friends for drinks.

title: Good experience but too pricy
comment: 1) Make sure you make a reservation if you want to head to this place  2) The view is absolutely stunning indeed, but only from one side of the terrace. When you are on the wrong side, the view is just ugly.  3) Place looks less fancy in reality than on pictures, but it still is pleasant place to be.

title: Stunning view for a sunny day in London - Excellent cocktails & bar food
comment: This is a great place for drinks and lunch during the week because this is a quiet time at the bar so it is good for business meetings. On the weekend this place in packed and the staff operate it like a nightclub which is not so welcoming. The cocktails and food is superb and it has a holiday feeling vibe with a beautiful outside space. I have visited this place about five times and it has been enjoyable every time.

title: Great way to spend an afternoon
comment: Very nice location, great friendly staff and lovely drinks. We had a great time and although the prices are at the higher end of the spectrum were all in agreement that it was worth it.

title: Disappointing Experience
comment: Having been before and enjoyed my previous visit I booked to return with a group of friends for a special birthday treat. The whole experience from booking to the visit was a huge disappointment. Considering I had booked quite a few weeks previously and noticing there was walk in availability we were shown to a very cramped area inside and again despite obvious table availability outside were told there wasn't a table available outside. The hostess was quite rude but eventually reluctantly moved us outside. We then had to endure a 45 minute wait to be served ironic considering the table is only available to you for 2 hours! Once it arrived the cocktail was indeed delicious but was served in a plastic tumbler NOT what one expects for an establishment that portrays itself otherwise and amazingly has extortionate minimum spend limits later in the day. Needless to say we refused to pay the service charge and would have appreciated at least an apology for the poor service which of course never happened. There are better places to spend your money.

title: Beaut views...
comment: Cocktails are abit disappointing for London standards, but the views and atmosphere is what you come up here for

title: A must !!
comment: Lovely view and great ambience and atmosphere not to mention the amazing food.  Wonderful setting for something special as my friend and I went for our 40th birthday celebrations and it was a perfect choice.

title: Amazing views around London
comment: I was "lucky enough" to reserve a table to meet some friends whom I've not seen for a long while. I was pleased to be seated outside, the weather wasn't great but the views was amazing, by night it reminded me a little of NYC. Especially around the London Eye and Somerset House. I have to say that the place was surrounded by city office types, maybe from the courts of justice across the road. The waitress was wonderful, I have to say that the snacks was very expensive, we ordered a couple of portions of Chips/potato bravas style, when they arrived I asked where the other portion was and they said that the 2 stacks of chips was 2 portions. We all didn't know whether to laugh or thought they were joking! Seriously we counted there was just 18 actual chips in total for nearly £8.00 yep I'll leave it as that as you can imagine the rest. The cocktails was lovely and again very over priced being at £13-£14 per drink, I guess this being average for just a nice cocktail. I have to say the best cocktails I've had was priced around £11 at a very well known bar. The best part was the view at night, it was just stunning, the bar and food I have to say was ok! Oh and they have a DJ, yes you can also imagine the drunken men in suits ...... Amusing

title: Super views
comment: This bar has some of London's best views and is in a superb location. Prices are as expected and the food is quality. Only let down is that beers are poured in to plastic cups but it is well worth a visit. Even go earlier in the week as it is quite chilled out and relaxing.

title: Not worth it
comment: Be nice to the pretentious entrance staff, they are just looking for some love. Once on top enjoy the nice view. Too many working girls and substance abuse for my taste though.

title: Lovely sunny brunch with great food
comment: Me and 2 of my friends went here one Sunday in August. We had booked this several weeks before just so we knew we would definitely get a table. Our table was booked for 11.30 but we arrived 10 minutes early and were shown to our table which was outside and right where the sun was beaming down which was lovely. We all enjoyed cocktails all morning and a variety of meals. I had the French toast with bacon and berries and I can't say it is the best bacon I have ever tasted. I also thought the portions were very big! Both my friends had egg dishes and enjoyed them too. We were disappointed when the waiter said they did not have any salt beef bagel. We also ordered mini doughnuts and the strawberry sundae to share for desert. We were disappointed by the 15% service charge as we didn't feel the service was overly good so we had this removed and tipped as we felt necessary. Definitely would return.

title: Location, location, location...
comment: This is one of those places you just have to visit when you have the opportunity. The views are extraordinary, which is a good thing, since the rest is very average. We had tapas and cocktails, which took forever to arrive and then they "reminded" us that we would need to leave soon, due to each table having a time limit! When we explained that their service was slow (it took over half an hour for our tapas), they meekly backed off, but the moment was ruined...

title: Zero Attention
comment: As a group we were very excited to visit this bar in the beautiful London sunshine, considering each round of drinks was approximately £100 for 6 of us I would expect the staff to be crawling all over us. Not so, we sat for 10 minutes before they came to the table and then each time we wanted a drink we had to search for a waiter to some times be told 'I will be back in a couple of minutes'. It is probably the worst service I have experienced in many years.

title: Shocking customer service
comment: Possibly the worst customer service I've received in the whole of London.  I was in town on business. Wanted to show a friend the views.  Travelling around Europe I attempted to make a reservation a week ahead of my visit.  They gave me an offer of a table and time. I replied with a question but I then heard nothing back from them. They took 4 days to answer their telephone calls. No replies to 5 subsequent emails.  They effectively view you as an element of currency. Not as a human being.  I will never go back and they have no idea how much potential business they have lost.

title: disgusting rude door staff
comment: we booked a table for a special birthday last saturday for 8 men, we had some ladies joining us later. we turned up at the door all dressed very smartly and the eastern european lady on the door said we do not take large groups of men, we said we had a table and had paid a deposit. she said sorry we cant come in, i have been in there a few times before and seen many groups of men on tables. we happen to be smart fellas and if i am honest 3 or 4 very wealthy guys, we are not the sort to look at and give doorman a concern. some of the guys travelled a long way and their evening was ruined. I am a former club and bar owner and i understand fully about door policies. the west end unfortunately has a pretentious attitude and awful door policies. it is all about if your face fits, we probably would between us and the ladies joining us spent 2 grand or so on inflated drinks and behaved perfectly. the management of these places should take a long hard look at their door staff and their policies. if a group of guys in ther 40's well dressed and coming from STK next door get turned away after booking and paying a deposit there is something wrong. Some rude door staff who get paid close to minimum wage and enjoy the power of ruining a 50th birthday for no good reason. will never go back again and i advise anyone else to avoid the same risk. its ok in there but not great, it was just convenient as we had dinner next door. Maybe the management should find some door staff who understand manners and can judge a group properly. also let people know when taking a reservation if you have these policies. avoid it at all costs

title: Rooftop experience
comment: Went here on a Saturday lunchtime for drinks ,it was so busy but we got seated and service was very good but very expensive for a few drinks .They where busy serving lunches which looked good and will be going back to try

title: Best views over london
comment: This place is a must if in London , the views are amazing the staff are lovely and the prices very reasonable. A gem in the city

title: nice rooftopbar
comment: the bar and the cocktails are really nice although we had to wait quite long to be seated. however still a perfect place to enjoy a sunny day in london

title: Beautiful views
comment: It's in London so it's going to be expensive but it's worth a visit just for the views. We went on a Saturday lunch time so there was no minimum spend but be careful as you will have a minimum spend per person during peak periods. I found this out when I booked via email and will always recommend booking in advance. Have to say both times I have visited we have waited a for our drinks, maybe they were hoping the views would distract us from the wait!

title: Great great views, good variety of drinks, great experience
comment: Recommend highly. great views across the city, both indoor and outdoor space; staff is attentive and friendly and will make sure to cater to your requirements.

title: Tip top roof top
comment: A very pleasant way to spend a few hours watching the world go by with great views and an interesting post work/pre theatre/we're staying here crowd. Good cocktails and some nice tunes in the background Great for people watching too!!

title: Great place for drinks with views of London
comment: I've been here a few times now and I always enjoy it. Really nice atmosphere and of course wonderful views.  Prices are what you'd expect from a nice rooftop bar in this area and there are some lovely cocktails available.  The tapas is nice but I personally prefer to come here for drinks rather than food.

title: Unbelievably rude entrance staff and horrific booking management
comment: I would highly recommend to avoid this place - very rude and ignorant entrance staff (especially security guy who was working on the 9th August ' 15 in the evening).  First of all, if the people who supposed to look after reservations could do their job properly it would be highly appreciated - a simple email back saying "you're fully booked" would make a big difference as probably on Sundays getting back to people is not considered as part of the job.. Also, hiring or training Radio rooftop doormen to be AT LEAST professional enough and have good manners would help you out with future customers as I would never ever in my entire life recommend this place for any of my friends, colleagues or clients. And for the record, your doorman suggested to write a bad review regarding his behaviour. All in all, very disappointing representation of the place. I wish you all the best with your new future customers and highly recommend to carefully consider who is representing the Radio rooftop bar in the first place. Kindest Regards, Simona

title: Pretentious with staff that clearly think they are too cool to wait on!
comment: Beautiful day in London so decided to go here for drinks. Arrived around 12noon to the hotel lobby. Lady on desk by the lift asked how many we were (quite clearly only 2 of us). Said it was ok for us to go up. Headed up in the lift to be met by a girl on the desk upstairs. Asked for a table for drinks outside but was told there was no room outside, only inside and were then left to find a table. The place was c.25% full, lots of tables available outside with reserved signed on them - not all set for lunch, plenty of other tables. Waited around 10mins and after asking at the bar we were told there was table service. Plenty of staff about but all too busy trying to look cool rather than serve people! Really not helpful. A guy then came to our table - looked like the manager - and took our drinks order. Drinks duly arrived, and still no-one had arrived for any of the outside tables! Drank up, ordered bill, paid extortionate bill for 1 wine & 1 diet coke (with service added automatically), and left. The staff are unhelpful and clearly not bothered about your business.  In summary, pretentious place, over staffed and under serviced guests. Not sure we'll be giving it a second chance when there are so many other great bars in London!

title: Brilliant!
comment: We recently spent an evening on the rooftop bar, what a great place, a real buzz place to be, Not particularly cheap, but the views across London are superb.

title: Stunning bar
comment: On a two day trip to London we visited Radio rooftop bar when staying in the ME hotel. It was stunning, we sat inside as quite cold that day. We had nice glasses of fizz and went outside and took some pics as views are lovely, outside area has nice sofas and seating. Met the manager Andrew who was chatting to us and taking some photos for us, offering us any help we required. All staff were very friendly and courteous. Thoroughly enjoyed our visit.

title: Beautiful, bubbles and sunshine
comment: Met up with a friend to celebrate a birthday, and we were fortunate to bag a table in the scorching sunshine.  The staff are good, but could pay a bit more attention to the paying guests without having to wildly flag them down. The buzz here is fantastic, and the views are obviously amazing, especially on a clear sunny day.  The Tapas selection is really good, and authentic.  I love it here, and would recommend that you book a table to avoid disappointment.  I will return.

title: One of the best views of London skyline
comment: Yes, the views from the bar are extraordinary. Very spectacular and well worth the visit. Okay, it's smart, it's expensive and it's a little pretentious but hey, we were in London for the day and lunch in the sun, on the roof was superb. Service for the drinks and food was good. However it took nearly 20 minutes to get the bill, and another 10 to get the card machine. That was very disappointing.

title: London's best rooftop
comment: Our second visit to Radio was as good as the first, if not better. We went on a Saturday night after a meal locally and everything was exemplary. The dedicated lift opens onto a vast space, with both indoor and outdoor areas, and a DJ in the corner although not too loud that you can't have a conversation. The hostess found a table for us on the terrace as it was a warm night. Although it was busy, the service at the bar was efficient, knowledgeable and friendly, with the barman taking the time to talk us through the wines at the same time as preparing the other drinks. And of course the view is just superb across London's cityscape. The manager even came over to ensure we were being well looked after and as the night wore on into the morning, they ratcheted up the volume and the atmosphere was fab. I would highly recommend Radio and everything about it.

title: Stunning views
comment: This is an amazing bar. It has fantastic views over London. You can order at the bar or get served at a table - if you can find one. You can book but you have to spend £75 per head on drinks. That's not as difficult as it sounds as drinks are seriously expensive. But it's good. You rub shoulders with bright, rich young things and it's very noisy but it's a stimulating and exciting venue.

title: Excellent evening
comment: The food was good, the cocktail delicious and excellent attention to detail from waitress Lissette, who was able to answer all of my questions regarding the menu

title: Avoid at all costs!
comment: I do not understand the hype. The views are nothing special, as all you can see is a strip of the Thames and half of the back of the London Eye (you'd be better off visiting The Oxo Tower, if you are in it for the view). The staff is EXTREMELY rude and high of themselves. The manager, Renato, is truly one of the most disgusting people I have ever had to cross paths with in my entire life. If you must go though, do not order any food, it is utterly ghastly. I had the banana toffee cake and honestly, it tasted like they just bought it off Tesco. Horrible experience overall. No wonder they have so many bad reviews.

title: Great view!
comment: Had a meal in one of the restaurants in this hotel and then went to this bar. We did not have a booking but was able to go up to this roof top bar as they had space (you can only go up if they have extra space which has not been prebooked) It was very crowded and smokey outside but also lively. We decided not to stay as there was no where to sit. The view was fantastic. If you book a table you have to pay quite a lot , I think £75 mid week and £100 at times per person minimum spend

title: Nice cocktails even better view
comment: Really good place to chill drinking some cocktails, staff was very kind and attentive, the waitress recommended the best cocktails accordingly to our tastes. Worth visiting.

title: Best rooftop in London
comment: I have visited all the best rooftop bars in London but Radio is the absolute best. Great spot for a few cocktails after dinner at STK, however, they do also offer a tapas menu. Don't forget to book early on the week as being a small popular venue it gets full very early, particularly Friday's - call Francesco Russo (the best host) and he'll set you up.

title: Brunch
comment: While visiting London, my friend and I wanted to visit a rooftop bar to enjoy the sunshine and take in some views. We tried to book a table on the Saturday night but it was fully booked, which is understandable as we did call last minute, we did however manage to book a table from 11:30 on the Sunday morning. You get a two hour slot to enjoy the views and food.  On arrival we were not disappointed, the place itself is very stylish, the bar and rooftop areas are just lovely. The views are wonderful across London and we were lucky to have the sunshine too.  The food and drink is on the expensive side but I think it's to be expected while in London. We ordered cocktails and food, both were delicious.  The staff were friendly and attentive and went out of their way to deliver a good service.  The atmosphere was chilled but the place does have a pretentious feel to it, attracking that kind of clientel. I will however return to the bar as I plan to take my husband as a treat next time we are in London.

title: Great rooftop, below average service
comment: The view here is undoubtably amazing. We went for lunch and you are pretty much paying for the view rather than the food or service.  Food and wine was good, no complaints there.  The disappointment was the service. For example, we ordered wine for our meal....the wine turned up after we finished eating. There was only one waitress working and seemed more interested in service the VIP area rather than the customers eating.

title: Julie Doumer & Alexandra EXCELLENCE AT ITS BEST!
comment: Where do I start with these two wonderful ladies! Professional, welcoming, fun and your night being fabulous is their priority. They are really top notch and I can't thank them enough for making my visits (both corporate and leisure) amazing. For the bar itself the views, music and food are incredible. Radio One bar is without doubt my favourite place in London and this has been made special because of Julie & Alexandra. Thank you soooooooooooooo much Linda Bagci

title: Amazing view and great night out
comment: Such an impressive venue to take your friends on a night out! It has an INCREDIBLE view of the city and we had excellent service the whole night. The cocktails were well made and the seating is comfortable and relaxed. The VIP manager Belinda made sure we were thoroughly spoiled. Would highly recommend.

title: good view,overrated!!!
comment: few times i went in this bar and my opinion is so-so about this place. there is a great view to the river.the service unfortunately is not on top level. the first time when i went one lovely girl hostess (very good professionalist by the way) Monica find for me great table on the terrace. and few days later i went with my girlfriend and the same girl gives us table on the terrace, and i think that she is one of the very few guys in this venue who knows how to do their job proper. i wish to say the same for the waitress, but unfortunately i can't. great view, great Monica and nice food.

title: Great views and food!
comment: Great views over London. Had the food from the tapas bar menu, was all very nice. Shame that you can't reserve a table without having a minimum spend of £75pp!! But still very nice for a treat!

title: Chillax
comment: Wanted a place to hang out for a few hours and meet up with friends out of town This was definitely the place to do it Amazing views of the city and with the sun blazing, a cool place to just sit and chill We had a bottle of champers to while away the time whilst catching up Highly recommended

title: Radio Views-top
comment: I heard about this place from a well-known musician so we thought we'd give it a try. The views are excellent; the atmosphere was good; the service was OK. Access to the bar, at the top of the ME Hotel, is via its own entrance on Aldwych. There's a doorman and then a walk to a lift lobby, where there's another doorman. You wait for the lift to arrive and then take you straight up to the 10th floor. We stepped out into the lobby in front of the bar and the music and views both hit us simultaneously. Service was somewhat slow and impersonal but the drinks were good and not too ruinously expensive. Although it was busy, we were able to wander around at will and sit in several different places. Highly recommended for the views - 5 green blobs, in fact! - 4 for the atmosphere/music/drinks and 3 for the service: would certainly go again.

title: Terrible staff / manager
comment: I have been to the rooftop on a number of occasions predominantly to meet potential clients usually in the afternoon. Yesterday however, I was let down completely. The manager (Renato) referred to me as "intoxicated" when I had just left work and in no way intoxicated. I work round the corner from there and having been a regular for a few months now. After this experience I'll not bother going here anymore as I don't want to be embarrassed in front of my clients. My sincerest advice to the Melia group, change your entire staff immediately. Radio Rooftop is nothing special, it could save some grace by at least being respectful and polite to their customers.

title: Great drink with stunning views and lovely staff
