comment: We visited 12pm on a Saturday as I had read about it and wanted to see if we could go up and have a drink and see the views. The guy on the door was lovely, no questions, just told us to go straight up, once inside the lady who couldn't have been more helpful explained as we hadn't booked we could have a drink and a table for an hour but it was reserved for 1pm so we had to finish by 1pm but also gave us times of when they had availability to book and eat and drink. We enjoyed a beer and wine and loved the views. I would advise booking, I had done my homework and knew our chances were slim as it gets so booked up but the staff were more than happy to accommodate us. Yes, drinks are slightly more than usual, but then again it's not a normal setting, it's a drink with fab views.

title: Amazing place for a special ocassion
comment: Visited for a friends 50th Birthday. Our experience was great from the moment we arrived. The sun was shinning and we had a great table outside overlooking the Thames with the London Eye and Big Ben in the background. We had food off the brunch menu which was amazing and the Wine was fab too. Would highly recommend to people. Not cheap but a great place to spoil someone.

title: Lovely Views and Cocktails
comment: This place is great for a treat for something special. I was recently taken here for drinks before I leave to travel. We hadn't booked a table but it wasn't very busy, probably due to the terrible English weather. We were given a lovely table over looking London and they waited on us hand and foot.  The drinks are expensive but they are very nice and the staff are amazing. It is worth paying the price.  They do add a 15% service charge which we asked to be taken off Purely because we had already spent £15 on each drink. When we asked for it to be taken off, the waitress did look annoyed and made us feel slightly uncomfortable so perhaps they need to be trained on that. It isn't just about the money.  Apart from this I would highly recommend trying this bar out. Make sure you pre book to ensure a table and to get an outside table you need to request this upon booking.

title: Lovely rooftop bar
comment: I have been here many times. Each time has been very enjoyable. The staff are welcoming and friendly. The cocktails are really good. As is the choice of drinks on offer.  The location is excellent right ontop of the ME hotel a stones throw from covent garden. The snacks are good here too. Offering small bites. The views are amazing. Book a table if you can as they are mostly booked so you may end up standing. Well worth a visit.

title: Great service and delicious food
comment: Walking in we felt a bit looked at, eyeing us up and down to see if we have got the right shoes on etc so I thought it might be a bit pretentious but it was actually a very nice relaxed friendly atmosphere. The tapas was delicious and the views were outstanding. Will definitely be going back.

title: Obnoxious (with a view)
comment: So this venue has the write up so we booked (and agreed to the minimal spend, £50 each)... However there are some stages you need to get through first: Stage 1: The lift Pterodactyl - this female will question the decision and make you look minimal in front of your guests. Even If adhering to the dress code! Stage 2: The desk vulture - probably female too will question your booking, your timing and be obnoxious... Stage 3: The lackadaisical server - if you get through stage 1 and 2 the next stage is getting served.... Try your hardest. I am fortunate to travel to lots of locations and to other Melia hotels avoid this one, it's an embarrassment to the chain!

title: Amazing place..
comment: Wife always wanted to go here so we did. Now would recommend booking a table. We was lucky the staff helped us out. They only had a table for an hour which was really nice to have a drink. Views are fantastic and next time we are in London we'll book a table and stay for an evening.

title: Tried to reserve but no luck
comment: My friend tried many times by phone and email to reserve a table for us for my birthday. She could not get anyone to help her so we ended up going and queuing. When we got to the front of the queue we told them that our friend was joining us and could she be let in. They said no, she would also have to queue. We eventually all got in, paid for some overpriced drinks and could only get a table for half an hour - everything was reserved. I am not sure what is wrong with this place but it doesn't look after its customers. I was really looking forward to enjoying the view and relaxing but we left after one drink. I think perhaps if I could book, or go at a time when there was no queue , I would go back but generally came away disappointed at the service and lack of thought.

title: Amazing view but condescending staff
comment: Be prepared to feel humiliated and belittled by the staff who desperately need customer service training. There are no welcoming smiles or gestures. They just go out of their way to ensure you feel inferior. It's almost like you are doing them a favour rather than to encourage repeat customers. Yes fab view but at a price in more ways than one!

title: Cool with a view
comment: Tried to get into this bar on a night out when we were in this part of town almost two years ago, but after waiting in a queue for almost an hour and then being offered a table for a minimum spend, we decided to just go to our favourite pub along the road. This visit, we were there when the elevator opened at midday and went up for lunch and drinks. The tapas selection is reasonable and the portion sizes were adequate, but there was nothing special about the food. The place gets its reputation for the view, and it is well worth a visit for that. They have a nice cocktail selection, not too pricey for the area and the exclusivity, and on a sunny day it was perfect to look out over the Thames and most of the London landmarks. I would think the evening vibe would be cool, but there is a minimum spend and booking is definitely advisable. Well worth a visit in summer, not so sure in the cold!

title: Nothing Special
comment: The only thing that can really impress you in this bar except the view is one lovely girl with BIG smile and amazing attitude the host MONICA. She was truly amazing and very kind to find for me and my friend great table on the terrace. The waitress - tragedy, the bar, hmm if you have 23min to order a drink it can be acceptable but otherwise NO!!! In general the only reason for me to go there again will be Monica

title: Cocktails cocktails cocktails!
comment: We were staying at the hotel and couldn't stay away from this bar. What's better than sitting in the sun with a nice drink, music playing (not too loudly) and maybe having a few tapas. In the evenings it was very busy even on a Monday night at 11pm, book to avoid disappointment!

title: Great view, beautiful people
comment: Great old fashion, creative cocktails done with a smile, servers have fun which adds to atmosphere. Didn't like the check overs ( have to get through 3 check points). While very polite, not feeling it... Get a seat on the edge or cabana. Arrive after work for better access, harder as the nights come... Definitely to return...

title: Amazing views
comment: Very hard to get into this place iif you don't book, that's if you can book and spend at least £75 per person. The bouncers on the door were very good and let us in as it was one of the girls birthday. The bar had inside and outside areas. We did have a dance and the music was good. I would like to come in the daytime to see the amazing views over London. The drinks are very expensive so be prepared!!!!!

title: Rooftop Drinks
comment: Nice setting with the rooftop element looking out over the city. Drinks were pretty pricey and cocktails were a bit different to normal, so hard to find the old favourites. Bar was very busy and we weren't able to sit outside and enjoy the views. It was a nice bar, but with a bit more digging I can probably find better.

title: Brunch time
comment: We have visited the Radio Bar on a sunny Saturday for a brunch. The food and coctails were great and very delicious (we have chosen the pulled pork burger and the ox with hollandaise sauce). The view is one of the best in London and the staff was very helpful and talkative (especially Dora) but also Tatiana and Sophie. I will definitely come back. All in all it was a great experience!!

title: Top Rooftop!
comment: Honestly I've never reviewed before, but this time I felt the need of doing it. I came to this place with some mates for first time, and speaking for them too, it won't be the last one. There are a well elected variety of tapas, DJ, very comfortable seats, a really friendly staff, and the charm itself, what makes a perfect place where to be. And I haven't mentioned the terrace yet, speechless! Very well designed rooftop where you have an amazing panorama of London. This place is definitely a must go. Looking forward to go back!

title: Try a cocktail whilst taking in wonderful views of London
comment: This rooftop bar is a great place for a pre dinner or pre theatre drink. The views over south bank are stunning. The choice of drinks and tapas is varied , comfortable seats both inside and outside. Access in gained via the Hotel Me on the Strand. On a lovely sunny evening no better place to be probably best to book a table so you are not disappointed. Friendly staff and good attentive service.

title: Birthday Drinks
comment: Amazing venue with a wide variety of well presented drinks and attentive staff. The views are outstanding. I would say though the wait for the lift takes a while and the toilets are very hard to see in as they are so dark.

title: Fantastic views!
comment: Very trendy, and upscale. Super cool crowd. drinks were great, as were the food items we ordered. The outside part does close early, I'm assuming for sound issues.

title: Not very good value for money.
comment: I booked to have lunch here with two friends. Whilst the welcome was good, once actually seated the service was really poor. It was a hot sunny day, they had not fulled over the canvas to offer shade for those who wanted it; I guess they were trying to make us thirsty. Which would be fine if anyone actually cared to take our order. The view is mostly of the cranes and building work of London. After we had asked someone to take our order there was a long wait (it was just two lemonades while we looked at the menu). After ordering our food there was another long wait and the waitress only provided one napkin. Food portions were small. The menu is limited and aimed at light lunches rather than full dinners. I would avoid the venue if I was you and leave it for the hotel guests.

title: Afternoon Cocktails in the Sun
comment: I was recommended to come here by my friends brother as we were looking for somewhere to enjoy Saturday afternoon cocktails on a sunny day. Unfortunately we were not prepared so felt a bit under dressed in comparison to the other guests who were dress smartly so I would definitely suggest you are more prepared than us. We could not find anywhere to sit inside or out as all the tables were reserved so we ending up standing around the bar our outside admiring the views which were stunning. You can see right across being on the 10th floor. The cocktails were delicious and refreshing but of course not cheap. We did not order food but we saw a few tables eating and the food looked amazing. There were quite a few hen parties and large groups here and I would definitely come back with a booked table and soak up the atmosphere especially in the summer.

title: So Fun
comment: Karina was our server and she was awesome! so friendly and attentive. The drinks and music were good and the people were stylish - such a good vibe

title: Don't bother - highly overrated and very rude staff !
comment: The only thing going for this bar is the view!!! We found the staff very rude and obnoxious and the service charge for drinks was ridiculous. Give it a wide birth !

title: people watching
comment: Fantastic views from radio bar,from the shard,to the eye to British telecom tower/ which are amazing. Drinks over priced, reservations are a must.

title: boss 60th birthday party
comment: beautiful place to drink and watch people. The dj brings you the latest beats,the drinks are expensive, and the views are outstanding

title: Nice comfy seats and a good view
comment: We visited for drinks on a Saturday afternoon. The place was very busy, but after a while we found some good seats and ordered cocktails. They had a DJ playing some good tracks and it was sunny. What more could you want. Although drinks are pricey, the cocktails are made to a high standard, and there is a good list of drinks available. There is no charge to get in, so it's understandably a little pricey. This place makes you feel like you're abroad somewhere nice.

title: Great views
comment: But not sure I would rush back. Certainly not going to get awards for a friendly reception or service. Value for money poor and a 15% service charge at the bar, note not for served, is pretty poor. Saving grace is some great views of the London skyline when the sun is shining

title: Top Brunch in London at highest
comment: Took me a while to find this rooftop bar,greet at the entrance by an young man called Sandro he took me and my family all the way to the lifts where he passed me over to Tatiana the bar hostess,she was very attentive with my son(five years old),once we reach the top July give us a very nice table by the river side,amazing views over London,and the menu is incredible,Dora suggested us to try the brunch menu and so we did,excellent choice,I was afraid that the food will arrive late because my son was a bit hungry but Robert brought our order in no time,all the staff is chatty and friendly,I've read some reviews about rudeness here but nothing of that came to my attention. Highly recommended!

title: No Contact
comment: In fairness, I haven't been, but I was looking for somewhere to have drinks late afternoon. I e-mailed them from their website, about a month before the date, and received no reply.  I wouldn't visit a place that can't be bothered to talk to it's customers. It may be the best and most and exciting venue in London, but they won't survive with that customer service.

title: Great view... If you can get past the stuck-up door staff
comment: Friends invited us to this bar to celebrate an occasion. We had not booked, but our friends were regular visitors so said there would be no problem getting in. Alas, the arrogant stuck-up door staff and their precious clipboard thought otherwise, saying the bar was completely full - yet even in the few minutes we were outside, at least 15 people left. Shame this short-sighted and out-dated approach to sales prevention / customer service still exists in London.

title: Life is too short to waste time on this place
comment: Yesterday afternoon I travelled up to London to meet with a friend who I hadn't seen for a year, he texted me to say he was at the Radio Rooftop Bar and to meet him there. He arrived at 5:30 got drinks in for us both and awaited my arrival. My train was delayed so I got there at 6:30 to see a queue outside.  I went up the door and explained I was meeting a friend who was already up there with a beer on the bar and they asked me his name. I didn't quite understand why they needed his name but gave it anyway and was told it wasn't on their list so I couldn't come in. The lady was very polite about it but more or less dismissed me and moved onto the next person. I remained at the door communicating with my friend (by the way we're both 40 something company directors) whilst speaking to the lady on the door but they stood resolute, I could not come in. Meanwhile someone else turned up with the same problem, friend upstairs at the bar, same response, names not on the list you're not coming in. He said he'd been told it was half empty to which a gentleman on the door replied "rooftop bar on the hottest day of the year empty? Yeh right!". My friend confirmed it was half empty which I conveyed to the door staff but the gentleman explained it was table bookings only now because of "capacity issues" so if my friend didn't have a table I couldn't come in. Meanwhile my friend got speaking to someone at a table who then offered to let us join them so I could get in, I gave his name to the lady on the door who checked her list half-heartedly (by now it was obvious I wasn't getting in whatever I said) and unsurprisingly she denied that name was on the list (but wouldn't let me see the list to verify it). After 30 minutes of failed negotiation, my friend left my beer at the bar, came down and we went to Henry's Bar in Covent Garden which had a live Jazz Band playing, quick service and friendly staff. I haven't received this kind of treatment at a door since I was 18 trying to get into an Essex nightclub. I've been to lots of rooftop bars in my life, I couldn't care less about places like this, but just purely based on their approach on the door I wouldn't recommend it to anyone. Life is too short and London is full of nice places to drink....give this one a very wide birth if you don't want your evening ruined by uncaring, aloof jobsworths on the door.

title: Girls night!
comment: As I had never been before, this was something of a treat, organised for a colleague/friend for her work hen do and some friends. On arrival, met with smiles all round and a friendly almost alluring walk, cool, smelling fresh & clean, through the corridor to get to reception for the roof top.  We arrived at the top, all ready, for a great night, which did not at any time let us down, with the views, which were stunning, the corner gazebo reserved just for us, and some champagne on ice ready for us! With our own waitress for the night, she was accommodating, and very quick to make sure that not at any time were our glasses not topped up.  The appetisers that arrived, all grasping for the little croquettes, which were bundles of oozy heaven! The chillies, roasted, only needed a ittle extra salt to really bring out the flavour.  What with a great group of girls, Radio Rooftop Bar, is somewhere I would wholeheartedly re-visit and bring more friends to.

title: Top night out
comment: Gorgeous evening, amazing views, great service and a brilliant start to our girls' night out. Good atmosphere and perfect for a Summer evening.

title: A brunch with a view in Central London
comment: Lovely open air sunny place (weather permitting) to have a good brunch. Nice staff, reasonably good choice of food and drinks. Prices are very reasonable Highly recommended.

title: Charmless
comment: I remember going to the opening night of Radio Rooftop Bar about 18 months ago on behalf of a magazine I write for when the reception was quite different - all PR and smiles. Last night, I thought it would be nice to have a return drink - the view is great - after celebrating a friend's birthday at Spring, in Somerset House.  It was quite a shock to move from the elegance & friendliness of Spring to the glade-plug-in scented frosty attitude of the reception desk at "ME" hotel. I was directed back outside to the non-residents entrance to Radio Rooftop and told by the doorman "no guest list or reservation, no admittance", as he turned away, clutching his list. We were the only people trying to get in (all 2 of us, by the way). I always say you can get a pretty good sense of the sort of crowd a place attracts by the manner of the door staff. With this in mind, we took the best option of returning home to Regents Park for a cocktail on our own terrace.  We won't make another attempt.

title: Not as amazing as on pictures
comment: I visited the Radio rooftop bar with my boyfriend as I saw the pictures and thought that it'd be amazing. Unfortunately, I was slightly disappointed as the view is not as amazing. Otherwise the atmosphere is quite nice.

title: Overpriced drinks, lengthy wait for drinks and 15% service charge automatically added at the bar for bar service. Avoid!
comment: If your idea of a good bar is a thirty minute wait at the bar for service, plastic cups instead of glasses, an automatic 15% service charge added for the privilege of being served at the bar rather than having drinks orders taken and drinks served at your table and the card machine offering you the option of adding on a further service payment (and if you don't check the receipt before paying you may well pay this by mistake - particularly after a few drinks if you can be bothered to wait that long for them!) then hang around outside for twenty minutes whilst being gazed at with barely concealed contempt by the door staff (as we did) before being allowed in and then spend the majority of your evening queueing away at the bar to your heart's content. Alternatively, avoid like the plague and find somewhere better. I would give a zero star rating but this facility isn't available here. The one star is for the 10th floor view if you enjoy staring at the London skyline whilst pondering the fact that you've been royally ripped off.

title: Evening drinks
comment: My cousin and I finished our evening off in this bar. Amazing views and good service, although I don't know how easy it is to get in without booking before hand. I would definitely return for drinks again.

title: Pretty Nice...(ish)
comment: After reading mixed reviews, my mum and I were a little apprehensive about going here but really wanted to experience the views. A lot of the negative things we'd read were regarding the staff being rude. I must say we did not encounter this. Everyone that greeted us was very pleasant and attentive.  Yes drinks are a little pricey... However, this is nothing I wouldn't except from visiting London, so we were prepared to pay a little extra for them and it's totally worth it for the views alone. We went mid afternoon on a Thursday and there wasn't really a great atmosphere, where I had expected a little chilled music playing in the background. I'm sure there's more of a vibe evening time.  We had made no reservation and didn't really encounter any problem with being seated as we were prepared to share the sofa.  Yes some of the people are a little poncey and yes I kind of expected a little more atmosphere, but we're totally glad we went and would go back again. However, I'd probably make a reservation next time.

title: Rooftastic
comment: Great bar, great vibe. Popped up for cocktails with my wife (twice) on Saturday 20th Jun-15. Stunning views. Loved it!

title: Birthday Booking
comment: Great view across London A bit over pretentious also the staff were amazing.  I have never seen so many selfie sticks

title: Stunning view!
comment: Amazing view over London on a sunny day was great sitting on the terrace. It gets very busy both during the day and evening. We were staying at the hotel and we're lucky enough to get an outside seat unsure if we got a seat as we were guests or whether just lucky. Service was very slow and waited 15 minutes before we ordered a drink that was by me chasing the waitress then had to chase another 10 minutes when it didn't arrive. Evening music was good again busy so get there early, food was also good. Would have given it a 5 but service slow.

title: Girlfirends Birthday
comment: We went for my girlfriends 21st birthday party and from the minute we arrived to the moment we left the service was superb. The views, staff and cocktails were amazing and would definitely recommend anyone who was planning a special occasion to try radio bar.

title: Great seevice
comment: I came here on Saturday the 13th of June for a short visit for drinks, and I thought the service was great. We were greeted by a friendly man outside welcoming us into the building, we were then shown to the lift to reach the bar and we were greeted by another friendly lady welcoming us as well. We got upstairs, we were sat down almost immediately to our booked table on the terrace outside, and the staff couldn't stop smiling and being attentive towards us. We ordered a bottle of prosecco to share, and it was brought out and poured for us pretty much straight away. As we were chatting, our glasses were filled up whenever the waitress noticed they were nearing empty, which to me was very attentive and appreciated. The views are stunning, it was a shame it was grey and cloudy outside but the sun and blue sky came out a little towards the end which was great! Would definitely come again as I didn't have time to try the food on my last visit, so definitely an excuse to come back. Thank you!

title: Very over priced bar
comment: After reading loads of reviews for this place I thought it only right I payed it a visit. The view is fantastic but that's about it. The drinks are very over priced £7 for a bottle of beer and a 15% service charge as standard.... The toilets are pitch black no lighting with dark walls makes it impossible to see in there !!!! As far as roof top bars in London goes it's by far not the best....

title: Expensive but worth it .
comment: If you want cheap drinks then do not come here . If you want somewhere very busy , classy , buzzy and trendy with wonderful views over London and great service from knowledgable and professional staff then this is your place . The prices here are similar to all London top hotels with a compulsory 15% service charge . It is advisable to book a table in advance however at really busy times like Friday after work you need to agree a minimum spend . If you want pub prices then go to a pub !

title: Don't Waste your Time
comment: I have been to the bar about 4 times and recived varying level of service and levels of welcome. But Sadly for a bar with a such a nice location and view it is a shame the level of service and welcome do not meet the same pleasant feellings, We visited around 3pm on Saturday 21st June the welcome was luke warm after requesting a table outside we where offered a table but no chairs (which was fine as out side was busy as it was a nice day) but after waiting for over 25 mins for our initial drinks order to be taken and being ignored by at least 2 staff members we decided to leave as it was obvious the staff where not interested in taking our order ! I travel globally for business I have never experienced this level of service in any bar or hotel that I have ever been to, avoid and find somewhere more friendly I think the moral should be treat people how you would like to be treated maybe this should be part of there next staff training !

title: Great for a lively special evening
comment: We visited on a Saturday evening to celebrate my fiancee birthday and had a table on the terrace booked which does come with a minimum spend attached Great welcome by all the staff, from the door to the waitress. Was shown to our table straight away Great service throughout the night by our excellent waitress. Cocktails were delicious as was the food. Average west end prices for the drinks so no complaints. A nice touch was as I was ordering a couple of desserts a neighbouring table was having a birthday cake delivered and I joked about having candles on the doughnuts, which were to die for. When they arrived there was a candle on the doughnut and a happy birthday in chocolate, a very nice touch. The bathrooms are dark but it goes along with the clubby feel and I liked it. Not sure how I'd fare if Ineeded my makeup touched up. It was a bit of a drizzly day but as soon as some drizzle started the awning was closed then opened up as the rain stopped. So now worries about visiting on a rainy day. The music was good took me though if you wanted to have an easy conversation outside is better.. The outside terrace closes down on one side at 10pm so as not to disturb hotel guests. The remaining terrace was packed as we were leaving at 10pm, great party atmosphere . You can smoke on the open terraces which did not bothere me as I'm a sneaky smoker but my fiancee noticed the smoke though it was not intrusive enough to spoil her evening. Altogether a lovely evening thank you RADIO, look forward to another visit

title: Would never go back.
comment: I visited this bar on saturday night (6th June) and firstly the blonde 'woman' on the door is disgustingly rude, and so are most of the other statf. I will never ever come back to this place. The bar staff are ok - its a busy bar so you expect to wait a little while. They missed out drinks on our order and expected an £8 service charge... For what? You go up to the bar and take your drinks with you to the table exactly the same as any oher bar or pub, the only service is them pouring your drink. Yes the view is beautiful but its the same view as many other rooftop bars in London, so i would recommend you visit one of the others.

title: What's a sole worth?
comment: So, the perfect Father's Day treat, an evning at a rooftop bar. We booked well in advance. When we arrived people were sitting at our reserved tabel and had to be asked to move with us hovering in the background, very embarassing and unecessary, there were other tables. So we ordered cocktails fron the list and waited waited wiated. I asked a waiter where our drinks were and he said there was a hold up as they were cleaning the bar. UGH! It should be clean before guests arrive. Our son in law was to join us for the celebration, he phoned fron the street outside saying the staff on the door would not let him because he was wearing trainers. The same staff let my huaband in wearing trainers and me wearing Doc Martins. My daughter was deeply hurt that her husband was treated so shamefully. He is a gentle and caring man, a delightful son in law and I love him dearly. He has Asperger's syndrome, so life is more challenging for him than most. Despite his disability he has responsible and very demanding job. He has cpoing stratages most people do not need. One strategy is to always wear the same clothes; black T shirt, black trousers and black trainers. No silly logos no fashion statements all vert low key clean on every day. He was judged for his clothes not his good manners and polite behvioir. All this happened 30 minutes after we arrived and we still did not have aou drinks. We left. Why would we want to spend time in a place where my son in law was treated so badly

title: Fantastic View
comment: Went last night, the place has a wonderful view special atmosphere and a good drinks selection, yes there are cheaper places to quench your thirst, but do they have the whole package? The Radio Rooftopbar certainly does.

title: The Most Amazing View of London
comment: I was interested to visit this bar having read some of the negative reviews (many of which seem to be about refused entry).. I visited on a Saturday evening in June around 9pm. I would agree that the staff are somewhat discerning about who they let in but I had no problems. The staff on the door were very welcoming and chatty. Maybe because I was wearing a suit? The bar itself has two parts, indoors and an outdoor the terrace. I preferred the terrace as indoors there was some horrible house music playing, not my taste but then again I've never been trendy. We managed to find a table outside (although I believe it's best to reserve online to be guaranteed one).  The view at dusk is fantastic! You can see the Shard, Tower Bridge, the Gherkin, Tower Bridge, Canary Wharf and much more in one eyeful. The vista only gets better as the sun goes down. I only ordered 2 cocktails, a Pina Colada and a Vesper Martini, both excellently and professionally made by the lady serving me. £30 for 2 cocktails seems expensive but bearing in mind this is London and a very unique bar it's not that bad. I would definitely recommend a visit, but best to look smart and sober I suspect.

title: Warm Beer, that is all...
comment: Today I visited the Radio Bar with 8 friends including my Wife to celebrate two of our friends 40th Birthdays following on from a superb meal at Shoreditch. On arrival, the staff appeared rather uptight bordering pretentious! Eventually we ordered our drinks which included two beers. The beers were warm, served in plastic glasses! All for £7 each! I naturally complained to the bar staff who very kindly replaced the warm beers with another two....... warm beers! On complaining further, a senior bar assistant confronted us and attempted to pursade that the beers were not warm and that we were mistaken? Any way, we finished our other drinks bewildered and left for the next bar where we were served proper cold beers, no problem at all! Summary : great views of London, service rubbish, drinks over priced, rubbish atmosphere full of wannabees. Sack the management, things will be fine!

title: One of the best views in London
comment: The rooftop bar has one of the best views over London. I visited for a work meeting and I have to say the staff looked a bit clueless. They were a tad non responsive. Having said that, they were extremely friendly once you got their attention. I would recommend a visit but maybe in the evening.

title: Worst Service Ever
comment: I travel globally for business, hit lots of bars (give this one a big miss), stayed in the ME Hotel 3 days (great hotel), headed up to the roof top bar, ignored at the Bar for 10 minutes, left gave manager a serve. Went up early next night 5pm sat down did some work with a few beers. Suddenly at 6.10, staff drop reserved sign on the table (three others vacant), saying 8.30pm you need to move, ok then. Ten minutes later other staff member says table reserved in 20 minutes. Well I flipped out called for manager, explained stupidly of this, recounted night before, they offered card to come back! Went to the American Bar @ Savoy over the road, their service was impeccable!!!

title: Great wine great view great food !
comment: Had a fantastic time ! The wine was exactly how I like it ! We tried lots of different food and the quality was amazing for each and every items we had (burgers, prawns, olives, chicken...!) bit pricey but worth it ! View on Somerset House and shard and Big Ben ... Even watched the sunset! Service was really good we had different foreign waiters and they were all very friendly and funny. Will definitely come again !

title: Stunning views
comment: This was the first time I had visited this bar. It was 5pm on a sunny Saturday evening and it was packed. We hadn't reserved a table so were lucky after around 10 minutes to get a table but it also meant we were moved twice when the people turned up for their reserved slot which was fair enough.  Very expensive but then it is London.  The views are stunning and I am sure it must look fantastic once it gets dark.  A mix of ages and styles - great for people watching!  It was an experience and I'm glad we went but not in a hurry to rush back.

title: Worst Service, Rude Staff and Not Worth It...
comment: 45 mins to get served for a drink, awful disgusting front of house staff there were nothing but rude and abusive to everyone (we had over 20 people coming to which people arrived at different times throughout the night and everyone suffered the same disgusting treatment on arrival).  The blonde front of house lady is the most rude I've encountered in the world. The manager wasnt much better that when we tried to make a complaint to him his answer "there is other places to drink if you don't like it"..... Definitely won't go back, and as per the manager go somewhere else if you want a welcoming enjoyable night...

title: Disappointing
comment: Views are fantastic but the staff are unfriendly and rude. There is a 15% service charge for bar service! I questioned the bar staff about this and they said I could have it removed but would have to speak to the manager.  London is so full of great rooftop bars, sadly this not one of them!

title: Extremely nice doormen, great view, and great drinks
comment: I highly recommend stopping up for a cocktail for happy hour or even an evening out. The staff was very friendly and the drinks were well balanced.

title: Fabulous, fashionable and fun
comment: This roof top bar is so cool! Wonderful views, great sunny outside deck, sleek design, great music played by a DJ, good service, nice staff and quality alcohol. Whats not to like! Just mix in a few friends and you have a perfect afternoon/evening at this roof top bar.

title: Its like Marmite.
comment: So this spot is becoming increasingly popular. It has its pitfalls. Recently when we left we met some guys we know who are nice lads aged 23 ish and have been here lots of times. Despite that the "greeter" refused them entrance. This can be a lottery and if you are refused entry clearly your review or opinion is going to be negative.  The selection process is deemed to be on appearance. So the greeter is looking to see if you sober (ish) and look like someone made of good stuff. Quite how that works seems hit and miss and our friends will attest to. However being of more senior years I have never been refused entry. I like this place. So when you enter you walk to another greeter who calls a lift that ONLY goes to the roof. As the door opens you get bombarded with sunlight, loud music and beautiful (well some) people partying. Its vibrant. Very vibrant. If you want a table or booth or sofa area you best book as getting one ad-hoc is unlikey. All cocktails and Vodka/GIn mixers etc are £14 as at May 2015. They make a good cocktail. You can run a tab and the waitress service if you stand or sit is good so you don't wait long. You can if you choose order form the bar.  Food, though I've never eaten looks very good. There are views but in reality you need a table at the edge and if your just standing you can t see too much.  But it has a buzz and these boutique bars are becoming more in number. Located a short walk walk from Covent Garden at Aldwych by the Strand I would say its a good spot for a few drinks. Its lively.

title: Nice Venue
comment: The roof top bar is so cool and beautiful views of London. You must go to this roof top bar in summer if you're in London. Staff were great and cool atmosphere. One of the bartenders were so amazing at making cocktails and so friendly and very helpful and I was also impressed by his Knowledge. His name was Tibor I think. We will def be coming back again soon. Thank you again for having us.

title: STUCK UP DOOR STUFF. SO VERY RUDE
comment: last time I came to radio bar we spent £1500. This time the stuck up door staff wouldn't let us in, but were letting others in. Your business work on recommendations, of which I will revoke to all of my friends. Does the door staff realise people pay her wage?

title: Rude Staff, Unorganised, Rubbish Service.
comment: We went to radio at ME London on Friday (Party of 5). . We were moved from a table we'd booked for in advance to some little corner with only 3 seats no table. . Meaning that the other two people had to stand. They told us that we couldn't put ice buckets on the floor yet they refused to give us champagne bucket stands. .So here I was holding two heavy champagne buckets on my lap with ice melting on my Lanvin skirt. After a lot of protesting and arguing with whoever was in charge (tall guy in grey suit and glasses) we were then moved to another table far from any views, close to the entrance and toilets. . Just after we had ordered our food (Nick was a brilliant and attentive waitress by the way, she remained professional regardless of how the other staff were treating us) Their little hostess in a chav outfit came to tell us that OUR table (the one we had been moved to) had been booked by another party a month in advance. . Who in their right mind books a table at a rooftop bar near the entrance & toilet doors a MONTH in advance. There was NO reserved sign when the table was allocated to us, so that made no sense. The host kept walking past us as if to try and intimidate us but we refused to leave as our food had arrived and we were now very frustrated and hungry. We got no apology from anyone from Management, they walked past us several times as if nothing had happened. If you have the money to spend I'd suggest staying away from this place. Terribly bad customer service and rude staff especially the hostess who has the curly hair. The only positive was our friendly and attentive waitress. . I think her name was Nic.

title: Drinks
comment: Ridiculous - turned away because of my extremely gorgeous and expensive converse. On my birthday. Who do they think they are? The Waldorf, New York didn't mind, neither did the Ritz. Don't give them your money,

title: Staff were top line and could not do more for you.
comment: My wife and I celebrated our 10 anniversary at Radio roof top bar. The staff were fantastic and very accommodating. The prices were on the steep side, but that is to be completely expected in one of the capitals premier bars! We both had a fantastic time and enjoyed excellent food and drink with a good vibe. Will be definitely going back.

title: Cool place for the wannabe uber trendy and chic young crowd !
comment: This bar is a very trendy young hotspot, on the roof of the ME hotel, in Strand/Aldwych. It is accessed by going through the hotel, to the far end, and up to the 10th floor by lift. Unless you are under 25, don't even bother trying to go there on an evening... it is extremely busy, and full of young wannabe wags and failed footballer types. I took my daughter there on a very sunny Monday lunchtime, on my Birthday day out. It was very quiet, and a totally different proposition.... i.e. far from the madding crowds, it is a very pleasant experience. The staff are relaxed, smiling and helpful. The view from the roof is great, and there are some really nice little covered 'alcove' type seating areas. There also seems to be a little glass conservatory, which I assume you can book for private functions ?  Cocktails are nice, but obviously at a premium, and you can have some food up there too. Probably a nice place to impress a date: During the day if you are older, like me ; During the evening if you are a young pretender ! Tip - I got lucky, as it was a Monday and early afternoon. I would strongly urge you to book if you want to go here. There is also a separate entrance door to the ground floor lift lobby, on the side opposite to the Waldorf Hotel... saves you having to go through the main Hotel entrance.

title: Relaxing and superb
comment: Food and drinks are both amazing here. Yes it is pricey but well worth it. Lots of heaters to keep you warm so high up outside and lovely views.

title: It's not all about ME!
comment: My partner and I visit a relative in London numerous times throughout the year, and no expense is spared. Having visited ME regularly with work colleagues, our aunt decided to give us the experience if their roof top bar which not only has a very chic club experience but also provides extensive and breathtaking views despite just being at The Shard. However, our experience left us feeling less chic, trendy, socialising and more like we were in a silent movie. Upon our arrival the concierge was polite and smiley, welcomed us happily, so far so good. We made our way past reception and round to the lift that takes you directly up to the roof top bar. Our aunt had always taken this route never having an issue. However when we reached the lift we were met with a tall handsome lady, with beautifully voluminous hair and a great professional dress sense (so her professional appearance were present but her manners were nowhere to be seen.  She stared at our approach and when we stopped before the lift and told her that we were intending to visit the roof top bar she then abruptly held up her hand and dismissed the idea in a heart beat. No smile, now apology. "You cannot come in this way you have to go back out the entrance and take the "club entry" at the side of the building"  Okay, bearing in mind we four were the only people there, we obliged. We qued up at a cordoned of make shift line with velvet ropes and made our entry quite swiftly, great we were in! Now for a drink!  Think again. We ended up back at the lifts with our very well dressed unwelcoming friend glaring at us and barking at us to wait aside for a lift to come down. I'm sorry, but we walked back out and all the way around to the side of the building only to end up in the same place?! We found it rather unbelievingly funny and could not stop laughing off our disbelief. Our abrupt friend then said " is something the matter?" To which we replied " sorry we just find it rather funny, when you sent us outside we expected a completely different entrance and here we are back in the same place, the hotel lobby is dead, not a soul in sight you could have just informed of of the new change in policy and allow us acces to one of those lifts, if we're honest we don't feel like spending our money here. you have not made us feel very welcome."  She held out her hands shook her head and said "well I don't mind"  She sighed and returned to her little desk. We decided to stay and have a drink out of respect to our relative, she really wanted us to have the ME EXPERIENCE, So we obliged only to meet glasses ( plastic which is fair it is a rooftop garden) with lipstick all around the rim. I work for a hygiene company that sells quash, give me a call anytime. We did speak to a manager briefly but left after one drink as we don't feel ME bent over backwards to retain our custom. A bowl of olives for the table would have surfised. Anything to tell us you care. The particular member of staff seemed to have this attitude of snobbery, an upstairs down stairs attitude. "You don't look like someone worthy of this hotel"  Just because we are relaxed easy going people does not mean we don't have the funds to spend in your establishment. You should be careful who you mistreat because that person might surprise you, I could have been scouting out potential venues for a very expensive prestigious event. Think about it.  Just a point to operational values, if someone had told us before we went in that non residents must use the side entrance, all of this would have been avoided, unfortunately for you we quickly moved to a much more charming venue called The Rosewood where we spent a lot of money and got on really well with their friendly staff.

title: Radio - who do you think you are?
comment: Made a reservation for over 10 of my friends for a chilled evening on the rooftop. We planned on having 3-4 cocktails each with a few bottles of champagne during our 3 hour slot however, due to the our 'lost booking', poor service and an incredibly rude & smarmy manager we only stayed for one drink and left after 30 minutes. If it wasn't for the lovely hostess Lizzie from Liverpool who sorted us out, we'd have left immediately! Why would we give our money to a business who does not value our custom? I will not be returning, plenty of other bars in London that have more delicious cocktails and actually treat their customers with respect.

title: Great views, food and service!
comment: Myself and several friends booked a table for food and drinks - our visit was faultless! The service was forthcoming without being over the top, food a little pricey for small plates, however tasted great and the views fantastic! Well worth a visit and would recommend you book in advance! If I had to have any grumble it would be the 15% service charge which is steep, even for London - that said it is optional and you can refuse to pay it, we happily paid on our visit.

title: Only went for a drink...
comment: Hotel was decent enough but I was bullied into getting a minicab by the doorman. I pointed at the black cab waiting outside but he insisted I wait for a cab he ordered.  The guy turned up and had to put Waterloo station in his say nav... it's literally the other side of the bridge!!

title: VERY expensive, but nice on a summer's day.
comment: It's a lovely place for a date/meet up in small groups as seating is at a premium, especially outside. Very nice views and a nice place to be if the sun is shining. The one thing I would note though is it's VERY expensive at £13 for a cocktail with a 15% service charge auto added on. The waitresses are quite quick to ask you for your next order, even though we had half a drink left! A few more promotions before this place becomes my regular!

title: On top of it all!
comment: Although not first timers to London, we were first timers to the Radio Rooftop Bar.  Our concierge at The Marylebone Hotel recommended this location as we had requested a dining experience in the evening, somewhere with a view of the city. And he did not disappoint.  After a 15 minute taxi ride through some heavy traffic we made it there on time for our 9pm reservation. We were warmly greeted street side by the door staff who confirmed our reservation. Another staff greeting inside & they sent us up the elevator to the restaurant as it is a separate elevator from the ME hotel guest elevator.  Doors opened & already the view is spectacular! Warmly greeted by Elizabeth (Lizzy from Liverpool) who took a moment to find out more about us & explain how the billing system works. She took our credit card & sealed it in an envelope & had us confirm the minimum spend amount per person. We were then led out to the patio with a view overlooking the Thames & it was explained to us that this portion of the patio closes at 10pm but that a table would be reserved for us on the other side to continue our visit.  Karina (sp?) was our server & most pleasant & as efficient as she could be since this place was constantly busy the whole time we were there. All staff were present to offer any help needed & assisted Karina in making sure we had a great experience. Including a visit from Elizabeth the hostess at check in.  Tapas style food was perfect for this atmosphere & time of day. We had the chicken skewers, beef skewers, dates, crab fritters, leek & ham coquettes, & prawns & chorizo dishes. & a few of them we ordered seconds of. The tapas were staggered as they were ready which meant all were fresh & hot. 3 rounds of Jam Packed, nice fruit bourbon cocktails,to wash it down & after just over 2 hrs we were done. Still suffering a bit of jet lag or we could have stayed longer.  This place was everything they promise & we will definitely be back!

title: Wonderful Drinking & Dining Experience with a View
comment: As of writing this, there are 163 Terrific and 170 Terrible reviews on TripAdvisor. That is quite a disparity of experiences. Initially this concerned me as my wife and we're making our dining decision but we decided to try it out. Reservations were made for a table for 9pm on a Wednesday night. In order to reserve an outdoor table, there is a minimum spend required which varies from £25 to £100 per person.  The entrance is discreet hosted by a hostess and doorman. Upon arrival my wife and I were warmly greeted and allowed entry and directed to the elevator that goes to the Radio Rooftop Pattio. Once off the elevator we were again warmly greeted by the Radio hostess Elizabeth ("Lizzy"). She confirmed our reservation and the minimum spend requirement. I provided my credit card that was placed inside an envelope and sealed. We were escorted through the indoor bar/lounge area that had a moderately sized crowd with a DJ playing music (not overly loud to inhibit conversation). Our table was on the side facing the London Eye and other London landmarks.  Our server was very attentive and friendly taking both out tapas and drink orders. All the tables were full and service was still quite good with it not being overly pushy but not having to wait too long and searching for the server either. It was a relatively clear evening and the cool breezes reflected that. Thankfully there are numerous heat lamps (both floor and ceiling areas) to relieve a bit of the chill. I found the clientele to be friendly and engaging. We spoke to several people and did not encounter the pretentiones that had been described in earlier reviews. At 10pm the side we were on closed due to neighbourhood noise abatement requirements and we were moved to another table on the other side. The food is tapas style. While I would consider the portions small and expensive, I could not find any fault in any of the offerings that were absolutely delicious!  We both thoroughly enjoyed our drinking & dining experience. All staff we encountered were very friendly and willing to assist. In fact we had three separate severs approach us to take our food/drink orders. I must make a special mention of hostess Elizabeth who was the constant throughout the evening ensuring that our experience was pleasant. A very nice and engaging hostess.  I imagine that the experiences would vary depending on the time of day or the day of the week. Overall though given my experience I would not hesitate to recommend the Radio Rooftop Bar for a unique drinking/dining experience with a fabulous view.

title: Fantastic views, lovely bar but so expensively pretentious
comment: The door is a bit unwelcoming, bit of 'face sifting' going on I suspect which I's,m amazed I passed. Lovely setting though with breathtaking views and lovely decor to boot. Staff a bit full of themselves and the prices are as likely to take your breath away as the prices. There are nicer roof bars in london, but worth a visit to see what the fuss is about!

title: One of my favourite bars in London
comment: I'm s huge fan of this fantastic bar in London. The location is second to none. The roof terrace comes into its own in the summer with comfy sofas/chairs, great music and stunning views of the city. The service is so slick from the team that work there which is why I choose this bar every time I'm entertaining clients or having a cheeky cocktail or two with my friends. If you've not been and are thinking about where to go do not hesitate and book today!

title: What a view!
comment: Our hotel opposite suggested we go to Radio for a drink and to enjoy the view early evening as it was sunny, before going on to the Aldwych theatre. We normally go to Soho House with a family member.  The staff were friendly and courteous and after the trip in the lift up, we were pleasantly greeted and shown to the only available table for two outside which was where we wanted to be as the evening was still warm and sunny. Understandably, the rooftop terrace was full. The views are amazing and the atmosphere was buzzing. When one of the comfy sofas became available which was in the last of the sun, we moved to enjoy our drinks there.  Yes... It's expensive, but really worth it for a pre- threatre drink for the atmosphere and views. I will go back when next in London and definitely book to dine.

title: Stunning Views of London
comment: Very pleasant atmosphere with friendly and very efficient staff. Nice way to spend a couple of hours on a sunny afternoon. Don't go here if you are on a budget though and drinks quite pricey.

title: Zoo Bar would be better name for it
comment: I heard many reviews about this "fabulous" bar for ages, so i`ve decided to check myself what do they offer. I`ve tried to book a table through their phone number listed on opentable, but answering machine was keep saying there is no availability on any of the days. Then, I went to their webpage and made a reservation, but I faced many rules of the bar that I was amazed: no big parties allowed (parties of 5 has to include girls and boys), on Fridays and Saturdays there is 100 pounds minimum spend on other days 25 pounds, which puts a pressure on you that you have to spend this money no matter what. For reservation they keep your credit card details to make sure you will turn up plus they confirmed twice my reservation before i went there. I`ve already felt stressed and thought I`m meeting the Queen not going to the bar to enjoy a cocktail. When we turned up we been met by a girl downstairs who was more interested in chatting with a colleague than us. After we been greet by receptionist we were given the worst located high table, squeezed in between lounge sofas, then thankfully after my complain they gave us better table. Most of the public there is absolute ZOO, seems like people not coming there to enjoy the view and time but only for proper showing off, which makes atmosphere absolute fake (i personally don`t like it). Design of the bar is really cheap (table, seats, bar stand, broken toilets) comparing even with a lounge which is downstairs. Cocktails and food were nice and not extremely expensive, but 15% service charge surprised me for that level of service we were provided. View of course is great especially during the sunset, but you have to come only in warm summer days as I was feeling constantly cold even we sat inside. Last thing for management note: please look after waitress attire. One waitress was wearing a dress which was not even covering her bum, that looks just ridiculous, and mainly waitresses looked too casual. If the Rooftop Bar would like to promote themselves as a posh place they need asap improve their service and waiters attitude as will as enhance bar design.

title: On the off-chance
comment: Great atmosphere, very buzzy, helpful and friendly staff Great views over London  Would definitely go again Interesting cocktails

title: Great view!
comment: This is a very trendy buzzy bar. We were staying at the hotel and went for lunch and evening drinks. Unfortunately due to it being s very sunny warm day the outside was full. As we were staying at the hotel we were told to sit inside and order our food and drinks and they would move us asap when a table outside became available. After many requests to the hostess and seeing many tables  outside leave we were never given a table outside. Exactly the same thing happened in the evening and after some complaining we were eventually seated outside. Would recommend but make sure you reserve a table if you would like to sit outside

title: Appalling
comment: Tacky, pretentious, rude. Nothing to see in this overpriced bar, even the view is hugely disappointing. I wish I had seen reviews before I went there, the table next to us left with all their glasses full and after a few minutes we understood why... this place is plain, not an ounce of refinement in the design, the menu nor the staff behavior. Beware of the so called "dress code": no tennis shoes after 5pm (understandable for an elegant place but radio bar in no way is). Please, do yourself a favor and move along to some nicer and trendier bar, which London is crawling with.

title: Amazing service and breathtaking view!!!!
comment: My now fiance has arranged post engagement drinks and snacks for us at the Radio Roof! It was amazing choice!  View was just something! You could see whole of London and as night approached it got better and better! I would highly advice to go there around sunset time! It will surprise you!  Service was amazing! It felt like every memeber of stuff knew we just got engaged and were super nice and lovely!  Food was just amazing! We had little snaks and tapas, loved it!  Our waitress Dora was so lovely and made our day even more special :)  Thank you guys! We will be back!

title: Do not take elevator to roof bar!!
comment: Nice chic hotel on the outside but that is where it ends. I was trapped in the elevator to the roof bar for over 30 min with a nervous girl who started to hyper ventilate and drive me crazy screaming for help. Not what I was looking for on my business trip to London and to make the matters worse, I had to be evacuated the next day to another worse hotel in the night because ME lost power for the next three days. I can's believe they do not have diesel generators in the hotel??? This has never happened to me in over 35 years and flying over 4 million miles on 3 airlines around the world. My wife asked, I thought you were in London?? I thought so too...

title: Different kind of excellent service
comment: I wanted to celebrate the proposal to my then still GF in a restaurant/ bar with a stunning view over London. Its spring, so I wanted something fresh and unusual. I came to take a look at Radio Rooftop bar and was fascinated by the atmosphere, lightness of the place and definitely the view over London. The personal at Radio Rooftop Bar has made it exceptionally smooth for me. I discussed everything with the manager Julie, she was amazing and lovely. Me being overwhelmed with all the excitement, she made lots of suggestions on food and drinks. I followed her advice and never regretted a single thing, well maybe I should have ordered more (the food was amazing). We've been served carefully, all the personal was aware of the event and it was very pleasing to hear everyone congratulating us, it made it special for my girl. I recommend this place to all the romantic couples, who enjoy beautiful scenery, good quality drinks, and a bit of lounge music in the back that kicks in the party spirit. I will definitely come back, haven't tried their cocktails- dying for it!!!

title: LOVELY
comment: Amazing, perfect to have a cool night , we've been served by roberto maugeri the best service I've ever had . Lovely service

title: Great G&Ts
comment: Came here for pre-supper drinks about 5pm. Unfortunately the outside terrace was full, but the views are amazing. Very good helpful and attentive service. Excellent selection of G&Ts and delicious smoked almonds. All very lovely. Ridiculously expensive, but worth it for a treat once in a while.

title: What a view
comment: Visited early evening and there was no que to get in, the bar is definitely a bit overpriced, but you are paying for the location and the view plus the fact it's part of a 5 star hotel. The tapas style food was very good and service was friendly and attentive. Slightly on the pretentious side but that's more down to some of the people that were there but worth a visit just to see the great views outside.

title: Drinks & dress to impress
comment: This fabolous venue has a great vibe, once u get up there. Booking of table or dress in style is recomended to speed up the queing. London dress etiquete for girls for accessing a Spanish 5 stars hotel Roof Top experience. Best time to go are summer brunches imitating Ibiza clubs parties. Head there if you are looking for mix of great cocktails and animation with dress to impress females and amazing Ibiza Djs.  It has heating in the outdoors sofas, for the colder days, and best views enjoyed on sunset and the later night lights.

title: Strange and unpleasant experience
comment: To be honest this venue (not rooftop bar - they think they are something else judging by the way the staff act) should be an easy winner. People come for the great view, they get friendly and professional service, they go away happy and come back for more. Radio makes money and the clients have a reliable hotspot in London to enjoy. Instead, you pass bouncers at the hotel door who will not let you pass without you acknowledging them, somebody at the bottom of the lift whose only job it is to tell you that it will arrive automatically, then a hostess at the exit of the lift to seat you in a place of her choosing if you are lucky enough for there to be space. In addition, after 10pm half of the terrace is shut - so no view of the Thames, just the BT Tower. The excuse given is that there are hotel rooms on that side requiring silence. We had a room virtually ON The Strand and it was so soundproofed that this excuse made no sense. The strangest thing was the mix of aggressive 'service' and the nightclub-style dress of about half the clientele. I ordered a beer and was told (after no response from the waitress) "Yes I know what that beer is, thank you!" - followed by "well aren't you going to have ANY food?". The drinks are served in plastic cups which is a joke considering they are 30% more expensive that even the average London prices. We wish we had listened to the reviewers on this site before wasting our energy on Radio. They are either living in a dream world, or this bar is a cover for something else. Whichever way, their appalling staff ego is losing them a bucketload of money. Sort it out and fire the idiots responsible before it's too late.

title: Amazing Thursday Lunch & Friday Night Drinks
comment: Just wanted to say what an amazing client lunch I had at Radio Bar last Thursday. The food was great with exceptional service, mostly from a guy called Ricardo. The clients were very happy and everyone had an awesome time.  I came to the bar again Friday night with a friend and again the service was perfect, so attentive & friendly, it was great. We moved tables a few times and the staff were really accommodating. The cocktails were also awesome! Ricardo was again working and took such great care of us.  I know there can be issues on the door reception on the ground floor, I've encountered that myself and I really hope they look to improve that. Friday night there were no problems aside from the standard look up and down but thankfully we were on the guest list.  I would always recommend this bar - amazing views of London both during the day and also watching the city light up at night. Ive always found the bar-service great and its generally a really nice crowd. If people find it pretentious then they should head to weatherspoons! its really good to be in a bar when people take time to dress well, be in a nice environment and receive great service. Well, I think so anyway!  Enjoy the bar and make your own mind up! i love it there!

title: AVOID this place guys !!!
comment: AVOID THIS BAR !!! I've been with some friends that arrived in London from Moscow and wanted to take them to a nice place like Radio Rooftop Bar !!! After we spent 400gbp on food and drinks they said that we ain't allowed anymore for drinks suddenly :))) that absurde !!! Although we haven't bothered nobody, we're just having a nice time, suddenly a manager said that we ain't allowed anymore on drinks ! So we asked him why ? He said that's the their house rule to select clients that drinked too much !!! We drank only a bottle of Ciroc Vodka which is 200gbp and had some food !!! They ain't offering no respect at all for you as a client !!! They're just ripping you off and after finding motives to kick you out for another one to spend they're money !!!! It's a pitty that's a nice place but the staff is horrible !!!

title: Amazing views
comment: Amazing views and good company. Exclusive lift up to top floor opens out into attractive modern bar. Friendly staff, good drinks, plastic glasses but I kinda know why given how high up and next to busy street. Very nice

title: Maggie Lou's in town!
comment: Six of us visited Radio bar last Friday night for Maggie Lou's visit to London from the UAE. The view, service and cocktails were fantastic! Cannot wait to visit again soon.

title: Awful
comment: Rowdy crowd and not the place to visit if you are staying in the hotel. Nowhere to sit as asked to move quite a bit due to being packed. More suited to a young crowd wanting to party

title: Amazing views, very busy and not cheap!!!!
comment: We popped up here for a quick drink because it looked interesting. It was really busy on the Saturday afternoon we visited. The views are brilliant, but you do pay for them. We waited quite a long time to get served and paid nearly £20 for a soft drink and a glass of wine. We knew when we came up that there were no free tables, so standing and admiring the views was fine. Worth a quick visit, but don't think I would want to stay and eat.

title: Great for drinks before dinner
comment: We ordered a table for drinks on a Saturday night before dinner at STK downstairs. The staff were friendly the atmosphere was great and the cocktails were really good. The views are amazing and there was plenty of outside seating. I would certainly recommend booking a table.

title: omg 40 mins in the que
comment: Bad experience waited in the que like 40 mins maybe more. I don't think that even in heaven I would wait 40 mins to get in.

title: Outstanding view!
comment: Must see in London!  Amazing place, very friendly and efficient staff, went there for a romantic date with my husband and everything was just perfect, so romantic and classy. Highly recommend!

title: really stunning views, and a nice atmosphere
comment: its very chic, cool, contemporary and sort of buzzing. However, having read a few of the other mixed reviews, I do get what they are saying. It is slightly over hyped in terms of what it has to offer, and the prices are not cheap. But, its one of those 'one off' experiences you kind of want to tick off the list. if only for the view, and your first G&T on a night out. Unlikely to go back, but it was fun for the evening. (I was there with a big group, so not so sure its the same if you are looking for a place where you can easily mingle and come and go. eg: given its accessible in special lift from ground floor, it takes time to access).

title: Afternoon drink with my daughter
comment: We had been to another local establishment for afternoon tea, and though steaming hot day roof bar ver close so off we go to tske a look! We did stay for a drink although very pricey for drinks, view was great toilets so blac was ire resign eyes adjustng to the light and you play let's find the door!  Tapas food available

title: AWFUL SERVICE - DO NOT GO THERE!!!!!!!!!!!
comment: We went for a drinks there on Tuesday and waited 45 minutes to be served ! We were standing in front of a person who got served and the the waitress just turned around and refused to serve us for another 20 minutes !! She was running around pretending she doesn't see us! I have never experienced such a rude staff in any other bars. Also some of the staff were wearing sunglasses which I think is unprofessional and it looks like they have been drinking all night and now hiding their faces. When we finally got served we have been given an incredibly dirty glasses and have been charged £6 for such an awful service. You can find many much nicer rooftop bars with a properly trained, much nicer and professional staff such as W Hotel or St.Paul's.

title: Radio Rooftop Bar at the ME London
comment: Great views across the city, very pleasant and spacious outside area. Prices are a little high, even for london, but the views are priceless!

title: LOVED IT :)
comment: Great place to be. Had an amazing experience. Staff very professional - Top service. Great view of the city. Had Quality time. I will definitely recommend the visit..

title: There are better rooftop bars in London
comment: I have been to this bar a few times and would describe it as average. There is a fairly strict door policy, the smartly dressed group in front of us got turned away due to 'full capacity' however when we got up there the bar was more than half empty.The staff are pretty unwelcoming but it didn't take long to get served. W e were unable to sit down outside because even though a lot of the tables were empty, they were all reserved. I went to the bar at 5pm and by the time I left most of these tables were still unoccupied. It was pretty frustrating having to stand the whole time when i'd just paid £14 for a drink. I would suggest stating what time the table is reserved from, however my guess is that the tables are just saved in the hope that bigger parties will come in and pay for a table. They should be more concerned about ensuring that current customers have a pleasant experience. The atmosphere at Radio bar is pretty dull, many people just trying to look glamorous and acting pretentious. For a better experience I would suggest Sushi Samba in the Heron Tower, Madison rooftop bar at St Pauls or Rooftop Gardens in High St Kensington. The views are great and the staff are more welcoming.

title: Overly Pretentious
comment: I've visited the radio bar several times and each time my experience seems to get worse. When they first opened, the venue had a cool and trendy vibe about it, with great music and attentive staff. More recently though the bar has developed more of a pretentious vibe, where they've become more picky about the customers they 'choose' to let in. The end result is you tend to get a crowed that conform to a specific look, which feels somewhat forced and unnatural. When you go to a bar like Radio you go on the basis that you understand you'll be paying a little more for the experience and you should make an effort when it comes to appearance. However, a bar like this should also have service and atmosphere to match but Radio Bar fails to deliver on both those respects.  If you're looking for a similar bar but one that meets expectations I'd suggest looking elsewhere. W Hotel is a great alternative and whilst it doesn't offer an outside area their bar often has great atmosphere with live DJ and club.

title: Great Drinks, great view, amazing nibbles and service
comment: I went there couple of weeks ago to catch up with friends and I have to say: this was one of the best places I've ever been in London.  To star the service was amazing, i just felt like a special customer; the bartender and the manager was calling me by my name. :-). cocktails and nibbles were great! Also you have a spectacular view of London. It's a good place to catch up with friends or go for a date.

title: Appalling service and staff attitude, a terrible experience
comment: If you are planning a group event or party there, beware. Our group of 25 were refused entry due to the male/female ratio and even when we increased the female headcount they refused entry, citing one reason after another, making stuff up in the end, in spite of that fact we had our event planned for months, had spent thousands, yes thousands, in STK beforehand, preordered our drinks and arranged an area following several conversations with the staff in the run up to the event. We specifically went to STK as we were heading to Radio after our meal, our group were polite, well dressed, not drunk, this was London bar snobbery at its finest. They had no regard whatsoever for the size of the group and where we could go at 11pm, having spent the last 3 hours dining in the restaurant as part of an event we had planned for months. We had females in our group, it was mixed as requested, not a 50/50 mix but this was not once mentioned in the lead up to the event, not once, this 50/50 rule cannot be found on any of the correspondence between myself and the staff at Radio, and it cannot be found on our contract nor on their website. We were not treated at all like a group that had spent a large sum dining with them beforehand or like a group who prearranged this event, more like 25 random people who had walked by and tried to get in on a whim, in fact we were treated more like we had been a rowdy group of beer-guzzling yobbos who were chancing our arm, which we were not. The staff were arrogant, dismissive and completely unreasonable. We have been to far more established clubs and bars in London with the same gender ratio and been treated so much better. Event organizers beware, this place will not make your group feel welcome or will not go out of their way to help you, in fact management were the worst offenders. Terrible place, appalling experience, I will strongly advise anyone who asks me against going there.

title: Great for drinks with a view!
comment: We went recently for a quick drink as part of my friends surprise trip to London for her 30th. The staff were really good and fit us in even though we hadn’t booked (although this was slightly confusing as I couldn’t find anyway of booking just for drinks on the website?),but they gave us a nice table near the window as we enjoyed some wine and a glass of bubbly. Views truly are stunning and though it’s quite pricey I don’t think it’s that bad for London considering the wonderful view and atmosphere. Would definitely go back there again.

title: A night to remember for my winning bid team..
comment: We were very careful in choosing our venue to celebrate our recent success and we wanted to ensure that the evening was something that our team of 37 people would remember. Everything from the evening itself to the preparation beforehand in working directly with Radio Rooftop was handled very well. Our team were greeted at the door by the front of house team who took them up via the lift to the bar. The added glam factor really appealed to everybody, as being spoiled by having your own lift attendant is not something we see often within IT! Once we arrived upstairs the views were just spectacular, a panoramic view of the City, breath-taking. The service received was brilliant, Dora our hostess was pretty, very smart, polite and prompt with drinks and food delivery. We were very well look after. I personally thanked her and the management team at the end of the night as everybody really enjoyed themselves. I would definitely recommend Radio Rooftop, whether you are with a large group of people or just a small party. I have seen some negative comments here and I can only say that it’s important that you speak with a venue before you arrive. If you’re in a large group, spend some time contacting Radio Rooftop directly. I did just that, ok at times they were difficult to get hold of over the phone but you have to expect that with a popular venue. E-mail was my best way to confirm dates, food and drinks and really RR were very accommodating with my own specific menu, designed from theirs of course! Comments about rude staff are far from what serviced we received and again, it only takes a conversation with the management team to address that. Paul Harrison

title: Amazing view of London
comment: A group of us visited Radio Rooftop Bar and had a very good time. The drinks were expensive but in line with similar bars. The staff were friendly. The views of London were amazing and it is definitely worth going there just for this.

title: Amazing experience!
comment: My husband and I visited this bar during our short visit to London a couple weeks ago and it was the highlight of our entire stay! I can't say enough about how beautiful this bar is and how amazingly we were treated by their staff. Tibor and Greg (I'm sorry if I'm not getting their names right!) were absolutely fabulous!! We told them it was our first time in London and they took such good care of us all night and made sure we had a great time. Thanks to them our last night in London was the best night of our trip. Not to mention that view!! What a way to experience London. Thanks again!!

title: Terrible service
comment: Waiters look like they have been out all night clubbing- not interested in good service. They dress appallingling macdonalds uniform is 100 percent better and that is saying someting. One waiter was picking his nose chewing his finger nails and then serving food. The only good feature is the view - resting on ones laurals !!!!! I advise to go to the Hilton Trafagar square, Level 42 or Heron tower bars for a professional calssy experince with rooftop views

title: Amazing view
comment: I recommended this bar to my sister but after reading the previous reviews she decided not to go..So I felt I should post a review..It was my second visit last week I had liked it so much the first time I returned with a friend who also loved it.
