I am really surprised at some of the comments we found the staff on both visits to be lovely and helpful accommodating us by finding a table outside even though they were very busy on both occasions they were friendly and make us feel very welcome..Please give this bar a try the views are amazing and I bet its even better on a summer evening..x

title: Beautiful venue, awful staff & service
comment: Went here for a colleague's birthday drinks. Beautiful venue but awful service. Waitresses did not seem on the ball & mixed up our drinks order several times. To make matters worse, the fire alarm was set off & we had to evacuate and walk all the way down several flights of stairs, then stood outside for what seemed an eternity. The door staff here cannot even speak fluent English & have an appalling attitude. They gave us a difficult time when we tried to get back in, even though we had not finished our drinks and my credit card was still up there. We eventually got back in, paid the bill & left. Having spent £500 here, I found the service below average & the staff rude & arrogant. Will not return.

title: Excellent costumer service
comment: Amazing experience in London! Amazing view! We all absolutely loved it from start to finish! Thanks manager Renato and all staff!

title: Too trendy for its own good
comment: Went to this 'must see' bar to see what all the fuss was about, well what a complete disappointment! The bar has no vibe or atmosphere, the staff are shabbily dressed and unkempt and the decor is simple & boring. The service was indifferent & unprofessional. The only saving grace is the view, but there are far better places to go where the staff look clean and are welcoming. Don't bother going.

title: Top 3 rooftop bar in London!
comment: I am a great fan of rooftop bars in general and it is fair to say: Radio belongs to the top three rooftop bars in London. You enter the bar and all your sorrows are gone – nice views, great ambience, DJ keeps it upbeat and prices are absolutely fair. Clientele rather posh, so if you have a dislike for the champagne-sipping ones, better stay away. Either you want to kick-off your weekend or just relax on a Sunday afternoon, Radio is the place to go.  Regarding service quality, as it has been somewhat questioned in former reviews; well, I always try to get served by Dori – she really goes the extra mile for her customers and makes sure that you have a great evening.

title: Dreadful
comment: Passing by my girlfriend and I thought we'd swing in for a quick drink. Only to be confronted by a hideous woman with clipboard looking us up and down. She was clearly there to make sure we looked like the right type of people. After she'd finished eyeballing us she decided to let us in.  NO THANKS. We went round the corner and spanked £400 in place that doesn't feel the need to look us up and down first. Well done Radio Bar!  Keep treating your customers like this and not even that view will save you. You'll certainly never see us again.

title: Amazing venue, service, drinks, and a view of the whole of london.
comment: I've been looking for a hip rooftop bar in London for ages now, I finally went with a couple of girlfriends and I was in love with it. The service was perfect, super friendly as well. The venue is so chick, you can choose to sit in or outside. They have heaters outside as well which keeps you warm in the chilly london weather and also makes a very trendy and warm atmosphere. The cocktails are just mouth dripping and exotic as well as the food. And as for the view, you can practically see most of central London as the bar is situated on the 10th floor of the trendy ME hotel. Highly recommended!

title: Fantastic night at Radio
comment: Fantastic Friday night at Radio. Having used Radio Rooftop for an event last year I thought I would check it out outside of work. We arrived at 8 pm for a table we had booked for 2 hours, when our table was up, I asked if we could drink at the bar but the staff let us keep our table till the early hours. Brilliant music and excellent customer service, our glasses were never left empty. Really good night and we all have been raving about it since. If you are looking for a upbeat, trendy and fun night then Radio would be the place for you. Make sure you book well in advance as this hot spot is hard to reserve, once up there its totally worth and money. Belinda and the Team really are fab!

title: Rude Service - Shame rude staff let the place down
comment: I had a reservation this bar for a table at 8.30 Arriving via the STK restaurant to the elevator and showed our reservation at 8.35pm. There was 2 females at the lift who said that we could not use this entrance as it was for hotel guest. I explained that we just came from STK and it was freezing outside so walked though the lobby. We have done this several time before so I did not see it as a problem. The reception downstairs refused to let us in the lift and said we would need to leave the exit we came in walk around the block and come in the side entrance. She then walked off and left us standing there for 5 minutes. The other female staff member said she could let us in until we came in the right entrance.  Fed up I was about to leave until my partner said lets just wait and leave. We left the entrance. Via the roped entrance. The security guard lifted the rope and let us through. We waited 10 minutes in the cold and finally I asked to speak to the duty manager  We finally got to our table of the empty bar 15 mins after arriving at the lift. Unnecessary pretentious staff at the door. Very unwelcoming!

title: Unforgettable
comment: I would like to start this post by saying, I'm not really the type of person who is into commenting experiences on this side. However i thought in this occasion is worth it, after seening on this site Radio Rooftop hasnt got many positive comments i felt sad as my experience last week was amazing. I know everyone is allow to share their opinion freely but i know also that people exaggerates too. On my behalf all i got to say is that even thought it was a little pricey, the views were of a WHAO!! and the service excellent.  My husband and I were served by a young and lovely lady who's name is Michelle, she helped us to find a table as there wasn't any hostess available at the desk and we were wondering around. Secondly the recommendations were perfect, she topped up our champagne always with a smile, at the end she became more like a friend for us rather than the waitress, we shared experiences and a few jokes i think she deserves a BIG thank you from us too. Elisabeth and Ben.

title: Most amazing night ! Beautiful scenery
comment: I came here on a date, we was treated like royalty. The scenery was beautiful and the staff were really friendly. It was quite big as well, we visited on a Tuesday night, wasn't busy and the music was quite good too. They had a live DJ.

title: Doesn't quite get there
comment: Great location and views and could be so good but misses by quite a way. We had a reservation there (at which we'd guaranteed a minimum spend by card) but even having done that the procedure to get in didn't really work. Accept it's a business and understand the minimum spend so had no issue with that (and 6 of us bought 5 bottle of champagne while we were there) but somehow the whole place seems to be doing you a massive favour by letting you in. Staff are oh so superior to us mere mortal (money spending) customers and the sheer fact they managed to get a job there clearly puts them a cut above??? Has potential to be a great bar but really let down by the staff.

title: chavvie
comment: This is the sort of place where people who enjoy Towie might like. Terrible rude staff, highly over priced and the view is not very interesting. Most of the buildings you can see are the really tall ones which can be seen from almost anywhere in central London. In fact I have a better view from my terrace in Covent Garden. Double tree hilton has better view, not to mention the new Sky Garden, on top of the WalkieTalkie. If you want to be judged by someone with a clipboard as to whether you're suitable to enter and then find yourself in the company of a lot of morons then give it a go. If you want value for money in an competitive environment go somewhere else. The Savoy is only 5 minutes away, go there and experience class every time.

title: Nothing special
comment: It was fine. The hostess on the door was extremely rude waxing lyrical about the need to have a reservation. Great, that's fine. However your website is horrendous so it's impossible to find. And if so don't let us on, it's irrelevant to explain your policy and then let us in anyway. The hostess upstairs explained they were busy and we may struggle to find a table inside which we did but there was some outside so we sat there. The drinks were nice but plastic cups - not a fan. we had some bar snacks which were vile. Calamari had so much salt and little else. The chicken wings were probably frozen and tasteless. Views fantastic so obviously they can get away with everything else being substandard.

title: Great place to unwind!
comment: Drank more gin than I imagined I would relaxing at Radio Rooftop Bar. Super cool place and often busy. Go when the weather is mild and just sit back and soak up the atmosphere!

title: Kind of like a Yates Wine Lodge with a good view
comment: The stench of mediocrity hangs heavy on every part of this play pen for those who prefer a view to any genuine human spirit. Crass, ersatz and aenemic in every way.

title: Radio Roof Top Bar
comment: I was at Radio at the weekend for a Birthday bash, and we all had a super fun night that made the birthday girl feel so special. The staff were very friendly and Knowledgable, from the door girl as you walk in the hotel, to the bartenders and waitresses. The Manger even came over to say Happy Birthday to my friend. A very nice touch. Drinks were very good and we always were asked before the drink was finished whether we wanted another. Non of this looking for a member of staff to take your order. You felt special. And the Views over the London Skyline were awesome. Would highly Recommend this place and i'll be returning soon.

title: A very nice rooftop bar with good drinks and good late tapas
comment: This cocktail bar is in a roof top In the Strand just closed to theaterland and I really like it. Great views of London, good food, very decent tapas and good looking people. Have a. look!!

title: Disappointing visit - rude staff, terrible service and not worth the money.
comment: My boyfriend and I went to Radio Bar for the first time in 2014 and have gone back 4-5 times since. We loved it when we first went - incredible views, great drinks, good service and no pretentious teenagers popping bottles of Belvedere! Although it is an expensive bar, it has usually been worth it - you're paying for the experience as well as the drinks (and perhaps, food). However, when introducing (which was probably our 10th) friend to the place, we experienced terrible service and rude staff. Firstly, we arrived and ordered drinks and food and was told by the bar man to ask the woman at the front desk to advise us on where to sit. I walked up to the three members of chatting staff at the front desk, and felt I was rudely interrupting their conversation. The woman eventually turned to face me and I told her we have ordered food, where can we sit to eat? 'You'll have to wait.' she bluntly responded. I politely explained how we need to know if we cannot sit down while we eat. She told me we are able to sit anywhere outside until the reservations turn up. We went outside and found a perfect table for the 3 of us, except there was only one chair. This time, my boyfriend went to speak to the woman. He came back, disgusted. The woman (in a deep conversation, again) had told him we cannot have any more chairs - even though there was a completely empty roped off area with over 30 chairs. So, we stood and eventually our food arrived and as it started to rain, luckily, some chairs became free. The food was fine - I wouldn't recommend it, though. Upon paying the bill, my boyfriend asked to remove the service charge. 'Why?' Was the barman's response. My boyfriend explained he would rather not say. He said he has to tell his manager, so I told him unfortunately, we have experienced bad service on this visit. He didn't say a word.  Unfortunately, we will never be going back to Radio. The staff were rude and pompous and it was a disappointing evening. I am not paying for service that I did not receive just as I would not pay for a drink I did not receive. I didn't expect to have to explain this to the staff. Radio is a nice place to go for one drink, to see the gorgeous view of London. Apart from that, my whole view of it has been thawed by this one experience.

title: Worth a visit and a glass or 2 of fizz!
comment: Always wanted to splurge on a few glasses of fizz at Radio Bar. It was a cold and overcast day but we braved it and sat on the terrace by a heater and admired the stunning skyline and a great ariel view of London Fashion Weekend! We asked for a small jug of Elderflower Cordial with our fizz so we could mix it in as we drank and staff were happy to do this - can thoroughly recommend it! The bar was buzzing on a Saturday afternoon - maybe due to its proximity to LFW - but it all contributed towards feeling like a special treat, We spent ages trying to guess the landmark/building - would be wonderful if they provided maybe a guide to what you can see in the drinks menu (as some of the roof top bars do in NYC) - it may also encourage you to order more drinks!

title: Very rude staff and outrageous service charge!
comment: The staff are incredibly badly trained and are almost encouraged by the management to be pretentious. The customer comes first does not apply to this bar. To add insult to injury the add a service charge whether you go to the bar or they serve you at the table. When I asked for the service charge to be removed because both times I ordered my bottles of red wine from the bar, I was given a look of death by the bar staff and told they will have to get the Manager to authorise it. Absolute joke. The venue was unaware that the reason why I went there was to potentially have a party of 25 people there for my birthday in July. That is definitely not going to happen after last nights debarkle!

title: Pretentious staff and overall a bad experience
comment: The receptionist at our hotel recommended that we had a drink at Radio Rooftop during our stay in London. We were warmly greeted by the staff downstairs, but once we got out of the lift on the tenth floor, we felt the pomposity roll over us. The whole bar is a meat market, but that's not the worst about it. All staff members I was in contact with had a very bad attitude, like they couldn't care less about me as a guest. The wine was terrible, and cost a fortune. Will NOT comeback and wouldn't recommend anyone to go to the Radio Rooftop Bar.

title: Great bar plus
comment: Pre restaurant drinks with a view absolutely great. Cocktails and sincere vino perfect. Barman right on it. Loved it

title: Great views but gets busy
comment: We went on a Friday evening so expected it to be busy, but despite this managed to get a seat outside. Views are beautiful and the bar is super cool. The staff are friendly but it can take a little while to get served but this is only because they take time and care over the drinks and so busy. But it doesn't matter as you can just stare out over London! Some of the clientele are a little snobby but there is a nice mixture of people which makes for great people watching. Drinks are a little pricey but not extortionate if you take into account the setting. Great place to go for a treat.

title: The Best Rooftop Bar in London
comment: Three of went to the Radio Rooftop Bar early evening yesterday and it was wonderful. Apart from a view to die for, the service, choice of cocktails and ambiance was faultless.  The lift up is swift and smooth, and the view down through the building itself is spectacular.  Go there!

title: Excellent
comment: Popped up here after an afternoon tea downstairs and wow. Had great atmosphere, delicious cocktails, stunning views and the staff in the whole hotel were so friendly and helpful. Can't wait to visit in summer

title: Quality! Stunning!
comment: Took my wife to lunch and from entry to getting up to the rooftop the staff are very friendly and welcoming. We had 4 dishes from the menu which were fish fingers, mini burgers, chicken wings and Sweet potato bravas. All were very good standard and left a fantastic taste in the mouth. My wife recommends the non-alcoholic cherry bomb for a drink. Apart from the wife, the best of all was the view. Outstanding! All the major building within view. Stayed for a couple of hours.

title: Swanky cocktails, great bar snacks and one of the best views in London
comment: Fantastic venue in the centre of London. You can spot every major landmark in the skyline from the covered & heated terrace. Great spot for lunch & people watching on a sunny day. The evening is busy until they close at 2am with a great vibe.

title: Great View & Atmosphere
comment: I was happy to get in without any issues after reading reviews. Reasonably priced when compared to other similar venues in London. An incredible view and a great feeling when you walk inside, staff are very kind and helpful (nursed my girlfriend back to health after one too many) The only thing I disliked was the music, I would have preferred a build up to something more lively rather than tech house throughout the night.

title: Beautiful view, shame about the staff
comment: Every year for my birthday i meet up with friends in a different venue in London, the criteria being stunning view or fabulous bar- preferably both! Over the years we have been in most of the so called posh bars in town and always been treated with respect and as if we were valued clientèle, not so at the ME hotel.  The entrance was roped off and I was interrogated to get through, I was asked if I had any other guests joining me and what their gender was? !!  Having crossed the first hurdle, we got to the lift and had to be cross examined by another minion, but this treatment was also meted out to hotel guests trying to go up to the bar. They tried to explain that they were residents, to no effect, and eventually lied and said yes they had a reservatioand gave a name. As there was nothing on her clipboard , she accepted this and let us  go up. Once up there I met up with some of my friends who had passed the entrance exam on condition we did not sit down, not even at the bar, as all areas were reserved but we could go out on terrace and look at view......yippee!  Be warned they add service to all drinks even when you're standing at the bar, it's not optional on the card readerand you have to ask them to take it off and they have to go off and reprint the bill. As you can tell this is what I did, much to the bar lady's chagrin, she asked me why i wasn't happy to pay the charge. I explained because I hadn't had "service " I replied me standing at the bar and her doing her job was not "service". If her face could have moved it would have been a picture!  Let me also add that this is the first time i have been in an establishment of this attempted calibre that didn't have a cloakroom or offer nibbles of any kind. So we stood round our pile of soggy coats and umbrellas, admired the view, looked at all the empty reserved seating areas and were studiously ignored. When one of my friends tried to get her attention to order some more drinks (20mins), she eventually came over and said she was intimidated by them staring at her as if she'd done something wrong, they were looking at her to try and get served. Fabulous  Be aware!!

title: Don't bother
comment: I called to make an enquiry for a staff event for the rooftop bar. If the way Emanuella spoke to me on the phone was any indication of service to be received we will not be booking there. She made it seem like the £60k min spend proposed was not even worth speaking to me about. No problem, we will take our money elsewhere. You work at the hotel you don't own it love.

title: Soulless
comment: After a wonderful day spent at the hand and flowers Marlow, we came back to earth with a bump here. Thoughts cocktail over looking the city would be the perfect end to our day, but sadly no. Service slow, staff no clue and drinks over priced for a cocktail that seemed short of booze. Can fault the amazing view, but many better rooftops for cocktails in London. Avoid!!

title: Amazing a must see
comment: Amazing view, great day... a must see... and once you go via the main hotel, you arrive in the rooftop bar !! Amazing Vista over London

title: Cocktail
comment: Popped in here for a pre show drink. I was the only one to have a cocktail . Very nice indeed . Prices are what you expect for London . Great views . Quite swanky inside . All though there wasn't any where to sit inside so we ended up just standing at the bar , it was ok as we weren't there for long . Nice bar .

title: Excellent pre dinner cocktail venue
comment: We had some excellent cocktails before dinner. The staff were helpful and friendly and it seemed that nothing was too diddicult.

title: Great to party
comment: Here for my mates birthday and you absolutely cannot fault this place. The views are incredible, you can see every major building on the London skyline with its panoramic views. Service is faultless with great cocktails and the Wagyu slider burgers are to die for. Best rooftop bar in London by far..get there early to avoid disappointment at the door.

title: Views make this special
comment: This would just be any other modern bar/restaurant without the view, but there is no getting away from the fact that the skyline of London is incredible and this is a great place to see it.  The clientele can sometimes seem to be a little bit... pretentious, but if you can see past that it is definitely worth a visit.

title: Fab view
comment: We went to this trendy roof top bar for cocktails. It's pricey but well worth it. The views over London are stunning We sat outside were there are heaters o keep the chill out.

title: Aafter dinner drinks
comment: We went for drinks with friends after dining at the STK restaurant. Pricey drinks which is expected with somewhere like this, but worth it for a one off experience not something you would do every weekend. The veiw from this bar is incredible and well worth a visit.

title: Ok
comment: We expected a posh and cool place, a great service, an amazing view... what we got was an amazing view and a high bill... perhaps we have simply seen too much better things before.

title: re-visited
comment: After having a dreadful first visit and having made a complaint, we re-visited this bar again and gave it a second chance. On this occasion it was a really pleasant experience. We had champagne and a few really nice bar snacks. Why can't the staff be more accommodating to their customers on a regular basis. Tis is a really good bar with views. The only conclusion we can imagine is that the their tips are obviously better coming from some of the brash city clientele

title: Nice view, poor service
comment: I love the views and the decor of this bar. This is a nice place to visit after work for drinks, however the service let it down. The bar was not extremely busy, but to get the attention of the bar staff proved difficult.

title: What a view!
comment: The view from this rooftop establishment is stunning, you could even say breathtaking. We could not get enough of it. The decor is modern, quite striking. The drinks were a bit pricey, the service competent, & the crowd lively. Expect to return for the view.

title: Ok during the day
comment: We like the bar during the day for cocktails etc (usual expensive London prices ) Great view. We went back in the evening - Music was so loud we couldn't hear what the hostess was saying - no tables- only outside (In January) but was told we could sit at the bar but was no bar stools or seating. There was plenty of empty tables with reserved on them but no-one using them. We like music but this sounded awful and too loud. We left without even having a drink - really disappointed.

title: Confrontational door staff, snobbish attitude and a rude attitude
comment: I agree fully with the majority of reviews here, unfortunately this could be a great venue that is let down by snobbish and rude staff. There are a lot better roof top bars that don't have any attitude, mainly the Queen of Hoxton, Boundary Bar, Aqua, and Sushisamba. Don't waste your money here as you you are only likely to get insulted or turned away by the door staff.

title: Excellent location
comment: We visited Radio at ME Hotel before a theatre show and it was perfect for a pre-show cocktail. Even though it's January, it was warm because there's a canopy and plenty of heaters. At 5.30 it was dark and all the lights across London were twinkling. Drinks were the usual London prices at £12.50 a cocktail but the views are well worth the visit.

title: Who do they think they are?
comment: Me and my friends arrived here on a weekday hoping to get a glimpse of London at night from one of the "best" rooftop bars in London. When we arrived we were confronted by some of the most confrontational and rude staff I have ever met. We were told our attire was not appropriate for the rooftop even though we were all smartly dressed!! The attitude of the door staff is appalling and in my 15 years of attending bars and rooftops in London this has to be my worst ever experience. I would recommend trying out rooftop bars such as Aqua and Madison instead!!

title: Rude arrogant staff! Avoid
comment: Finding the bar entrance is not easy. A helpful hotel staff member in the bar downstairs directed me to the third lift. Arriving there met with first problem. The Radio staff informed me there policy was to queue from other side (20 feet away) but I had to retrace steps through hotel and round (400 yards) as door locked. On trying door it was open to be greeted by second Radio staff member who informed me we had breached their policy. There was no queue ironically - not a single person waiting! After discussion the staff denied access! Rude, up themselves - try other bars where staff want your custom. One Aldwych greeted us with open arms!!

title: Ruined Christmas Party
comment: We visited the Radio bar for my team’s Christmas party in 2013. My team requested for 2014 that we return to the same bar, but stay longer for the evening. I booked a month in advance as is required for their terms of table booking for 9pm on 18th December 2014. Unfortunately on arrival on the evening, with no warning nor reasonable explanation the manager claimed that a couple of members of the team were intoxicated and therefore none of the party could come in. I can categorically state that whilst everyone was under the influence of alcohol, no one was drunk. To the point where the door staff even agreed with me. Interestingly the bar DOWNSTAIRS in the hotel the staff were more than happy to sell us £150 bottles of Champagne! There was no reason whatsoever for the refusal of entry to the Radio bar and I suspect that in fact the table had been given away to someone else, this totally ruined my team’s Christmas party, and we ended up going back to our hotel. Whilst the view from Radio bar was something very special, it is absolutely not worth the embarrassment or complete and utter disappointment that happened this Christmas for my team. I can assure that we will never return to the Radio rooftop bar nor any bar affiliated with the ME hotel and MELIA hotel chain.

title: Exceptional Bar, Exceptional Service
comment: Took my girlfriend skating to Somerset House and afterwards popped to Radio Rooftop Bar for a drink. The staff were exceptionally friendly and even found us a table. The drinks were exceptional, my girlfriend particularly enjoyed the Blackberry Nights, and the views breathtaking. A must visit.

title: Great evening, great view!
comment: I actually have to disagree with all of these reviews. We had booked a table for a mixed group of 12 of us for last night and we had a great night! We had a large area inside, the staff were very attentive with filling up our glasses and bringing more bottles. We had previously been informed that we had to dress smartly so there was no issue with that. I would have expected to dress up anyway to attend a bar like this.  I found the lift quite easily, I was greeted politely and set straight up in the lift where I was directed to the table with my friends. The bar was not too full as some can be this time of year. We got served quickly everytime we went to the bar, we did have table service as well.  The view outside is amazing. We actually moved to a table outside so we could enjoy the view and the staff had no issue with this. later on we were told they were closing one side of the outside and the staff found us another table round the other side. All in all we had a great night and I will be sure to come back another day!

title: Amazing views!
comment: Great bar to watch the world go by with an amazing view - spans from canary wharf round to Big Ben! Visited in December for husbands birthday - drinks and late afternoon food. Sat outside to take in amazing views - great setting to watch the world go by!  Had some warming mulled wine which had some vodkas shots in it - fair warmed us up! Would recommend for couples / groups to have drink or eat (we had Tapas food which was great) and basically just relax in great surroundings Only let down was a group of 7 year old girls arrived for a birthday party - having a group of girls screaming and running around trying to look at the views was extremely annoying. Don't mind children being there but running amok is unacceptable. Took the edge what would have been a perfectly romantic afternoon otherwise.

title: Not sure what the big deal is...
comment: It was a Monday night. A Monday night. The week of Christmas. It is hard to predict how a destination bar may be during this time. It could be rammed. It could be deserted. Media yuppies piling in fuelled with self-congratulation? Celebrities cheersing their comedy show or (soon to follow) work out DVDs? Recently ‘renovated’ WAGs on the prowl for fat wallets and magazine covers? Another rooftop bar boasting another great view of what is probably the greatest city in the world. It's like catnip to those named. Radio claims to have it all. And it did. It had all of them. We did not have a reservation but being a couple not stumbling around and just celebrating my partner's birthday, we strolled in much to my surprise. The copious amounts of ropes, clipboards and shiny black panelling is designed to give you the impression that this is exclusive. When that rope comes back, you are one of The Lucky Ones. You are one of Wonka's lucky ticket holders. Well done Charlie. You've arrived. Collect your prize. We lived in Dubai so we have seen lots of this (more on that later) so I don’t get the same buzz that I once did. I should say before going further that the staff here were nothing but polite, friendly, courteous and amusing. I reckon they see a lot of 'types' here and they deserve a medal for their perma-smile and unflappable approach. Some reviewers here appear to have had less luck.  The clientèle however ... *cough*. The media types were easily spotted across the bar with their signatory square black glasses and upmarket hipster look. The WAGs circled like malnourished buzzards waiting to feast because it's been so long since they've dined on the impressionable flesh of new money. Well-known British comedian sat in a dark (but sufficiently well-lit) corner enjoying the company of their female 'publicist'. (I'm sure that's the Daily Mail caption on the photo of them leaving.) Is it pricey? You betcha. This spectacle does not come cheap. And neither does the view. £40 for two drinks. Admittedly a cocktail and glass of champagne. Still, skyrises in London are no longer rare and - surprise - they all have bars with views. If you like Kensington Roof Gardens circa 2006 then you will probably love this place. I know I loved it back in the day. The roof terrace outside (booking essential) is novel vs some of the other aforementioned bars in big shiny buildings around London.  Would I come back here? I'm not sure why I would. Having lived in Dubai and London, there are taller buildings in both with less pretentious clientèle, better views and marginally cheaper drinks. There is clear organisation and - to be honest - less try hard fun. But for the prestige thrust upon you in the first five minutes of just trying to get to an elevator, you wouldn't know this place was something special … until you get to the view. Then the price column in the drinks menu. There’s food available too in case you can’t wait to eat spring rolls. Rooftop bars are about as rare in London as a pizza pasta restaurant now so you really need to pull something out of the bag to stand out, compete and keep the glitterati coming back time after time.  The drinks were good. The staff nice. The view is awesome. I still felt underwhelmed. Shame. If you do not live in London and you are visiting (maybe staying in the hotel which hosts Radio) then you will probably be awestruck which is great. Treat yourself to another high rise bar in London too. For perspective.

title: Terrible Business ethics
comment: We don't get out much so when we went to London with two other couples we thought we should try somewhere special. (Not boring just all parents in our late 30's/early 40's)...To be honest we planned to stop off at Dirty Martinis but it was full so we headed to Radio.  This place should be used as a case study for BAD Management.  The truly surreal experience started at the door when the lady with the clip board (who truly believed she was something special) wanted to evaluate what we looked like! didn't this sort of thing stop back in the 90's??? after 5 minutes of being looked up and down, we were escorted down a dark corridor ( fire exit entrance by its appearance) and being looked up and down by large door man with ear pieces we arrived at an elevator. I think these door staff and hosts are instructed to work in silence and make the clients fee really uncomfortable. ( this they excel at).  Now to the actual bar, lovely looking place with stunning views, but that's were it stops. The hostesses, bar staff, bouncers (which I counted 7 for a very small place, all standing around talking into their cuff links) and the randomly placed others all without fail looked us up and down as we entered. They certainly know how to make you feel welcome? The prices are step even for London and the beer was warm and served in old plastic glasses. The people in place are very special too as most just pouted and stared out across the room looking vacant, (you know the type).  The DJ was very good and set a good vibe, ruined by the air kisses/hugging and selfie taking pouters.  I am not sure who runs this place but they really need to address all the issues this place has... Time Out gives them 1 out of 10 and they don't fare much better on here. They need to listen as it appears a lot of people want to hold business meeting here without being dictated to... Its a shame as the views and location is something special.....

title: Wonderful views of London - With snobby attitude
comment: West here as a surprise drinks with some close family and friends for my birthday. The bar is very nice and simple with the wonderful skyline of London all around which is the main feature of the bar. The bar has comfortable tables inside and out on the balcony - The outside you are surrounded by London lights and kept warm with the outdoor heater flames and blankets. There is a good range of drinks and cocktails available at typical London price.  The only down fall of this place is the stuck up and snobby staff. They looked down at us and talked down to us. The staff at the lift which takes you straight up to the bar were not welcoming. Then there was the table service which works with a tab service - the waitress was very pleasant and welcoming however this soon faded when the bar got another 20 people and she seemed to be the only one running around serving all the tables and so she became less friendly. We were there early on a Sunday around 8.00pm so it wasn't as packed as i have seen it before. Someone from my table asked her for a drink and she snapped - This certainly made us leave early. Certainly a lovely bar and good location but wish the staff had better customer service - Less of the attitude,

title: Fantastic experience.
comment: We had an absolutely amazing time!  We came here on Saturday for our office Christmas party and we were pleasantly surprised!    We were shown up by a lovely girl at the entrance (Sophia), and led to our table where the rest of our party were waiting for us. We were presented to our hostess for the night (Dora) who was amazing throughout the whole evening. She was very quick with our orders, very pleasant and attentive. I never saw a frown coming from her, even when one of my colleagues accidentally knocked over a bottle to the floor causing it to smash, she just smiled and went straight to cleaning it up (However we cleaned it up ourselves because she was just so nice we couldn’t have her doing that!)   I must say before we went we had read the reviews which to be honest were not the best, especially in regards to issues with the entrance and issues with the staff being ‘rude’ and ‘pretentious’ so we were mentally prepared for the worst. From our first contact with the reservations lady to leaving the venue at 2.30am, we were treated fantastically. We always do have good Christmas parties but the fact that the venue was amazing; the food was perfection; the staff were friendly and attentive; the music was spot on and to top it off The View! This without a doubt was one of our best parties!!   I wouldn't be put off by the reviews, yes the place does have snobby people, but where in a high class place like this will you NOT find snobby people, if that is not your cup of tea then do not go BUT if you enjoy good music, good food and amazing views then THIS is the place to go! Try it before you knock it! :)

title: Quite extraordinarily bad...
comment: Myself and 3 guests had been looking forward to a 'much deserved' afternoon/evening out to end a particularly busy year - we are all company directors working within the media industry. Whilst the venue, decor and anticipated views were good, I am afraid to say that the rest was really quite extraordinarily bad! The food at the STK restaurant was just about OK, but the service was hurried and disjointed - we were left waiting on several occasions between courses and ordering drinks at the table. However we were not going to let that spoil the evening as we were looking forward to drinks at the Radio Rooftop Bar. Despite having booked in advance - we were refused entry by the attendant 'hostess', who would give us no meaningful explanation as to why we were being turned away. We returned to the main hotel reception and asked to see a manager who might be able to shed some light on the situation - and that was when things started to get sereal.  We were then introduced to the STK restaurant manager who very cordially asked if we would like a free drink at the bar in the STK restaurant while we waited for the general manager - he recognised us from the lunchtime sitting and was bemused as to why we wer not admitted to the Radio Bar.  However when the general manager arrived he explained that the reason for not being admitted to the Radio Bar it was because we were drunk - REALLY!!!! - AND IF SO WHY HAD THE RESTAURANT MANAGER DECIDED TO OFFER US ANOTHER DRINK!!!! He then told us that if we did not leave we would be escorted from the premises. Honestly in all my 20 years of working in the capital I have never experience such a bizzare level of customer service. There is however a happy ending to this story - being gentlemen who thrive in adversity we went on to have a superb evening - the great thing about London is there are choices... ...just don't choose ME London, the STK Restaurant, nor indeed the Radio Rooftop Bar (if in fact you are ever admitted)...!!!!

title: Poor service or maybe the worst one in town
comment: This place has certainly the best roof top bar in town but unfortunately the entire experience is destroyed by the time you step in.... Arrogant staff will look at you if you were lucky enough to talk to them, then they make everything complicated for you to really enjoy this place. Either you spend £1000 at a table (which I did) or £10 you will be badly treated by a poor qualified staff who sometimes cannot properly speak English. Arrogance rarely brings success on a long run in London and seeing all reviews below confirm mine!

title: Probably the worse trained staff in the world
comment: Invited for lunch at STK, which was average but looked forward to the table we had reserved at Radio Rooftop. One of the guest to lunch was slightly late and as a consequence we were late to move up to our table in Radio. We were met by a young lady who had more attitude than the whole of America. We were first told we could have our table because we were late and then later it was inferred that we had drunk too much. Having pre booked the table and spent some £600 in the restaurant, my host was mortified by the pretentiousness and rudeness by the manager . We will not be going back to this place again, and I implore anyone with any sense not to go there.  They really need to send their staff on training I think the fact that so many reviewers think the place terrible says it all.

title: PRETENTIOUS CRAP!
comment: This has to be the most pretentious and worst managed hotel bars in London. The staff are extremely rude and under trained in how to speak to their paying customers. I visited with a girlfriend last month and spent a lot of money (approx. £300 for just us 2 girls) on poor cocktails and even poorer tapas plates however undeterred I decided to give this place another go. We arrived on time for our reserved table however as it was raining outside we entered through the main hotel lobby instead of the dedicated entrance to the side of the hotel. No problem you would think as they both lead to the only designated lift to the roof top however the extremely rude girl attending the lift told us we had to leave the hotel and re-enter via the side. Bewildered, it just didn't make sense however we refused to do this as it was raining and she eventually let us in 'her' lift. To make matters worse once we arrived at the bar we were instructed to leave a credit card and given a note to read their T's&C's that there was a minimum charge per person. All this information was given to me when I made the reservation (for which they took credit card details over the phone) but to be told again by another exceptionally rude member of staff proved very embarrassing in front of my guests. To make matters worse the cocktails were over-sweetened with a nasty syrup by a pretty crap barman. The Manager came over to us and apologised for the way his staff behave however he was not much better which proves why the staff are so poorly trained. He did however provide us with a free round of 3 drinks which we left on the table and made a swift exit. We couldn't get out of this place quick enough. When we got downstairs it was still raining and I waited inside the building for my car to pick us up. There was not a sole queuing to get in this place and nobody else apart from me and the door girl by the entrance but yes, you've probably guessed again this cold, rude cow on the door insisted that I stand outside and waited. I was not blocking any doorway and I was on my own - this is obviously the normal behaviour of the staff of this place. Yes it has the views, yes its got the looks but this place needs to buck up its ideas when trying to attract paying customers. This was a Tuesday night and the place was less than half its capacity with relatively un-cool people which says it all really but it is a shame when it could be a really cool place attracting the hippest of London's society if only it was run better. Avoid at all costs!

title: Wonderful views of London skyline
comment: We went with friends who were visiting London. It was a cold,wet,windy night yet we sat outside for two hours, enjoying the wonderful view of the London skyline, thanks to the canopy and great space heaters. It's not something we would want to afford too often but for that special occasion it takes some beating. Re: some of the previous reviews, we found the service to be attentive and friendly. Perhaps it depends on how you treat them.

title: Poor Customer Service Ruined My Christmas!!!
comment: With booking made four months in advance, upon arrival we were told we would not be gaining access to the club due to a lack of female members in our party. This was never made clear during our booking, or even leading up to the time of our booking. With 5 clients to impress, this was highly embarrassing.  Whilst laboring the point with the door staff and even the manager. Large quantities of men were allowed free access, without a booking. So how is the color of their money any different? Obnoxious and aggressive door staff, without so much as an apology for their poor planning and lack of communication.  We have regularly taken clients there, spending considerable amounts of money. This will not be happening again. We managed to take our £3k bar bill elsewhere for the evening, and had a much better, welcoming even at the Baltic bar in Southwark, with staff who could not do enough for us...which i would highly recommend. Unfortunately there isn't a less than 'terrible' rating for selection. A 'terrible' rating is being kind to this place, with their pretentious clients and unfriendly staff

title: Company Christmas Party Ruined. Refused Entry Yet Pre-booked
comment: We Pre-booked our Christmas drinks complete with table reservation only to be refused on night. They were informed of who attending and in particular they confirmed in writing that all was ok. We had a client attending who had flown from Australia, and therefore was extremely hurtful and embarrassing to be refused entry. The other peculiar thing is that we have been there before and spent a significant amount without issues.  The staff gave no explanation, were very pretentious and were very rude. They just didn't care. So please, don't assume what they confirm is true. Don't have your Christmas business or social event ruined.

title: Woeful attempt at customer service
comment: I was part of a 12 person party who booked their Christmas party at the Radio Rooftop Bar. We booked about 4 months ago. In the lead up to our arrival, we confirmed our booking and also the dress code for the bar. We were told that what we had planned to wear would be more than acceptable. Upon arrival, we were greeted with a fake smile and a "one moment please" while a manager was called to the door. She informed us that unfortunately our male to female ratio was not in accordance with their entry policy, as we only had one lady with us. Incidentally, she had flown from Australia for our Christmas party which must have been a big disappointment to have this unfold. We insisted that this policy was not quoted to us during our booking. If it had been advised, we could have chosen another place to book. Why would we waste our time trying to enter otherwise? Despite our insistence, she continued to tell us how sorry she was, but that she wouldn't be able to let us in. After some mild debate and a whole lot of "policies" seemingly being made up on the spot, it became abundantly clear we wouldn't be let in. As we debated, a large queue of men in suits was forming at the door. We assumed of course that they would also be refused entry. Alas, as we walked away a little bitter and twisted, the group of men at the door was given the look up and down, and subsequently let through the door. Double standards much? Meanwhile, we were left the daunting task of finding another bar in the Strand late on a Friday night. The staff at this bar should be ashamed they work for a venue that is so exclusive that it borders on sexism. I wonder if we would have received the same treatment as a group of women? There is no space in our modern society for closed stereotypes to be applied based on your sex, let alone your appearance. Despite this dated, idiotic rule, the way the staff handled the situation was dismal. We were simply denied entry and the staff clearly had no intention of resolving it to the betterment of their customers. Although, judging by most of the other reviews here, we dodged a bullet. Thank you, Radio Rooftop Bar, for ruining our Christmas party and for gracing us with your complete incompetence in customer service.

title: One of the best views of London
comment: The bar located on top of ME hotel, great view, good ambiance and ample choice of drinks. It is great for after dinner drink occasions or prior/after theatre shows

title: Saturday night
comment: I absolutely love this place. Went out with my friend Alan and we were treated so well with by the staff. The view is amazing, the crowd aren't pretentious and the atmosphere is extremely lively! Definitely a 5 star review!

title: Evening Drink
comment: Positive  - great views over the Thames and the sights of London - Pleasant atmosphere - Very attentive waitresses, very quick to offer a drink refill and very quick to serve it Negative  - Selective door policy even when the place is half empty (can't be good for business !) - Repetitive 'dance / beat' music played by the DJ - £31 for four bottles of beer - quite pricey even for London

title: Great view, but...
comment: When we finally find how to get here (the official entrance is closed on Sunday and you have to go through the restaurant - the waitress was very helpful to show us the lift), but we were not really welcomed in the actual bar. The receptionist was just looking at us without saying anything. So we have to start conversation with greeting and asking for table for two. Then she urged us to the table and we could order the drink.  The view was beautiful and we could see Somerset house with its ice ring and London eye on the other side, but we were bit put away by the fact we were served the drinks in plastic cups! Seriously? Who would want cocktails for almost £14 in plastic cup? Why was the wine on next tables served in glass then? It's good to go for the view, but otherwise dont expect too much.

title: Highly recommended!
comment: Wow! What can I say! From the understated entrance up to the amazing layout of the radio bar this is one special place! The views across london are some of the best you will get and what better place to enjoy them than on the stylish terrace to the radio bar. I went with a group to celebrate a birthday and the venue just made it extra special, the service was slick and friendly and despite it being busy it never felt crowded -we really could not have asked for a better place to go for such a special occasion.

title: Views!!
comment: What a fantastic setting, best I've been to in London if you want to see most of the major sights in one go. And to top that a great atmosphere to be had . Will be visiting again soon without a doubt.

title: Great Bar, Stunning Views
comment: Really great bar, Situated on the 10th floor above the ME Hotel, its terrace has stunning views of London. Perfect place to spend the night...

title: Eating a bit too pricey
comment: We had lunch in the Radio rooftop bar. it has nice tapas and a magnificent view over London . But although the staff were friendly and pleasant they did not match the professionalism to which the hotel aspires. The wine was outrageously expensive and they charge a 15 per cent service charge which is really unacceptable. The temptation to cross the service charge off the bill was great. AND they then have the cheek to show a line on the bill for a gratuity! This is a hotel with just a bit too much bling!

title: Radio Bar has it all!
comment: The Radio Rooftop Bar has a fantastic choice of international tapas, we had the spicey prawns, calamari, slider burgers and goats chees crostini! as well as spectacular views of the Shard/city,London Eye, Trafalgar Square, London Bridge, Covent Garden etc. Great for cocktails too and enjoying a fab time with your friends or partner + excellent dj set/music. Quite big terrace with lots of outdoor seating with heaters provided so good all year round!

title: Rude hostess
comment: Me and my partner were planning to spend our anniversary in Radio Bar. It was heavy raining and as we reached it we were soaking wet while dealing with a rude blond hostess standing under the cover and not letting us in. As I got in a heavy rain my hairstyle was completely destroyed, however it wasn't a reason for hostess to give me judgmental look. She was unfriendly and unprofessional. She pointed out on my partners casual Lacoste shoes, arguing that it is a sportswear, which is not allowed in the venue. Despite it she asked us for ID, after checking it she ended conversation saying that entry is strictly from 21y.o. Which is not true, according to one of the managers reply to the other complaint on trip adviser, the entry is from 18 y.o. It was the rudest service I've ever experienced.

title: Check you bank statement and expect a long wait!
comment: We visited the Radio Bar on the 4th October and had a table reservation for food. The views are amazing and the place has a great vibe, however be very careful when you pay for your food or drinks!!! We found out on the 5th October that we had been charged twice by radio bar, and promptly called them to rectify the mistake.  Many phone calls later and being passed around we STILL have not been refunded the wrongly taken money of £115, and we are now in November. This is absolutely not acceptable. When you visit a bar/restaurant which is aiming to be top end and first class they should follow through this service to rectify their mistakes.  This has left us with a very negative view of this establishment and I would warn everyone to be very vigilant when paying by card here, as it is not a straight forward process to get your money back. To the bar manager, Brendan, I would like to say that while you aim to give first class customer service on the night ( we were appreciative of the free drink to smooth over the issue of finding a bottle top in my cocktail) you need to follow through when your staff have made such huge errors, and promptly refund people their money back. It is appalling to have to chase your own money and never speak to the same person about it. Sort it out Radio Bar!!!!

title: The kind of place that thinks monogrammed shirts are classy
comment: There's one good thing about this venue and that's the view, knowing this I went with my wife. We went through the hotel as I had one afternoon before, when we got to the lift we were asked if we were guests of the hotel. We weren't so we were asked to go to the main entrance of the bar and given some rough directions. We went outside to find the entrance, it turns out this is basically a fire escape with a grumpy and judgmental eastern European lady standing behind a metre of rope. Anyway, a couple of stupid questions later we were inside and making our way down some high-end service corridors, at the end of which we found the exact same girl and lift we'd initially been stood by. Laughing at the stupidity of the situation (they have got the authentic middle eastern experience nailed to a tee) we went upstairs and found a seat to admire the view. 15 minutes later with no table service materializing we left having enjoyed the view. I know from a previous visit that a 330ml bottle of mock-craft lager will set you back £6 and be served in a scuffed up plastic beaker. If you're the kind of person that thinks that skinny jeans and loafers with no socks is 'smart' and don't mind being messed about then this is the place to go!

title: Very disappointed
comment: I could not get over how rude the staff where! From front of house to the bar staff!! They where so unapproachable I was so shocked! The only member of staff that was pleasant was the manager

title: over-charged my card - customer services won't help
comment: would never go here again. I have had a dispute regarding payment. they overcharged my card by £120 which i did not realise until i checked my bank. I have tried endlessly to resolve the matter and no-one will come back to me. The only way, apparently is to go there and speak to someone.  Customer service is non-existent and i'm amazed that such a 'reputable' establishment are allowed to do this sort of thing.

title: Beautiful view
comment: My wife and I wanted to stop by for a drink but were told that it was full but we could try to get some space. In the end we were given a table that was reserved but the people hadn't yet arrived. It was good enough! The view is spectacular and worth it

title: AWFUL
comment: Can't get over how bad this place is to save time I'll try and make this quick! Booked this as birthday surprise drinks for 4 people before STK dinner which is in this hotel too. We arrive on time in pouring rain and despite a confirmation email of my booking with all the details of birthday surprise etc the hostess would not let us in as she could find no reservation. I Rummaged through my now soaking wet hand bag and showed her my print out of email exchanges with their concierge. Still standing in the rain she then wanted ID for 2 of the group which only 1 had again I showed her my email which asks about this and the bar had confirmed it was not necessary. (???) After a long haggle with most unhelpful person I've come across in a long time, she finally lets us in, by now we are all wet (she would not let us stand under cover) On arrival at the bar the staff up there much more friendly, until we needed the bill to which we were told we had not spent enough and the minimum spend is £200, please bare in mind we were there no more than 40 minutes, again I have to rummage in my bag for my email paperwork which clearly states £75 minimum spend. The manager decides to let us off with £100, by this point I can't be bothered to argue and we pay up. Down the lift we go and then get told to leave to the right???? Can't get out of there the same surly woman standing there as before and won't let me open the door to get out so we wander back to lift and are told STK is to the left...... Err which is it left or right?? What I really can't fathom is if your expecting customers to spend £200 plus would you not try to be helpful and at least friendly? Apparently not, Thank god I bought my email exchanges with me otherwise it would have been a fairly disastrous birthday surprise. I have to say I did feel very foolish and it put a real 'dampener' on what should have been a special evening. I would never return and would never recommend this to anyone.

title: Great view...
comment: Me and my partner visited here for some after dinner drinks after being to the Italian restaurant in the Melia. The view is great and the range of drinks available is good too. I wasn't too impressed with the waiting staff considering the standard of this place. A little work to do on developing their hospitality skills but otherwise, a great visit.

title: Great way to kick of my birthday!!
comment: Not only is the view amazing but having booked an area the personal waiting staff were attentive and personable. Security and management were very helpful in making sure my area was kept secure and that all my guests gained entry for the evening, even though some arrived much later than told!. The cocktails were amazing and the music was upbeat and at the right volume, I was in a group of 40+ and everyone was able to talk and interact.  Maybe one of two additional heaters outside (early Nov and it was a little nippy) but additional blankets were provided without hesitation. Nothing was too much hassle, when my guests wanted to go inside to warm up an area was provided. Amazing place with an amazing views, amazing staff (Julie, Brandon, Roland ) and amazing drinks (Shem). The bar bites of which there were many were great too. See you soon.

title: After Tea Cocktails
comment: Lovely views, buzzing place even for 4 o'clock on a Friday afternoon, great friendly service and fabulous cocktails, at the sort of prices you would expect to pay for a London Hotel (no more , no less). Would definitely like to go back there again, had a lovely vibe about it.

title: Love it!!
comment: I loved this bar! Not only did it have the most stunning views but it also had the most amazing cocktails and champagne drinks. The outdoor area, despite it being freezing was warm enough tk sit outside and relax!! A bit hefty on the price tag but worth a visit.

title: Average
comment: Bit of hunt to find the lift! If you go after 6pm... Total nightmare, you have to be on the list etc  Nice bar, friendly staff at the bar. View of Somerset house is nice. But nothing special otherwise! Yum cocktails.

title: Always a pleasure!!
comment: Radio Rooftop has got to be one of the best bars in London, the incredible view of London is the perfect backdrop to a great day/night out. I have been going to Radio since it opened and must say the combination of yummy cocktails; friendly staff and great atmosphere make it one of London’s little gems.  I recently arranged an event at Radio for a party of 10, I was extremely impressed with the organisation and the way we were taken care of by the staff. Perfect for special occasions, events or a cheeky drink after work!

title: Will never EVER return
comment: I had been looking forward to visiting this bar for some time, however I will never return. The previous comments about the awful people employed to guard the entrance are quite correct. When I visited there were three of them, one woman and two men. When I asked if the bar was full she looked me up and down and said that yes I could go up as there were spaces available but could not guarantee that my daughter who was some 10 minutes behind me would be able to get in. She also said that if my daughter was not appropriately dressed she would not be allowed in. She was on her way from work so obviously there would be no problem there. The woman obviously had been at the back of the queue when they were handing out charm and made me feel like she was doing me a massive favour.  I decided to take the risk that there would not be a stampede of guests within the next ten minutes and wait for my daughter upstairs in the bar. By the time she arrived (appropriately dressed) 15 minutes later, I had only just been served. The wait at the bar is ridiculous and when you do get served they too make you feel like they are doing you a favour. If you decide to run a bar tab, they take your credit card from you and keep it. They do not take an impression of it and hand it back to you, they keep it and give you a plastic card with a number on it. When I queried this (as I have never experienced this before) the girl behind the bar sneered at me as she explained the process. The view from the terrace is indeed very nice, although drinking from plastic glasses is definitely a let down. My daughter ordered a non-alcoholic cocktail which she said was not freshly made and tasted disgusting. My drink was equally awful with a mixer added without asking how much I wanted. This resulted was a glass full of ice and mixer and hardly any spirit. Obviously we only had one drink and decided to leave. This resulted in about a 10 minute wait to get anyone's attention before I could pay the bill. Amazingly they have the cheek to put a 15% service charge on the bill and then give you the option to add another gratuity when you use the payment terminal. Unbelievable!!! We could not wait to leave this truly awful place which is guarded by people who have never been to charm school, serviced by people who obviously feel they are doing the world a favour by working behind a bar and frequented by people who are prepared to be treated in this way just because the bar is popular at moment. We left and went to the Savoy for our pre-dinner drink where the service was as impeccable as ever and where they value your custom and treat you correctly. Avoid this dire bar at all costs.

title: Lovely afternoon
comment: I would recommend this place, but please ensure you read the terms and conditions to avoid surprises. I booked Saturday afternoon tea which is in the foyer but was mistakenly shown to the lift to the roof-top bar. No one had any idea of my booking either at the foot of the lift or upstairs in the bar, even though my name was in the system. It seems like all the venues have separate booking systems. Despite not having a reservation for the upstairs bar, the maître d assured us she would find us a table and she did after about 5 minutes and it was a great spot on the terrace in beautiful autumn sunshine. The serving staff were friendly if you were friendly with them, especially Anna! We ended up staying there drinking cocktails and prosecco and we had a lot of attention from the manager on duty. It started out badly but we ended up having a wonderful afternoon, although the dessert we ordered never arrived! I would certainly go back!!

title: Excellent View and Food and Average Drinks
comment: The view from the Rooftop is amazing and the setting perfect for a easy laid back session of Drinks. Weather permitting ( which was in my case on 27th September 14 in the afternoon), the Atmosphere was too good. The quality of finger foods ( We had Grilled Chicken portions, Tiger Prawns , Fritters, Bell peppers stuffed with cheese and Red Chillies fried with a tangy twist. ) - All were quality stuff. There was a complaint that the drinks need to improve as far as the proportion of alcohol goes, there was more ice and lime and less vodka. I offcourse had Cider Beer which was fairly fresh and refreshing. We did not eat lunch there, as we had booked the Italian restaurant on the ground floor, the food there being outstanding and the chefs very helpful, involved and enthusiastic.

title: Really enjoyed the view
comment: Felt a bit like Vegas. Not cheap but worth the effort. I can see the posh vibe could be off putting, but since I was staying at the hotel I just rolled up to the elevator like I belonged and had no issue. Bartenders where friendly enough, poured strong drinks, and meet some very friendly people - which as an American, I didn't find elsewhere.

title: Ok good vibe
comment: Vibe was good but a little disappointed with the service maybe because it was busy and there were not many staff on we were left feeling a tad dry around the gills so we left early and frequented another bar shame cos I liked the vibe

title: Great view great cocktails
comment: Really nice bar with some good music, but it's the tables outside that are outstanding with an amazing view, lots of space and a good vibe. The cocktails are immense and the meat platter is great!! Thoroughly recommend this for Friday drinks!  If you want to continue the party the in house DJ wasn't bad either! Only gripe would be some of the patrons are a little air headed. ;)

title: Bar with rooftop terrace and GREAT views
comment: The Radio Rooftop Bar has a great choice of international tapas as well as spectacular views of the London Eye, Trafalgar Square, London Bridge, Covent Garden... Great for cocktails and enjoying a nice time with your friends/partner + good music. Quite big terrace with lots of seating. If you see there is a queue outside it most likely will not be because they can't fit more people upstairs; if the bouncers tell you to wait for 30mins I'd recommend having a drink in the ground floor lobby of the hotel while you are waiting -and as soon you can go up someone will tell you- as instead of waiting outside standing to get in.

title: Great drink but Ridiculous entrance policy
comment: The Bar itself is great. The view is amazing and the mixologists make really good cocktails. the problem is the sheer effort to get into it. I have tried almost 4 times over this year to get in, being successful on my 5th. i understand that the door policy makes the place more appealing but honesty (you're not right, clothing, gender/look of group) would be more appreciated then saying they are capacity and then letting people in straight after. That experience takes away from one in the bar!

title: Beware cheack your bank accounts!
comment: Visited the Radio Bar, On checking my bank account I realised I had been charged twice for the same drinks! I called the hotel who said they would refund my money within five days. Seven days later still no refund! So called the ME back today and after over forty minutes of been passed around and having the phone put down on me by the finance department! And also being told by the Radio Bar staff this has been happing a lot worrying ! Six hours latter still waiting for a manager to call me back!!! I have also contacted trading standards.

title: Jack R - Very Hospitable
comment: I was invited to the leaving drinks of a singer/songwriter friend of mine called Anusha Nava. The first thing that struck me was the welcoming and professional attitude of the door staff. In particular the wonderful customer service and hospitable nature of the door girl called Melanie. Melanie greeted us with a friendly and courteous manner and made sure that her staff took us personally to the table of our friend Anusha. In addition, once we were at our table, all the food and drink were brought to our table with a smile by the waiters and waitresses and it was all delicious. I will be visiting again very soon and very often. Thank you.

title: Not sure if I went to a different place than reviewers below?
comment: I visited Radio Rooftop bar last night with three clients/friends for cocktails and some food. I'm not sure whether the staff have been told to be more friendly following bad reviews, but they could not do enough for us. Super attentive, friendly, happy to make recommendations and very quick efficient service.  Beautiful bar and views, fantastic cocktails, great food and lovely staff. Definitely at the pricier end of the scale but perfect for special occasions or smarter drinks.

title: Radio bar don't go
comment: We pre booked corporate drinks at the Radio Rooftop Bar but were left standing at the door for 20 minutes because half of our party weren't women. We eventually got in but frankly it was embarrassing being refused entry when we had pre-booked; and being spoken to in this way was disgusting. We were also sober, well behaved and all of a mature age. I'm not sure if it is legal to discriminate in this way, but in any event I will never go back there and wouldn't recommend the place. There are plenty of better venues in London. Other than that the rooftop bar was fine, nothing special though, and the waitresses pleasant and helpful.

title: Good place but very snooty door staff
comment: I really enjoyed my time here and had a great time. the views are amazing cocktails good and the bar has a fun and friendly atmosphere. However I would say beware of the snooty lady at the door who does everything in her power to make you feel like she is doing you a favour letting you in so you can spend your hard earned cash. She is quite rude to be honest but once you get past her its actual a nice place.

title: Fir coat, no knickers
comment: As I walked out onto the terrace I was totally blown away by the view, it's stunning, but it all went down hill from then. Firstly they don't sell cigars, how crazy is that, beautiful new terrace, smoking allowed, beautiful Friday afternoon and no cigars. Then we ordered two whisky and sodas and they arrived in a huge PLASTIC container, who on earth serves ten year old scotch in a swanky place like this in horrible scratched plastic 'glasses'? Then without asking they had poured half a pint of soda on top and drowned the scotch. If you want to see and be seen here, be sure to book a table and make sure you are very specific how you ask for your drink to be served, even if it is in a plastic (Yuk) glass.

title: Fab view. Overpriced food & drinks. Pushy service.
comment: OK, just, if you want somewhere for a short while sitting outside above the mayhem of London.  The outside seating is fairly comfortable, spaced well around a glass room that reminded me of an airport lounge, and filled mostly with corporate types and tourists.  Quite tasty but very pricey tapas-style food in tapas-size portions to go with very pricey wine – the prices certainly not reflecting either the quality of the wine or the dish ingredients. Decent enough cocktails, but then, at the price, they jolly well should be.  Service is friendly enough (for this you pay 15% extra on top of the already exorbitant prices) but so very efficient that you feel that they’re practically forcing alcohol down your neck so they can ramp up the bill by replenishing your order at breakneck speed. Way too pushy. You virtually have to beat them away if you don’t like the intrusions of having your drinks refilled, or of being asked if you’d like another drink, before your glass is anywhere near empty. Going to the bathroom is a disconcerting fun-fair experience. If you’ve been sitting outside on a sunny day, before entering the near pitch-blackness, best you allow ample time for your eyes to acclimatise lest you won’t be able to see the floor let alone find the lavatory. Thinking about it as I write, the fact that I enjoyed a couple of hours here was down almost entirely to the company I was in, with the view providing a nice backdrop. Only the view has saved my overall rating from being anything less than average. Considering the cost, the food, drinks and service (for which there are no rating buttons here) would drag it below this.

title: Love Radio!
comment: Firstly i will admit it can be a little pretentious, but its London and a 5* hotel bar so its to be expected. Been few times now over past summer and always a nice vibe, especially around sunset, the view is beautiful.

title: Great cocktails with a view
comment: Called in here around 4.30 on a Friday and despite having no reservation, we were admitted and got a table. I've been here before a few times, but had 5 friends with me who had not... Everyone loved it and loved the cocktails. Staff are really friendly and helpful.

title: Great Panorama
comment: A lively, active bar with fabulous views over London and excellent service. Good simple tapas, interesting cocktails, though disappointing Marguerita; far too sour!

title: Face control at the door but worth it if you can get in!
comment: This bar is surprisingly difficult to get into as this is an extremely try-hard place and pretty popular so they can choose to be snooty and selective. They won't let you in if you are badly dressed or in a large group of lads and there is usually a queue. They try and hire a lot of tables out so they will often try and get you to pay a minimum spend of around £100 per head for table service on a weekend evening which isn't too bad. I have walked in several times without a table reservation and got in but it can be harder at the weekend. The bar itself does look like a bit of an airport lounge but I do like the open, angular style and the views are spectacular. Would be a good place to impress a date, but also good for singles as there are lots of attractive single people here too!

title: A celebration!!
comment: We celebrated with champagne here after our wedding in the West End. We booked a table that had a minimum spend attached to it which is fair enough as you visit this bar in particular for its views over London and they are in demand. Our waitress and the manager were very good and the service was attentive. I can see why some of the negative views are perceived. The entrance could be made to look much more welcoming as it is very stark. Maybe some flowers there and pictures on the wall? The lady at the lift could also be much more welcoming as you sort of stand there and wait to be ushered in. Overall we very much enjoyed our visit so don't let the above turn you off, my comments are just suggestions for the management. Views are spectacular!! We would definitely go again

title: Great views, but very unwelcoming
comment: Myself, my mum, her friend and her 3 daughters arrived at Radio Bar on Friday after having been for a delightful afternoon tea. We were having a nice girly day and just looking for some cocktails to round off what had been a very pleasant afternoon.  Upon arrival, just before 4pm, we were getting in the lift to go up to the roof when the member of staff stopped one of my friends and asked her how old she was. She told her she was 19 at which point the woman looked at her watch and in a very sarcastic way rolling her eyes she responded "hmmmm... Hmmmmm" before telling us that there are no under 21s allowed in the bar after 5. I understand that a rule is a rule, but there was no need for such rudeness and making us feel so unwelcome. We were only after one drink!! We eventually reached the actual bar only to be left standing for 10 minutes before anyone even noticing out presence and showing us to a table inside - the empty terrace wasn't open until 5.  The best thing about the bar was the views when we ventured out to the terrace for a peek and the cocktail was actually really lovely.  If you are stuck up and condescending, you will fit right in here, as that really is the best way I describe the staff. A very disappointing experience.

title: Best rooftop in London
comment: Best views of London, based in Heart of London in Strand, touching Covent Garden, just by the Somerset House. Cocktails are the best same as all experience.

title: Worth a stay
comment: Make sure you have a reservation - I recommend to go there, when the weather is good and then enjoy ...; nice to take a break there

title: Panoramic views of London but rude Staff except for Shopay!
comment: This location & venue in itself is absolutely stunning & certainly provides the greatest views of London, however, with the exception of Shopay, whom is charm personified & an extremely polite & professional Bar a Tender, the Staff are dreadful in terms of the very snooty, rude & arrogant attitude they portray! I have been here several times since January & it's the exact same every time, so my most recent experience wasn't just an "off day!" Prices are steep, but hey it's central London & given the views it's most definitely worth paying a premium, although be warned, no matter how much you spend, throughout the afternoon, they ruthlessly & unceremoniously evict you from your seat to accommodate Guests whom have reserved tables circa 18.00 onwards. Such eviction is executed in a very abrupt, discourteous manner which is just terrible customer-service & extremely unfair, particularly since their approach very much seems to be "like it or lump it!"

title: Amazing venue
