comment: I took my lady for night out to radio bar. It was amazing experience. Special thanks to security Mohammed Aziz with his amazing hospitality and service. Very friendly and helpful

title: Terrible Shocking.
comment: Very Rude staffs include door man, cliff board women and waitress. Treat guest like garbage, over price , and nt particular crazy amazing place compare to lots of other places in eu or asia but this typical london roof top bar , charge ppl for bucks but very poor quality.

title: Fantastic bar!
comment: First time at radio rooftop and we will definitely be back! Fabulous views and the service is second to none especially David who was super attentive and was a fantastic host!

title: Really great atmosphere. David is a top man!
comment: A bit apprehensive, visiting Radio rooftop due to negative reviews. However my cousin and I were pleasantly surprised at the warm welcome we received on arrival, by Melanie at the main entrance. We had a lovely Italian guy called David serve us and he was great, very friendly, attentive and welcoming. I'd go back just for David! He really looked after us, nothing was too much to ask. The decor is nice but the best part are the views. If you're looking for somewhere cool to chill and have a nice drink, Radio is the place. Contrary to others' experiences at this bar, ours was very pleasant and we'd definitely go back. Thank you David!

title: Excellent service and ambience
comment: Had drinks here after a friend arranged it. The view is amazing and the service is impeccable. Try to get the Italian dude David who seemed to be watching the table as he made sure my drink was replenished before I realised I needed it.

title: Fabulous lunch with a view
comment: Had a wonderful lunch here today on the outside terrace. Was a bit worried about previous reviews regarding slow service especially as we had children with us, however we found the service today very friendly and attentive.  The tapas were well presented and delicious. Would definitely recommend it as a lunch venue.

title: Great views
comment: We went here for drinks on what should have been a sunny August afternoon but was in fact wet. There are awnings which cover the outdoor seating and the service is very good. Would like to visit when the sun shines. A bit of the beaten track so it wasn't too busy.

title: Live the Dream
comment: Fantastic views over London, delicious Cocktails, chilled tunes, what's not to love about this place?

title: Great views
comment: We only came for a bottle of champers, was a nice day, we were lucky to get a table outside and the views were amazing, and a nice set up. The ladies toilets ( when you can work your way past the door) are a bit nuts - too dark, everyone inside was moaning but not a complaint as such, was quite funny actually....great place though ( the roof bar not the toilets :) .

title: Great view, vile staff
comment: Brilliant bar, great cocktails and a beautiful view. Time after time my experience has been ruined at this bar by their revolting door and bar staff. Take one look at the guests and if they don't think you are rich enough you are declined entry even when the bar is way under full capacity. Bar staff have no manners. Management just as bad. Having been a regular guest at this bar, I don't think I would return purely down to the staff.

title: Great bar, poor staff
comment: Been here a few times now with clients. Location great, views great, bar great, however, the security and the welcoming hosts are awful. I won't go into masses of detail, but on two separate occasions, they've been very arrogant, flippant, unaccommodating and just plain rude. It's a shame, cos it spoils what is a great bar, & excellent, polite bar staff. Take a hint from the guys at Aqua!

title: Great Bar, Great Bar Staff ... BUT!!!!!!
comment: Beware of the goon show…  Tuesday was our 25th Wedding anniversary, my wife and I decided to take a trip into London with our family to celebrate. We arrived at the Radio Bar circa 4.00 pm (meeting our 22 year old daughter and partner there). We arrived with our 17 year old son and were greeted at the lift (via the hotel lobby). Lovely warm welcome by the lady at the lift entrance and on our arrival in the bar. The following 2 hours were great. Superb bar with amazing staff – really attentive, friendly and helpful. At around 6.00 pm I received a call from our third child – he was about to arrive. Given he had not been to the bar before I thought it easier to pop down and meet him in the lobby. Which is where the evening took a very different turn. I meet my 20 year old son (who was smartly dressed) and tried to return to the bar using the lift that I had come down in. The security guard informed me bluntly that I could not use the open lift and had to exit the hotel to use another entrance. I explained that I had been in the bar for 2 hours, that my family were still there and that I had come down in that lift 2 minutes before. In an aggressive manner he informed me that he had not seen me use the lift (mainly due to being engrossed in what appeared to be a flirting with a colleague working the lift area). I informed him this was ridiculous but realised he was now performing in the alpha male role to impress the young lady. As we turned the corner outside the hotel heading towards the side entrance it was apparent that the next security guard was in radio communication with the first. The first thing he did was ask for my sons ID – which he produced. We were told that he couldn’t come in as he wasn’t 21. I explained that we had been there for 2 hours, my family still upstairs, I had a tab running, etc. The guard became aggressive and told me that it was policy not to let anyone in under 21. When I mentioned that my 17 year old son was already in the bar he started chatting to the other guard on the radio. I was becoming increasingly annoyed at this point. I am a respectable middle aged man and in no way a trouble maker, my family are well educated presentable young adults – all we wanted was a nice start to the evening. I again asked that I be let up to the Bar – at which point the guard became incredibly rude and aggressive body language – informing me that “I bet you are used to giving it the big’un and getting your own way all the time” along with other expressions that I would have expected at a low end night club in the early hours of the morning. I told him I had a tab running – at which point he told me that my son still couldn’t come in. He was quickly escalating in his aggression so I called my wife and asked her and the rest of my family to leave.  I went to hotel reception asking to speak with a manager and was told that they had nothing to do with the bar.  I have been in contact with the Hotel today and heard nothing. The way in which the security people behaved was nothing short of disgraceful and is so completely out of line with the environment that the owners have clearly worked hard (and invested) in. Great bar, great bar staff… if you get past Dastadly and Muttley.

title: Stayed at hotel 'Me' and the bar was recommended
comment: This has got to be the worst bar I have ever visited!! 5/08/2014  The poor experience started once we arrived at the lift and was greeted by the signage for the Radio bar which was barley still attached to the wall. Once we stepped into the lift we had to listen to the host complaining about how bored she was and how she couldn't wait to finish her hosting shift. We then arrived at the floor and walked into total mayhem as there was clearly no manager present who was running the place and subsequently we wasn't seated, advised or directed to the bar. Once at the bar we had to wait 20 minutes before anyone even acknowledged us. Considering there were 6 members of staff behind the bar, they seemed more interested in talking between themselves then actually providing any service. Once we finally got served I ordered a gin and tonic with the bar lady she walked off and came back with a pint of tonic water and ice cubes and the gin was clear drowned in the glass!!! there was not question of preference to which gin I would like or how much tonic.. slim line or normal.... To top this off my drink was served in a large dirty plastic pint pot and for this drink I was provided with, I received a charge of £25. This place has great potential but I can say delivers on none. This totally spoilt what was a great hotel experience!! 5* it is not, I wouldn't even give it 1*. I could rant about this endlessly and I would highly recommended that you don't visit this bar as you also will be disappointed.  This was a birthday treat and I ended up feeling rather embarrassed  Say no more!!

title: Great Experience
comment: "Julie looked after my party perfectly and everyone had a great experience, the staff were v. helpful, the cocktails were served regularly and everyone got in no problems.”

title: Dreadful Service with some lovely views over London.
comment: We had a reservation, but were told they couldn't find our name on the guest list and refused to let us in. We called our friends from the bar upstairs and they came and spoke to the doorman who only let half of our guests into the bar stating it is very busy upstairs and can only accommodate half of our guests. How awful! This was made worse when we witnessed a couple with no reservation being let thought after bribing the door staff. Once at the top of the bar, the views were amazing and the cocktails are delicious ranging from £10-15. The venue is a great place to hang out with some awesome music. Expect to pay an automatic a 15 % service charge without you knowing from some rude and arrogant staff members. I would have expected better from a 5 star!

title: Fantastic Views, atrocious service
comment: Went for an afternoon tea slot in the Marconi lounge downstairs, beautiful and amazing service, at just under £70, pricey, almost justified.  Went to Radio Bar for the 2nd time, well before the rush, (only 4pm) and told to wait even though so many unreserved tables empty. Finally let through, got a table, made to get a tab after waiting 20mins to be served.  Ordered 2 cocktails, nice. Wanted to order a 2nd round, waitresses rude, flutter around ignoring everyone. Went to bar myself to buy more cocktails, meanwhile my sister had moved to better table with more of a view.  To my disgust, a 15% service charge added to the bill even though I got it from the bar myself. £28.75 for 2 cocktails, which were mediocre this time and nothing like the first round.  Shared our table with 2 other ladies who were struggling to find seats or be seated. They left soon after getting their own drinks.  Soon after, waitresses started throwing socialising guests from tables mid-drinks, the tables were now magically "reserved," you guessed right, we were turfed off next.  So the tab cost another £28.75 for our first 2 drinks including another 15% service charge!  SO almost £60 out of pocket, rude and ridiculous lack of service, all for a great view!  Go once for the view, never again.

title: Amazing views, fabulous venue...completely let down by the service!
comment: With some of the most spectacular views around, this should be the MUST GO recommendation for roof top cocktails in London. However the service really does let the place down and my experience seems to be in line with many other reviews, whereby we were shown to an unreserved table on arrival and then left waiting around 15-20 minutes. When we did decide to go to the bar ourselves, were redirected back to the table and told that someone who be over to take our drinks order. Ten minutes later and without so much as an hello, we were finally served! There was no return to see if we needed a top up, so decided to take our business else where...after another long wait for the bill! L.E

title: Loved it!
comment: I Googled what rooftop bar was best in London and this is where it said to go. It was a beautiful sunny day and the view from the top was amazing. We spent a couple of hours here just people watching. We didn't think it was that expensive as some people have said, at the end of the day you are paying for the location and you really can't be anywhere better in London!

title: Ricardo: a Reason to Return
comment: After a long day, we collected at Radio Bar for some delectable tapas and drinks we had heard so much about. Woe betide us: to our great dismay the kitchen had closed and the renowned chef retired for the evening. Ravenous, we pleaded with our waiter Ricardo, for some food. Ricardo: his eyes like the deep crystal waters of the Caribbean; his skin like the caramel undertones of a delectable nougat. He kindly offered to rustle together what he could from the kitchen, resulting in a sweet, sumptuous melange of flavours orchestrated together in a symphony of fruit. Our rumbling bellies desisted almost instantly. We shall return, without a shadow of a doubt.

title: Rude and Obnoxious Staff & Security
comment: I have been to and reviewed the Radio Rooftop Bar before and could not understand the reviews that stated people had received poor service. However, after last nights episode I now can! I was meeting some friends in town for a drink and something to eat. They were waiting for me in the bar and had spoken to the Manageress to make sure that I would be able to get up just after 6pm. She agreed. At 18:05 I arrived at the lift in the hotel to be told by the 'host' that I would not be allowed up without a reservation. I was also told that I could not stand by the lift as this area was for hotel guests only! I phoned my friend who spoke to the manageress who then denied agreeing to let me up saying that was a long time ago. Finally she agreed so I went back to the lift. Before I could even finish my sentence the 'host' told me that I would not be allowed in. A member of security then walked right up to me, only a couple of inches away from my face, and said that I could not be in this area. Why not? There are three lifts and one says 'Radio Bar'. Obviously the custom of their hotel guests is more important than that of the guests that do not stay with them. As suggested, I walked around the side of the building to the other entrance. Again I was greeted by two rude security guards and another rude 'host'. Again I was told I would not be let in. After a third time of calling my friend I was finally allowed entry.  I am appalled at how rude, unfriendly and obnoxious the staff at the Radio Bar and the Me Hotel are. Clearly customer service does not exist. And after reading the below reviews with comments from the Management Company saying that they are always looking at ways of viewing customer service, clearly they are either being too slow or just saying it to try and appease customers.  For those of you that do read this review, I really would recommend that you stay away from here, unless you want to be in the presence of extremely rude staff and security.  I shall not be returning to this venue and would even go as far as saying that is one of most unpleasant experiences of customer service that I have had in a Central London Bar.

title: The biggest disappointment in Aldwych
comment: Perched atop the ME hotel on Aldwych, Radio Bar offers a beautiful view of the Eye and the neighbouring buildings. Yet apart from the view, the Radio Bar has very little going for itself. Drinks are more expensive than Boundary in Shoreditch or than Aqua on Regents Staff is impatient at best and the seating plan makes for a easily cramped place.  Such a shame for that the view truly is a rare sight in central!

title: Fab view and atmosphere
comment: Wonderful location for a Birthday celebration. Attentive staff and a great atmosphere. The weather helped, but the view is brilliant.

title: Views and ambiance to die for!
comment: One of the gems in London, Radio Rooftop Bar is a place where you can have a nice chilled evening enjoying yourself with a few mates (be sure to have a few ladies in the mix!) and take in the surrounding views. The music, normally orchestrated by resident house DJ Jez Pereira (http://www.youtube.com/jezpereira) is great to say the least, with a progressive house feel. The drinks and food on offer are also commendable. If you're wanting to go, be sure to call and place yourself on a list as walk-ins are a no go.

title: Great view
comment: This could be a great bar too but the arrogant, rude staff need to have some customer service training. They act like they are doing you a favour when they do get around to serving you! We sat at an unreserved table as we were requested to do so on arriving and after going to the bar ourselves, having been ignored when asking the waitress for service, we were then told the table was reserved. There was nowhere else at all to sit either inside or outside and we would not have stayed had we known we did not have seating beforehand. The place is rather a shambles and I am very surprised by the other reviews. I really do think the automatic service charge of 15% is very unacceptable in a sub-standard bar like this.

title: The best bar in London!
comment: Quite a bold statement to make but it's a superb bar! I have visited several times, the views are stunning (English weather permitting!) and the staff are always friendly/unpretentious. The cocktails menu is well worth spending some time working through(!) and the tapas style food menu is lovely (tip: try the chorizo). I don't quite understand some of the negative reviews on here as I have never had anything less than a great experience on each visit. It's a popular bar, particularly on an evening when the sun is out, and that means it's going to get busy and therefore might take a while to get in.....but it's always worth the wait. If you're in London and fancy a rooftop bar, this place should be at the top of your list!

title: wife's birthday
comment: visited Radio bar yesterday 3/8/14....it has a true wow factor !! this has to be london's best kept secret, i had been searching for somewhere different in london to arrange a surprise 40th birthday get together for a few of my wife's friends and family (our age range was 25 to 65), radio came highly recommended from a frequent patron so i checked it out and bingo......just what i was looking for, somewhere different to go. the view is just the best, you can literally see every landmark in london, i have been up the shard which was great, but somehow radio is better because you are not so high up and you just feel like you are part of london, like you can reach out and touch them all !! we were very well looked after by Ludovica and Monika who made my wife feel like a million dollars, and that's what i wanted. did it cost a fair bit? yes, but when you go to somewhere like this what do you expect, it's not poundland, i wouldn't want the running costs, there is no better place i can think of to enjoy great drinks and food, with a fantastic vibe, whilst watching the best city in the world !!

title: Gorgeous views of London
comment: I've been here a couple of times as it's around the corner from work. During the week days the queue can be heaving so turning up on a Saturday was a pleasant straight walk inside. It is spectacular and it's lovely to take someone there that admires the views.   As all the seats are taken, you're on a high alert for the next available seat though we stood next to the bar and watched cocktails being made, including our own. These do not come cheap, not much change from £30 for two cocktails, so we made these last. You definitely feel that you need to dress up, to be approved less you get kicked out! So it's quite a posey place which might make some people feel uncomfortable. But if you love fine views, it's definitely worth taking a look. Otherwise, if it's pouring rain, head down to the ground floor and order drinks there, it's much more laid back. Try and check out the hotel reception area on the first floor, as it has an amazing atrium and starkness that is different to any hotel I've been to.

title: Nice but under underwhelming
comment: Having just returned from the ME hotel in Ibiza, they may want to take some service advice from their sister roof top bar. More staff, ie. more than one bar tender! We went to radio bar sat 09-08. 2.30 table reserved. Contrary to other reviews found the staff welcoming and friendly - might be the difference between weekend and weekdays. Was not too busy at 2.30, however, we still had to wait about 15 mins for 2 cocktails. We then ordered a bottle of champagne and they seemed to loose the order and we eventually got it after about 25 mins. It seemed to get really busy about 4pm and then it all seemed to go a bit haywire. Service became very slow. We were suddenly told we would have to vacate the table. We had not been informed at time of booking or on arrival. Considering we were onto our second bottle of champagne and only half way through they did not offer to find us another table although we did get a 30 min warning. Without wishing to sound demanding if they looked after us we would probably have stayed longer and spent more money but I don't think that this is their priority as currently this is one of the places to go and be seen and hence they have the choice of patronage.  All that being said it is a nice place to go and has one of the best rooftop bar views in London. Order drinks in enough time, ie. before you finish the previous one and enjoy the people watching and the view.

title: Fantastic view and great staff
comment: This must be the number one place for views in London. A must for any visit to the city. The staff are friendly and professional but the drinks are a little expensive.

title: Great views. Extortionate prices. Just 'ok'.
comment: I get you're paying for the views - which are amazing - but my partner ordered a glass of red which cost £12. The same bottle is £12.99 at the supermarket. And it wasn't a particularly special wine. We don't mind paying extra for something nice at dinner but not a supermarket red.  Food is tapas and nice enough but again very expensive for what you get.  They're also a bit weird about drinks - you can just order them to be added to your food bill, you have to give a card and start a tab - almost like they think you'll do a runner.  All in all, decent enough experience but place thinks a bit too much of itself and treats you like it's the cool kid at school and you should feel lucky to be there. Great for showing tourists the view but we won't be making it a regular haunt.

title: Great cocktails, beautiful views
comment: We loved this rooftop bar. Very trendy, great cocktails, beautiful views. A must try are those mini pork sliders – yes, they're not cheap but they're delicious! We had a pre-dinner cocktail every night before heading out to dinner while we were in London and we were not disappointed. Particularly gorgeous on a hot summer day out on the balcony. When it's busy you might have to work hard to get the bartender's attention, but it’s worth it in the end

title: Inappropriate service charge
comment: After waiting patiently at the bar for 20 minutes & being passed over by other customers, we ordered two cocktails at £12.50 each. With my £25 in hand I was asked for £28.50. When I questioned it I was told the extra was for service. To my reply "what service?" The barman said it was up to me. Not very happy. However, the cocktails were great & the venue brilliant

title: Great views and well looked after
comment: i think this is one of the best venues in London. The views are stunning and the venue is well designed. It gets busy on the door as you would expect from a popular venue. The bar staff are really quick on the whole and make great cocktails. The last time we went, we ordered everything on the food menu and thoroughly enjoyed it. The team really look after you and it's number 1 destination whenever friends and business contacts come into town.

title: Amazing views
comment: I must say when I made a reservation for my works summer party the venue did not disappoint. Spectacular views of London and lucky for us the weather was perfect. In regards to value for money as it was on the company it did not bother me however worth bringing someone special just for the views. The food was tasty especially the prawns and the service was good. Only issue was there was a fire alarm that went off and we wasted an hour and when letting people back in they should have given first priority to the ones who had tables reserved. I can assure I was not the only one complaining. However definitely worth a trip to the 10th floor.

title: Great views, good service!
comment: Every time I have been to radio rooftop they have always been polite, quick service, friendly and the atmosphere is amazing, when the suns out it's the ideal place to be!

title: Rude, surly, pretentious and arrogant staff who look down their nose at patrons
comment: We arrived at 1pm on a sunny Saturday to be whisked up the lift to Radio bar. When we have previously visited there has been someone greet and seat guests so we hovered for a while waiting to catch someone's eye. In fact the staff - particularly a dark haired man who looked mediterranean - actively ignored us when we tried to ask if we could seat ourselves. After sitting ourselves down we waited a VERY long time to be served - fortunately by a man in a blue shirt who I suspect was a manager as he wasn't in black like the rest. He was friendly but couldn't make up for the attitude of the rest of the staff or the very slow service. We eventually wanted to pay and leave and couldn't even get someone to take our money - I ended up leaving cash (WITHOUT the 15% service charge - what servce?? - they automatically add on) and walking out with my friends. The view is lovely but not worth being treated like you should be grateful to be there by surly staff whilst being rinsed for hugely overpriced drinks. The fact that one of the only roof terrace bars in London was not very full on one of the sunniest and warmest day of the year speaks volumes - people are voting with their feet. If the staff here think they're 'smart' they should try spenging time with waiters and bar staff in truly great establishments like Claridges where service is unpretentious, attentive and incredibly professional. Emperors new clothes anyone?

title: Roof top terrace
comment: Great location, pity they have changed their menu to just tapas. Worked out £2 per prawn, £1.50 per ham croquette, best value meat platter, lunch with just 3 platters plus bread and 2 bottles wine £140. Bring back the club sandwich and French fries!

title: Great visit
comment: We had such a great time. We were served by Ricardo he was very helpful and the best waiter which we ever had. Thanks from Aneta and Octavia.

title: Good views but awful service
comment: We went here as a group of about 10 after a conference- we had booked a table at about 9am in the morning- we just requested a table, not knowing they would give us one inside on one of London's hottest days! When booking the lady didn't ask inside or out and we didn't know to ask having never been. The outside area is smaller than one would think and the inside area feels like an airport membership lounge! If you go you will know what I mean!! Now on to the service which is potentially the worst I have ever had in London- we ordered first round of drinks after hunting down a waitress to say we were ready to order- then once ordered the drinks took forever to come! By the time they came we were gasping so guzzled them down- stupid idea as then no one came to see if we wanted any more- despite a waitress walking past and looking at our table at least 5 times. We then also ended up going to entrance desk to ask for bill as waited too long! Also for somewhere that according to the host- the person who takes you up and down in the lift- only wants select visitors, they haven't got select staff- not only poor service but also our male colleagues didn't know where to look at the entrance desk as the lady behind the counter was wearing a dress that was see through without a bra!

title: Great place
comment: Went here for drinks and had to write a review. Great bar, great view, great atmosphere and great staff, especially Davide who was excellent at looking after our group and keeping the drinks flowing! Would highly recommend!

title: Don't believe the hype
comment: had a couple of bottles of wine with a friend here on Thursday and have to say, the wine was nice enough although certainly not worth half what they changed us for them! It's just such a shame that you are made to feel like you owe them for being there! Should I be grateful to all the rude staff that I was graced with they're presence? Having been such an inconvenience as to have asked for the wifi code four times, I decide to ask for the bill (over £160 for a couple of mediocre bottles of wine and a plate of chips). JUST DONT BOTHER AS THERE ARE BETTER VIEWS IN LONDON!

title: Amazing Views - Amazing Cocktails
comment: Attended here on a Friday early evening with the girls - lucky one of us knew you had to guest list or we would not have got in ..amazing views over london's skyline, lovely seating areas inside and out...we had not booked a table but asked on arrival and the staff found us one for the few hours we wanted - as the table was not booked out till later - Cocktails were amazing - at times service was a little slow but the bar was busy - but worth the wait !! would really recommend a must !! and will be returning !!!

title: Summer views of London
comment: This place is a must for drinks on a summer evening in London. Never eaten but the food has always looked good. Staff can seem a bit "stuffy" but it has been voted in the top 7 rooftop bars in the world. Watching the sun drop over the city is stunning from this place.

title: Outstanding views and service, thank you Mr Mike Haydon!
comment: Having read some of the reviews about the Radio bar, I was slightly apprehensive about holding my birthday drinks here for about twenty friends. This was completely unfounded, and my entire party had an absolutely fantastic time. The service on a Saturday night was flawless; we had some champagne on our table, the staff constantly came over checking whether any of my party required a top up. The quality of the drinks and cocktails were outstanding and comprehensive, as was the very chilled lounge type atmosphere. The highlight of this bar is of course its fantastic views, which are simply breathtaking.  I would definitely recommend making a reservation in advance, as understandably this bar is very popular and it also avoids disappointment in gaining entry; the reservation team [Katerina and Niklas] is incredibly friendly and responsive, and despite a number of last minute requests to change my reservation time and party size were very accommodating.  I would highly recommend this true gem of a bar in London and would like to thank the entire Radio bar team for ensuring my evening was perfect. I cannot wait to return!

title: We 😍 The Radio Bar
comment: Good morning !!!    I hope you are all well. Just a note to say thank you to "team radio" and "team reservations".    We had a great time last night and the first timers at the radio( richard i and party) loved it. We had the wonderful Roberto looking after us in the cabana and the always amazing Grazia popping over to make sure we were ok with her infectious smile and personality.    We ❤️ the radio and everyone in the team.    Have a great day and thank you all so much.

title: Radio bar is by far my favourite venue this summer!
comment: Booked a party of 40 last week and had an all round excellent experience. Stunning view, exceptional tapas, plenty of bubbles and exceptional service. Nora who looked after us all evening made the night run like clockwork for me as host. Her attention to detail and proactive nature really impressed me and meant I could just sit back and really enjoy the evening. Very special place and I highly recommend it.

title: One of my best nights of 2014
comment: Had a fantastic evening at Radio earlier this month - the weather was fantastic meaning the view from the balcony was the best London has to offer. We were treated very well by the staff and both cocktails and food were very tasty. A great time had by all!

title: Stunning Views, Delicious Cocktails, Tasty Food & Awesome Tunes
comment: We had THE most fantastic evening at the Radio Rooftop Bar last week. Bathed in the (very rare!) beautiful summer sunshine we spent the evening gazing out at the incredible view over London, drinking totally delicious cocktails served by smiley, patient and helpful waitresses. The food plates that kept wafting by were too tempting so we decided to order a selection for ourselves and what a good move that was! Absolutely delicious selection of little tapas dishes which were just ideal for an evening like this, especially when with a group of people. The music was also worth a mention too. Not sure how often she's there but there was a wicked girl DJ'ing some fantastic music which really was the icing on the cake of a totally brilliant evening.  I'm also keen to mention in response to some of the other reviews that I read below that although I agree that the girl on the door was not the friendliest of sorts, I wouldn't want her job for anything. The arrogance and rudeness that she had to deal with from some of the potential clientele in the short while that we were waiting, had to be seen to be believed. Really. The same for the staff upstairs. I honestly don't know how they keep their cool. Perhaps that's the downside of a place that's got so much going for it but if you can blinker out some of the more unpleasant arrogant attitudes knocking around amongst your fellow drinkers, then it really is the most wonderful place to spend an evening and I couldn't personally recommend it more highly.

title: Amazing views and great bar
comment: Visited Radio Rooftop Bar for the first time last Thursday and it was fantastic. The views of central London are spectacular. The staff were friendly and helpful. Tried a selection of food which was delicious. Probably had too many of the large gin and tonics but they were perfect on a hot summer's evening! Would definitely recommend to others and will definitely be returning.

title: Fantastic!
comment: Our experience at Radio really couldn't have been better. Beautiful drinks, delicious food, faultless service and one of the best views in London. Perfect for groups of friends, colleagues or for a date. This really is the only place you need to know about for a stylish evening out in London.

title: This place is unmissable!
comment: I went to this bar a couple of weeks ago when I was over in London on vacation. It is truly memorable. The view is breath taking, the drinks are great (and huge) and most importantly the service is exemplary - knowledgable, friendly and charming. I would highly recommend a visit.

title: Awesome view, very good tapas
comment: Great place to watch the sunset. Drinks are good and the food even better. The two times I have been there were nice DJs playing. The atmosphere in general is very good.

title: Best bar in London
comment: Went to Radio for the second time last Thursday and after what was a brilliant first experience, the second one was even better and I felt I just had to write about it. Food was delicious, there is a fantastic and varied drinks menu and the staff are brilliant and efficient. If you want a view of London, this is where to get it - a definite "must-do" in this fine city. Great music aswell.

title: How would Radio compare to Vista (rooftop benchmark)
comment: Had high hopes of my first visit to Radio (reviews had been glowing) But experience was disappointing Can only drink/eat on balcony if booked a table (all these reserved by up themselves corporate types) So only option was to sit at bar (could do this anywhere) Drink options boring, staff okay, toilets far too dark (so had to be careful where you aimed and who you spoke to) This new bar won't take me away from Vista, which is far more straightforward and welcoming I'll wait for next challenger to The Trafalgar Hotel

title: Radio bar dreadful.
comment: I took a client to the radio bar. What a big mistake! Plastic glasses and they refused to open half the outdoor bar despite being a really hot day. Computer says no! The option from the pretentious idiot on the reception was one set of four chairs - Indoors! Overpriced and overblown. Don't go there until they sorry there attitude out.

title: Expensive, pretensious, poor service... Worth only the view!
comment: This place is crazy. It is seriously expensive (£24 for a glass of champagne), and full of poseurs, wannabes and hookers. We came here for an office summer party and had booked an outdoor terrace area, but the bar staff had difficulty on remembering who ordered what and brought (and charged) whatever they thought we had ordered. Only come here if you have a high pretensious scale and deep pockets! Don't come here if you are looking for mixologists who know how to make a good cocktail or for good food....

title: Amazing birthday dinner
comment: Firstly let me say that the service was excellent.  Our waiter Ricardo was fantastic. Had great recommendations and was extremely attentive. I was taken here for a birthday dinner by my girlfriend and it was an incredible experience.  Hadn't heard of this place beforehand but I certainly would recommend it to anyone! June (I hope that's her name) the manager was also very nice and really friendly!  The views are amazing and we were treated (by accident) to kelis performing live next door. Can't wait to go back again! It is pricey but you can't expect any less from a bar this good in such a location!  Thanks Radio (esp Ricardo!)

title: Simply dreadful but nice staff
comment: Not sure where to start! We came with clients who were thinking of a group booking and we stayed for one drink and left. At 4pm probably half of the place was reserved, the few tables that were left were full and we had one of the last few. The outdoor space was half full and the remaining half wouldn't be opened till 6 with no sensible explanation. Indoors we were served with plastic beakers! Apparently this is because someone threw a glass off thd balcony so we were told! Classy place!  Lovely staff but all style and no substance.

title: Spectacular view; food and drinks good. Pricey
comment: It is expensive. And you have to spend £50/ head to sit outside, but as the maitre d' said, "you won't have any trouble doing that!" I wouldn't queue so we did book. Our waiter was pleasant but some of them were reminiscent of the hipsters that care more for their appearance than your enjoyment. Clientele is mixed. Special occasions, office parties. Expensive but not exclusive. More flashy. Worth a visit if money's no object.

title: Birthday drinks ruined
comment: I decided to visit radio rooftop for my birthday after coming here a few times during the day. However this was the first time I had decided to visit in the evening. I arrived at around 8pm (on a Saturday) to a small queue with a few friends. As we approached the bouncer and the lady with a clip board the mam whispered to the lady (not realising we could hear) "not sure? Shall we tell them it's full" the lady didn't answer but asked us how many there were to which we told them 3 girls and another 2 to come. We gave her my other friends names and went up. Already slightly offended that we were almost turned away purely for how we look (We were dressed nicely) 10 minutes later my friend who's name was on the door was denied entry by the same rude bouncer. He wouldn't give any reason as to why. She called me so I came down. He was very rude and said in so many words, who asked you. My friend was so upset she left and went home. I saw another friend walking up so I waited by the rope. The bouncer then said "move, stand over there". I was so put out by his rudeness I was shocked. Later we ordered peppers stuffed with cheese which was vile. Then went to the bar to pay for our bill (because no one served us at our table) and we're greeted by the second rude gentleman of the evening, the barman. We asked to split the bill 5 ways and he told me "he was too busy and had other people to serve. And that we had to pay on one card" we did in the end because he pretty much refused otherwise. My friend and I spent over £200 on drinks yet we still got treated like we were drinking tap water. I doubt I will be returning here. Day or night.

title: Pretentious staff
comment: I really don't need a barman looking at me when I ordered a Stawberry Daiquiri, asking me if I realised it wasn't a slushy as though I was some sort of inferior peasant that had no place in the Radio Rooftop Bar really pretentious and offensive. Shame it's a beautiful venue!

title: Very bad experience
comment: We had a very bad experience. This place might also has an amzing view but they should change immediately their managers. The "door manager" doesn't really know how to do his job. He let get in people with flip flops and white shoes and if you are well dressed in a trendy way he doesnt let you in because for him you are "too casual"!!! Ahahahah. Really?? please. Also, the door manager and his supervisor were very rude with my friends and my syster. Very bad experience.

title: Fab, fab, fab!!
comment: We booked for a table on a Friday afternoon, georgous, sunny day for a rooftop meal on the 10th floor of the Melia hotel. Amazing views of the city, lovely fresh tapas and good service! The manager came around on two occasions and we were so impressed by the good service and general attitude. Sometimes London eateries get a bad press but this place is like a breath of fresh air. Very good prices considering all the factors. Would absolutely return. Do make sure that you book and request a terrace table.

title: Poor customer service and horendous clientele.
comment: The place itself is nice. The bar is well decorated and the view over London is pleasant, especially on a summer's evening. That is about all that can be said about Radio Rooftop Bar.  On entry, we were greeted by a woman who had a natural unfriendliness about her, not to worry, we thought, not everybody is born with a cheerful disposition. We informed her that we wanted to have a drink to which she inquired if we'd like a table, naturally, we said yes. She then informed us, in a very matter-of-fact manner, that a table would require a £100 minimum spend per person. We just wanted a casual drink for an hour or so, spending an arm, a leg, and maybe some kidney, wasn't in our plan. When she was met with our shock, a shock which she obviously could not understand, she just simply reiterated the fact and told us that that was how it was.  Now I understand that bar policy isn't decided by the front of bar woman, or whoever she was, but her attitude left me in amazement. When we, once again, said we just wanted a simple drink, she instructed that we could have a drink at the bar, in a way, that said "you're obviously too poor to be here.". I seriously did not appreciate being spoken to in this way, especially when I have come to spend money in the establishment in which she works. I don't feel the need to talk down to any one, even if they are serving me, I therefore do not tolerate being spoken to in such manner, especially when I'm paying for a service. Anyway that was that. The cocktails were ok. Nothing to ring home about. The people there are awful. Just a bunch of women hungry for men, who are all too happy about their appetite, and then some couples trying to live the highlife, instagram-ing their every cocktail.  Thank you, Rooftop Bar, we won't be back.

title: Superb view, excellent location
comment: Visited Radio Rooftop Bar and was really amazed with views and sunset over London- excellent. Nice music, good atmosphere, but... was expecting more from bar & service- very pricy cocktails with poor presentation- you would expect more from such a ''posh'' place. If you don't have a reservation, you could end up waiting in queue for hours. But to make one, ther's 50,-£ minimum spend per person.. Otherwise- a ''must visit'' bar in London.

title: Nouveu Riche crap
comment: A colleague of mine stayed at the ME hotel a week ago and recommended this bar to me. My girlfriend and I found ourselves with a few hours to spare yesterday so went up to the bar and my god it was pretentious. at 4 in the afternoon the entrance had 2 people with clipboards and ear pieces (think wanna be secret agents) we were asked if we had a reservation, we didnt but were let in after the door staff looking us up and down as if we had rolled in out of a gutter (we were both dressed for dinner so were up to standard of even the fussiest of restaurants) there is a separate lift for the rooftop bar which has another person in to ask if you have a reservation. you then get to the top, another up and down look and asked if you a reservation by another person.  anyway with all the dirty looks and MI6 agents i was expecting something rather special and I was very let down, we were shown to a table outside to look over the menus and left for over 15 minutes before we asked someone to take our order. apparently the person who looks like a waiter had to go and get a waiter. 5 minutes later a waitress appears to take our order. after ordering a bottle of champagne the waitress clearly changes her opinion of us and decides to actually give us some service. the champagne came out and one glass was dirty so she had to go back and get another which really should happen. The service was pretty dreadful although the view was nice this place is really poor. It wants to be a high end champagne bar but poor service, door staff who think theyre better than the customers who are there and over priced drinks make me think this is a dreadful spot. I would avoid this place at all costs. The cherry on the cake was being charged a 15% (for admittedly already very over priced champagne) compulsory service charge and then when you pay by card asking if you would like to leave a tip. yes I would, close this horrible place down youre embarassing yourself.

title: Nice when no young kids allowed
comment: We were regulars at this rooftop bar and just recently on a Saturday night there was a fight and everyone was told to leave. We left a bottle of champagne that we were not allowed to drink because of this. We noticed that the crowd has changed and it's full of very young kids which is probably why there was trouble. Also it's such a big deal trying to get up to the roof bar with the queuing and when you want to book a table you are told you have to spend some ridiculous amount of money per person (hundreds of £'s). It's such a shame as we did like it here with the great views of London but we won't be going back, there are many more bars to drink in London.

title: Nice View shame about the service
comment: This looks like it should be a really nice bar, the seating area is good and the views over London are great.  It had a somewhat mixed and young crowd. A few men with expense accounts accompanied by their nieces! a sprinkling of 18th Birthday's and a few completely hammered individuals who had hung around after work. I am trying to be polite and but it felt a bit sad and rather pretentious. There is a good range of cocktails but you would not want to be thirsty as it took over 25 minutes for our first order to arrive, prices are as you would expect cocktail between £12.50 and £13.50, it does serve food but bowls of chips seemed to be the most popular.  Nice to visit but many much nicer bars in London.

title: Do yourself a favour ...... AVOID
comment: Working / Visitign London you have a lot of choices of rooftop venues. Coq d Argent, Queen of Hoxton, Heron Tower are all better than this shambles. Firstly theu want £100 minimum spend person, Secondly the security is laughable and made to make you feel not welcome or somewhat thankful that they let you in. I had a group of 8 -10 booked and they let half the group upstairs 3 girls 2 blokes and refused entry for the other half. 4 blokes 1 girl saying they needed to be a mixed group. We tried expaling the other half had already entered but nope, the stoodge on the door did listen. We ended up leaving having spen £126. Things is they dont care. So avoid, dont be thankful it aint that great and after the excessive security measures it normally half full anyway. Spend your money elsewhere.

title: Fabulous experience at Radio Rooftop Bar
comment: My friends and I have visited this bar twice in the last couple of weeks - each time we have had a fantastic experience. Both times we have been lucky enough to be seated outside on the balcony (late Saturday afternoons) with fantastic views. Our Cocktails ranged from £12.50 - £13.50 which in the centre of London with great views I consider to be very reasonable. We found the staff very helpful and would like to thank Julie for her help and assistance. I would recommend this venue.

title: Great views - average bar
comment: Radio cannot be criticised for its views of London. They are fantastic. You get views across the City, Somerset house and Big Ben. It really is gorgeous on a summers night. You appreciate how beautiful London is.  However this place is seriously let down by its clientele. It's a fashionable venue, so you are always going to get the posers who enjoy flashing the cash, especially in London. But it really does spoil the atmosphere as they are mostly interested in looking around to see who's looking at them.  It's also London prices with an uplift (due to the rooftop views one assumes). Two G&T's set us back over £25. We ordered at the bar so there wasn't even a service charge added. But you are there for the views so you don't mind really.  The Interior was minimal chic and it works, you feel as if you are in a New York or Vegas bar.  I would recommend going once for the views and the experience. We are glad we went, if not just for the entertaining clientele!

title: Shameful
comment: We got married on Saturday at Chelsea Town Hall. It was beautiful. As we came out onto the steps after the ceramony strangers shouted their congratulations, the Taxi driver actually rounded our charge down. Lunch at Petrus with our family was incredible. Drinks in the bar, 5th floor Harvey Nichols lovely. Then we arrived at Radio roof top bar. We were residents at the hotel and had booked an outside table a month previously. I told them it was to celebrate our wedding along with our family - 5 daughters and their boyfriends, the oldest being 33 and the youngest 20. They stipulated a minimum spend of £150 per person to reserve the table for the whole evening. Ok, so you get the picture. We were treated horrendously by the staff from the moment we tried to enter the lift. They are aggressive. When 2 of the boyfriends arrived early they were told there was no such booking, when the rest of us arrived they suddenly decided that 20 is too young and when they ID'd they two youngest they insisted they were 18! I complained. Silly me. Condescending, rude service with dirty looks and snide comments all round. The worst was when one of the girls asked a member of the male door staff to take a picture he said "go **** yourself"!!!!!! I could pick him out of a line up if required. I am horrified. It was our wedding day, they had my credit card number, we could not leave all that credit. We stayed and although we asked for regular print outs of the credit so far this was given verbally. We did enjoy ourselves as there was no way these people were going to spoil it for us and as a family we always have fun. If the Me Hotel were mine I would distance myself from whoever runs the dispicable Radio roof top bar immediately as they are in danger of ruining the reputation of the whole hotel. They have already done that for us.

title: Lovely views. Shame about the service!
comment: I decided to celebrate my birthday at Radio Bar, well I couldn't have been more disappointed. We had a reservation for 3-5pm, it was 3.25 before we received our first drink. Our waitress was clueless about the drink menu and what was in the cocktails. I would definitely say go elsewhere, there are much better bars in London with much better service and price. Staff very unfriendly.

title: Great View at a Price
comment: I do love roof top bars and this is a spectacular one, quite a few outside tables when the weather is fine hard to think of a better place to be. The drinks are good and a decent size. So the downside you do have to run a bit of a gauntlet to get in, certainly not the most welcoming of bars. Service is slow but at these prices perhaps you should be grateful! The bar does seem to be populated by the beautiful people who are there to be seen.

title: A drink with a view
comment: Booked a table here for four and was told the minimum spend would be £50.00 as we had booked before 9pm. They offer drinks and tapas. The views are amazing and luckily we had our table overlooking the riverside, ask for this side as the view is better. All acceptable nothing great the music was a bit loud so tricky for conversations. Food and drink acceptable. One annoying point was the guests from inside the bar would come out and have a cigarette right where you were sitting and eating. I was so surprised at how many selfish smoker and actually how many smokers they had there I thought we had all cut down on smoking but not here I'm guessing 1 in 3 people smoked. So if you are very anti-smoking don't go. All in all okay but as we have made it our mission to visit as many rooftop bars as possible in London I don't think I would return here.

title: Great views
comment: First time in this place. Seemed quite "posh" at first glance. Lovely view of London and plenty places to seat outside while protected under a canopy with heaters. A fight broke out...bouncers not very good at pacifying the situation.  15 minutes later bar was closed. ..all present were invited to leave...not very courteously either...via the only lift...or stairs.

title: Disgusting Treatment
comment: When we got to the front of the queue, we were informed by the lady with the clipboard that we would def get in but it'd be a looong wait of 15/20 mins!! Her definition of long should have been the hint that we wouldn't get in!! After 25 mins the lady informs us that because we are a large party (of a whooping no of 3!!) she'll let the couple in behind us first. When I suggested that my 2 friends could go in and I'd wait she said that I wasn't listening to her and that I was being rude!! Needless to say, she let in the couple behind us, ignored us for 5 mins then informed us that she wouldn't let us in due to my rudeness when she was trying to be helpful! If we'd known to dress in as little as possible with 3 inch heels, maybe we would have got in...can't figure out on what grounds we were discriminated on! If only we'd read the reviews on timeout and tripadvisor beforehand...we would not have wasted our precious time! To be treated so unjustly is shocking and disgusting..hope she sleeps soundly with all her blatant lies and self importance.

title: A view to Die for !!
comment: I would like to say that I have been to all the top bars around the world. By far this tops them all. The views are fantastic and all the waiting staff look like they have just come out of the Vogue magazine. What impresses me most is the exclusivity of the venue. Ignore the previous messages with regards to staff being rude. Every time I have been there they have been more than accommodating especially the Radio Bar manager Julie who made sure our needs were catered for to an impeccable standard. If you get a chance book the Octagon Suite of the ME hotel as it leads directly onto the roof terrace of the Radio Bar.

title: The venue doesn't warrant the attitude
comment: We had booked this a month in advance, as requested and the minimum spend to reserve an area is £50 per head, which, being London, isn't horrendous for the view. On arrival, we were questioned as to whether we were REALLY on the guest list at the door, then the same by an incredibly haughty lift person (you work in a lift love, get over yourself!) and then again when we reached our floor. A little overkill if I'm honest and incredibly annoying, as when we got in, while it's nice, the decor and cleanliness of the place (the floor being particularly bad) is nothing special, although the view is lovely. Service was pretty decent and the food, a mixture of tapas was lovely, however, we had to request they wipe down the table before our food arrived as it was quite dirty and it did begin to rain quite heavily and we were in an area that wasn't covered. We were informed that there was nowhere else for us to sit. They made quite a big deal out of finding a new area for us and had an issue when we asked that the minimum spend be lifted, as why would we stay? As for the attitude regarding people's attire, given that many people there were staying in the hotel anyway, they certainly weren't dressed up. Saw quite a few football tops and trainers, that would never have made it passed the front door! As I was with friends, our treatment was quite amusing to us, however, if I'd brought clients, I would have been mortified. Can't say I'd recommend, as there are many other places in London with just as good views...

title: Nice one!
comment: I was in London for the day on business and after our meetings thought it would be rather splendid to spend some time in the capital for dinner and drinks. The weather was beautiful and we decided to go for drinks to somewhere with a view of the city. And the Radio Bar certainly hit the spot! We had made no prior reservations and on approaching the bar entrance at the side of the ME Hotel we were met with a black roped off area with two doormen and girl with a guest list. I immediately thought........mmm..........however I explained that we had made no reservation but would love to have some drinks. We were promptly escorted inside and to the lift - very darkly lit area but fine. On arriving at the Bar again I thought...........mmm..............all the outside tables were reserved and it was VERY busy! However, we were kindly given a 'reserved' table unitl 7pm - nice one! The cocktails were perfecto and we also enjoyed a nice bottle of red Malbec. In addition to the views being amazing over the city I really liked this place! The ladies are very dimly lit and one of my colleagues walked into the bathroom wall because of this - it did make us chuckle! Overall - very good and I wil be back!

title: The most pretentious bar ever
comment: I have been in a lot of bars in big city's and every city has a bar like this. The staff are rude and impertinent. Although I have never been treated with such distain by nothing more than a glorified waitress. It has an amazing view if you can see over the fat cats and big Essex hair. The service charge is a joke when you collect you own drinks. There are many other roof top bars in london. Pick any one of the others! Don't go here!

title: I would give zero stars if I were able
comment: I wish I would have read these reviews before I went to Radio Rooftop bar. This place is unlike anywhere I have ever experienced. The staff at the door (where you have to queue as if you're going into a club!) are very rude. The front of house staff are even worse - unsmiling and pretentious. The minimum £50 per person spend is a joke and frankly I am annoyed I agreed to it.  The tapas is OK but very expensive for what you get. The only good thing is the view, which is amazing.  If you don't want to get ripped off and want good friendly service - do not go here!!

title: AVOID: BAD SERVICE AND VERY EXPENSIVE FOR A VIEW!
comment: I have been to most of the rooftop bars in London (Paramount/Sushi Samba/Aqua) and although I am happy to be paying for a great view and atmosphere I am not happy to pay for bad service and incompetent waitresses. We boooked a table for 3 girls on a Fri night and when we arrived we gave our credit card for the £50 p/p min spend. When we were shown our table it was in a crap area in the shade where 90% of the other tables were in the sunshine. When we ordered drinks, the waiter couldn't understand why we werent given a tab so spent ages trying to sort that out. Lots of confussion with 3 separate waitresses coming over. This place is basically TOWIE meets MARBELLA with a lot of pretentious attitude around. We only had our table for 3 hours and I came from there £85 lighter (15% service charge) and would not come here again.

title: Great view but really not worth the queues!
comment: The view is great but unless you're lucky and get in easily, it's really not worth queuing for. The irritatingly trendy crowd, slow service and queues at the lift mean we won't be back.

title: Possibly the worst experience in London
comment: The place came recommended through the internet. personal experience was the worst, starting with overzealous (Guards) not ushers. They INSTRUCT patrons on what shoes to wear, where to stand, where to queue and what button on the elevator to press. That entry experience killed everything else behind it. Plenty of other places similar in nature. Would not go again for sure.

title: Biggest rip-off in London. Avoid. Underhand charges
comment: Went there the other night to experience a rooftop view in London. 1st up half the bar - the side with the good views was closed off for a private function, but there were no more than 20 people there. On the other side, every outdoor table had a reserved sign on it. we quickly worked out that they are there just so the staff can decide who sits where. Ordered a white wine £9, and a bottle of corona, £6.50. Now I don't mind paying a bit more for drinks to drink in a nice bar, but when the barman proceeded to pour my corona into a plastic glass, which was warm by the way and drop a lime into it, I was losing patience. Paid the very rude man and returned to my friends. It was only then that I checked my change and thought I had been done. No, my friends said check your receipt and sure enough there was a FIFTEEN % service change. - For ordering my own drinks at the bar. What a joke. The next time, I ordered I asked my server to remove the service charge to which she made a song and dance about it and said she would have to get her manager to remove it and then she proceeded to serve someone else and leave me stagnating there like a tool. Eventually, with no manager present, the original bargirl went to the till, and removed the charge that she originally said she couldn't.  To sum up, this is an extremely rude, bar with some lovely views of London skyscape, that charges 15% service charge on everything and makes a a big song and dance about it if you ask to have it removed. I would be very suspicious of the positive reviews here, or else they came from people who weren't paying or have any interaction with the staff. Will definitely not be returning or recommending this place to anyone.

title: Don't Bother!!
comment: Had to try this bar as I had heard so many bad reviews, I almost felt it can't be that bad. Trust me it is! Unlike lots of others we did get in without too much fuss but it was early Saturday lunchtime. There are more places you cannot sit than sit. Outside was full with people basically looking at the not so nice London skyline (it is not New York or Hong Kong) and scaffolding but I understand when the sun is shining it is o.k. It is very pretentious with the staff uncomfortably dressed and charging you a service charge even when you go to the bar and order the drinks yourself. We left after one drink. Apparently it is one of those places that is fashionable at the moment but it won't last unless the staff have some training and they change their policies of making people spending money feel uncomfortable.

title: Definitely go! View is spectacular
comment: Came here for a bottle of Prosecco with my Mum on Thursday afternoon. Wasn't busy, everyone was really helpful from the receptionist in lobby to all the waiters and waitresses - we both loved everything! Don't drink too much though as the ladies was a bit disorientating (you'll know what I mean!) - view is unbeatable. Be prepared to spend £45 + service charge for a bottle of Prosecco although the tapas dishes weren't too pricey (can't say if they were good or not as we didn't have them)

title: Where is the service?
comment: After half hour at the counter we decided to have a sit and after another half an hour we been served. The drinks arrived in 20min, nothing special but for the price of each one( around 13 pounds) they were served in plastic glasses full of scratches. Once we asked for the bill we had to nicely wait for another 30 min. We asked not to be charged with the service, as we didnt get any, but the waitress seemed like she didnt hear anything. We didnt want to wait for longer after almost 2 hours in there so we just pais the bill with the modest service charge of 15%. Honestly we'll never be back and I highly recommend to anyone who wants to have nice drinks and better service

title: Not worth the humiliation of being screened for entry.
comment: Uncertain why there is a requirement for two door staff, New York style. Both were condescending and rude. They blocked our entry and told us the tables were all reserved, we said we would stand at the bar and they retorted that the bar was very busy and so the staff would not have time to serve us! Great start. We insisted and were reluctantly allowed past with some scowling expressions from the staff. The way they looked us up and down made us feel like low life; we are professional people and were dressed very smartly for an evening at the theatre. The bar was not busy but the terrace was for a private party and guarded by bouncers who would not let us even approach the windows to try and get a glimpse of the view. Drinks were very expensive and the bar staff bored and unsmiling, although appeared attentive enough to some of the more flamboyant customers! Clearly we did not fit the bill and sorry that we paid for the humiliation. Try some customer service training.

title: Strange but 'ok'
comment: So it's a Sunday afternoon, I wanted to treat my partner to a nice tapas, few drinks, good setting and a sophisticated afternoon. On arrival the first impressions were good although the youth club style welcome was a little strange. No problem getting a table on the terrace in the sun with drinks quickly ordered. Lacking in atmosphere but my in good company I thought the initial experience was ok. But... That is all it remained. The venue lacks personality and the staff are a little lack lustre. The bar design is a bit dated and has missed the boat slightly. I am a regular at oxo tower which although also a bit dated, far exceeds on atmosphere and service. Radio rooftop seems to pretend to want to be a sophisticated venue but actually all it provides is a half hearted approach to what could be a fantastic venue. I'm sure on a Friday or Saturday night the bar could be slightly more exciting but there are certainly better venues to be had. Ok if you want a no hassle but. I frills venue but certainly nothing special or to live up to the much hyped description. Certainly a venue for the "ok I know somewhere" on the 'run out of options list'. I was sitting there and decided to book and go to Asia de Cuba at St Martins Lane.

title: TO BE CONSIDER
comment: We booked a table on Saturday at 11 I arrived me and other girl venue looks amazing service was good but they kept my dad and my brother from 23:00 until 23:55 for no reason I asked a security upstaira and the hostess what's the problem,so they radio down  stairs for few times but still the door girl doesn't wanna let them,until a french manager went downstairs and brought them up as I was about to leave the place,the manager was so nice and when I asked my dad what was the problem? apparently a black girl on door her name is Melanie  asked my dad to look her if he wants to come in, my dad refused and says why would I look after you if I already have a table???? She just refused and ask the security to ignore them...  It's a loss as it's nice place with horrible staff Nina

title: Beautiful settings but the customer service is SHOCKING!
comment: I went there for lunch with some of my clients... towards the end we ordered another round of drinks however we were still waiting after 30 minutes. I asked one of the waitresses whether our drinks were ready- this was her exact words "I didn't serve you so don't ask me!!" and she just walked away. I asked for the manager and she started defending her staff and telling me that I am making a complaint because I've had too many drinks... that was it for me! I cleared the bill (over £1,200) and left. The owners need to replace the whole management team ASAP!  I don't think it was just me... I saw at least 2 other people complaining about the service.

title: Terrible service. Don't waste your money for a view.
comment: The Sunday afternoon strict door policy is slightly unnecessary. Great views but the door lady's stuck up attitude leaves you agitated rather than happy to be heading up for a drink. TERRIBLE staff, from manager to waitresses to barmen. It's the kind of place that is set out to make you feel lucky if you get the drink you ordered....and it calls itself a bar! You are judged from the minute you walk in right to the end.  Perhaps the pretentious selfie-obsessed crowd that frequents this place actually likes awful service, mediocre over priced drinks and the battle to find a seat. Each to their own. Personally, I like to get what I pay for....

title: Great views
comment: After having a lovely dinner at Stk, which is also part of Me London, went up to Radio Rooftop Bar. Great views of London lit up at night would recommend a visit.

title: Great service & views
comment: Popped in here last Friday. Is a great cocktail bar, and service was good. Took a while to get the drinks, but expect that if they're decent cocktails. View is the best thing here though!

title: The best thing is the view
comment: Reserved a table for eight after a big lunch. Had to guarantee a minimum spend per person to reserve one, it was not a problem to exceed this! The views from here a spectacular, we were there on a beautiful sunny day and it made it a great location sitting outside on big sofa's. We also ordered some tapas that was okay, nothing special though. My only niggle would be the service, not bad just mediocre, it should be far better in a establishment like this.

title: Nice place, arrogant staff.
comment: The place is spectacular with sights, drinks are tasty. However its hard to get waitresses attention and get served. I constantly go to radio, been there on my birthday too last week, the girl serving us was very moody, no smile, would forget our orders as well. Service is a let down.

title: Loved it
comment: Amazing time....loved it esp the view ambience & service had a wonderful time with my best friend overseeing london, sipping wine, savouring the wonderful memories....memories which are priceless which money cant buy as for everything else there is mastercard which I do have and did use here and happy to come here again it is one of my favourties in london! i come here every month at least once

title: Bar
comment: Had drinks here for first time.  great staff who are swift and amazing cocktail selection.  Spectacular views across London.  Only problem is clientele are less interested in the venue and more interested in using this place as a viewing tower.  Not what one expects, so maybe more emphasis should be put on vetting at the door?

title: Strange vibe
comment: Popped in here for a drink with friends but left thirsty as apparently we became invisible to waiting staff when we crossed the threshold. Spectacular views and spectacularly rude dead-eyed staff. What a shame.

title: Wonderful Sunday afternoon at ME Radio bar
comment: As a lover of bars and hospitality industries, want to send a huge <thank you> to all members of staff for a great evening. My girlfriend and I we had a lovely anniversary at Radio Rooftop Bar. see you again soon. KM

title: rooftop tapas and vinho
comment: We came across this rooftop tapas bar by chance and had not booked. However the staff were so very helpful and found us a table . Even though quite a cold evening the outside heaters made it still quite comfortable with lovely outside comfy furniture. The prawns were delicious , but the lamb was a little disappointing. Certainly somewhere we will return to when visiting London again.

title: Spend time and money.
comment: No doubt this is fine if you have all day to wait for a drink, and don't mind the prices. I would say pretentious if I could spell it.  For the money I would expect better. Much better. Waiting more than 15 minutes for a drink is tiresome when you want one. If I go again I'll bulk order! The waitress was very pleasant.

title: Not what I expected..
comment: I am pretty disappointed to acknowledge I am not the only one who experienced poor service at the Radio Rooftop bar. Such a famous rooftop bar should pay more attention to customer care!  I visited the Radio Rooftop kind of a month ago as recommended by a friend of mine. Honestly.. a let down. The host at the door was ice cold. Not even a smile. Great start!  He walked us though the venue and found us a little table outdoor (best tables/sofas empty but reserved - oh yes, I'll defo reserve if there'll ever be a second time!), but did not get us the menu. We had to ask twice and wait 15 minutes in order to get two. I would understand if it was busy but.. indoor was empty, terrace was not even full. Ok, let's move on. We had two glasses of wine, Banfi, excellent and reasonably priced, along with some small bites. Like... small.  All in all: nice views, good wine list, bad bad service.

title: Great night !
comment: We went to radio last saturday and were greeted by a blond lady with a clipboard. She was really nice and very professional and I can imagine It must be really difficult to deal with that many people throughout the night and I noticed some guests being really rude to her and to the security! Once upstairs at the bar, we had amazing time, the view is amazing and staff were great even though they were really busy. We stayed for most of the night and I would highly recommend the place, we will be back soon!

title: Surprised !
comment: After reading so many bad reviews, I was really skeptical to visit this place. We had a table reserve with my work colleagues so I said why not. At the entrance, I was welcomed by security guard and door host Camille. My reservation was checked and then I was directed to the lift. Upstairs was an another welcoming host and she took us to our table. Waitress was really friendly I think spanish. We had great time, only the food should have bigger portions. Everything was great! I will definitely come back my experiences were great! T.

title: Stylish, beautiful but service is poor when busy
comment: Went here last night with friends for a couple of drinks. I have been to this bar before, purely because of the roof top & the views. Sun was shining, so it was very busy and progressively getting so throughout the night as the offices closed and the beautiful people poured in. This gave the bar a great buzzing atmosphere but unfortunately there are enough staff to cope with the crowds or have the experience in the level of customer service a bar like that needs. We were drinking white wine - its arrived room temperature, which means with wasn't stored in a cooler, so it would be 45 mins before we could drink it. W had to point this out 3 times to waitress as she insisted on luring us warm wine. Finally a cooler arrive and we had to use ice to make it cool. Second bottle ordered and this time it arrived in an ice bucket (which contained no ice!) and the wine was warm again. By the third bottle we were taking bets on what would happen next. We had an ice bucket, we had ice, the bottle was lovely and cold, but the waitress didn't open it and didn't leave a cork screw so it sat taunting us for nearly 30 mins and us asking 6 times could someone open the wine before we could enjoy it. This is a good place and place to be seen. The terrace is comfy, the tapas is tasty (I've had it before) and the drinks are good (very expensive though), but the service lets it down. The staff obviously have been bred to look young and beautiful rather than for their customer service or waiting skills. Will i go back - of course, because its now a long standing joke within my group of friends about what can go wrong when we go there and we play a drinking game linked to the poor service!

title: Rudest door lady known to humanity.
comment: I suspect the only reason people drink in here is to calm themselves after the ordeal of entering. The blonde female door host looked at me like I was excriment, made comments about what I was wearing and attempted to make me feel lucky I was let in. I wasn't lucky. The drinks were below average and the fittings/furnishings cheap. I strong discourage you from going.

title: Radio bar still worth going to
comment: Having had afternoon tea in the ME hotel ( fab and amazing customer service) we asked our waiter if we could go up to this iconic bar and he was able to do this ...that in itself was great. Good starting point. Very buzzy ( understatement !) and lots of very beautiful people. The service was strained BUT the staff hard working and dedicated which was impressive. The senior bar person very adept at assessing the scene and excellent in his interventions! Would go back again because of him. Went there this afternoon.

title: Wonderful view, dismal service!
comment: My friend had tried for over a week to book a table on the roof terrace for Saturday 17th May, with no success. On arrival around 5pm we arrived at the lift to be met with disdain (seniors) by a young lady who asked if we had walked through the hotel bar, and did we have a reservation. She was informed we were unable to book. She then asked us to walk back out of the hotel and walk round the block to the 'no reservations' entrance, where we may be allowed in! We were shocked but thought we would try it anyway, and the roped off area was lifted (how kind) to allow us to enter, and we arrived back at the same lift looking at the same 'lady' (not). It gets worse as we spent £24 on a glass of Moët and a dry martini, walked onto the terrace, 2 people vacated a table that we then sat at, took in the view and were faced with another 'lady' who asked us to vacate the table as it was booked? To book is impossible, and it had just become free. We were beginning to feel most unwelcome as 'senior customers' and finished our drinks and left the building. We have a reservation next weekend in Claridges bar, where we are always made to feel welcome to enjoy our champagne, and suggest to the Manager of the Radio Bar (who seems extra busy with more than enough complaints)that to keep his bar from the same fate as many new establishments in London, who have their day, he should at least employ staff who understand what the word 'RESPECT' means, and to take care with their ageist attitudes.

title: Didnt get let in disgusting.
