comment: The door lady was very rude, looked down at us, and disappointed we did not get let in. The attitude of the front of house door lady was disgusting, we obviously did not look the part, went Argyll Street instead.

title: Underwhelming
comment: Tried popping in on a Sunday evening and were turned away by a disdainful doorman with the excuse that one of our party had 'sports shoes' on - although this didn't seem to stop the beautiful young things being welcomed in! Out of curiousity I went back the next day at lunchtime to take in the view and have a relaxing drink. No problems getting in this time and was welcomed at the door and asked to take a seat. Then sat for 10 minutes being ignored so eventually left and went elsewhere for my drink, Shame as the setting is lovely - I guess I'm just not their target clientele!

title: Very Cool
comment: Visited here with business partners after a lovely lunch and it was very relaxing to chill out in this tranquil bar. The service was excellent and nothing was too much trouble. The views were lovely and we there was plenty of room and not cramped at all but it was a Tuesday afternoon. I believe you may need to book in advance but I'm not sure as I was a guest. Would love to come again in the evening next time.

title: Great views but that's about all
comment: Completely agree with previous post most awful staff apart from one young lady who severed us drinks. My friend and myself went to the hotel entrance and asked for the radio bar and showed us where to go. On arriving at the entrance all completely roped off with 3 door staff this is at 4.30 pm on Tuesday we asked if we could come in and get a drink the small guy asked us how many of us and as a joke we looked behind us and started laughing as there was only the 2 of us oh he had already asked if we had a reservation and we said no so this is why we thought it to be slightly amusing that he asked how many of us as there was nobody else near us and then as we entered or should I say allowed in he turned round to myself and said that it wasn't a joke and not very funny in a jumped up and rude tone now we are middle aged women and I could not believe that a small child like looking man would talk to us like that I have to say it really put me off drinking there and paying a very hefty price for a drink views or no views I will not return as there are plenty of over lovely places in London also with great views and I don't even mind paying a premium price for a drink but I refuse when people are so rude I have also been told that they make young people feel the same it's like going back in time for me when in certain places in London if you didn't look the part you wasn't allowed in that was back in the eighties get with the times guys and sort your staff out people want to just have a nice time and not made to feel like they have something on the bottom of there shoe having said that I say at the beginning of my review that the young lady that severed our drinks was lovely and couldn't have been nicer I only wish I had taken her name because she deserves a mention (Sack the small guy you'll know who he is his the only little rude boy in there )

title: Better than expected
comment: Went to the radio rooftop bar, music was excellent, staff were great . It was a lot better than I thought it would be after reading other reviews. The only thing I would say is that they should have a better selection of finger food.

title: The best place for an alfresco drink with a view
comment: My husband and I had a bottle of wine at Radio on Saturday afternoon in the sunshine and it was bliss. We didn't have reservations but had no problem getting into the bar and whilst all tables in the were reserved we managed to get a seat outside in the sun. There is a real mix of clientele which was nice. The view is brilliant. The only downside is the appalling service - granted it was a busy Saturday but there were only 2 staff on the bar and it took 20minutes to get a drink - once we had a seat we got great table service from a friendly waitress - they needed at least 4 competent bar servers to deal with the customers adequately. Id definitely go back.

title: Never got in, now I don't want to
comment: Completely agree with other posters - the two staff at the roped off entrance - platinum blonde lady and smallish tough-guy - seem to consider potential guests as somehow beneath them, and are incapable of civil conversation. If that's how the management of the business want it to be, I see no reason to ever go back. Maybe they have enough customers who they consider worthy turning up from time to time....

title: Rude undfriendly door staff
comment: This is a nice bar especially if the sun is shining and you fancy an outdoor drink with good music.  I don't however appreciate the dumb & dumber blonde and her short sidekick at the entrance to the lift on the ground floor. Like someone else before she couldn't wait to say that we had come through the hotel entrance instead of the one for the bar. What bloody difference does it make which entrance you come in?? your still going the the same place, The Bar!! She has the cheek to look over you like she's anything special herself & she's probably earning £10ph to stand at a lift! Lol Pathetic!!! Once upstairs and past those two morons, all the other staff were welcoming, friendly & attentive to your needs. Get rid of the two downstairs and this place could be a hit this summer!

title: Very rude staff
comment: Visited the Rooftop Bar on Saturday 3rd May at lunchtime for a cheeky drink. Although being table service, we were initially ignored for a bit too long. Once we finally ordered our drinks, we waited for our final friend to arrive.  However, our friend was not allowed in, despite there being plenty of space at the table in an uncrowded bar. We were not on the guest list, so we did not have priority. Although I understand the need for guest lists at venues, it is baffling that the staff could not take a view on the situation - and be so rude and unhelpful at the same time.  Needless to say, we finished our drinks and promptly left. We will not be returning.

title: The Only Way Is Essex, without the fun.
comment: This place should be an amazing addition to drinking in London, the views are amazing as is the location, but the bar staff are comically rude and the Russian-esq door staff dressed in 1990's Balkan rig, a touch baffling. I felt a sense of pity for the employees as they looked like they were trying their hardest to be imperious but weren't too sure of themselves. Cocktails are £12, which is not surprising given the location but they are served in plastic beakers a la Ikea/Music Festival. The music was text book West-end pop, so what you'd expect. Clientele was The Only Way is Essex, but perhaps for the over 40's. In summation, think nouveau riche Moscow in 98 with Footballer's Wives undertones and soupçon of V festival.

title: Door men and manager tried to bribe me - dodgy and unprofessional
comment: Visited Radio bar fairly recently, as I arrived at the door with my girlfriend we were told to wait to the side. As we waited the manager (guy with the glasses) approached us and we were told to 'sort out' the door men in order to be allowed in. I asked the manager what he meant by 'sort out' and he told us it would cost us £20 each to be let in. It's such a shame, the bar itself is great (and is suppose to be free to enter) but the staff (door men and the manager) are dodgy, unprofessional and patronising.  Wouldn't recommend it to anyone....

title: Please, please employ friendly staff!
comment: What pretentious, cold, unwelcoming, rude, wooden, stuck-up staff! Gobsmackingly awful service and atmosphere provided by them. I have honestly never experienced ANYTHING like it. They actually look you up and down as if you are scum of the earth. The most bizarre business model ever. Such a shame as the views and decor are lovely, but my 20 + guests and I would be scared to go back to be honest.

title: Amazing views
comment: Staying in the hotel so no issue with getting in. Were provided with a table despite all being reserved as long as we vacated in an hour.  Defiantly worth a visit

title: Shocking...
comment: I really don't understand why the staff are so rude here at the front door?  When you ring up the person on the phone is very informative and polite, you then turn up to the door to be told they are full!?! When having called 20minutes earlier and told show up and we are open! Out of three times this has happened twice, and one time I have actually gone in. Great views.. but is it worth the hassle of the hit and miss attitude you get at the front door?  Plenty more places in London to spend money on a good night out.

title: Overrated - You would think you were in a east end club with over protected door bouncer
comment: Have recently been involved with an event at the ME Hotel, was introduced to the Radio Bar, which has stunning views (that's where it ends)! Wanted to go up in the lift with 6 friends on Thursday night, I checked the staff managing the lift in the downstairs lobby that I could get access without having to wait. I was told it would be no problem. I walked my guests from the hotel area to the lift to be told by some Jobs worth that I had been mis-informed by staff and I would have to re enter the Radio bar through the street door. (This was not what was agreed). We walked back through the hotel, out onto the street and walked upto the Radio Door, at this point no problem, security waved us through. We walked along a short corridor to find ourselves back in the hotel lobby at the same lift we had been at 2 mins before with Jobs worth standing there, I couldn't believe it. I asked him if he was real ! Company policy he said. Despite spending £500 on overpriced drinks I felt the service level for what should be a 5 star experience was very poor. The attitude that goes with this place would be better suited to a doggy night club in the East End. We won't be lining their pockets again. Need to upgrade their staff employment policy! (However the girl on the desk was polite and professional)

title: Worth visiting!
comment: Pricey, but awesome cocktails! AM/FM cocktail must try! Panoramic view, ideal for group meetings. Overpriced, would not visit more than once.

title: Fantastic place!! Very polite & excellent staff...
comment: Without any shadow of a doubt the London best place ,very nice atmosphere great service . Visited the place several times and will do it again & again ,much like the service ,very polite team from the security outside to the manager upstairs ,never had any problem there ,always enjoying every single minute I spend there... Tips : Reckon you guyz should keep a permanent toilet attendant in the gents ,doesn't always reflect the notoriety of your establishment sometime ! Apart of that well done to all the team !

title: Nice views
comment: I was at Radio Rooftop Bar for a mate's stag do. The view was great but that was all. Drinks and foods are quite expensive. Unless there is a special need, I would go somewhere else.

title: Awfull and rude staff
comment: A hotel that base it self on glam but only delivers cheese from rooftop bar to stk. Rude staff and the only hotel with bouncers and a guestlist to enter a hotel bar and restaurant. Dated and tacky system that feels like your in a street club rather then a hotel. Only go if you are in your early twentys dressed half naked and dont know london well enough.

title: A great place to visit !
comment: Visited this bar on a friends recommendation & it didn't disappoint! Great feel to the place with great service. Would deffo go again!

title: Lacking a but of love
comment: This place should be amazing. Prices for this location were as expected but I think execution fell a little short. I found the wait staff to be pleasant, the door staff were nonchalant to the point of being rude. The decor is fairly tired and the clientele were quite rowdy chavs with cash. Views are great but I don't think they alone command the prices they are charging.

title: Wonderful views - wonderfully expensive!
comment: Went here for lunch time drinks and snacks. The staff were helpful and allowed us to choose our own outside table. They were attentive without being intrusive. Having paid 3 times the rate for a bottle of 'fizz' we enjoyed that as well as some cold meats with break and oil. The comfy sofa's were lovely and when a few drops of rain fell staff lowered the roof. The view was to die for and I would love to go back at dusk but I guess it would be even more busy. There were folks there having a half of beer and wandering round taking photos so I guess they had the right idea about doing it on the cheap. Watch out though at certain times there is a minimum charge/spend so don't get caught. Would I recommend this place definitely. Would I eat there no. Your call, your bank account.

title: Nightmare with a view!
comment: Just returned from this awful place and my beautiful daughters birthday, pretentious in the extreme, bouncers on the door look you up and down, if you don't meet their 'dress code' you can't come in, I thought London had rid itself of these self appointed bigots with high level security comms more suited to Baghdad than Europe, rude, excessively expensive, even idiots with money should avoid this place at all cost, loads of wonderful places nearby with warm and friendly welcome, why bother with this load of s****!

title: Summer is here
comment: WIth the great weather we've been having i have gone to Radio a few times this week. It was my summer spot of choice last year and is even better now. They have put in an awning and heaters, if its cold or rains you can still sit outside. New authentic Spanish Tapas is surprisingly good. I was a little confused until I learned its a Spanish company. Smoked Eel and Chorizo are must tries. The wine list has more and better selections. We had some great Rose on the Terrace. Perfect Setting!

title: Opinion was changed
comment: I visited this bar with a group of friends a few weeks ago on a Friday night and was surprised at how rude and unfriendly the girls on the desk where when you enter the bar, straight from the lift. The service throughout the night was average, at best, apart from one girl named Nica - very friendly and warm and nothing was a problem. I came back last night with a friend and, again, the service was indifferent. When my friend arrived, she was made to stand and wait before being able to enter the lift and she saw how the door staff (down at street level) spoke to potential guests of Radio and was unimpressed. We stayed for a few drinks and then decided to go downstairs to the Italian restaurant in the same hotel - Cucina Asselina, We were greeted by Yvonne, a lovely Irish lady, and taken to our seat and she asked how our night had been until that point. We just gave a very throwaway remark that we had been at Radio and that the views were amazing, but that the service hadn't been great and that you aren't made to feel welcome. That was it and then we had a lovely dinner - the service in this restaurant was great. Towards the end of the meal, a guy approached us and asked if we minded if he sat down and he explained that he was Javier Molina - Manager of Radio - and that Yvonne had mentioned to him that our experience of Radio hadn't been altogether positive. He apologised profusely and said that he wanted to change our opinion and so invited us back up when we had finished to have a complimentary drink as a further gesture of apology. He then left and 15 minutes later, came back again to see if we wanted to go back to the bar. We decided to go back and he brought us up and offered us a table and invited us to a glass of Champagne each. We then saw the lovely Nica (who I had met on my last visit) and, again, she was a star. So warm and chatty and genuinely appeared to be interested in us and to care about our situation. Overall, when I see the comments below, I do understand where people are coming from as the Door Team are not at all friendly and nor were the Welcome Team in the bar when you enter but the fact that Yvonne (from the restaurant 10 floors down) took what we said and cared enough to call up to the bar and then Javier came down made all the difference. Little tiny things can change your opinion of a place and following last night, my friend and I will definitely return to Radio and I really do hope that they are able to change a few more people's views on this bar with an incredible roof top terrace with almost unparalleled views in London.

title: Denied entry "no trainers" - very uncool place
comment: I was denied entry by low quality door man as I was wearing trainers. This type of place gives London a bad name internationally. Having now read some of the reviews I'm glad I didn't get in!

title: Never again
comment: This place is so far up its own *rse it beggars belief. Following a botched visit in July, (see my review from 11 July) I vowed never to go here again – until I was invited by a broker / business relationship who hosted a few clients here (I accepted the invite before I knew where we would go). When confirming the details, the broker asked me if I could bring some female friends as the group would be a bit male-heavy and when booking, he had been asked by Radio Rooftop staff to specify the number of females in his party and come up short. I assumed my host was making this up, but on the night other people confirmed that on entry, they were again asked at the entrance how many women they would bring. Rather awkward to think I might have been invited because I am a woman rather than a business partner. As if it was a meat market rather than a business reception! The bar itself was a huge disappointment. The service was incredible slow. I have been a waitress myself and I am sure I could singlehandedly double the turnover of an evening by simply getting on with it. My goodness the staff was inefficient, one person of our group would walk up to the bar to order, only to return after 10 – 15 minutes with the message that somebody would come to take our order. Another 10 – 15 minutes later, somebody might, or might not, come to take our order. This order might, or might not, be delivered at some point during the evening, but it was a bit of roulette. Bar snacks or any kind of nibbles were unavailable (or we were simply never shown the menu despite asking). Notwithstanding the steep prices and the fact it was only early evening (6 – 8pm) when I was there, all drinks were served in plastic rather than glass (except the wine which for some reason did arrive in a glass) which was just ridiculous given we were in what is supposed to be a trendy lounge bar (as opposed to an open air music festival or a football match). Speaking of “trendy”, even at this early stage of the evening, the music was so loud that any kind of verbal communication was out of the question. When we stood up to be able to hear each other better, we were repeatedly asked to sit down again in the area we had reserved, standing up was apparently not allowed although I am still trying to work out why that would have been a problem. Never again. What a mistake, and how embarrassing for our out of town host that he should have chosen this place for his client drinks.

title: Disgusting and Unhygienic
comment: I'd read some positive things about this place and was very interested in going here. Friends and family had told me that this is a place I should check out as it is similar to the places I usually go. However, when I got in there it was messy and the service from the staff was extremely cold. The toilets were dirty and I had to clean up my own table, which had mess from the previous occupants. This is not somewhere I would recommend to others before they really up their game on the friendliness and efficiency of their staff!

title: I think the bar needs to be so high up to accommodate staff looking do far down their noses at you!
comment: I had a friend visiting for out of town so wanted somewhere with a little bit of a 'wow' factor to show off how great London is. We were staying near the strand and had heard about this roof too bar... London has a wonderful skyline... Perfect! Turn up at the door... About 9pm. A lady of the door and security. 'Hello, can we please come up for some drinks?'... Cue disapproving glance from security and what felt like the lady looking me up and down and critiquing our attire. We are a group of three 25 year old girls, just looking for a nice cocktail and a setting to chat the night away. We already felt uncomfortable.  'Stand here'... We were waved to one side. After standing there for about ten minutes, we were nodding inside with any words. We thought it maybe busy as we were kept outside... We take the lift up. The bar is smaller than I had thought, but trendy music fills the room. A lot of empty tables all with reserved signs on. Busy but not exactly packed. Why did we have to queue? Maybe the tables are reserved but you already feel like they are reserved for people who the staff may chose are 'good enough'. No friendly staff to tell you have it works, as in.. Ladies free tables over here, waitress service or order at the bar. Or all the tables are reserved but your welcome to stand at the bar... There are staff walking round but don't expect a meet and greet.  Drinks... About £13 a cocktail. We perch at the bar. Waiting about ten mins before staff notice us or can be bothered enough to serve us. We order three cocktails, made swiftly... No smile, no chat from the staff but then again they don't need to earn the 12.5% service charge you have to pay when ordering....  The views are wicked up there, the bar can be quite cold as the the doors are always open to balcony for smokers and there are more 'reserved' tables out there.  Average age.... 25-35. Big gap but it really is varied.  I really wanted to like this place but it was very hard to. It is definitely not welcoming, therefore feels like you are being well and truly ripped off.  Avoid.

title: Pretentious
comment: Been here before had no problem as it was evening, I was dresses up and with a group of young attractive girls. Decided to bring my parents here for an afternoon drink, we were all dressed smart but not gleamed up to the max. The door staff looked us up and down and told us they were accepting table bookings only...it was in the afternoon! This place thinks it is more special than it actually is...regulars on the London night life scene will avoid this place with that kind of attitude. Avoid is my advise...much friendly nice places to go central.

title: Cracking place to enjoy an afternoon above the streets of London
comment: Good for drinks and some lovely Spanish tapas. Great service, great food, good wine, fantastic views. Loved the blankets for when it got a touch cold.  It's on the pricier side of things, but you get what you pay for. Thank you.

title: Great views, decent drinks, bad service
comment: The best thing with Radio Bar is the view from the terrace.  The worst would be the staff, that best can be described as people who have worked at the same place for thirty years and have been tired of it for the last twenty-nine years. Just that they were not old enough to have worked at a place for thirty years. Not rude, but VERY uninspired - a smile seemed to be lightyears away. This goes for both the staff at the door (with one exception) as well as the waitresses taking orders at the tables.  Somewhere in the middle are the drinks. Quite overpriced, but decent. They appeared to mainly use premium brands and there were lots of fresh fruit, herbs and berries in the bar. Conclusion: Today it feels like a place that wants to be a hot spot, but fails to achieve it. It's a shame, because I really think that this could be a great bar if they just replaced the staff (or management?) and changed the profile of the place, to focus more on good drinks and a relaxed atmosphere where the staff strives to make guests feel welcome. Would not visit again.

title: Very Enjoyable
comment: A small group of us sat outside and had a lovely afternoon drinking wine in the sunshine. Grazia was our hostess and she was beautiful, polite and very observant of our needs. Do Not lose this member of staff. I do agree with Kristina that the toilets were disgusting!! I also agree that the door staff are beyond rude. Once you are past the judgemental clipboard holding (we are better than you) door staff you will have a lovely time at the Radio Rooftop Bar.

title: Euro Trash at its worst
comment: Firstly, the view is stunning - one of the best you'll get of London. But really,that is all there is to say. The feel and decor is cheap and Euro-trashy, and the £12.50 cocktails are indifferently made by clearly bored bar staff. If you want a decent cocktail on the Strand, head to One Aldwych, which is the opposite Radio Bar in every way.

title: Nice scene and music
comment: One of my favourite spots in London, offering a nice view of the city, good music and good looking crowd. Drinks are priced just like any other top bar in London, with the added bonus of a DJ. My only complaint would be the inconsistency of their door staff, sometimes letting you in and sometimes enforcing reservations only, which is beyond annoying if you've been there countless times before without the need to reserve for 2 people.

title: The best, must see view in London - and a great night out too
comment: We went here with a group of 50 for a birthday/engagement party. The staff were exceptional with our party, my drink was never empty and there was always someone on hand for us. This was at the cost of £50 pp. the outside area is gorgeous with a spectacular view across the city complimented by lovely seating and blankets. Inside there's not particularly a dedicated dance floor, just some space by each table to have a dance. I think the music and people that go here are probably too cool to dance though!

title: Can only agree with the other disappointed reviews...
comment: The management response is a load of rubbish too.  This has been an issue at least since May 2013 when I had exactly the same experience.

title: Pretentious
comment: A great view. Not the best service and more than over priced for level of attention given to our party of 10.  We won't go back. A shame because we were really excited but the atmosphere and overall staff experience made it not fun.  The reservations manager was particularly rude. Like I said, it's a shame.

title: A smile goes a long way
comment: Nice views, poor service, rude waitresses and snotty lift attendants. You'd think considering the price of a drink in there they'd employ staff that could at least be pleasant - not even friendly - just pleasant would do. Being made to feel an inconvenience is not the way to ensure a return visit. There are better bars in London that will make you feel more welcome and not charge you £8 (plus 20% service charge **for what service exactly?!?**) for a bottle of beer. Wouldn't bother again.

title: Breathtaking view
comment: If you like to sip/gulp your cocktail and take in a view then you will do very well to find a better place than this. When we visited it was overcast, the view and atmosphere was still amazing. In the summer this place will be booked up so you may have to treat yourself and stay at the hotel to guarantee your place.  Well worth the visit but would probably suggest using it as a pre/post lunch or dinner venue as the elevated view comes at lofty price.

title: Awful
comment: Unbelievably rude staff & management. Shockingly bad customer service. Whilst the setting was nice the overall experience and atmosphere was complete ruined. Average drinks - overpriced.

title: Fantastic view but it's not enough...
comment: The view from the terrace is amazing; I was lucky and I came there without reservation on a Friday evening in March. Then I tried to come back few weeks later but I was rejected because we did not have any booking.  So, few days later, I called to book a table for a drink and I was shocked when they asked me £ 50 per person as a deposit (I was asking a table for 6...) so we went to another roof bar in the area... It's a pity cause is a nice place but it cannot be taken in consideration at these conditions!

title: Worth a drink or two.
comment: Fantastic 360 views. Our waitresses were great. So were the prices! But a great experience for one or two drinks if you havent been up there before. (No pints?) Minnimum 200 pound spend on a Saturday! We went on the Friday.

title: Perfect place to stop for a drink
comment: Made a short trip here for a lunchtime drink, while on a day trip to London. We stumbled across this place while walking around the strand, must admit the Moët signs did attract my wife. We had a drink in the Radio bar on the 10th floor, which has the perfect location, with fantastic views across the London skyline. Fortunately we picked a wonderful spring day, which allowed us to sit outside, enjoy the early spring sun and take in the best city in the world. The staff were very friendly and helpful and the champagne good value considering the location. Very glad we stopped.

title: Don't go there
comment: We went last night and it was really bad. Staff is rude prices are cosmic. It's dirty, view is nothing special. Service charge is high and for no reason. They should employ better staff and drop the prices...

title: Give credit where it is due!!
comment: I had the pleasure of visiting the Radio Rooftop Bar with my friends on Saturday night. We were welcomed by the host, Adrian, who was both attentive and immensely kind. We had not made arrangements for a table but he went out of his way to accommodate our party of 5. We also had excellent service from Dominica and both our food and drinks were of excellent quality. The London night life scene is what you make of it - I would highly recommend the Radio Bar for fabulous and unrivalled panoramic views of London as well as wonderful service.  Best, Cherisse

title: excellent service by Dora
comment: We had an exceptional experience in the radio rooftop. If you have a reservation and some money to spend, this is your place to have a really good night with proper stuff who can pay attention and serve you in the right way. Especially if it's Dora, the hungarian cocktail waitress. No matter how busy is the enviroment (what is beautiful), she'd been take care of us and our orders with the greatest attention. Beautiful sunset, great cocktails and barsnacks, and the music is going to entrains you to have the best experience there. Will return as soon as possible Thanks for the unforgettable night Dora

title: Brandon (manager) was lovely - girl waitresses all VERY RUDE
comment: Heard that this rooftop bar hadn't been 'discovered' by tourists yet, so thought we'd check it out for my partners bday. The man and girl at the elevator seemed lovely, and sent us up the elevator to the top floor - when we got there, none of the people working even looked us in the eye. We sat outside to catch the view (Which was great), and after 5-10minutes, nobody had even come over to us.  I went to the bar to order a coffee - there must have been 6-7 waiter staff and a few bar staff - i was the only one at the bar, and nobody even acknowledged me!  When I finally got a girl to take my order, I almost felt I had inconvenienced her in some way - then I had to carry my coffees and sugar (balancing on my arm like a waiter-luckily I used to be a waiter, so Im pretty good at it!) to the table - looked at the receipt and she had CHARGED ME 20% SERVICE CHARGE - for what service exactly?! We complained to the manager, Brandon i think his name was, who was totally welcoming.  Please GET RID of these female waitresses though - really rude.

title: Can I get some service with that attitude?
comment: After being made to feel unwelcome on arrival and being lectured SEVERAL times about their ridiculous minimum spend, the party vibe was almost killed. The only reason we spent so much was for our friends birthday, zero cash tip given but words of advice, get over yourself and perhaps attend one of those hospitality schools, watching the Kardashians is not how one learns about service.

title: Made to feel very unwelcome!
comment: I visited Radio bar mid week with a group of colleagues (who are also very good friends) this week, arriving before 5pm. It was a birthday celebration and my friend had tried to pre-book a table but was told you can only reserve with a minimum spend of £100 per person. My friend decided against this option and therefore we arrived promptly to secure a table before 5pm. I arrived first with two colleagues to find all the tables inside were reserved. However, a member of staff told us that we could use one of the reserved tables, as the party who were holding them had decided to use the outside terrace area. Not long after other friends turned up (now after 5pm) and told us how rude the bouncers on the door to them. My friends explained to the door staff they were with a group of friends already in Radio Bar, however the door staff looked them up and down without a hint of a smile, asking if they were on the guest list. My friends explained again they were not on the guest list but friends were waiting upstairs. Against this was met with a discourteous glance from the door staff, who eventually let them in but made them feel unwelcome before they had even got in the lift up to the bar. When the rest of our party turned up we took a couple of chairs from the next empty table (which still had reserved signs on it but no people) which seemed to cause the staff real concern. My friend and I became aware of Radio staff pointing at our group continuously, obviously bothered about us sitting at this table. It started to make us feel very uncomfortable and a little later, a senior member of Radio staff came over to tell us off for taking chairs from all his tables (at this point there were still NO OTHER PEOPLE at these tables). I pointed out that his colleague had said we could sit there to which he replied, he was expecting 200 people that evening and we were taking up chair space. He was very rude and made us feel like we were second class citizens and perhaps not of the calibre he was expecting!  My friends, who stayed a little later than me, confirmed that the reserved tables were, in fact, not taken for the rest of the evening. They went on to buy champagne and wine and spend a fair amount too, despite being made to feel not worthy in the first place. I personally work in events, marketing and PR, regularly take out clients to various restaurants and bars around London, and I personally would avoid going back there like the plague.  I had a similar experience last time I tried to get in there at 5pm on a Friday night last summer. Door staff with clip boards and guest lists making people feel worthless. No thanks Radio Bar! Like a previous reviewer said, plenty of other roof top bars with better customer service.

title: Greeted by a very rude Natalie - the guest list girl
comment: Had a wonderful evening at the stk restaurant which was quickly spoilt by the rude woman who does the guest list at the entrance to the radio bar. Apparently a group of 6 is too many for the bar area!!  She known as Natalie the guest list girl completely spoiled our night with her stuck up attitude bad attire and slightly awkward disposition, was dressed in cheap fur and clown like make up ...I am shocked that radio have such a monstrosity at their doors. After all first impressions do count and this woman was vile. Thanks to NATALIE I would not recommend the Radio Roof top bar to my dog.

title: Rude
comment: I called to make a reservation but was shocked to learn £50 deposit pp. For 6 people, who has £300 to spare as a deposit a week before. Anyway, decided to o as a walk-in. The woman at the door was rude and unfriendly. She was not accommodating when I asked her to allow a friend in when she arrived 10 min after I did. At least, the barman attended to us promptly.

title: Radio bar
comment: I suppose if you have more money than sense,like surly doormen and velvet rope to engender a false sense of privilege and can appreciate interior decor I would classify as a light industrial vibe,this is your sort of place.A poorly trained E European waitress attended to us .When the bill came with a service charge included and the demand for a further gratuity on the slip you just wanted to get angry. By rights this place should go out of business immediately.No friendly greeting,no customer service,rip off central with (attempted) double service charge.Excellent bars DO exist in London.This isn't close to being on the same page.

title: Snobsville! Luckily we were an executive party!
comment: Having been delighted to attend a late New Years Do for one of my Boyfriend's clients (A Pharmaceutical company). After having a delicious dinner, and going to the Theatre, a party of about 20 of us (mainly age 35+) walked into the hotel's main entrance, to then be told by some snooty chap that we had to go around the side of the building. So we all walked to the side of the building, and a disgustingly rude lady with a clipboard told the manager of this company that we were not on the list. Well, it all kicked off, the manager was extremely angry and demanded he speak to the manager of the Bar. So we all stood there in the rain, and the manager came down. Straight away he apologized for the lady's rudeness and let us straight in, where we were taken to the lifts. People were stopped and we were allowed to go straight up and were taken to a private cornered off area on the balcony. With regards to the Bar itself, nothing too special to be honest, but the views were beautiful outside and although it was a chilly evening, some waiters quickly got us lots of heaters to keep us warm. Although everything was pre-paid for by the company, I did have a quick glance at the drinks menu and it all seemed so over priced. Luckily, we had unlimited bottles of champagne and the service was impeccable but no doubt that was probably because the company had paid a bloody load for all of this!  Please take note: Don't expect anyone dressed in anything but a Prada Suit, or a Chanel dress, it was very obvious that only a certain type of snooty snobster come here, in which the woman look at you as if you just aren't good enough to be here. Oh please!  So overall, the experience was nice, and very fortunate for us, but I would NEVER go there with my boyfriend again. Too many drugged up looking men sitting around drinking champagne worth more than most peoples rent! Overrated! And not worth it!!

title: Extremely rude. Will not visit ever again.
comment: These are the rudest staff I have ever met. They simply were not interested in letting us in despite explaining we were there to entertain someone from our company. Will not be visiting this place ever again, there are plenty of other rooftop bars in London who know how to be polite and respectful.  Out of principle the staff there really need a reality check on life as they are only bouncers and girls clipboards.

title: Brilliant Night
comment: I have been here 3 times now and never disappointed. Drinks are excellent. Staff are attentive. Atmosphere is great. View is fantastic. It's very expensive, but nothing less than you should expect from a rooftop bar in central London. P.S. Definitely worth reserving a table even if you do have to spend £100, since you get table service all everning.

title: Beautiful in summer
comment: The Radio Rooftop Bar at the ME Hotel has wonderful views by night, unfortunately I was there on a cold cold night and couldn't take advantage of the outside seating. However I guess it's all about what you are used to. The ladies were dressed in skimpy dresses and open-toe heels and were just fine wondering outside, so maybe it was just me :)) Service was good.

title: Cocktails ahoy!
comment: Have been here a few times and think sitting at the bar during winter is great. Pro barmen shaking their stuff, and willing to do all sort of special cocktails for you. In summer outside is prime of course. Had the best Whisky Sour in ages here.

title: Great views if a little expensive
comment: I've been to this bar several times, once when it was raining and very windy making Radio just like any other bar. The other occasion was blazing February sunshine, it was worth the wait. The views are spectacular and the cocktails are good. Sit outside and admire London as they have plenty of patio heaters. They have chilled music playing in the background and overall the ambience was perfect. All staff are friendly and there is a nice mixture of clientele with the exception of the clipboard girl at the lift.

title: Awful, tacky, gauche and way too much attitude
comment: In a city full of incredible and dynamic hotels, there is absolutely no excuse for service this poor from a hotel in Central London.  The view is a panorama of exactly nothing interesting. The drinks are very expensive. The service is a mishmash of languages and cultures all covered in a thick layer of attitude to cover the general incompetence. The roof is caving in from water damage. The toilets are dirty. I think the service charge on our bill was a default 20%.  Oh, and be prepared for a £50 per person minimum charge if you are dumb enough (in their view) to call ahead to book.  A quick google and you will find amazing alternatives without the attitude and where the service, room and view are worth the price.

title: Good London Bar if you want a view
comment: Been to the Radio Bar at the Me Hotel several times now. There is nothing not to like really. Stunning views across London especially at night. Cocktails are nice - not cheap but this is London so to be expected. Service Ive always found good. Only gripe is their door policy. Sometimes you just walk straight in. Other times they want to play a game of 20 questions. On the whole though ive found the staff polite and friendly.

title: Lacking in Atmosphere
comment: I came here in the afternoon with friends for a drink. The views were good but relied on too heavily to create an effect. The drinks were very nice and the seats comfortable. We did order some chocolate lollipops but it was forgotten until we reminded the waitress. She did apologise and they were taken off the bill which I wasn't expecting. Overall a nice, standard experience.

title: Don't waste your time going to this bar - rude staff & pretentious atmosphere!
comment: I visited Radio for the first time last night with 4 other friends. On arrival we had come into the main hotel not knowing there was a separate entrance from the street to be greeted by a door witch who told us in future to go through the other entrance! Got to the bar, waited about 20 minutes for our drinks to be made during which time some guys were leaving a table so we asked if we could sit down. We all sat down, there was no reserved sign on the table as the previous ppl had left, yet within about 10 minutes a very rude girl came over to say you'll need to move off this table it's reserved! So I said well there wasn't a reserved sign so no. Then a very rude man came over to say we needed to move and we asked where these other ppl were that were needing our table?! And yet there were empty unreserved tables around us!  Drinks are overpriced and for the awful service and rudeness of staff I'd say I'll never be visiting this pretentious place again! Get over yourself Radio, you're not that good!

title: Great way to unwind !!
comment: The Me hotel is a fairly new hotel in a great location , a friend had stopped there previously and had mentioned the radio bar on the roof top sported great views. We were not disappointed the views were fantastic , giving a fantastic panoramic view of the London skyline , the staff were attentive and the cocktails were great . One extra thing I would mention a lot of the tables were already reserved by the time we got there , we sat down anyway , don't be afraid to sit at a table , many people were coming in walking around and leaving because all the tables were reserved , we were asked to move to another table very politely eventually which was fine

title: Stunning view/Stunning cocktail!
comment: We were a little wary of heading up to the Radio Rooftop Bar this weekend having read earlier reviews on this sight, but all of our party thoroughly enjoyed the experience from my 11 year old nephew to my 50 year old brother.  Determined to sit outside on a crisp but pleasant day, we sat at a table but admittedly had to go inside to order our drinks as there didn't appear to be any service outside. As more customers came out, there was more service and the heaters were put on, blankets are also available which is a sensible touch. Yes it's pricy as are the majority of hotel bars in central London (£13 for a champagne cocktail) and yes I can see how it may have the propensity to appear 'a little up itself' as the hotel lobby can seem a little clinical (beautiful melon fragrance throughout though), but on this occasion (a Saturday lunchtime), the service and staff were efficient and friendly including the 'lift guy'. Views as you would expect, are fantastic and the cocktails very tasty indeed. I'm looking forward to returning in the Summer, though I expect it will be rather more crowded then.

title: Great Customer Service
comment: I went to the Radio Rooftop Bar in the Strand the view from the rooftop is amazing. it was a last minute decision. We were greeted by a lovely stylish ethnic member of staff with a clipboard that looked like a catwalk model, great first impression of the place. She greeted us and made us feel very welcome, her manner and demure was second to none, had a great smile throughout and I believe was genuine. Customer service issues for my partner and myself is something we are very big on and appreciate good service when we experience it. The bar reminded me of a glamorous place in Dubai or Miami complete with the stylish ethnic tall staff member who's face still with us. Customer service is great. I feel that the place has improved with better crowd. I believe a place can only get great reviews when you have a great dining experience and customer service. Will Definitely return......

title: "I will allow you to go in"!!!!!
comment: This review is not about the Hotel but about the guest experience we received when 6 of us (all 50 something plus!) tried to go to the ME terrace bar. Having had a great experience at Alain Ducasse for lunch we decided to go for drinks at the Roof Bar at the ME Hotel. Having previously had a very poor experience when trying to gain access to the bar I was a bit dubious but we thought we would try again.  There was no Q at the bar street entrance and we were met by a very tiresome "hostess" with the dreaded clipboard and an attitude of condescension that was beyond belief... "Have you booked..." - answer no  "Are you expecting any more people to join you....? Answer no.. Serious consultation of clipboard and then...."I will allow you to go in..." The six of us were amazed by this greeting and frankly could not wait to leave after that welcome. Super cool bar with such an attitude problem that you wonder why...NEVER again... The saving grace was that we ended up having drinks in the lobby bar where the barman who looked after us was a delight...he saved the day.  We then went in to The Savoy American Bar where the hostess could not have been more charming, welcoming and really ME hostess should go there for lessons in how to treat paying guests...

title: The roof top Terrace Bar…amazing
comment: My friend Tiffany and I went to visit the top roof Terrace bar, named Radio of this amazing hotel during a short holiday in Lodon. We reserved two tables and bring 10 people of different nationalities to the event. As we booked we said that we will have a tapas dinner. Me being spanish and settled in Mallorca, where the Melia hotels are originally from, was completely excited about the experience. The bar is very trendy, but what impress me the most were the stunning views of the London skyline…amazing!! Again as in any place you go, the staff make a difference and we would like to thank very much Grazia, the gorgeous italian Lady that took care of us during our visit. She was friendly, very professional and always ready to attend our requires. When we ask the lady at the reception of the bar that we were ready to eat and that we needed to set the two tables together, she was completely ineffective, saying it was the policy of the hotel not to do so. I try to explain the lady that we wanted to be together and that we had informed about that while booking the table. Meantime Grazia, was doing some research to help us and she came back by saying that the manager has said there was no problem in setting the tables together. That made us so happy. We had a lovely dinner and enjoyed the atmosphere very much. The other waiter, Roberto, was also a sweetheart, always asking if we needed something else, very attentive. Grazie mille and keep it up!! Laura( from Spain) & Tiffany( from USA)xx

title: Stunning Views, Excellent Cocktails
comment: Situated in the ME Hotel and not obvious unless you know where you are going. The person with the clipboard at the lift is somewhat off-putting, almost as if you have to have a booking to enter but not the case. Excellent, friendly service.

title: Underwhelming!
comment: I went last night to have an early drink with a friend before going-on for dinner and was seriously underwhelmed by the experience. To start with I found the clipboard/have-you-booked attitude quite offensive when I was only going for a drink at 6.30pm. While the lady wasn't rude to me, 'friendly' is not a word which would come to mind for describing her. I was then told that if I wasn't staying in the hotel I should be using the street entrance and not the hotel entrance - even though they both use the same lift. When I was finally allowed past the bouncer on the lift and upstairs to the bar, the lift doors opened and it was like going into a nightclub - at 6.30pm! - the music was so excessively loud you couldn't hear yourself talk. Again we went through the have-you-booked routine and when I said I hadn't I was told we would be 'allowed' to stand at the bar or have one of the tables in the lobby by the lift. I walked round the bar to see if my friend was already there and finding that she wasn't I waited on one of the tables by the lift until she arrived. We ended up moving our chairs close together and leaning into each other to enable us to hold a conversation, which we did until we'd finished our drinks and then left. I found the whole experience completely ridiculous and really don't like this idea of having to book a table just to go out for a drink, quite aside from the fact that the music was not just loud but absolutely deafening so early in the evening. Needless to say it will be quite some time before I return.

title: Attempting to trade on a reputation it doesn't yet have!
comment: We’d tried to get in three times before but had been firmly rebuffed - O.K., we hadn’t booked and it was on busy nights. Needing to do business on a weekday lunchtime in the area however we thought we’d try just one last time in order to enjoy the promised views. No problem accessing the dedicated elevator and bar this time. There were only 6 people at 13.30hrs in the bar. The service was pleasant enough and the Champagne acceptable but the Straight Up Dry Martini was distinctly average. The staff were not experienced, their English marginal and we got the impression they’d been hired because they pleased the financial director’s bottom line. No complimentary olives or nuts etc. came with the drinks either. Instead, we were offered a small “bites” menu to choose from and to pay for...which we declined. On a sunny summer day ( our day was distinctly overcast ) the outside terrace would be inviting. We swiftly finished our business over just the one round of drinks. On leaving, we visited the clean “cutting edge loos” but the smell in both was distinctly and extremely stale and unclean... If it’s views of London you are after ( and better drinks and value ) go to the OXO Tower or the Shard instead.

title: Good fun..
comment: So not having the greatest expectation for this bar.. but being a rooftop bar in London we thought we would try it.. have to say I was pleasantly surprised thanks to the staff behind the bar.. some great music .. no reservation needed and well a spectacular view Of south London..  A Great place to start the night celebrating and prices in line with central London..  It gets busy quickly and a great vibe when it gets going .. well worth a visit..

title: Left speechless - and not in a good way!
comment: Having walked into the reception area and been ignored by at least 4-5 staff milling around - we found someone to ask how we got to the rooftop bar and were told to go to the lift where we would be taken up. We arrive at the lift and there was only us there and a girl leaning against the wall chatting to a chap and they were laughing and giggling close together so we assumed they were guests. After waiting for a lift for 3 mins or more, one came , we got in it and it didn't have a button for the bar floor level 10. We got out again, girl was still chatting and flirting away - within two foot of us, we got back in having made it loud and clear we were confused. My husband then asks the girl could she possibly help us and she informs us she was the lift attendant!!!!!!! Seriously! Not only that, the chap she was flirting with a staff member from the restaurant, as he travelled up with us in the lift and went straight to the booking desk to work. They need to stop payingher wage immediately. Esp as she thought it was funny we had stuggled to find the correct lift and said "so many people do that". Really?????? Might it be you are there to do a job and just ignoring customers?? We were completely ignored by stuck up staff in the bar, so made our own way out of a very difficult door to the terrace. I ordered a cappucino and glass of Prosecco, only to be informed 5 mins later they had run out of milk! I kid you not. I literally laughed in her face and said how can you run out of milk in a place this size - it cannot happen. What you mean is the bar has run out of milk and no-one can be bothered to go and get some from downstairs. Finally, my coffee arrived, but not the prosecco as they don't serve by the glass! Had a nice light lunch of pulled pork and chilli fries - no complaints there. Views were lovely, heaters ample for a terrace lunch outside, mid December. As we left, there were 5 staff mooching around, not one was smiling, or even bothering to catch our eye and smile and say goodbye, somehing you would expect in a service industry. When I visited the ladies loo - the seat was completely broken and propped up on the side. All in all - I was amazed how bad this experience felt and glad we had just popped in out of the bue whilst passing and not made a special trip. Will not recommend and if anything will ensure I tell all my friends how bad the place was and not to be fooled by the glossy photos and PR. All style, so substance.

title: AWFUL
comment: First of all get rid of the RUDE lady on the door with the clip board - manners cost nothing. Went with a group of girlfriends was told before hand that no reservations were needed. Turned up to Radio Bar and the Bouncer gormlessly looked at us and asked us what we were there for, asked to go up to the bar and he had to wait until Clipboard lady came out, she gave us a nice look up and down and said - NO reservations only. So that was that, we had to leave. I would never recommend this place to anyone!!!!!!!!

title: Great place to come for nice drinks & a great view of the city
comment: Had a lovely evening here, staff were all polite and friendly and wine was very reasonable compared to other similar bars. One of the only outdoor rooftop bars I've been to that is warm enough to enjoy even in winter months. Would come again

title: Disgracefully rude, don't waste your time !
comment: The reviews of this establishment speak volumes,unfortunatley nobody is listening ! Plenty of other rooftop bars to use in London without having a clipboard person and doorstaff whose so 'up' thereself, unless you're Tom Cruise or Lady GaGa your not getting in ! Pretentious and unworthy of decent custom. Not a chance of returning !

title: Poor in every way
comment: The view is not as good as from Oblix at the shard. Horrible service and rude staff. Never again. Would advise against anyone want to go there. You will be ganranteed to ruin your evening.

title: Could have been - POOR ON RESERVATIONS
comment: Its great place. Nicely decorated. We however made a reservation, were told that we had a minimum spend of 100 per person. However, when we got there- there was not even a table booked for us!!! How this is possible I dont know???  We did get the last table available, by the sliding door where everyone kept on coming in and out of for smoking purposes. Cocktails were good. Liked the manchego and ham snacks. but not the humous...

title: Simply awful.
comment: Rude staff, over-priced drinks, pretentious, zero atmosphere, DJ spinning out generic house music. Waitress expected a £10 tip for her service of being rude, slow and aggressive. This was on top of the 12.5% service charge. We weren't allowed to leave until her Manager apparently agreed that we could without tipping the extra. Bouncers on the door looked and behaved like bad James Bond villains, channeling Grace Jones & a mafia thug. Save your money, time and effort, and visit any of the other rooftop bars in London and the City. Guaranteed to have a better time.

title: Loved it
comment: Great service, great atmosphere, great views. Well worth a visit if in town. Drinks are on the pricey side but it's worth the visit.

title: Great staff great Customer Service 4*
comment: I went to the Radio Rooftop Bar in the Strand, it was a last minute decision as previous experience was not great due to the staff on our first visit this was last summer. Nice place nice decor. We were greeted by a lovely stylish ethnic member of staff with a clipboard that looked like a catwalk model, great first impression of the place. She greeted us and made us feel very welcome, although she looked at us from head to foot ( I am aware it's part of her job) her manner and demure was second to none, had a great smile which I believe was genuine. Customer service issues for my wife and myself is something we are very big on and appreciate good service when we experience it. The bar reminded me of a glamorous place in Dubai or Miami complete with the stylish ethnic tall staff member who's face still with us. Customer service is great. I feel that the place has improved with a better crowd. A place can only get great reviews when you have a great experience from the Staff. Drinks a bit pricey but will definitely return.

title: Best Bar in London
comment: Spent New years eve at the radio bar with my partner and friends. The view is out of this world it looks right over the Strand & Themes. Ideal spot for the fire works. You get complementary drinks from 8-9 and canapes which they bring round every 30 mins. The atmosphere is great, lively and the staff are brilliant.

title: Clip board girls walks off while im talking to her, RUDE Doorman told me to move off the pavement
comment: I attempted to take some business clients to the Radio bar, & hearing it was "select" i did not wish to be turned away in front of my guests i was treating for Christmas. With that in mind i telephoned a week in advance for a table of 6 mixed people, to be told i could make a reservation, with a minimum spend of £50 per head, "No problem" i said & they took my name, credit card details, and estimated time of arrival. "What proof do i have of this booking with you" i asked ? "we will send you email, bring it with you as proof" i was told. My guests & i arrived 6.15pm, & i approached the blonde girl with the clip board, told her my name, she just shook her head, & said "NO," Whilst i was explaining i had made credit card booking she walked away. HOW CRAP iS THAT, The door man now stepped up to me & said "move away from this pavement" as leaning towards me, to which i replied "NO i'm still in conversation with this girl in an attempt to find out whats going on," She said we didn't have reservation, so I pulled the printed e mail as proof from my pocket. She didn't even look at it she simply said "your credit card will not be charged" ( which proves she new what i was talking about & the procedure i had followed) So despite telephoning your booking, with your name, number of guests, ( mixed, well dressed) time of arrival & giving your credit card number, THIS IS NOT A BOOKING according to these muppets. The blonde girl with the clip board should have sued the charm school she attended, because she clearly hasn't learned anything. She is arrogant, RUDE, NO eye contact, no charm, cold, un-sympathetic to me & my GUESTS, we are customers, WE DID NOTHING WRONG. Both her & her stumpy bouncer should be sacked immediately.  I work making tv documentries, so the next time i return i shall be waring hidden camera & microphone & we'll blow the lid on these knobbs. The worst part was it all happened infornt of my guests, looked just terrible. DONT WASTE YOUR ENERGY GOING HERE

title: View is amazing but door lady needs to go
comment: The lady who was running the door at Radio Rooftop bar on Saturday 23rd November didn't know whether she was coming or going. We went to the door before dinner to ask to book a table as there would be 12 of us. She said that there was no need as she would remember our faces and there would be no problem getting in even though there was a group of 12 couples and to just come back after dinner. She then asks some silly questions like are you going to be smart? and you are going to behave? Erm excuse me we are all mature adults aged 32 onwards and all married couples I wouldn't of minded if we didn't look the part but there was no need for her to ask them questions.  So that's exactly what we do, we go back after dinner to then discover that half of us aren't getting in then she changes her mind and saids it's fine so we proceed to the lift and the 12th member of our party joins behind us only to then get refused in. I'm sorry but make your mind up. You totally spoiled our evening it was bad enough having dinner in STK surely it couldn't get any worst but yes it did. Once your up there if you get ok'd in that is, I wouldn't mind if it was an amazing bar but it's not the only good thing is the view absolutely stunning you could literally sit there all night and just look around absolutely amazing but the rest of it nope not worth a visit I'm afraid and they need to sort their door policy out and employees and stick to your policy not a good start to this bar.

title: Fantastic !!
comment: There is nothing anyone could dislike about this place, very swish in both decor and ambiance, great place for a first date or to meet friends, fantastical well stocked bar with great selection of everything, proper skilled bar staff that can do any mean cocktail you can think of, always one of the best nights out.

title: 30th birthday
comment: I had great difficulty finding somewhere classy in London that played great music with spectacular views. Somewhere that made my birthday memorable. I booked online and bounced emails back and forth trying to get a good deal with having a table etc. the girl I dealt with was faultless. Although I was slightly shocked that I was expected to pay a minimum spend of £100 a girl ( 9 of us) to be on their guest list and acquire a table for us. Bearing in mind we had met at 3pm had drinks at home, then been to Gauchos and only planned to be there 3 hours. From 9pm-12am although we were told we could have the table until 3am. I was told that on a Saturday the music was a mix of everything. Current, 80s, chart. This isn't the case. Don't get me wrong- I danced, but I jig in shops to music. I love my music but it left me feeling a bit 'meh'. It is background music for a slightly pretentious get together. Great for corporal or for 'peacocking'.  We felt a bit squished in our area and as for the view I rarely got outside as I was mingling with the girls- so don't get hung up on the view if you are considering this for a hardcore night partying. View would be amazing for quiet drinks with a couple of girls, or again, corporate. The waiting staff were nowhere to be seen and the staff in general need to learn how to smile. They seem bored and generally pissed off and snooty. When I'm paying £900 for 3 hours when half my girls are on water because they are new mummies or athletes I expect to feel quite special.  When they tried to charge me an extra £150 service charge when my bill was actually £600 but I still had to pay £900 ( min spend) I wasn't impressed.  Basically a fab place for lunch or corporate drinks or just a couple of girls after a show. Just don't bother booking a table. The interior is stylish. The atmosphere slightly pretentious which is great for the right occasion. It just left me a bit cold. The girls said they would go again and they loved the views. Sadly I need good music and friendly efficient staff for me to feel I had my money's worth. Can't just rely on location although this is a strong point for The Radio Bar.

title: OK for tourists perhaps
comment: A group of us from work visited here yesterday evening after work as it is just across the road. Being met on the door by a lady with a clip board may look all very important but really isn't necessary. We were shown our table. How the waiters and waitresses work here amazes me - it's so dark you can't see what you are doing - you can't see the menus or the prices (perhaps that is a ruse!) The prices naturally are quite high but I do agree that the views are very good indeed and under the heaters it was quite warm bearing in mind it was a November evening. Only one half of the exterior walkway was open due to some work being done but there was plenty of room out there for you to have a walk around. There are small padded seats on the floor mixed in with the chairs which were actually quite easy to miss and trip over and the waitress had to keep pushing them out of the way when she wanted to top our glasses up. The music was also quite loud so we all had quite hoarse throats this morning due to us having to shout most of the evening. All in all it's a nice ambience with spectacular views. I have to agree with the earlier advisor who mentioned the ladies toilets - it was like going into the mirror maze in a fairground - fumbling around trying to find your way through shiny doors was enough of a problem completely sober - thankfully the drinks were too expensive to get drunk. There was a broken lock on one of the doors and I think there were only four loos. The sinks are quite novel though and the hand cream on the side is quite a nice touch.

title: Disgraceful condescending attitude
comment: A couple of friends were visiting London and we were going to be in covent garden so I booked a table for three at this bar. I was informed there was a £100 p/p minimum spend which isn't a problem as I'd expect to spend that much in a central London bar over an evening. I was then asked for my credit card details to confirm the booking which I gave before being told "we look forward to seeing you this evening".  All not a problem so far...until we get to the door.  We are three white males early 30s dressed in smart trousers, shirts, evening jackets and shoes.  The lady on the door (who had already turned away several mixed groups of people - who all looked like nice / decent well dressed people) asked four our reservation details, briefly scanned her list and said:  "no that names not familiar with me, we've got no record of your booking, I'd remember the name 'baby' so sorry we're not going to be able to let you in"  ...and then she continues: "and we're also only letting mixed groups in"  ...we were three guys(!) hardly a group. She made no efforts whatsoever to accept responsibility for the error and/or make enquiries with the booking team as to why our booking hadn't been registered.  Meanwhile a group of males who looked more like a group of undesirable drug dealers were showed straight in without even being asked regarding their reservation.  Having seen the people they let in and the people they turned away I'm glad we didn't go in the end.  The three of us have been all over the world drinking and eating in high-end establishments & never had any issues of this nature before. Disgraceful attitude of door staff & a door policy that clearly marks this place as one to avoid(!)

title: Amazing views worth seeing
comment: We popped in here for a cocktail when staying at the hotel. The cocktails were lovely. It was incredibly busy... It was a Friday night! Looks like you need to reserve a table to be able to get a seat. It a great place to grab a drink and take in the views.

title: good cocktails!!
comment: Went there a couple of times with my boyfriend, the view is great, not my sort of music but the night was very much redeemed by the amazing cocktails from Stefano, we had a good chat with him and made us feel very welcomed,cracking a few jokes!

title: Beautiful
comment: Beautiful people, beautiful view and beautiful cocktails! This is the kind of bar you want at the top of your hotel - minimalist chic that lets what's going on outside be the decor. Enjoy cocktails overlooking London in a great location. Service is a bit stuffy though...

title: I wouldn't bother if I were you .....
comment: This bar is completely overrated and needs to reviews its policies. We have been there before but tried to take some visiting friends there on Saturday evening before going to dinner, when we were greeted by smiley clipboard girl who assessed us (3 late-thirties, well presented couples) and then nodded that we could come in (gee thanks luv). The short, burly door"man" then stepped in front of her and said "no it's reservation only". The bar is obviously selective in its clientele but looking at other reviews on this site from guests who have had similar experiences, I would suggest management take notice of the comments as it now has a reputation for being somewhat discriminatory. My boyfriend went to speak to the GM at the Melia Hotel to let him know what had happened and he said he was aware of the problems customers had but said there was nothing he could do as they only rented the space and were not linked in any other way (interesting how when you google Radio Bar it comes up with Melia.com though!!). I would be very interested to attend the Bar's "commercial awareness" course ....... oops it doesn't exist. There are plenty of brilliant rooftop bars in London so I suggest trying those who are grateful for your custom. Comments from management would be very welcome however I suspect they will not be forthcoming.

title: Big Wow Factor - could be perfect with a few minor tweaks
comment: The photos on the website don't do this bar total justice. It's huge, very spectacular and attractive. We had reserved a table without any problem for lunchtime on a Saturday. The member of staff who organised the lift entrance was charming and helpful. The bar staff gave prompt and pleasant service so far, so good. No real complaints about this place just a few off-putting niggles. The seat covers on the outdoor sofas covered by awnings were very grubby and stained with the odd cigarette burn. They might be able to get away with this after dark but in the harsh light of day, it was a bit of a let down. The ladies loos are tiny and cramped. The reflective black walls left people stumbling around not sure how to get in and out. Maintenance staff need to get in there with some WD40 and sort out the very creaky doors, two out of the four locks were broken and the coat hook on the inside of the door in my look was broken off. There is nowhere other than the floor to put your coat and bag if you want to wash your hands. All in all very badly thought out (probably by a man....). The tapas were 50/50. One of them was just a plate of cold sliced chicken with a bit of chilli oil sprinkled on top - no wow factor here. I would definitely go again but not to eat.

title: Radio bar
comment: We have visited this bar twice now. We had a lovely afternoon in the summer but were moved from our table because of reservations for outside tables after a couple of hours. However, we were invited back and had a lovely day yesterday. The service was fabulous, the views spectacular and we enjoyed our champagne and tapas. Cocktails are always good here. Thank you to Quincy and the team at the Radio Rooftop Bar. We will be back :)

title: Amazing views
comment: My friend and I always finish our trips to London with a cocktail in the OXO bar, but this time we decided to try somewhere different. We didn't have a reservation but the doorman said it wouldn't be a problem as we only wanted a couple of drinks. The lobby area was impressive, but the concierge calling the lift was quite conspicuous with his bottle of air freshener/ aftershave, and he wasn't very friendly or chatty. Was he trying to get rid of a obtrusive smell?? The views upon entering the bar were amazing, and because it was dark we decided to sit outside and take in the view, which were out of this world. Big Ben, the Shard, St Paul's all lit up- quite something. The service was prompt and the staff helpful. Unfortunately it was a very chilly, windy evening and not all the patio heaters worked, so we had our £12 Flowers In The Rain cocktail and decided to leave as we were cold. The ambience was very relaxed but the cocktail was not as spectacular as those served in the OXO tower. Would visit again on a warmer day- wrap up if you want to experience the rooftop bar in November!

title: Great drinks & view
comment: Really good choice of cocktails and wine (found the cheapest one great to be honest!). Amazing view!

title: Radio Bar
comment: We had just an amazing time at Radio bar, such a nice place,nice music and nice people . We have been already many times there. we were regulars at the Wyld bar (W hotel) and Long Bar (Sanderson) but since our first visit to the Radio Bar we haven't returns to the others. Radio is definitely no.1 in it's category. The service and friendliness of Monika is amazing, would be great to see more of that in London.

title: Go elsewhere
comment: After a fantastic meal at STK, we decided to have a cocktail in Radio and one of my friends was told he couldn't enter because he was wearing a T-Shirt. After reading so many reviews on here mentioning rude staff, I think they did us a favour! We instead went across the road to One Aldwych which isn't pretentious and where all the staff were superb. The management need to take on board the TripAdvisor feedback, review their door policy and start delivering customer service in line with the rest of the Melia group.

title: Radio Rooftop Bar
comment: The Prof and I had arranged to meet in the bar, with the family to celebrate his birthday. I had been before so this was going to be a quick drink before dinner. Entrance to the bar is through the side door, no reservations allowed.  I arrived with my son (smartly dressed as we were going out to dinner) at 5.30pm (tea time)  to be asked how old my son was. "20" he said, and showed proof of age. We were told that he had to be 21 to enter the bar, and this was the rule for Friday and weekend. We pointed out it was Thursday..... "sorry you can't come in" ?? Two young girls were immediately allowed in - no questions?? Not impressed with the way we were treated..... We went to the splendid bar at No One Aldwych instead.

title: Cocktail with a view
comment: An amazing find with an exclusive feel. The view is stunning and the outside area is warm due to heaters. We sat outside comfortably in November. The ambience is great, music, staff and the atmosphere. The age is mixed and works. The staff are welcoming, helpful and professional. The drinks are more expensive than a pub but you pay for the experience. I would go back , loved it.

title: Great cocktails!
comment: Stefano was awesome. His cocktails were amazing. If you come here make sure Stefano is your cocktail man.

title: Fantastic place
comment: An amazing view, good service, excellent cocktails and great people. you should reserve a table and enjoy the wonderful rooftop of Me London. Highly suggested

title: RUDE AND OBNOXIOUS
comment: What a bar for losers this is - we were met by the blonde gormless door witch and the unfriendliest doorman ever experienced in London only to be refused entry because one of my party was wearing leather Prada trainers. Get your hand off it and get over yourselves. This bar needs a new door greeter and a friendlier door man. Both need to be relieved of their duties immediately. It's just London and it;s just a bar - get over yourselves. We sure did - straight across to One Aldwych across the street for great service and great cocktails. And to tell you the truth, I've been to the foyer bar in the ME London and it was hideous. I think I have been spared the same experience at the Radio Roof Top Bar. Many other reviers clearly agree. My recommendation - stay away from the guard dogs on the door. It's not worth the grief. It feels more like Spearmint Rhino than a 5 star London hotel anyway. Nasty and tacky. Get the picture?

title: Radio Bar
comment: Been several times to Radio, good atmosphere, nice music, high quality service. Julie, manager of the place is always attentive and friendly. Waitresses Coco and Daga really nice.

title: Radio Bar
comment: The venue was in a great location but it didn't justify the drinks prices. I don't expect to pay 3% service charges when the barman doesn't bother making eye contact.  The view was brilliant but there was limited seating and the number of people on the dancefloor was a little awkward. Sushisamba charges the same drinks prices but for a 10/10 venue.

title: Radio Rooftop Bar... One of my best nights out in London
comment: This place is amazing. From the moment I stepped out of the lift until I left, I was impressed. The venue is very cool and attracts a good clientele. The atmosphere is great because it’s in between a club and a bar. I am now definitely a fan of Radio. I had a reservation for 8 people and was given a nice table near the window and the bar. The hostess (wish I could remember her name) was very cheerful and friendly. Our waitress, Coco, was very friendly and very efficient. She took care of us the whole evening and often approached us to find out if everything was fine. We rarely had to serve ourselves drinks from the bottles, as she anticipated our needs. Having worked for several five star hotels in Switzerland and London, I can say that I was very impressed by the level of service received at Radio. Also, the view from the bar is breath taking.
