You can see many attractions such as the London Eye or the Shard from the bar. Unfortunately, it was raining that day so we couldn’t fully take advantage of the terrace. The outdoor area is very nice and even has heaters for people who want to smoke or just chat outside.  Everyone from my group had a great time and I would definitely recommend Radio to anyone who wants a memorable night out in London. David T.

title: Yummy cocktails with London city as your backdrop
comment: The most amazing views and tasty cocktails to be had for a post dinner treat. STK downstairs compliments any trip to the rooftop bar.

title: Amazing cocktails with an amazing view of London
comment: I had the pleasure of going to radio rooftop on Friday. The venue is very cool and is going to become one of my favourite spots in London. Everyone was very friendly and the view was breathtaking. The cocktails were made by a guy called Stefeno and this is what made the evening. They were the best cocktails I have ever tasted and I have had quite a few in my years! Thank you Stefeno and the team for making a average Friday night awesome.

title: Fantastic views over London with fantastic service
comment: I wanted to host a small gathering of friends on a Sunday afternoon, and decided to hold it at Radio, the rooftop bar at the ME Hotel. The management went above and beyond to help me organise something and on the day we all had a fabulous time. The views of the London skyline are superb, and rain or shine, this bar with it's attentive staff and knowledgeable bar-staff is a superb venue for a quiet drink, or a full-on night out with friends.

title: Awesome views
comment: We visited here with friends after work and were lucky to have picked a dry evening to sit outside and take in the sunset. It was a bit brisk but nothing a warm jacket couldn't resolve and the views are breathtaking. Very attentive table service. Drinks are a bit pricey but it's no more than you'd expect in this part of town and with these views. A definite must see!

title: Room with a View
comment: I had some drinks there on Wednesday evening with a group of work friends. After getting the third degree from the doorman going from do you have a reservation through to how many women are you joining I was escorted round a corridor into a lift and then ‘swiped’ up to the 10th floor. The bar itself is very impressive with views stretching from the City round to the West. Just the new layout of the bar with the glass wall looking down 10 floors to the reception desk was impressive. The bar staff do there upmost to keep service to a high standard and thanks to the booking policy you don’t find the bar over crowded in most areas. All in all a very good night at an amazing location.

title: Love this place! - Amazing views, amazing cocktails!
comment: I've been to this bar twice, once on a sunny Saturday afternoon and once on a Saturday night. We queued for about 30 mins on the Saturday afternoon, but we expected this as it was a beautiful sunny day. It was worth the wait. The views are spectacular and the cockails are superb. They are priced at around £10-13 which is pretty standard for the area but the cocktails are really well made.  All staff are friendly and there is a nice mixture of clientele. Saturday night was equally as good as you can still sit outside and admire London at night as they have plenty of patio heaters. They have chilled music playing in the backgroun (so that you can still speak to each other!) and overall the ambience was perfect.  Would definitely recommend this bar.

title: Radio Rooftop Bar
comment: Radio Rooftop Bar = GREAT venue, very COOL, CRACKING scene, SUPERB views of London. Most importantly, the staff are VERY proffessional, managed by Javier R. Molina who is also very friendly and super approachable. Specifically, one of the waitresses there called Kerry, has without doubt very much been (and continues to be) a fantastic host. On several separate occasions when I have visited the bar with friends, work colleagues or clients Kerry has been SUPER friendly, very charming, very knowledgle about the 'best' drinks and VERY FUNNY! She’s a KEEPER!

title: So So dissapointed!!
comment: we travelled to London as a group of friends to celebrate our friends 40th birthday, we spoke to the staff on the phone prior and was advised it should not be a problem early evening to get into the bar. We turned up at the door only to be looked up and down by some exceptionally grumpy door staff and then to be told at 6.50pm sorry we are full we are working on reservations only. we reluctantly accepted this but the most most annoying thing happened just as we had turned our backs, two pretty girls turned up without a reservation and we let in. surprise surprise obviously we did not fit into the martini set even though we dressed appropriately. This is a shame your beautiful bars reputation is being spoilt by your door policy and attitude of staff, not just on trip advisor but also time out, time and again this problem is brought up, and eventually people will stop coming !!!! sort this out melia management

title: Beautiful venue, terrible customer service
comment: We don't have that many good rooftop bars in London, so I was very excited to check out Radio. The views are beautiful and location is very central. That's where the compliments stop.  Table service is very slow. I experienced this on a couple of different nights. Sometimes they even forget what you have ordered. There is also a serious ATTITUDE PROBLEM at this bar! All of the staff seem to think they are above everyone else. I worked in hospitality for 3 years and so I have an understanding of good customer service. When your bouncers, bar manager, floor staff and girl managing the lift to the bar all are so far stuck up there own backsides that they forget what manners and basic courtesy are, you've got a serious problem on your hands. I watched as a guy and girl on reception chatted to each other all the time and did not once greet guests as they came out of the lift. I get the feeling the staff that work there are only there to say they "work" at Radio Bar. I don't think they are interested in making sure their customers have a pleasant experience.  It is such a shame as the venue is great, but the experience I've had (and other friends) is really off putting.

title: Best Cocktails in London...
comment: I had a brilliant night at this bar last week, intending to only stay for an hour or so but ended up being there all night (and virtually drinking every cocktail on the menu). My friends & I were met with Stefano, who made our drinks and care of us all evening. He had a great personality and energy and above all, his cocktails were amazing! I wasn't sure what cocktail to choose, so he knocked me up one based on my preferences and it was beyond good! Definitely coming back here again for a night out and most importantly the cocktails!

title: Amazing atmosphere, great service
comment: I came to Radio Rooftop bar with a few friends. We were served at the bar by Stefano, his cocktails and communication was amazing, so we ended up staying at the bar the whole night, enjoying his cocktails. The selection of cocktails was great, and Stefano was preparing them with great skill! We felt welcome and enjoyed the night.

title: Great view, music and cocktails - take door staff attitude with a grain of salt
comment: Firstly I would like to compliment the waiters at Radio Rooftop Bar for their service. I have always found the bar staff to be very friendly and accommodating. My boyfriend and I were there on Tuesday night for my Birthday and we were met with Stefano who had a great personality and energy and more importantly made some extremely good cocktails! The bar food he recommended was delicious (although the portion sizes were on the small side). I do however understand people's frustration when met with the door staff downstairs and not sure what the intention of the nonchalant / arrogant attitude really accomplishes. Each time we visit there is a different rule - this time we were met with a lecture that we should have used the outside entrance instead on the elevator by the champagne bar downstairs. We have learnt to ignore the simple minded ness we are greeted with at the entrance and enjoy the fantastic views and great music the Radio Rooftop Bar has to offer!

title: Great cocktail experience !
comment: Amazing Bar with Superb cocktails , I was we a group of friends , 6 of us , and we set at the Bar , Stefano the Bartender welcomed us in a friendly and professional manner ; We couldn't stop drinking his cocktails ... All made with great flair and knowledge in balancing the ingredients . Amazing cocktail experience !

title: Amazing
comment: The service by Stefano was the best, great views day and night and really good service - I am going again....

title: Meh.....and they charge double service charge
comment: It was OK. The view was special but nothing else particularly was.  My friend had the same experience as many others here - was waved through reception towards the lift for the bar but on arrival at the lift was told that she would have to exit back through the hotel reception, walk round the hotel and enter through a different door. This led her straight back to the same place. Hysterical. There are tons of staff but mostly standing around chatting in groups. The real gripe was when I paid. I added a tip onto the credit card when prompted by the machine but service had already been added to the bill. I felt that this was an attempt to screw more money out of the customers. Why set the credit card machine to prompt for a gratuity when it was already on the bill. With so many AMAZING bars in London, this one really doesn't cut the mustard. Sorry, the view isn't good enough to make up for lacklustre service.

title: Delicious cocktails, fabulous views!
comment: I went to the Radio Bar as quite a few of my friends were saying how good it was so thought it was about time I experienced the so called place to be. I met a couple of friends after work for a 'couple' of cocktails and was impressed from the moment I walked in. The bartender serving us was the lovely Stefano and he was a very charming guy and made the best cocktails. Well, I ended up staying for about 3 hours because the drinks were so good as was the music and atmosphere! I definitely recommend this bar and if you go, ask for Stefano!!

title: Style with no substance, service or sense...
comment: I first tried to book the Terrace Bar for a Sunday at 6pm. I was told by a young lady that to secure a table they had a minimum spend policy of £50 per head but I could just turn up on the day and see if they had tables available. Decided to go this route. We turned up after the theatre and wanted to head for the Terrace Bar to eat - on previous occasions when we have visited the Terrace Bar we are escorted from the main hotel lifts to the Bar. On this occasion we were asked (whilst at the lifts) if we were residents - when we said we were not they lady said in that case would we go out of the hotel turn right and the entrance we needed was there. So we did this and found the "street" entrance at which were another lady and a security guy and not one person in the line. So we tried again - I said we wanted to have dinner for the 5 of us and we had been asked by the hotel to come to this entrance. We were advised by a rather rude young lady that there were no outside tables available - so I asked if there were any inside tables....she said she didn't know and why don't we go up and check it out. By this time it was all becoming rather annoying and so I suggested that perhaps they could communicate with the Terrace Bar and ask them. I am not kidding you when I tell you that the young lady on the door raised her eyes heavenwards and "tutted"!!!! Anyway, there was a table available so we were finally "let in" and we walked around the corner to find ourselves back at the same lift we had just left before - when I complained to the same young lady about how stupid this was she had to dissemble and say it was "Company Policy". All this before we have even set foot in the bar!! Arriving in the bar we find not only table available inside but also on the terrace! We order drinks and food "bites" from a not very extensive bar menu - the menu contains perhaps 10 different options - after we ordered our waitress came back and told us that they had run out of 4 of the 10 items on the menu and the wine we had ordered as well!! Having nearly lost the will to live just to get up there we persevered and stayed. We were rewarded by a great sun-set and the food that did turn up was fine. This is a place that has become a victim of its own success and really really needs the Management to wake up and realise how easily they will destroy good-will. London is a City with many many great Hotels and One The Aldwych (right next door) is one of them. I think that they will sleep easily at night (except of course they wont be complacent!). Very unlikely will return again - and being a hotelier myself hope that someone in Management at ME reads this and wakes up...

title: Radio Rooftop Bar at ME Hotel London
comment: 2nd visit to Radio Rooftop bar did not disappoint. Fabulous views over London from the outside terrace tables and from inside the restaurant. Tapas menu items delicious along with the mid-priced sauvignon blanc. Well-trained, happy waitress/waiters provide great service to enjoy the Radio Rooftop experience - including getting the luxury sun umbrella in place. Assistant Bar Manager Julie Doumer provided excellent, no fuss, customer service. Definitely on our list to visit Radio Rooftop again not least for great people atmosphere and music. Thanks Radio Rooftop!

title: WHITES ONLY BAR
comment: Just this last Wednesday 11/09/2013 my husband took me to this bar after being recommended by a friend. We loved the view from the roof top and the bar was was beautiful. Our waitress told us to seat anywhere we wanted and she would come to serve us. we started off outside after it got a bit chilly we asked to go inside ad our waitress again assured us that it would be no problem and again to seat anywhere we wanted. Our waitress was very pleasant and engaged us in conversation which made us feel at ease.The trouble came when an hour later the bar started to get busy and a tall lady with shoulder legnth blond hair wearing beige mc hammer pants ( OR HAREM PANTS ) with a cream jacket came and told us to move as our seats had been reserved. i looked around and saw that we were the only ones approached and there were still some empty seats around .at this point I asked her if these same seats had been reserved an hour ago when we sat there and she looked down her nose at me and spat out a yes.and promptly found some reserved seating signs and her team put them around the best seats in the bar. she offered to seat us somewhere else (her choice was two seats in a dark hidden corner out of site) the lady was so condesending she made me feel dirty for being black and also unworthy of daring to visit aplace like that. she continued to tower over us , impatiently waiting for us to move. I calmly told her matter of factly that I would not move but would leave. My response was followed by a thousand excuses and explanations that came too little too late as far as im concerned. I was adamant to leave. One lady who seemed to have drawn the short straw tried to give us a buiness card and asked if there was anything else they could do . I only suggested to them to put a big bold sign by the entrance that says WHITES ONLY BAR and left. Now I read another review with a similar experience and im interested to know what their response will be this time. If you are looking to be humiliated please visit but if not please find another bar.

title: Overrated and rudest doormen ever
comment: Iv been to many bars and clubs around London and I have never been treated or spoken to as rudely as I was!the doorman or whoever he was made such an issue about letting us in saying it was busy when infact it wasn't! He had the cheek to turn around and say to me you don't know how it works in London when he's not even English himself!!!!!i was absolutely furious by this comment considering I was born in london,live here n go out every weekend to the best bars and clubs in London! Unbelievably rude I'm still fuming thinking about it!theyve hyped it up to be more than it actually is and all my friends agreed! DON'T WASTE YOUR TIME OR RUIN YOUR NIGHT!!!

title: Absolutely lovely!!!
comment: We were guests at the ME for 6 nights at the beginning of September and ended up at the Radio Bar at least once a night!!! The service is absolutely wonderful...from the door girls/guys, to the bartenders, to the management staff. We were lucky and never really had to wait in a queue for the elevator up, but did see the long line a few times as we came down. However, they seemed to be moving people along pretty quickly. We easily got a seat at the bar every single time and were front row for some great service from the bartenders. Fanni V. has now become our favorite bartender in ALL of London!!! She is super friendly, knowledgable, and has quite a tolerant personality. She made our Radio Bar experiences extra special. The views are amazing. The set up of the outside area makes it fairly easy for you to jump out and walk around for a bit to get a couple of pictures if you would like. The crowd is a nice mix of all walks of life and personalities. The DJ in the evening is great and gets people up and dancing. I would highly recommend a stop in at Radio Bar if you live in or are just visiting London. All of the staff is simply amazing!!! Can't wait to be back in London!!!

title: Rooftop bar with a great view
comment: Happened to be in the area, early evening on a Wednesday after a day out in London and thought it would be nice to visit the hotel's rooftop bar for a drink. My friend and I were immediately put off by the snooty attitude of the hostess girl by the lift entrance, who intially ignored us then made us walk all the way back around the side of the building to be allowed upstairs. Although we didn't have a reservation this seemed totally unnecessary. Fortunately the service improved once upstairs and the bar staff were all great. We enjoyed a couple of cocktails and the great view across the city. Would recommend booking if you want to sit on the outside terrace.

title: "She was very rude and not the least bit understanding or willing to help. She was implying I was a liar."
comment: For my 20th birthday I booked a table 2 weeks in advance, I was told on the phone that it was £100 minimum spend per table and I was asked for my e-mail address, bank details and contact details. After reading some reviews I saw that some people were having trouble getting in under 21, so while I was on the phone I asked if it was over 21s for this particular night and was told no and I also checked on their website, where it says nothing about an age restriction. I then called again the week on my birthday to confirm the table and to also move the table time back half an hour. Which was all confirmed and the woman on the phone appeared to be very helpful.  My friends and I then turned up the bar at the time our table was booked for, to then be rudely asked our age by a doorman and a woman with no sort of welcome. She then told us that that night was over 21s, to which I told her I had a table booked and I should not of been allowed to book a table as the woman on the phone knew my age. She then took a quick glance at her reservation list and told us there was no reservation in my name. I tried to explain my situation that I had called several times and had had my table confirmed and checked that it wasn’t over 21s. I told her what I had been told about the £100 minimum spend for the table, to which she told me that was incorrect and that it was £100 minimum per head. I don't know whether she was lying on the night but I know for sure that I was told it was per table as I had checked it several times. She asked me for proof of my reservation and told me that I should of had an e-mail confirmation, I remembered giving the woman on the phone my contact details but I hadn't received any sort of confirmation. Which was not my fault if I didn’t receive one. She was very rude and not the least bit understanding or willing to help. She was implying I was a liar. I asked to speak to the manager to try to solve the problem, to which she told me she was the door manager and her name was Shannon. I made sure I asked for her name so I could make an accurate complaint. The man on the door remained quiet the whole time so I can't say I have an opinion on him.  After unsuccessfully trying to reach an understanding with Shannon we just decided to walk away. To hear her say to her colleague, "how pathetic, they are really showing their age." Which I thought was very inappropriate and disrespectful. We then saw another group of girls approach the door to then also be turned away. We went to speak to them and found out they were all 22+ and had also made a reservation but were turned away and told that there was no reservation in their name. I think this bar chooses on the door who they want in there and who they think are going to spend the most money. Even though we had booked a table we weren't going to be let in because we were a group of young adults. Awful door staff, will be making sure I tell a lot of people not to go here. Do not waste your time booking a table or I would suggest no one even bothers going here at all!

title: Estupendo...mostly
comment: We stayed at the ME London in late August and visited the Radio rooftop three times. The first was Thursday lunchtime, just a quick visit to do a recce. Not many in , so could stroll around and have a good look. the views are very good. We went for pre diner cocktails on friday night around 7pm and it was fabulous. We got a seat at the bar and enjoyed a well mixed dry martini, the bar was buzzing with good music and a great crowd. we stayed twice as long as we had intended and really enjoyed it. We went for a repeat on Saturday about the same time. We did manage to get a seat but not at the bar, once again the drinks and service were good, however, the music was decidely exclusionary. Club volume drum and base is not intended to attract a mixed crowd (hotel guests) at that early stage of an evening. The bar was full and no doubt the very young crowd were enjoying it but we felt the DJ policy was intended to attract a very limited clientele, which did not include us, c'est la vie. Like some other bars it has lots of seating, all of which has reserved notices, despite the fact that no one is sitting there, what's all that about? Oh, maximising profit, silly me.

title: Awful, unwelcoming, poorly managed and tacky to the core
comment: Very rarely have I walked out of a bar or restaurant, but this was one occasion which justified it completely. And in truth, I would advise anyone ever thinking of going anywhere near this awful bar to think again. We visited as part of a birthday celebration for a few pre-dinner cocktails. However even getting up to the bar was problematic (the hotel has bizarre rules about which door you must enter the hotel from in order to be allowed to use the lift to the rooftop bar). So we entered the hotel only to be greeted by a stone-faced member of staff who told us to go back outside, turn right, then right, then enter by another door. We did all of this only to follow a maze if hallways leading to exactly the same lift and stone-faced lift operator. Bizarre and unnecessary especially as it was 7pm and there was no queue at all. Other customers had been forced to do the same thing and we're equally confused. Eventually we made it up to the bar - awful decor (think Russian living in Chelsea) - lots of white leather. Bit like an outdated 80's George Michael Video. As a result all the customers and staff seemed decked out in silk shirts and pointy shiny shoes. It was about as far away from stylish has you can imagine. The only thing to justify the prices was the view (but there are plenty of fab views from bars across London). Took an age to get served (it is table service) and the staff were inept, unfriendly and rude - so we decided we would rather give our money and time to a bar which wanted to actually have us there. Never. Ever. Go anywhere near this bar. I can't caution against it enough.

title: Rudest barkeeper I have ever met!!!
comment: I went to the radio roofttop bar before and was quiet enthusiastic about it as it offers an excellent view on london's top attractions. Furthermore I really enjoyed the atmosphere, music and the staff was very nice and helpful too. My second experience however was not as good at all. To summarize: I asked the barkeeper if it was possible to pay by card at the bar and his answer was seriously " If you have enough money on it"!!!!! I could not believe he was seriously saying that, implying I don't have money on my card. I felt very offended and I don't think that anyone should be talking to a guest like that. I believe hospitality is not the right industry for that rude character. Very disappointing!! I am not planning on returning to that venue as I highly value people treating me with respect.  Best regards, A very disappointed guest

title: Absolutely Terrible
comment: They are a bar pretending to be a club, the place was empty but they had the most ridiculous door policy which can only be classified as racist. There is no room for a place like this in the hospitality industry. Inside the crowd was quite trashy not at all what you would expect from a bar in a high end hotel.

title: Unnecessarily snobby
comment: A frequent visitor to Mayfair-esque bars, restaurants and clubs, I had high expectations for what was a seemingly beautiful rooftop bar...however, I never got to find out what the bar itself looked like, as getting up there in the first place was impossible. My boyfriend and I went on a Friday evening, and after standing in the queue for 10 minutes (for no apparent reason as there were only six people ahead of us and it was only 6pm), the hostess looked the group in front up and down before saying "no sorry, we're full" and then patronisingly adding "plus its a Friday... we expect people to dress up a little" (all this said with a look of disgust on her face). After this group walked away the woman then said to the couple ahead of us that of course they could come in... it wasn't full at all, they'd just have to pay £50 per head each and they could reserve a table, (note that this couple also had "shabby converse" like the group that were refused before, but they were better looking, so of course they were allowed entry!) so off they went into the magical lift which clearly only the very privileged were allowed to enter.The hostess then turned to my boyfriend and I and, after looking us up and down and deeming us acceptable, said "we are soooo busy, the minimum spend is £100 each to reserve a table" well, in the space of about 60 seconds the price of a table doubled, i mentioned this and the only reply was "we're just soooo busy that's all we can offer" (again said with a look of disgust). I couldn't be bothered to argue to no avail so we just left it at that. Appalling customer treatment.

title: Amazing views
comment: a great new addition to the roof top bars of London. views are great, drinks are spot on. Only thing is that it isn't so good for spontaneity - with strict capacity limits it is a place that you need to book.

title: Disgusted by this bar
comment: I'm outraged!!! I was told on the phone that 18 was a age restriction, so I arrived to be told its 21 for a 5star bar I'm disgusted to have been waisted my time by untrained staff. I rang up to be spoke to on the phone by "Lillia" the manager in a way that made me feel outraged, in not so many words called me a liar and did not deal with my compliant. A real 5star bar would not treat me with such disrespect! They Are not deserving of a penny of my money! The hotel should have nothing to do with them they put the hotel to shame. I'd get more respect getting into a grotty club in town. Do not come here

title: Good views, ok drinks, rude staff, essex crowd
comment: Ok, I have been to this place several times, both with friends and with my girlfriend. Views are quite good (if you have not visited sushi samba or the shard restaurants or any other higher place, this bar offers a great view of east london, saint pauls and the city, especially after sunset!).  Drinks were quite good, had several different cocktails and I can say they were decent. However the crowd has always been quite trashy - loud orange overweight girls and over-dressed guys (not in a good way, I remember having seen a guy wearing a FUR). Anyhow, having said that, last week me and my girlfriend attempted to go to this place again, as the weather was quite nice, however we were not allowed to get in, "unless we were going for dinner or had a reservation". It was just 6 in the afternoon and we were properly dressed and everything, both in our mid 20s (never had any issues entering any nightclub in London, from Maddox to Funky Buddha and Boujis). I have to say I was put off and won't really try to visit this place again as the lady at the door was quite disappointing (not rude, yet.. really? are you seriously not going to let me in when you let all these trashy orange girls in?!)

title: Perfect
comment: I came here with my boyfriend before we went to dinner at STK and it was the perfect start to the evening. Staff were very nice they made you feel a bit special and the cocktails were really good. Yes it was expensive but I think if you turn up and expect it to be cheap then you will be disappointed! I would so come again it was great fun!

title: Good lunchtime food, decent wine and superb view
comment: We arrived at ME for a one night stay at lunchtime to be advised that our room would be ready in a couple of hours but would we like a glass of champagne and they would find us. Armed with champagne to the roof for an excellent tapas-style lunch, the lobster particularly good, and not overly expensive. Cost £70 for the two of us with a decent bottle of wine, superb view and excellent service.

title: The worst service in the UNIVERSE!
comment: Ok... maybe not the Universe (because I haven't been everywhere) but certainly London. We were sat for fifteen minutes without being attended to. A drinks menu was 'dropped off' buy the 'too cool for school' waitress but she never returned. Having decided to leave we were asked in the lift how our drinks were by the assistant manager (who was actually very good about it, giving us his card and telling us to contact him when we're next in town for a chance to put it right). Unfortunately for Radio you only get one chance with service so we will not be taking him up on his kind offer. The views are great though, so at least we got a few pictures for nothing! (We stayed at The Soho Hotel - the best hotel bar in London - check it out!)

title: One of London's hidden gems
comment: I was quite scepticle about this place having read numerous bad reviews about gaining entry and also the poor service but i like to make my own mind up about things and wanting to make the most of the last day of summer i decided to give this place a go. Myself and my date turned up about 6pm on a very hot Thursday (the last sunny day of summer) and yes there was a queue outside but we waited patiently, like everybody else and was soon upstairs in no time. The thing i noticed was that although there was a queue downstairs it wasnt that busy upstairs- but i liked this. It meant it was easy to get a drink, you wasnt getting bumped all over the place and it added to the relaxing but vibrant atmosphere of the bar. The view is amazing and the bar itself looks very cool and upmarket and wanting to sit outside we noticed that all the tables seemed to be reserved however, on speaking to one of the hostesses, she quite happily directed us to a table where we could sit until the reserve party turned up. 3 hours, numerous drinks and some food later, the party did turn up and the hostess actually apologised to us for asking us to move. However, she then took us to another table and said we could sit there. Exceptional customer service seeing as we hadnt booked a table. I did not encounter any rude bar staff or waitresses infact i found them to be polite, helpful and very efficient and they kept the drinks coming. The prices are very competitive with the majority of other bars in London and as the night went on the atmosphere became more lively as the dj turned the volume up and the sun and the lights went down over London. All in all i thoroughly recommend going to this bar, the view alone is worth while but i genuinely did not encounter any negative aspects at all. If you go with an open mind knowing you are getting a great view in a very upmarket, classy bar with a great atmosphere this is the place to go. I definitely hope to return as often as possible in the future.

title: Stay away....
comment: My mother is a bit of a roof top bar fiend after discovering Madison's so she was desperate to try this one. Tried to book a table but got told that we cant book, it is walk in, just turn up.... We decided we would "just turn up" before our trip to the theatre on a Monday evening for a cocktail and a bit of food. The doorman reluctantly let us up but when we said we had another couple joining us in about 20 mins, he shrugged and said he couldn't guarantee they would be let in. On the way up, you meet at least 4 more members of staff at various "check points" and they all the ask the same question "do you have a reservation?" um, no, we were told you cant book? then you get all that "oh....ok" and the sucking in of breath like you are really putting them out. Once up on the roof, it wasn't busy, but we couldn't get a table as the majority of them were reserved.... odd, considering you cant book? The bar itself is very small but very well done, it is beautiful. The view is really nice too (although, Madison's for me is nicer. St Paul's Cathedral is so beautiful) We asked the waitress if we can sit on a table that was reserved from 7pm onwards as we would have gone by then and she said yes. We sat down and got moved almost immediately. The 2nd table was more successful and we had 2 spare spaces for the rest of our party. The drinks were nice and actually, our waitress was really helpful and nice and we ordered a few plates of tapas and again, this was pleasant enough. Our friends arrived and had to called us as the doorman wasn't letting them in. A total of 3 people had come up after us but the doorman was saying they were full. Eventually our waitress had a word with the staff downstairs as we did have 2 seats waiting for them and they were let up (this whole thing took about 15 minutes). The experience by now had been ruined as they felt very unwanted and the lady we were with felt it was because she wasn't dressed right (even though she looked beautiful) and she wasn't feeling very comfortable. We paid the bill and left vowing never to return.  My feelings are that this is a very pretentious bar and you have to look a certain way or have more money than sense to be "let in". I have a friend that went on a work night out and she said the clientele was awful... Traders and bankers buying magnums of champagne that light up so everyone can see who is flashing the cash... she left after one drink. The staff need to go on an English course and a Customer Service course. You can get away with being arrogant and rude to your customers whilst you are new and fresh but once people are bored and the next "new place to be" opens up, this place will be empty and have a bad reputation. It is bad enough that tourists get treated like this is normal in London but as a local, I think it is disgusting. Luckily, there are plenty of much nicer, friendlier, cheaper and easier to visit roof top bars in London. In a years time (maybe even less) this will be full of young City boys drinking their weight in Jaegermeister and throwing up in the plants and prostitutes looking for easy money while the "Made in Chelsea" lot pose for selfies  Its a shame as this could have been great. Thanks but no thanks.

title: Who do these guys think they are?
comment: Dreadful experience trying to get in here last week. Clearly have to be under 25 to be allowed in or be treated with sme civility. Started going here when it opened, when they were keen to attract custom. Now, you'tated like dirt if you look like you've been earning a living for longer than the bouncer has been alive. Fod and drink mediocre. Manners abysmal. Was virtually manhandled when I made to go through the hotel to the far more decent bar at the fantastic Cucina Asellina. I would suggest giving the Radio Bar a miss.

title: The Sunset of London
comment: I came to Radio at 6pm on a Sunday in late August for drinks with a girlfriend. The staff was very friendly and accommodating. I saw one of the best sunsets of the summer from their patio.

title: Stunning Bar
comment: Great bar! We were warmly greeted at the door and whisked up to the rooftop by lift. What greeted us was the most spectacular panoramic views of London and a well laid out bar with some funky, modern seating. We were lucky enough to get one of the comfy couches overlooking Somerset House and enjoyed a crisp bottle of Prosecco. It can get very busy, but we had a lovely waitress who was very attentive so we didn't have to go to the bar and risk loosing our seats. The snacks menu is well worth a try and the prices are pretty reasonable for such a staunning venue, £5 for a beer- same as in a west end pub! We will definitely be going back to the roof terrace on sunny London afternoons!

title: Radio Roof Bar - Service was impressive as the views!
comment: I have always had fantastic nights at Radio Roof Bar. The views are as impressive as the service and the cocktails are delicious. The waitresses are so friendly ,attentive and well presented. I am a frequent visitor now. It has the best views of London due to its prime position and the drinks are of good value for such a high quality service and hotel. The music’s wicked and it is clearly a popular choice as its always busy. I’m an Events Manager and frequently get asked for recommendations of where to go in London, top of my list is Radio Roof Bar!

title: Great Venue, Shocking Service
comment: We went at midnight on a Tuesday night for a final drink after a birthday meal. We were all very impressed with the venue and its views, but nobody appeared to be waiting on the tables. After 30mins of sitting at our table I decided to try the bar. It took another 20mins to get served despite the fact the bar was quiet and there was 5 or 6 staff on duty. When I received the bill, I told the barmaid I didn't want to pay the optional service charge because of the poor service; she told me that I would have to speak to the manager about that. Truly astonishing.

title: Disgrace
comment: I went to Radio this afternoon. Myself and my wife love STK and the Italian restaurant in ME hotel but Radio is an absolute disgrace. My sister in law was admitted without question (although not without obvious inspection) by the bouncers (at about 1500hrs on a Saturday afternoon). My eight months pregnant wife (who is beautiful - but frankly this isn't the point) was proclaimed to be a "school-boy error" as she followed on her sister's coat-tails. Had I known at the time that that comment had been made I would, frankly, have left immediately but, my wife being more demure than the bouncers, did not tell me that this had been said. Our other guests (who were not within the age profile evidently prefered by those on the door) were refused entry until my sister in law went back downstairs to plead their case. When we did eventually get a table the staff were mediocre at best. However by that time I had been made aware of the ordeal that my wife and our other guests had been put through in order to gain admission to the bar. As a result I was, to be entirely honest, fuming. However having been almost refused admission and having spent over £200 on what was a fairly mediocre magnum of champagne (the "best value" way of buying bubbly for more than 6 people) I resolved never to return to this establishment ever again.  My issue with this place is not so much that it is stupidly expensive (although it is) nor that the people who seem to populate it are carbon copies of each other (although they are) but that the bouncers and those who work there appear to consider that unless you are straight out of an Abercrombie & Fitch or Kooples advert, you are not worthy to grace their bar. This is an absolutely disgusting approach to running a drinking establishment.  Yes; the view is great. If you have no self respect by all means go there to drink. If you have even a modicum of decency as a human being however please give your money to a company that will not charge you six times the retail price of your drink and where they will treat you as something other than sub-human if you just so happen to not fit the management's / bouncers' vision of perfection. There are, quite frankly, much more pleasant roof top venues in which to spend an afternoon (Cod d'Argent in the City for example) where you will not be made to spend a fortune and won't be made to feel like scum if you dare to have a BMI that is not on the dangerously low side. However if you genuinely think that you would fit right in in the cast of "Made in Chelsea" (and would like to) then this is the place for you. However, if you have earned your own money and would rather use it somewhere worthwhile I would implore you not to waste it at this place.  I entirely appreciate that having read this review you, dear reader, will have formed the view that the writer is somewhat embittered by this particular experience and will have concluded that I am ugly and fat and annoyed by that fact as well as my treatment in this bar. You will of course be completely correct but I do subscribe to the (old fashioned) view that my money is as good as anyone elses and that I should be permitted to spend it whereever I chose without being made to feel bad about it. If being made to feel less than human by a group of uber trendy people is fine by you (or if you'll fit right in) then I wish you very many happy times at this bar. However I have no intention of spending my money here ever again.

title: Excellent evening at Radio Rooftop Bar
comment: I recently celebrated my birthday here and had a brilliant night. The views across London are breath taking, especially if you're up there as the sun sets across London. The Roof Top is spacious, the bar service was fast and friendly and the cocktails excellent. I'd thoroughly recommend visiting either for a nice lunch or a night out. Thanks to everyone at ME Hotel for making my birthday one to remember!

title: A great night out
comment: Great bar with an incredible view of London. Entry and service was friendly and speedy. Would thoroughly recommend.

title: Midweek Brunch/Drinks
comment: Came here for midweek Brunch and a lovely sunny day. The service was a bit slow, but the staff were pleasant. We didn't really eat as much we just sat back and drank. The view, like many have pointed out was exceptional. We had no issues getting in (but it was 12noon on a Tuesday) and we come here again, definitely while the summer sun lasts!

title: Awesome time at Radio Bar
comment: To cap a great strategy day with the Sandpit team, we had a table reserved at Radio Rooftop Bar from 5pm for 18 of us! We loved it...wine, beer and cocktails all went down well, along with some amazing "tapas" type plates of food. I have been previously and really enjoyed, but many of the team had not and everyone had a great time. The service was attentive and friendly. Overall, completely recommend it.

title: Rudest doorman I have had the misfortune to come across in London
comment: Went to the Radio bar on a sunny afternoon last week, with my boyfriend, who is on leave from the army at the moment, and sporting a beard, intending to have a few drinks. Was met by the most ignorant doorman I've ever come across! I asked him were they open, to which he looked my boyfriend up and down with a look of disgust on his face, replied Yes and turned his back on us!! We stood uncertainly for a couple of minutes, before having no choice but to walk away! Unbelievable! I have never had any problems entering any establishment in my life, and this has left a very bitter taste in my mouth! Would not recommend at all.

title: Don't bother
comment: We wanted to have a pre dinner birthday drink with friends so enquiries a few weeks before. We were told we could only reserve a table if we paid a minimum of £50 per head. We were told we could just turn up but there was no guarantee of being able to get in even at 7.30 on a Tuesday evening in August. So we turned up. There was no queue at the outside door. Just the rope and the back of a security guard. Eventually someone with a clipboard arrived to tell us that unless we had reservations we couldn't come it. We were a party of 10 middle aged people. So instead we went and spent a lot of money in the excellent Waldorf Hotel bar opposite where we were warmly welcomed. So my advice is to not even try to go to this unwelcoming Radio rooftop bar!

title: It's all me, me, me .......
comment: I have to start this review by saying that it relates only to the Radio Rooftop Bar. If you are lucky enough to be let in (maybe that should read unlucky...) the only solitary thing going for the place is the view which is spectacular. However, the service is appalling and the attitude is positively dreadful. Full stop.

title: Just drinks on a Wednesday night
comment: Getting in to the bar can be tricky, but a quick and polite dialogue with the guys on the door on the pavement gained access. The bar itself is in a stunning location and has some amazing views down towards the Thames. Drinks are priced as you would expect here and the range of cocktails was extensive. Staff all courteous that we came into contacts with. Would definitely return.

title: Lovely venue, rude stuck-up staff
comment: We had arranged to meet friends here for drinks before we ate in the STK restaurant downstairs (great place but see separate review). We walked into the ME hotel and round to the Radio Bar lift where the two staff behind the ubiquitous velvet rope asked if we were residents and when we said no, said we had to go out and walk round the side of the hotel (in pouring rain) to get to the guests entrance. So far so reasonable, so off we trotted, through the side door, round the corridor and lo and behold back to the same two staff by the same rope who then let us through! When we asked why on earth we'd had to go through that pointless, and wet, charade they were humourless and bordering on rude.  The bar itself was buzzing, full of "beautiful young things" and VERY loud. We will not be going back and i'd suggest you do similarly.

title: Absolutely Disgusting Service
comment: We recently visited this hotel to have a drink in the radio rooftop bar as we had heard good things about ME hotels in general. WHAT AN ABSOLUTE DISAPPOINTMENT is all I can say, I wouldn't recommend this place to my worst enemy. The staff have no interest in helping or being polite. We were told we were not allowed to go outside and if we did we had to be gone by 6pm (it only gave us just over 30 minutes) so we decided to sit inside. After asking two waitresses if we could order drinks and approx 7 of them standing around a till point chatting, chewing gum and laughing, one eventually came to take our order. When we finally received the drinks we had been seated for over 25 minutes by this time - so please don't expect service to be quick! The atmosphere was awful, it felt like we were being a nuisance to the staff who couldn't be bothered to serve us, smile at us or even be there in general. One last point, a female member of the bar staff, whilst mixing the drinks used a straw to test the drink and adjust accordingly, and then licked it as a tester. Am I not right in thinking, that she should have been trained to a higher standard in the art of making cocktails?   The hotel itself is indeed a well presented modern one, however the majority of the members of staff let this hotel chain down, with what can only be described as less than professional attitude.  Once I came home after feeling very deflated I decided to air my views with the hotel only to find that there is no complaints section or even "contact us" page on their website......I wonder why! As you can imagine I will NOT be visiting this place again and most definitely not be recommending this on to anyone I know.

title: Great views, shame about the staff
comment: I've read a lot of the reviews on the Radio Bar, and obviously the popularity of this new venue especially in the summer months has caused much disappointment to those who have struggled to gain entry. I'm lucky enough to "know-someone-who-knows-someone" and I didn't need to wait at all, but I also know my bars so I have to agree that the staff are generally average (a few are apparently more concerned with being cool than being efficient), and although the drinks are reasonably good in a 90s "been done before" way, there's nothing special about the bar, other than the view, which is without a doubt the only reason to visit.  My tip is to dress-up to avoid the chance of being sidelined at the rope, arrive early, certainly before the braying idiots get there, and if you are going to go through all the hassle, go on a Thursday when there's a DJ. I've read what Ian D the Bar manager has replied to many and he has my sympathies, but the essence of any bar, indeed any business is it's people, and the staff are generally not worthy of the venue, Ian will be a seasoned bar manager so he almost certainly is aware of the shortcomings, but it's hard to change staff in your busiest period- I'm sure some butts have been kicked though.  As far as the policies on entry, they make sense, but it does grate when you know that private members "concierge" companies can get their members in at very short notice with no queuing, and the capacity never seems to cause their members to wait. Funny that. (Also, if a bar is to allow men to spend ages in cubicles "powdering their noses", maybe a few more loos would be useful, or some cubicles with just glass shelves).  Finally, as far as I know the bar is operated by another company, not the hotel, so maybe there is some dis-connect between the two that causes issues? All in all, nice views of the greatest city in the world, maybe it will get better as time goes on, or maybe not, in which case the next wave of great bars will inevitably take over and it should be easy enough to get in.

title: Roof Top Radio Bar
comment: I went to The roof top bar back in May this year and I know I should have wrote a review there and then but I didn't. Nevertheless i have no comment to say about the hotel itself as i didn't use it. the only place i used was the Radio bar on the roof.  I was meeting some friends at 18h30 after work. My friends had been there for few hours already and I was joining them after work. I was told by the host/receptionist with a clip board in hand that I had to queue for 40 minutes in order to join my friends,as the bar had reach the maximum capacity and there was nothing he could do. The only alternative was to queue and wait for my turn.  I then called my friend upstairs and explain the situation, I was told by my friends that they were sitting on a table of 4 with 2 free chairs, the host/receptionist still didn’t want to know about it.  Then my friend came to pick me up from the bar and we had the same kind of arrogant and non helpfull attitude.  He was adamant I would not go upstairs due to the capacity , even thou there were free sitting.   After 10 minutes of debating and arguing a security guard got involve (which I thought I was going to be escorted out) but he kindly escorted me to the bar.  He defused the situation in no time, I must say his professionalism was excellent.  Thankfully the staff at the bar and waitresses were very friendly and did an excellent job.  Needless to say I did not feel welcomed is this establishment and do not fancy repeating the experience. I think they should drop the attitude and go to learn customer service at the Savoy. there you are treating like star even if you are not.

title: Arrogant, dismissive staff!
comment: After hearing about this bar from some colleagues my friend and I decided to stop for a drink en route home after dinner, what a mistake, we didn't even make it past the door, we were met with serious attitude from the very rude woman with the clip board who simply said "we are full to capacity" Now I appreciate venues have this type of policy due to health and safety which is perfectly acceptable, however she then contradicted herself by saying we are waiting for a group of 60 to turn up! We ended up with a bit of querying as to how 60 people are going to fit in if the place is already full but in the end we couldn't be bothered and took our custom to the Savoy, where the staff were delightful. It's a shame that when an establishment gets a name for itself the staff seem to think they can behave in any way they want with zero regard for customer service. From reading the rest of the reviews on trip advisor it appears I am far from alone in this experience. I go out all the time in London to many different types of places and rarely have had such an unpleasant experience before even getting through the doors of a venue! The responses to other reviews from the management basically sum up my 5 minutes experience of the place- contradictory and dismissive!!

title: Incredible!!
comment: I was a guest of the hotel for one night, and was very keen to try out the famous rooftop bar. I had read the numerous bad reviews, mostly from people who failed to get entry, and I wondered what type of experience I would have, as apparently even hotel guests had been refused access on occasions! We decided to go at around 5:30pm, and as we approached the bouncer, all we were asked was whether we were residents of the hotel, and upon confirming this we were immediately sent up. As the lift opened on the 10th floor, we were instantly blown away by the venue. It was achingly cool in design. There was a reasonably large indoor area, in a triangular shape with a bar in the middle of the room. This was surrounded by a spacious outdoor area with great views over London. On this particular day, it was quite cloudy and windy, which resulted in most people occupying the indoor area. A DJ was playing house music (apparently the DJ is present on Thursdays, Fridays and Saturdays). Cocktails were priced at around £12, which is reasonable for this type of venue. Various nibbles are available as well, which were surprisingly tasty (we had the mini-burgers, beef satay and monkfish tempura). I noted that bottle prices were slightly cheaper than what you would pay at certain nightclubs (but not by too much). The atmosphere was buzzing, and some people had clearly been there for a number of hours already. What was surprisingly was how dressed up people were, given that it was still daylight outside. Several of them probably intended to stay there until the early hours! The bar was crowded, but not too crowded, which is quite a rarity in London, especially for a rooftop bar. We managed to find a small sofa for two people. Larger tables were all ‘reserved’, but it did appear that many people were sitting here without reservations, and some of them were subsequently asked to move away. We were here for about 2 hours, and service was good throughout. There was never a long wait at the bar, and I was always greeted with a smile. I would love to return here with a bigger group of friends, but do wonder how easy access would be if returning as a non-resident!

title: Amazing bar...unacceptable staff
comment: What more can I say. The bar is amazing, views are stunning. The staff are an embarrassment to London. They are just plain rude. The hostess with the clipboard on the door was beyond belief, her attitude was disgusting. I absolutely understand firm door staff are necessary but she was not firm, she was appallingly rude and disrespectful. I got in no problem but whilst waiting to speak to her I watched her treat other people and it was astonishing. Its fine to say that no reservation no entry, fair enough. But sniggering and laughing with her college whilst ignoring people talking to her is disgusting behaviour. Even when you're let it, its not with a smile, its more of a "fine, go in, be grateful" look! And you're about to spend money at this place! No beautiful bar is worth being around staff who have such low levels of respect for potential customers. Spend your money somewhere else (which will be a loss to them, as this is an expensive place). To people visiting London, I promise this does not represent British people, there are plenty of classy bars with respectful staff.This is just not one of them.

title: Must have been lucky...
comment: Went to this bar last night with a couple of friends. We had not been able to get through to make a reservation so decided to chance it. The entrance was roped off and we enquired, to be told that the hostess would be down in a moment. We waited about 5 mins, then she appeared. There were others also waiting. We were asked if we had a reservation, we said no, but we had tried. Having ascertained that we would be only three in total, the hostess let us in. She was firm but polite. The people inside were also polite, and the barman was charm personified. Also served one of the best mojitos I have ever had. Views are amazing, it's a bit pricey but worth a visit in my view. We sat inside, but the outside seating looked great if the weather is good.

title: Great Views, Terrible Service!
comment: Took my girlfriend for a drink here for her birthday. The views over London are acsolutely second to none, however this is all rather let down by the attitude of the staff. Unless you are dripping in money they really dont want to know. Reception guy was more than happy to show us up to the bar, the lady in the lift not so much. We were welcomed to the bar upon arrival but from here it went down here. Outside tables are reserved for wealthy high paying guests only so you have to sit inside if you havent pre booked by you still get the views. We waited an age to be served, then waited at the bar, then asked three times from the table before we got served. The bar is full of extremely wealthy looking men, and women trying to catch their eye! If you dont mind being looked down upon when your money is as good as the next persons then this is the place for you

title: Amazing hotel, but don't expect to get into the bar....
comment: I took my mum to ME when she visited me recently. We looked around the hotel, which is well worth a visit, and the staff were very helpful (if a little condescending). When we tried to go to the rooftop bar 'Radio' for a drink, at 5.30pm on a Wednesday, we were told it was guestlist only, despite previously being told they don't take bookings. Apparently it is booked up for the next month. A confusing policy, and a disappointing trip.

title: Not all its hyped up to be
comment: We didn't have a reservation but turned up anyway and I was let in - must of looked ok as they turned away 4 younger girls wearing jeans. Make an effort if you want to get in. I wanted to go somewhere nice with my mum for a cocktail and a view after our meal, the views we got, cant fault the views. However its such a pretentious place to be, I felt really uncomfortable, most people were suited and booted. After a long wait at the bar we got our drinks and went to find a seat - everywhere was reserved but we decided to risk it and sit at a reserved seat that wasn't being used. We were approached by a waitress who said do you realise this is reserved? We said yes and when it was needed would move, she said ok but you have to move fast. How rude.

title: Staff who think they are God!
comment: I have to say after reading a few of the reviews on here, i now feel a little better about being refused entry to this place.  I had been told about The Radio Bar by a good friend of mine who had been a few times before, however she had never mentioned any queuing system or unfriendly door staff, so when i happened to be out with old school friends and mentioned this as a place to have one last drink before going home we were slightly disappointed to be told that there was a 'private party in place' and that we couldn't come in, ok so no biggie that does happen after all, but when a few weeks later my husband and i were turned away not once but twice within 2 weeks and told it was too full, i was starting to think the staff had an agenda to stick to and this was more or less confirmed when the very next day we got in with said friend who had been before, with no question of "have you booked" they just opened the rope and let us through.  So we finally got to see what all the fuss is about and tbh i can confirm that's just what it is...fuss! Ok so the views are great, but match that with obnoxious customers/staff and doormen who all seem to think they are part of the elite, then it doesn't make it a very pleasant experience.  It's pricey and you have to fight for somewhere to sit, hoards of people placing their bags on the sofas but standing at the railings to look over...annoying and once the Sun has gone down, you don't even have the views to keep you there.  I don't think I'll be rushing back, they can keep their views and so called luxury sofas, I'd rather sit in my own garden!

title: To be avoided for lunch !
comment: Recently booked a table for lunch as I was told the food and the venue were great. Well.... they changed their menus = no more lunch menus just few expensive sandwiches and tapas dishes. The restaurant was empty from 1200 to 1400. Waste of time and waste of money.

title: Gorgeous Views
comment: I went here for a girlie date with my friend for some pre dinner cocktails, I must admit the door staff were funny about who they let in and said it was busy when it definitely wasn't. We were asked by a member of the concierge if we wanted to go up for a drink so luckily didn't have any trouble. The bar staff were lovely and friendly and were recommending us some yummy cocktails The views are amazing and it is a must visit. Perfect for a date night if you want to impress. Reviewed on my friends blog also - http://shegoeswear.blogspot.ie/2013/06/stk-london.html

title: What is all the fuss about!?
comment: Having read all of the reviews on trip advisor I was dubious about trying this bar but my friend from out of town was keen to try it. Firstly I called a week ago and reserved a table no problem at all. They even sent me email confirmation. My friend missed her train to London so I called to move the table back an hour - no problem at all. No one was rude to us. The service was prompt and we were regularly checked on to make sure we were ok. We even ordered cocktails which were not on the menu! We sat outside, enjoyed the view, chatted and left. If anything I was a little disappointed - for all the fuss I was just expecting more. It just a typical trendy bar in London where you pay a little more or the drinks.

title: Spoiled a great day out!!
comment: After reading reviews, as three middle age ladies on a day out, we should count ourselves lucky to even be allowed up to the bar. Having stayed in the hotel in February, I suggested we finish our day with a trip to The Radio Bar. We were let through, no problem, went on the very busy terrace where some table were reserved. In one of the booths that could have seated 6-8 people were a couple who said they were just leaving, so we sat and ordered a bottle of wine (£38 + 12.5% service, for a branded wine that is frequently have on offer at local supermarket to £5.99) We received our wine, and was then told by a young woman that this area was reserved for people on their way up in the lift, and we could have a sofa inside. I told her that the reason we were here was the terrace and view, so we would happily move, if they could find us an outside table. Her response was " I'll have to get the manager then." The manager arrived and told us once again that the table was reseved for a party that were spending a minimum of £1,000. Once again we said we would happily move to another table outside. "There are no more tables available was his reply." Strange as there was a small table for two opposite empty !!! We suggested that had he any initiative whatsoever he could just add another chair to the empty table, which he did, and we moved. Now, after reading other reviews, I wonder whether we should have been 'allowed up' in the first place, and if we were just the wrong sort of customers to be sitting on their terrace. The manager did offer us an extra glass of wine, which we declined, we also told him we wouldn't be paying the service, I think he would have agreed to anything get rid of us. Bye the way, nobody came to sit in the booth, it was still empty when we left.

title: Lovely views, nice drinks... service could be better
comment: We came here to start off my wife's birthday celebrations with a quick drink. First of all it was only 630pm yet there was a "velvet rope" and we were asked how many people were in our party (we assumed it was SO busy upstairs). We got upstairs and it was virtually empty... so that was weird and gave us the feeling that the place was a bit pretentious. When we got our drinks, they were very nice (although pricey!), but that's to be expected. There were lovely views of London and as it was a lovely sunny day, it was all the more better. The staff that work there do seem to love themselves a little too much so be prepared for that! Not sure if we would go back again, as there are plenty of other roof top bars in a London which are a bit more laid back than this... but still, it's a nice experience to go at least once.

title: A wonderful experience - views are superb
comment: We were lucky enough to visit when the sun was shining and the views across London were stunning. Faced with such a beautiful view, we felt the need to order champagne. Considering the location, we felt that at £15 a glass this was reasonably priced. We went to the bar to get our drinks and didn't experience the poor service that many have complained about. As we didn't queue, we didn't come across the bouncers - but my daughter and her friends tell me they were incredibly rude when they went last week. It was a wonderful start to our evening and I can't wait to return. Unfortunately, they seem fully booked for the next few weeks. You can just turn up, but the queue was quite long and seemed to move very slowly.

title: PATHETIC! RACISTS!!!
comment: One of the worst place for anyone to go to.  I tried getting in 3 times, back to back, and could not get in. For some or the other reason, me and my friends were not allowed in.  They keep you waiting in a queue for hours long without giving any kind of proper replies, and to be honest, the entry depends on the colour of your skin, so all of you all dark skinned people, I don't think you should even look at this place. Terrible coordination among the staff below. One says something, the other something else.  THEY THEMSELVES DON'T KNOW WHAT THEY ARE DOING.  There is just a gush of people in and out that's it all.  In a nutshell, don't even think about getting there ever no matter what anyone tells you.  There are other better places to get to!

title: How hard is it to be pleasant???
comment: So we drop by to scope the place and have a drink - ignored in lobby, ignored at lift, ignored at bar entry on level 10 (we didn't give up and it's easier to get through heathrow security).... Finally someone spoke with us and it was all in riddles - can we book a table? Maybe...can we have a drink? ....maybe....blah blah blah and some day I wish upon a star! So we took ourselves off to enjoy the trust old trafalgar. - mind you it took 3 minutes for the lift to arrive as we stood steaming and just feeling strangely embarrassed by the whole experience! And NOTE the people in the lift in front of us also walked out - end of and I can't wait to see is place on top table soon desperate to get people in!!! @chanceDONE

title: Who needs a club!
comment: Came for their Saturday brunch party today. All I can say is wow!!! Entertainers dancing on everything, breathing fire, dressed in leather all in a classy environment! Staff was excellent and kept the bottles coming. I had so much fun I am cancelling my table at the Box tonight. See you next Saturday!

title: Appalling, Disappointing, Smug, Self satisfied staff!
comment: I had high hopes for London's newest rooftop bar and queuing up for 20 minutes in the 29'C sun was anticipated.  What I did not anticipate, however, was standing at the front of the queue with 3 other (incidentally, India-Asian) friends, 2 of whom had visited the bar recently to be passed over several times. After waiting patiently for another 10 minutes, we were advised by the All Important 'Woman-with'-clipboard' named Monika to wait in the downstairs bar and she would collect us when a table became available. We questioned this as it didn't make any sense. We also questioned why, when we had called to make a booking, to be told 'We don't take bookings' followed by 'We're fully booked but you can try a walk in.' WTF?! By this time, we were gasping so after a bottle of Prosecco and some tapas, my friend ventured out to talk to Woman with Clipboard. When asked why the people behind us had mysteriously been whisked up to the bar while we were left to rot in the downstairs bar, she had no answer. A saner person may have gathered their dignity and accepted that for some unknown reason (we are all smart, professional, young women who frequent the these types of bars and clubs most weekends.) After all, we should naturally be disinclined to provide profits when delivered with such disappointing behaviour of the door staff.  Being the type of ladies who don't take things lying down and not being used to hearing no for an answer, we proceeded to simply walk from the downstairs bar, stalking through the lobby and up the lift to the roof bar.The place was busy but not heaving and it turns out Woman with Clipboard reluctance was based, on what I can only assume, a racial issue. How very disappointing, given one of our group is an MD for one of London's leading PR agencies....yes, this tale will be told and people warned not to go there.  When ordering £50+ bottles, the bar staff upstairs tried to fob us off with the house bottles, yet of course, attempted to charge us for the more expensive kind. Not once, but several times! And woe betide you place your bag on a table...these tables are reserved! Reserved for whom? I asked, given that it had been empty for the last 2 hours. The waiter had, at least, the grace to blush and say 'Um, we like to keep them free, just in case.' 'And how much does it cost?' 'Well, it's ah, to the discretion of the management.' Note, we did not attempt to sit on or around the table- I simply placed my bag on it for 20 seconds! I rarely feel compelled to write reviews, let alone such a saga! However, it is clear that despite the wonderful potential of this place, it is severely let down by the disappointing behaviour of the staff, undercurrent of racist sentiment and clear lack of structure re prices and reservation structure. Disappointed- at least in Kensington Roof Gardens, nobody attempts to shoo me out of a chair when I sit down with my cocktail!  Save your time, energy and money people! Go somewhere else; anywhere else, where you're treated with a modicum of respect and you'll have a better time!

title: Awful, they don't care!
comment: Went on Friday with my wife for a cocktail, champagne and food but never got past the first cocktail. Took 15 mins to get our drinks and when I joked about delay the waiter sneered at me. Our waitress was truly dim. No personality and seem board to serve us. I only wanted to spent a load of cash after all! Do not go. Shame really as the views are great and it looks good. Also central.

title: Worst Customer Service Ever!!
comment: It's nearing my birthday, so i decided to check out a few venues for me and my freinds. I had heard this place had great views so today me and my girlfriend decided to check it out at around 3pm.  We were greated outside the entrance by somebody who worked there, really friendly spanish guy who told us where the elevator was and where the entrance is normally after 5pm. Walked in- reception area looked nice- we were impressed. Until we got to the elavator. Standing outside the elavator was easily the rudest doorman I have ever met. In an almost policeman tone- he says "And where are you going?"  Bearing in mind that my own mother hasn't spoken to me like that since I was 13- I bit my tongue and said "to have a look at the bar"  Doorman says "you can't, you don't have a reservation"  (This guy was either a psychic or he's not very good at customer relations)  Anyway- I bit my tongue again- and explained no, we don't have a reservation, we just wanted to see the place. To which he simply replied "No"  When leaving 2 managers walked past me and said "thank you" to which I responded "you need reservations to see the bar?"  One of the Managers replies (in a sarcastic tone) "yeah" Bit my tongue again and walked out.  This place may have a great view (not that I saw it)  But the customer service alone makes it not worth it. They are rude, obnoxious, pretentios and just plain bad at their jobs. I'd rather stick red hot pokers in my eyes than give these cowboys a penny of my money.

title: The Radio Rooftop Bar - not for everyone...
comment: I always wonder when reading negative reviews where the hurt egos end and real facts start.  With regards to the Radio Rooftop Bar I sadly have to agree with only 50% of the comments simply because after 2 & ½ hour queue (FACT) we were denied the view of this ‘sleek, glammed-up, ‘Sex and the City’ destination’. I have now learnt that ‘bar at full capacity’ is a better word to turn the ‘unwanted’ away – how else would you explain the door staff still letting friends and ‘fabulous people’ jumping a queue of mostly tired and yet still smiling ‘commoners’? After 1 and ½ hour wait, my friend and I were next in line to become fashionable immortals and finally join the gods sipping cocktails in this brand new Olympus of Aldwich. One more hour went by and not a sign, nor a word, or even eye contact from the tall lady at the door holding the clipboard and sharing jokes with her colleagues. She also decided that it was absolutely acceptable to turn her back to us for most of the time and leave us to wonder whether she would ever unlock the cord between us and the most pretentious entrance to a bar I have ever come across in my life. The rest of the experience you can gather from other people that have actually managed to cross that line……alas I was not one of the lucky immortals to be chosen to grace this current bastion of coolness. It is now my mission to make sure that my –dreadful- experience of the Radio Rooftop Bar ‘entrance’ is shared with everyone I know. Places like this kill the spirit of London, a city where the very diversity of its people creates the exceptional experience that is London…Do the ‘only-fabulous ghettos’ have a place in this? Perhaps they do but I don’t think I will be wasting any more of my time to experience what they think they have to offer!

title: Terrible telephone service and £100 minimum spend if you book in advance - 'You've got to be kidding me!'
comment: I had a not-great experience trying to gain entry to this venue last week and, after noting that I am not alone in my thoughts about this bar, thought I would pen this review to add to the list of gripes that others have. I have not done this lightly as I know this website attracts a lot of attention, but I was really shocked by their attitude and the minimum spend thresholds. Will be interested if I receive any response as the management seem to be very selective in which reviews they reply to. Tried a walk-in (we were a group of 2 females in our 40s) to this London bar last week at around 5.00 pm. Got through the main door OK to be met by the leggy blond with the clipboard at the lift who said they were full and suggested booking in advance for another evening. (We had spied the rooftop from the river and it frankly didn't look that packed to me so maybe we just didn't look 'trendy' enough). No worries, we left and went to another (more upmarket) bar in the same locale. So I then tried to book another evening that week. Firstly the website does not show the correct number to book the bar - you have to ring a separate number from the hotel number apparently. When I located the correct number I called and the answer message (the call had been answered so I was paying for the call) informed me I was fifth in the queue (this was at 9.30 am) and would be answered in, I recall, 5 minutes. Some 15-20 minutes later my call was answered. They could only accommodate my booking at a time that did not suit us and informed me that to book early in the day you have to agree to a minimum spend per person of £60 and later in the evening a pre-booking incurs a minimum spend of £100 per person and the only way to not incur this minimum spend threshold is to be a walk-in. I have absolutely no issue with paying for good service and a nice ambience but that is frankly outrageous given that at other, more exclusive, venues, (in the UK and abroad) it does not cost that much for a couple of cocktails. If the management of this establishent think I (or others it seems from the reviews) are going to take a taxi/walk/tube/bus over to their bar on the off-chance they have walk-in availability they must be kidding themselves. I can only assume they have a regular clientele of 'cool kids' who are willing to be royally ripped off. I am not, and will not be, one of them.

title: Great experience
comment: Fantastic views over London , great DJ creating a real atmosphere . Plenty of 'beautiful people' to watch performing . Doorman and reception were helpful and polite we had no issues at all gaining access pre and post dinner but we were staying at the hotel . A unique venue in London , just a shame can't get the general access and table booking right looking at the majority of comments . We managed to catch the end of special function in early evening with dancing / firebreathing , champagne spraying acts , which added to the experience although not sure security removing a couple of over endulged lunch guests was part of the planned entertainment.

title: Terrible service and attitude of Jose and team.
comment: DONOT GO TO THIS PLACE!! Awful hospitality!! It seems the staff is doing a favour to its guests who visit this place. This place doesn’t even deserve 1 star.
