With so many options to go to in London, I request all readers to blacklist this place. Its high time the management takes some action against the staff.

title: Moccasins need not apply
comment: Firstly, this is not my usual type of place, I wouldn't choose to come here, but I was meeting family, so that must be borne in mind when reading my review.  First, it was a hot, hot day, so I know I looked a bit dishevelled after traipsing to and from meetings all day. Secondly, I was wearing moccasins (heels in bag) for comfort. The door staff, with clipboards, pointed me to the downstairs bar. But I was meeting family at the rooftop... Are they there yet, clipboard asked. No, I said, so again she pointed me firmly to the bar with a 'try again later'. Well I freshened up in the loos, stuck my heels on, ouch, and waited with a glass of wine. Once family arrived - younger, cooler generation - we were allowed upstairs at which point I really couldn't be bothered any more. Yes, it is nice on the rooftop, and yes the views are stunning. The drink prices are as you would expect - £8 glass of wine, £11 cocktail - but my bar snack was awful. The cheese sauce on the macaroni had split. The chips were a la McDonalds. The Mai Tai was nice. Serving staff were very helpful, unlike the clipboards. Cool looking blokes in suits with earphones were openly sneering of people.  The clientele are also as you would expect, stylish in the way of city workers and sloanes. There were a couple of groups of girls on what looked like the start of big nights out.  As I said, not a place I would choose to go, but I do expect to be made to feel welcome and at ease when I visit establishments and pay good prices or food and drink. I wasn't. If this bar is class I will eat my moccasins.

title: Bad experience at the radio rooftop bar 19-7-13 (Strand London)
comment: Being a frequent visitor to the roof top bar an enjoying many a summers evening their and knowing numerous staff & security of the Radio bar. I decided to take some friends and 2 clients (an all male party of 6). The bookings were made for 6 people, minimum £600 spend, 9pm table, under the name of Staples. My guests and clients arrived promptly, sober and easliy meeting any dress code laid down by the bar, however upon our arrival, we were denied entrance, given the party was all male ??, nowhere does it state that all male parties will be declined access, not on the booking confirmation or when reserving the table.I'm not going to rant about the lady on the door (Monika), in fairness she called the manager (Brendon) at our request. he also stated that there needs to be a balance of women and men in the bar, but surely this has to be stipulated upon booking ??? we had some female friends in the area and agreed with the manager, if we brought our female friends along then we could get gain entry. After numerous phone calls and the expense of a taxi we finally got our additional female guests (7 of them) to the Radio Bar, now there is a total of 13 people, yet again we present ourselves to the entrance, yet again meeting the criteria set by the management. the management would then allow us access, based on we pay £1500 for the party, yet previously it was £100 per person and we had 13 guests = £1300. I tried to explain this in a civil, sober and diplomatic manner to the lady on the door, but was told, her manager (Brendon) had now set this new cost and was not offering a reason for this revised figure. Ultimatley the cost of enjoying a few hours in a relaxed enviroment was turning into a costly experience. Hence we had to leave due to the cost.  This totaly ruined everybodies night and caused me embarressment in front of my friends and clients too. Thanks for ruining what was planned as a really good night and constantly moving the goal post i.e an all male party and then raising the entrance fee. A very disappointed and saddened customer.

title: Terrible place with dated cocktais, bad food and horribly rood staff!
comment: Absolutely outrageous, rood and disgusting staff! I came to ask to have a look at the terrace as I wanted to book it for a big party. The man at the door told me its full capacity, I tried to be nice and explain that I just need few minutes to see the space again so I would be sure I could accommodate all my guests. I got very rood response from the host and there is nothing that could be done. I absolutely do not understand how is even possible that the HOST, the first person you see when you come to the venue could be that rood! I will absolutely will never go there again, despite the great views as there is nothing good about this place, the cocktails are dated and bland, made with cheap juices from concentrate, arrogant bartenders and waitresses and very strange Croydon of people who hang out in this place. Absolutely horrible experience, went to sushisamba after, had much better experience. I will do everything so people know how the staff treats guests there!

title: London's coolest rooftop bar
comment: I had to write because of a couple of negative stories on here about the queue to get into Radio when the sun shines. It's the coolest rooftop bar in London right now, so yes it's gets busy when we have nice weather - but by planning a few days ahead and making a reservation, hey presto problem solved! You wouldn't walk into the Ritz for afternoon tea and be surprised if they couldn't seat you immediately! The downstairs staff do control how many people are on the roof to make sure when you're up there it's a really pleasant experience, rather than other rooftops, where it's five people deep at the bar - like the terrace at Aqua Kyoto now everyone goes. Here it's ultra-civilised and it only takes a couple of minutes to get served. I had a birthday party here in one of the cabanas and my friends agreed that it's absolutely awesome - great service, cool views over Covent Garden, to Somerset House and the river, and when the sun goes down the music's turned up as there's a great DJ. They send food up from STK on the ground floor, which is great.  I've been back a couple of times since, with clients and on a date, and because I've booked, have walked to the front of the queue and straight up.... The reviews here have focussed on their difficulty getting in - but that just proves the point - it's the place to be right now, so when the weather's great you need to make a reservation!

title: Radio rooftop - problems getting in but worth it
comment: So i'm in my early 30's and a food and travel journalist - i even wrote about the hotel in a NEW HOTEL OPENING's feature for the magazine i write for on before it was opened via the PR who i know closely and keeps me up to date about new openings. Fast forward to 19 July 2013 - i finally had the time to come and check out the rooftop bar (already reviewed and been to Cuccina) I arrived at 5.50 and immediately the tall, dark haired lady at the door told me and my friend (we are two girls) that it was reservation only and that she could not let us in. We hung around a little and noticed she more or less said the same to everyone BUT the odd few people she let in.  We went into the hotel to figure out what to do where to go and bumped into a lovely, pleasant and very friendly girl called Tasha who advised us to go back out and try again which we did and this time the tall, dark haired lady allowed us in - even though it was 30 minutes later....yes it was a little hassle getting in but yes it was also worth it but not worth it if its too stressful. One thing management should realise is that people revolve their day around arranging to go to venues like this which are few and far between in london and if you can't cater for first come first served (which was what isabel told me on email via the reservations email) what's the point in coming??!!  But the ppl inside the venue (ie the customers) were very friendly, the vibe was great and it's a nice older, sophisticated crowd and it should stay like this. It was not pretentious at all - even the security guards upstairs and bar staff were nice. I bumped into Tasha again and had to approach her and just thank her for her kind words and just being so bloody down to earth - makes a pleasant change. Since my visit i have spoken to my sister who has also been and said Tasha was very nice and pleasant to her and her work colleagues when they went.  I will recommend it and will be going again - my only worry is being turned away for no reason.

title: And now the positives..
comment: Agreed, entry to the roof bar is a daunting experience and would benefit from being refined... That said the experience on the whole was indeed one I would love to repeat. I was one of a party of 7 females, celebrating my 40th birthday. My husband who had arranged as a surprise, had asked for outside seating and although he was advised this could not be guaranteed, we had a fab spot at one end of the terrace. The time between ordering and getting drinks were at times slow, but then it was busy and we soon cottoned on to ordering the new new before finishing our current. The food was fabulous, who would think deep fried cauliflower would work? It does and it tastes divine! The staff from waiting to clearing to door and management were all friendly, helpful and attentive, even the lady at the lift. The atmosphere, weather and surroundings made for a fabulous late afternoon and evening and it's tempting to turn 40 again!

title: A Great Place If You Can Find A seat!
comment: It was a lovely day and we were looking for somewhere to sit in the sun and have a drink before going to the theatre. We arrived at 5pm, and got the lift up pretty quickly. We walked out to stunning views across the Thames. It was already busy and bustling, with a good atmosphere. At first sight there appeared to be plenty of comfortable seats available, but on closer inspection most had reserved notices on them. We managed to find a couple of seats and a table in the sun and checked out the drinks menu. A good selection of wines at West End Prices, and a small selection of bottled beers. We started a tab and ordered a glass of wine and a beer. The beer was cold but the wine not so much so we asked for some ice to cool it down. This is a really chic bar and filled up quickly, and it wasn't long before all the seats were gone. We spent a great couple of hours drinking in the sun. Would come here again, and would recommend. For larger parties you may want to book if you want to get a seat though.

title: Wow! Fantastic experience
comment: We had an amazing time here and popular places need a reservations system so cannot understand some of the negative comments. With a reservation the process was simple and we were escorted in the lift from the foyer to our table with no problem. The view was to die for and it was a 33 degree scorcher. The food was also outstanding and the service attentive without being intrusive. We had a truly memorable afternoon and would definitely return - obviously with a reservation!

title: Great Bar with Amazing views of London - Lads night out
comment: Made the booking by phone the previous day for a table for 4 at 9:00pm. We were told about the minimum spend per person of £ 100, prices to keep riff-raffs at bay, so we thought. Our reservation was confirmed by email promptly and I noticed, dress code: smart /casual. We arrived the next day at 8:45pm, the girl at reception checked our names on the list and we were directed to the Express elevator to rooftop bar. (though our reservation was during a week day, I could not but notice that there were very few reservations on the list). Our reservation was checked again by another beautiful long legged blond and we were taken to our table. The bar and terrace was full people, lounge music not too over powering. As we were seated, they made us give our credit card to open the TAB and signed a white envelop containing the credit card confirming that we would spend at least £ 400. We sat down, looked at the menu and noticed that the drinks and food are reasonably priced, we ordered a bottle of champagne and a selection of "tapas", all delicious, small portions. I quickly realised that there is no way, a normal person, would spend £ 100 on food and drinks unless you are driving home. We started people watching, a great place to do it, and here comes the big disappointment. Sadly this bar, with the most amazing views of London, is not the place to bring your date. This is a place where you come with the lads or lasses to have fun, a birthdays party, look at FEW beautiful/elegant (including our waitress) women but the rest would make Essex girls proud. Forget the dress code, at least in the summer, bring shorts, tennis shoes, T shirts, etc. Shame really, OK, Melia Hotels are not Claridges but having this unique location management should make sure the ambiance is sophisticated. We ended the evening with the sensation that unless you have a table reserved (minimum charge £ 100 p.p), they will let you in anyway without spending more than £ 20 p.p. a 10 Service was courteous and efficient.

title: Sneaky ploy to keep you at the bar
comment: I stopped by with two clients on a Tuesday at 4.40pm without a reservation on the offchance that it would be quiet enough not to need one. When we arrived the gentleman at the door informed us that we could go up to the rooftop bar and directed us to the lifts. Once at the lifts we were confronted with a young man with walkie talkie and clip board (very officious looking) who told us that he couldn't let us up yet but that if we waited in the lobby bar for 20 minutes he would let us up by 5.05 or 5.10pm. This in itself didn't seem to be a problem to us - we were willing to wait 20 minutes. We ordered a bottle of bubbles from the lobby bar on the understanding that we would be shown up to the rooftop bar shortly. When 20 then 30 then 40 minutes had passed we asked to go up to the roof and were told that we wouldn't be able to go up, possibly until 8.30pm! We asked to see management at this point, who incidentally, never showed up. Having given them an ultimatum to either get us the management, get us on to the roof or give us our bottle of fizz for free so we could go elsewhere they chose the latter. Alejandro on the lobby bar tried very hard to fix the situation which we appreciated but when he was unable to get the management to speak to us we felt that we were being played a little. We came away feeling that the Melia has a particularly cynical tactic for getting people to stay in their lobby bar and buy drinks when they have absolutly no intention of allowing you up to their roof bar. A terrible experience that has put me (and my clients) off going to any Melia in future.

title: Great view
comment: Foster designed hotel, with great top floor bar with nice open terrace offering breathtaking view over Strand. Very much W-style, modern and stylish with a more diversified crowd, fewer City bankers and lawyers, more art, design and al. people. Large drink menu, great snack, London prices (but, hey, you are in London) - all in, a very nice bar !

title: Totally humiliating experience
comment: I and a friend meet every three months or so to catch up on news, usually in a London cocktail bar. When summer finally arrived this week I asked a friend of mine (in her 30s) if she could recommend somewhere serving cocktails with an outside area and she suggested the Radio Rooftop bar for its spectacular views. I looked at the website and couldn't find any details about how to book, apart from booking a hotel room - but I wasn't worried as the website also says walk-in customers are welcome. We arrived at 5pm on a Thursday evening and went into the ME hotel where we were advised that we needed to go to an outside door to gain admission. The chap who told us where to go said they had only just re-opened the bar so we didn't think there would be a problem getting in. At the door there was a small queue - about 5 parties of two to four people ahead of us. A longer queue soon formed behind us. Some people who went straight to the front of the queue were being let in, presumably because they had made reservations. Fair enough. When after about 15 minutes the queue hadn't moved I went to the front of the queue to ask how long we might have to wait for entry. The young woman at the door told me she couldn't say - it depended on how many pre-booked people arrived. She didn't give any indication that we wouldn't be able to get in so I rejoined my friend in the queue. As it was a nice sunny evening we decided to stay and wait.. Another 15 minutes passed and two parties ahead of us finally gained entry leaving two young girls ahead of us, ourselves and another woman in her 60s with ?her daughter. There were by now maybe twenty plus people in the queue behind us. I guess the six of us were a bit underdressed compared to other people gaining entry to the bar (think Made in Chelsea and you'll get the general idea) But we were all respectably dressed, eg one in a summer dress, me in a summer skirt and camisole, no jeans or shorts). At that point the young man on the door looked the six of us up and down (not in a good way) and told us that the waiting time would now be an hour to an hour and half. At that point two people came out of the building so the lady behind us asked if that didn't mean that the two girls at the front could go in. 'NO' came the reply, the bouncers upstairs have advised that the bar is over capacity. We thought it strange since very few people had gone in while we'd been waiting, but decided to accept what they said and wait a bit longer. The two girls ahead of us and the lady and daughter behind us finally gave up. At which point the male receptionist came back to us (we were now at the front of the queue) and said 'I admire your persistence but you are going to have to wait an hour and a half' We still decided to wait until ten minutes later he approached us again and said he'd be grateful if we'd step aside from the queue. My friend asked politely if that meant he didn't want us in the bar. He simply said, No, I'm just asking you to step aside from the queue. He didn't ask any of the now 30 plus people behind us to do the same. So, yes we finally got the message we weren't welcome and left. Three minutes later we turned back to see the people who'd been queuing behind us being let in. I didn't mention at the beginning of this review that my friend and I are in our 50s, did I? Though I can only assume that's the reason we weren't let in. That and the fact that we weren't wearing the glamorous outfits being worn by some, but by no means all of the customers who successfully got in to the bar. Sorry, but I cant find a dress code or any age restrictions on the website. We wouldn't have minded quite so much if the door staff hadn't let us wait nearly an hour before informing us we weren't welcome. I have never been humiliated like this in my whole life (despite having the audacity to reach 50 and assume I can still have a night out!). And I have been led to believe that its illegal in this country to discriminate on the basis of age. So I do hope all you trendy young things who manage to get in to the Rooftop bar have a lovely evening. But before you do, maybe you'd like to consider if you'd like your mother, aunt or older friend to be treated like this? Our evening was ruined, not because we didn't get in but because we were made to feel humiliated and worthless. So I hope this review may help other people avoid being treated in a similar fashion. I for one wont be spending my 'grey' pound at this hotel chain and will be encouraging my many friends, young and old, to boycott it as well.

title: Incredulous about the staff at Radio
comment: My experience was not dissimilar to that of other reviewers. A total disgrace. As she and others have remarked it is totally unclear as to whether you should make a reservation or not, even if you only want to come for a drink at 4.30pm like I did. To be on the safe side, I did email at around 12pm but never got a reply or even anybody acknowledging my email. When I entered through the inauspicious door with the name “Radio” on it, there were no signs but I managed to find my way to the lifts where some other people were waiting too. We all boarded a lift with the intention of going to the bar on to the 10th floor, only to find out that we could not actually access the 10th floor so we were all send back down. We saw a hotel staff member who said the “should be a host” downstairs but there wasn’t. The other guests and I decided to walk to the hotel reception, where we were told the hotel does not operate the bar and there “should be a host somewhere near the lifts”. No sign of a host. Having agreed to meet a friend there, I and some other guests joined a few other people, who had been waiting even longer, at the lift bank. All in all there must have been some 15 of us, in various different groups, and no host in sight. Occasionally hotel staff took pity on us and tried to locate the host for us but to no avail. In the mean time the group kept swelling to about 20 people waiting to access the bar. Not only incredibly annoying for people like me who agree to meet friends up on the terrace (one guy said his friends were already up there) but also a huge loss of income for the operators of the bar on a sunny afternoon. Finally a very snooty girl called Sasha with a clipboard made an appearance. No apologies were offered, she did not seem to see any problem with the crowd in front of her. In addition, if your name was not on the clipboard, that meant no reservation, which meant no access. No apologies for the confusion, the wait, the frustration, the misunderstanding or any form of consolation whatsoever. Just rude short answers. At least 20 people who spent between 15 and 30 minutes waiting in vain were sent away without any form of apology and still at a loss to understand what just happened and why. Even though the hotel may claim that they do not run the bar, I think this reflects very badly on the hotel.

title: Lunch on the terrace
comment: Reception was a tad disorganised with no-one there - apparently there should have been a hostess to take me up in the life but apart from that Wow and Fab. Amazing place to have lunch on a sunny day and the Nicoise Salad was lovely. Very chilled and lad back. No rushing - you wouldn't want to be in a hurry but its not that type of venue. Will def be returning.

title: Rude, Pretentious, Rubbish
comment: It’s been a while since I’ve written a review for any establishment, but on this occasion I feel compelled - a warning to others – the experience was that bad.  I recently visited Radio Rooftop Bar as a dear friend and her husband were visiting from overseas. We thought we’d go somewhere special on a Friday night for reunion drinks, and decided to check out Radio Rooftop Bar for the views. We were a group of 5. My friend and husband got there early at 5:15pm and got us a table big enough to sit 6 people. I arrived at 6:20pm, and was told in a very stuck up manner by this now notorious lady with the clip board that they were ‘full to capacity’, it was a one in one out policy, and had to form an imaginary ‘queue’ of just myself. I told her my friends were upstairs already and had a table with empty seat, but her reply was she couldn’t do anything, they were definitely full and she couldn’t tell me how long the wait could be...maybe an hour, two hours, she doesn’t know. After a few frantic phone calls to my friends waiting upstairs (who confirmed the bar was in fact quite empty) they said they will try to talk to the waiters and hosts upstairs to see if they could get me up. Waiting, I watched her turn away people with the same response, while sniggering and smirking to her co-worker – another pole up the behind type guy who seemed more interested in his hair and mobile phone . A group of about 6 came along, turned away as they had no booking, but were let up when they said they knew so-and-so (confirmed by a phone call, in front of all the people who were now queued up behind me). Various other friends with the door staff were also let up without any difficulty. By now there were a few people like me waiting downstairs who had friends they were meeting were upstairs with a table. This included a lady who was meeting a business client waiting upstairs, and was pleading with the door lady to no avail. All this happening while groups of people were leaving from the bar upstairs, so you wonder if the one in-one out policy really applies. Finally, after waiting over 40 mins, the group of people who had friends already upstairs waiting were let in by the door lady, without much of an acknowledgement, eye contact, or an apology, beside a gesture of the finger motioning us in. What a privilege. Sure enough, once upstairs, the bar was half empty. Now waiting to get served by the various waitresses milling around, my friend went to the bar hoping to get faster service and was slapped with 12.5% ‘service charge’ for the bar tender to pass over a bottle of wine and 3 glasses.  My 2 friends who came shortly afterwards were treated with the same rudeness and contempt. When asking if one of us could go down and get them, the curt reply was , ‘you might not get back up’. I can honestly say this has been the most ridiculous and pretentious bar I have ever encountered. The arrogance, rudeness and bad attitude of the door staff and hosts, coupled with the incompetence of the waitresses who had no idea of what they were doing were astounding. After reading the reviews, it seems like my experience is quite the norm here. You’d think the management would get a clue and address issues of customer service and staff training. Shame really, the views are indeed spectacular. But no view is good enough, in my opinion, for an establishment to treat their paying customers with such contempt. Save your precious time, hard earned money and take your business someplace else where your custom is deserved and valued.

title: Radio rooftop bar
comment: I have been here twice and the first experience was extremely positive with very friendly staff who couldn't wait to show us in, a helpful lift attendant and lovely staff in the bar. The view is absolutely fantastic - no doubting this. The second time was a weekday evening and I'm afraid I had a very different experience. The bar itself is still lovely and the staff in the bar are lovely but the door staff seemed very rude. They asked two older ladies to leave the queue for no good reason and kept suggesting people who did not have a reservation did not bother queuing. The strange thing was that upstairs, the bar seemed half empty. I can appreciate that they may have numbers restrictions but my overall impression was that they were concentrating on creating an air of exclusivity rather than concentraing on customers. My experience was overall quite uncomfortable and I am not sure I will go back.

comment: My experience was not dissimilar to that of the reviewer below, Amethystgirl. A total disgrace. title: Grumpy staff
comment: Very grumpy staff. The place could do with friendly waiters and better service. Bar tender behind the bar was courteous.

title: Radio Bar
comment: Great bar as 360 degree view of London from the 10th floor radio bar and you can sit outside, Very disappointed as the staff are told to say that the tables are booked when they're not, they do not value your custom, and the minimum spend is £100.00,  I was there yesterday evening having visited previously, had the same trouble, having been shown to a table to drink and eat, and then being told a couple of hours later that the table has been reserved, when initially we were told it was free. The same happened to others around us, and they were not happy either. We ended up grouping together at the same table.  Its a shame as i really like the bar and the atmosphere, but the way they treat their clients is very disappointing.

title: Amazing views
comment: we visited on a very sunny day and it was packed. Lovely vibrant atmosphere but the service was really, really slow to get a drink. Lovely place to go for a drink before dinner or a show.

title: Radio Rooftop Bar - incredulous at blatant rudeness of staff representing Melia
comment: We dined at the STK restaurant - we had a pleasant experience - it was OK. We had been keen (celebrating a friends birthday) to venture to the the roof top bar for a cocktail. When we booked the restaurant originally we were told that it would be no problem to go to the bar after the meal - and as we had an early table this was fine. While at the table we took the precaution to check with the Radio Bar that we could go and it would be no problem having spent in excess of £400 in the restaurant itself -over the course of an evening we were keen to finish the evening with a drink to celebrate. However what we were not expecting was the basic hostility and attitude we experienced as we walked round to the entrance to the bar. We expected to be shown to the bar graciously but instead were told that the bar was "full". Having said that we had phoned and were told to go up no problem we were told by these two members of staff that this was not possible (this is a hotel and we definitely spoke to a representative from the roof bar as evidenced from the phone) - as if we made this up. We then rephoned the same number from the mobile and asked them to verify the conversation. The member of staff actually said to us it was not his "job" to speak on the phone and verify anything. That was his response. We were denied access to the bar - with no plausible explanation. Immediately after - having faced this treatment - some people queuing immediately behind us - a group of 7 or 8- very casually dressed to say the least were let up to the bar (we were a group of 5 well dressed). All in all contemptuous treatment for no reason whatsoever - how can you represent a hotel and brand and treat customers in this way (I had thought I left this sort of doorman idiocy behind when I was in my 20's- made worse by our unwitting expenditure in good faith). I am appalled that someone could work for this hotel and have this sort of attitude and lack of respect- we live in London we have so much choice we are not in need of access to a bar that has some unfathomable door policy - but as an experience of an evening this attitude belongs in the dark ages and no hotel should endorse staff who think it fit to speak to customers in this way.

title: Don't Miss the Radio Roof Bar on 10th Floor
comment: Sit back, relax and enjoy the views! We went there mid afternoon for some drinks which were well made. We sat outside and just soaked up the amazing views (even on a grey afternoon!!) Well worth the trip up. Service on the terrace was friendly and efficient, and there's plenty of room to sit/stand. We didn't stay at the hotel so I can't comment on the rooms. The reception area looked fab though.

title: Roof Top Bar
comment: I went to the Roof Top Bar on Monday for my partner's birthday and have to say it was a great experience. The views of London from the bar is pretty spectacular and highly recommend a visit. Drinks are on the pricey side but to be expected for the location. We waited about 15 minutes before we were given a drinks menu which was a little frustrating. However after this blip it was fine, service became better. Overall we had a great afternoon and would visit again.

title: Very nice bar but unreasonable minimum spend
comment: I went a couple of times to the Radio Rooftop bar and always had a great time. The staff is really nice, very good cocktails and food.  That's why I thought about booking a table for my birthday next week, for about 6 people. I emailed the person in charge of reservations and was really confused when I got told that the minimum spend per person for bookings is £100!!! Which, given that the menu is actually reasonably priced, represents about 2 botles of Moet or 3 botles of Chardonnay each?! Definitetly a tad too much for a Tuesday night... I do understand the need of a minimum spend, but this seems completely ridiculous (if not dangerous) to me...

title: World's worst bar?
comment: I used to visit this bar with relative frequency when the place was very new and still struggling to get on the map. I always enjoyed it and of course mentioned it to friends and colleagues. My recent experiences make me wish I hadn't.  I recently attempted visits on two separate occasions - both incredibly disappointing. The first time I went with a friend for an after work drink and was told (in a very rude manner) that it was reservations only and also (conversely) first come, first served. I asked if we could put our names down on a waiting list only to be told that this wasn't an option and that we should just to come back later and see if they could let us in. Obviously this wasn't appealing - no-one with any sense would traipse across London to a bar that they may not get in to. Its a nice bar, but not worth that sort of ridiculousness. On the second occasion, I visited with a work colleague on a Monday night at around 10pm. We walked to the entrance where a group of people had gathered. They turned around and said (so abruptly) "What? Can we help you?" whilst sniggering. We soon realised that they were all employees so asked them if we were okay to go up. They looked us up and down in the rudest of ways before laughing in our faces and saying it was reservations only and they had no idea if they would have any availability that evening. On the latter occasion I was so incredibly shocked by the rudeness that I went into the hotel to complain. The guys on the door to the skybar radioed the doorman at the hotel to say that an "eastern European girl with a black dress and pink shoes" was refused entry and to had just walked into the hotel. This was obviously a reference to me as it matched my outfit and no-one else had walked into the hotel (however I am half Greek and half English so the description was somewhat inaccurate!). I found this SO rude and on the verge of being abusive and discriminatory. I always dress incredibly well and on this occasion was wearing Ralph Lauren and LK Bennett so "my look" was hardly an issue. I asked to speak to the manager who was fetched. She was kind but said she had no authority to do anything as the Radio rooftop was a separate business. I advised that I had never experienced such rudeness in any bar or hotel anywhere in the world and I was astounded that this was tolerated. There was a general sense of disinterest. I left for a better bar, never to return again. I am not a hugely fussy person, nor am I very demanding. But I have stayed in some of the world's best hotels and been to some of the best bars and I can honestly say this is the worst bar I have ever encountered. Service is an absolute imperative for any top venue and this falls very far short of the mark. The door staff are rude, uncouth and ill-mannered people who believe that having a clipboard makes them somebody. They have ALOT to learn about the hospitality industry - though I doubt they will learn as they seem too arrogant to even care.  What the Rooftop bar didn't know when they behaved so badly is that I direct the corporate accounts for my company and will never consider sending any business their way ever again. It may not make a material dent but it will certainly ensure that the reputation of this place amongst decent, modern companies is lessened. What a shame that a place with such potential has become a D-star nightspot. A truly poor experience.

title: View was the only highlight.
comment: Dressed to the nines and ready to head to see Charlie and the Chocolate factory, we decided to meet friends who work nearby. Our friends arrived early, went upstairs and held a table of four for us, where they had a drink.  We arrived some 30 mins later to be advised we couldn't be let upstairs as we didn't have a reservation, even though our friends were already seated at a table for 4 with two empty seats waiting for us, and they were not ordering food until we got there. We explained all this to the rude hostess, who said it didn't matter if there were people waiting as there was no reservation.  I fail to see the logic, let alone the business sense, in having a table half full, which won't be ordering food until its filled, while the rest of the party is downstairs being told they can't enter for lack of a reservation? I realize that generally higher calibre intellects are in the management side of a hospitality business but can you please inform your staff that a table that isn't spending money or being turned around quickly is not the ideal for increasing profits?

title: 'Receptionists killed the Radio Bar'
comment: I had a drink in the bar on 3rd July. I was a guest of a friend who had reserved a table and had been there at least an hour before I arrived with two other guests @ 6pm. Upon arrival I told the Lady with the clipboard, the name of my host, and for about 5minutes she seemed to have'glue ear' coupled with an inability to read the names of the guests. She prompltly said no, she was not accepting walk ins and our host was not there. Our host then called us from the bar and asked what was going on and I told him, I then gave her his name again, she scanned her clipboard and said he was not there and she was not accepting walk ins and the bar was full to capacity. (think the clipbaord gave her super powers, God help us if she had, had an earpiece).After an exchange of phone calls, with our host, we were let in, when our host sent someone from the bar upstairs to collect us. This lady, who came to collect us, was extremely polite and apologetic for our wait and the misunderstanding. Bar has fantastic views, good music, friendly and mixed crowd. Staff in bar were very service orientated and extremely helpful. If I were going on the attitude of the door staff upon arrival, this bar would a no no. One thing I detest are door / reception staff with bad attitudes. This is the first impression people receive upon arrival, and if it does not change, people can and will take their business elsewhere. These are hard times, and people do have choices, and for a bar in this price range, there are plenty of other places, that you can get a better service and reception. So using the old scam of trying to create a queue, to create hype and interest does not fly anymore and people can and will go elsewhere. This could be a really great bar, or become a fly by night, that people flock from, as soon as the next hot place opens.

title: Has potential, but there are better rooftop bars in London.
comment: I went to Radio Bar with a colleague the other day with the intention of meeting a client there. We arrived at about 6 and were made to queue for 10 minutes by two very rude door staff who seemed positively annoyed that we had troubled them with a few questions, before being let up to a fairly empty room. The bar is designed so that the seating outside dominates and there are very few areas to stand if you have not reserved a table. I called up in advance to reserve a table but was told no reservations were taken before 9pm, so I was surprised to learn that there was another list you have to put your name on in order to reserve a table - why was I not told this on the phone? In addition to this, we were told there is a minimum spend of £50 per head if we do place our names on the list to reserve a table.  We ordered a couple of rounds and I was disappointed to see the bar staff free pouring the spirits. When I'm paying £10+ for a G&T I expect the bar staff to use a measure as a sign of both quality and consistency. Needless to say both of my drinks differed in strength quite a bit - not good enough for a 5* Hotel bar. The service was very slow and we had to wait for about 10 minutes for each round.  When my client arrived the bar was quieter than when we had arrived, but he was told by the doorstaff that there was a 30 minute wait, so we decided to venture elsewhere at this point.  Radio Bar need to sort out the ambiguity with the reservation policy and employ some more friendly doorstaff. I understand there is a need for a queuing system sometimes, but I don't expect rudeness from this kind of place. The bar certainly has potential and is worth a visit if you can get in without the fuss. However, if you want rooftop drinking then go to Aqua, SushiSamba or Coq D'Argent, they are all much easier to get in and all have open air terraces.

title: Fab London views
comment: Lovely smart bar with fantastic views over London, helped by the gorgeous weather the day we visited. Only had a ceaser salad which was perfectly nice however the dessert I had was absolutely exquisite. Very reasonably priced for west end of London. Service was a bit slow. We waited about 15 mins for our wine to arrive even though it wasn't very busy. We also found we had to ask for another bottle of wine and ask for the menu for dessert rather than them being a bit more proactive and offering it! Certainly wouldn't stop me from visiting again or recommending though. I can't wait to visit this place again!

title: What a fabulous place especially when the sun shines!
comment: I went to this place with a few girlfriends on a weekend to London & it is truly spectacular! It has the wow factor! Yes the service could be better, they forgot things& I had to get up twice to ask for our order to be taken, however in spite of this - the food was great, the atmosphere is brilliant & you truly feel like you are in MIC!! Cocktails are yum! I will defi be back!

title: Far from a 5* hotel bar
comment: I had very high expectations about the Radio Rooftop Bar: the views over London and a new 5 star hotel bar. Maybe that's why I was so disappointed... I went to this bar with my friends (4 of us) on a Thursday late afternoon for drinks. To start with we were asked to wait for the receptionist outside (not very welcoming!), then we were asked if we had a reservation - no - to what she made a face like she was confused or was not certain to let us in... She finally said ok and escorted us to the lifts. When we got to the bar there was another receptionist that came to us asking if we needed help, (lack of communication from my point of view) we repeated ourselves and said we would like to have drinks to what he said: " I do not have any tables available at the moment, errr, I only have that booth over there" (a booth, one chair and one table! Exactly what I have asked for, maybe I did not express myself correctly?...). Well we got ourselves comfortable and chose our drinks, it took a while for someone to take our order but fine. Drinks were average and service poor. No one came to check if we were happy with the drinks and no one offered a second round. A part from the waitresses, in those very tacky dresses, you could not say who works there. All managers are dressed in different way and when this gentleman approached us I was not expecting him to take our drinks order. Also something to note that I felt was very unprofessional, the waitresses had their hair loose and there was one specifically always touching her hair. Have they had food safety training?? The view is definitely amazing but there are other places with a great view and better standards and service. If this was a pub or any bar around I wouldn’t be surprised but I was not expecting this from a 5* hotel.

title: Booking? Afternoon? Ridiculous
comment: Honestly who needs a door person with attitude at 5pm just to get a drink. Don't know if I will ever see the view but don't care. The people are rude and no place is worth that.

title: Incredibly rude and arrogant staff.
comment: I tried to go here for a drink with a friend and encountered the most incredibly rude and offhand staff I think I've ever experienced at a hotel in London. We were told you needed to have reserved an area (although it doesn't say this anywhere on their site) but were also told that it's first come first served. A highly contradictory statement. We asked if it was closed for a pivate event and were just told 'lots of things are going on' in a very blase fashion and to come back at 9pm and try again. We were surprised by the rude and unhelpful manner of the man we spoke to, so decided to go inside the hotel and speak to someone who was perhaps a bit more friendly. We were then actually chased in to the hotel by another man asking where we were going. At no point did anyone offer for us to try out one of the other bars or perhaps ask if we wanted to reserve for another occasion. We were practically chased out of the hotel as if we were rifraf from the street! I can appreciate that there might be a procedure in terms of reserving an area but it was the way we were dealt with that I found abhorrent. Absolutely shocking and arrogant behaviour and I will not be returning.

title: Early stages.....
comment: The staff are brilliant, but it is too much for them. We had three bottles of champagne, because I couldn't see the bar coping at all and serving a bottle is straight forward thing - right? Wrong!  It is a fantastic view, but the place is new and boy they struggle. It is too early to judge really, but if they don't learn to deal with the volume of people soon you will continue to get slow or no service, warm glasses and stressed staff. The staff are using the guest toilets and dispite that fact the toilets were a disgrace. I asked the guy next to me with a walkie talkie to call someone and they tried to clean it. It all good and well to be called 'Sir', but I just want a clean toilet. Also, if you run a 5* roof terrace you have to be ready for a big night when it is a) Friday and b) the weather is great. Why would you run out of items like cigars? Lets give them a few more weeks.....

title: Radio rooftop bar
comment: I've been to other hotel Me in other countries, lived in HK, Sydney and London, enjoyed a good range of cool chic places.. We called to make a reservation for my go away for Tuesday and was told we didn't need a reservation before 930, just show up. The hostess downstairs was nothing buy rude, eye you up and down and was not helpful at all. We are all professionals in our late 20s, attractive I'd say and do not need this type of service..  Don't mind if people are judgemental for a reason but really... the hostess?

title: The best rooftop bar in London
comment: Radio Bar is like a slice of Marbella in London - it's fun, it's funky, it's amazing. The view will knock you out. The seats will entice you to sit back and chill, the music is funky and mellow and a glass of chilled fizz never went down so well. Service can be slow unless you're ordering champagne by the bottle, but other than that this is an AMAZING place to visit.

title: Rude
comment: I'd read the reviews on trip advisor prior to attempting to visit this bar and thought that I'd try anyway-what a mistake we didn't even get out of the lobby. I tried to take my sister's hen do there and at 4:45pm on a sat afternoon we were told that they couldn't let us up as they were full to capacity!!!! Really??? That time on a Saturday afternoon despite having doubled their capacity allowance recently?! What really happened was they saw a group of women on a hen do and decided that we clearly weren't the type of clientele they wanted-all we were wearing were tiny tiaras which could've easily been removed had we been asked otherwise we were all dressed up and perfectly respectable with a lot of money to spend! Funny how when one of the other bridesmaids had called previously we were told that at that time of the afternoon it would be no problem and we'd be more than welcome to come for a drink. All the other negative reviews are correct-don't bother trying to get a drink here-you're money is better spent elsewhere.

title: Radio Bar - Rude & Arrogant Staff
comment: First of all, I would like to say that the location and decor of this place is amazing. The views over London are stunning. However, the staff let them place down incredibly and can definitely put a downer on your night and leave you reluctant to return. I booked a table in advance for 8 of us for my boyfriends birthday and was told there would be a minimum spend of £50 per person. This was not a problem at all and we were all happy to pay this. On arrival we were taken to a table that didn't have enought chairs, some of us had to squeeze together. We were not introduced to our hostess and not given any menus. She came over and said 'sorry, you cannot sit here, it is reserved'. I explained I had actually reserved it and she went to us menus. Then another member of staff came over several minutes later and said the exact same thing, asking us to move. A little embaressing to say the least in front of my party of friends. Several bottles of wine and cocktails later, another member of staff came over and wanted me to sign an agreement to what equated to £75 per person and for 11 people. I told him we were a party of 8 and that when I booked it was said we only had to pay £50 pp. He insisted that it was £75 pp and I must have been mistaken. Luckily, I had printed the email booking I had made with the Reservations Manager. I showed this to him and he went through it with a fine toothcomb and then said 'This email is from April. Our prices have changed.' This conversation went back and forth for around 15-20mins, with his attitude being something to desired. He was incredibly rude. We eventually got him to agree to £50 pp but for 9 people, even though we had always been 8. I was tired of arguing by this point and wanted to get on with the night. The tactic of waiting until you've had a few drinks before trying to pull a fast one on the minimum spend is awful and to be honest we probably would have ended up spending more £75 pp anyway, but after this member of staff did this, we deliberately kept an eye on what we were spending and kept to £50 and guess what? No tip either. Train your staff in some customer service. They are already getting a reputation for being some of the worst.

title: Oh dear, I wont be returning!!
comment: What a shame, this place could have been so much better, the location is great but thats it. Awful greeting at the front, we were looked up and down when we asked to have a drink on the rooftop, my sister and myself were dressed nicely as we were out for the day and this was not done at J sheekey, the boundary rooftop (great) or dishoom where we later ate, also went to Sushi Samba Saturday and they are great there. We should have turned round then. It was full of lips and *its!! Not a nice could for a Monday lunchtime.  The hotel is new but the design is not nice, it is just showy and almost dated. All the tables said reserved on so hard to find a seat to even sit outside, nobody took any tables when we were there. All in all a unfriendly experience especially when we were out for my 30th Birthday. Wish I had looked at the reviews here like I normally do.

title: Radio Bar- What a terrible experience, don't bother
comment: First of all it was very difficult to get through to radio bar, but when I did this is what happened.... Tried to make a reservation for Radio Bar for my engagement party for Friday May 10th and was told that they don't take reservations on Friday it is too busy. Decided to move the party to a Thursday night so I called again and was now told outright they don't do any reservations only walk ins.  Frustrated as I was, fine, if that was their policy then I had to have my party elsewhere.  But what really infuriated me is that I called back today Weds 5th of June to check that I could walk in and I was told that they are FULLY BOOKED!!  So what is it? do you take bookings or not? It is a different answer depending on who you talk to or which day it is .. Spoke to a senior manager of the reservations team, but he could not offer any sort better customer experience whatsoever ... basically admitting they they have been trial-ing different policies.  Forget it, these people have no idea what they are doing.

title: Staff need some serious training
comment: Walking in on a Saturday night we were expecting it to be busy so when we were told at the door they were at capacity and had to wait we didn't complain. After waiting on the door for 15 minutes we were escorted to the lifts, we got out and to our surprise the place wasnt even half full. We found ourselves a table as the hosts just watched us walk by without any acknowledgement and waited for a waitress to be served. After waiting for 10 minutes we finally had someone walk past and acknowledge the groups presence and take out order. We waited 20 minutes for the drink (it was 1 cocktail and 2 spirit mixers). I would understand if it had been really busy but the place was very quiet and service was not up to scratch. No matter how good the views are you will not be getting return guests with service like that.

title: Radio bar review
comment: Wasn't sure what to expect. The reviews that I had read were not particularly good. I went with my wife and 4 other friends. We arrived about midnight on Saturday night and wasn't sure we would get in. Anyway we strolled straight in to the ME up the lifts and got a great seating area overseeing the fantastic views. We had a great night and left about 3.30am. The drinks were a little pricey but to be expected in this type of style with fantastic views. A great night.

title: On the roof in London
comment: Wonderful weather brought the crowds to the roof top garden on the top of Me. When I got there it was no entry due to health and safety. I did eventually get up to the roof top to meet my friends who had saved me a seat! Thanks to Bruno manning the lifts, I found the team very pleasant and helpful. Not a bad price considering the central London location.

title: Amazing Staff and Service!
comment: I visited the Radio Roof Bar with a group of friend for cocktails and nibbles! We weren't dissapointed! I thought the hotel was uber cool and just what London needs! We couldn't thank the staff for being more helpful, especially the gentleman in charge of the conceirge team! We will be back!

title: If it wasn't for the staff, this rooftop could be the best in London..
comment: I have been to Radio a couple of times now and it really is a hit and miss. The food is pretty avarage and the wine selection is OK. The only thing going for it really, is the spectacular view over London. The staff is just so incredibly rude and arrogant, that it makes it such an unpleasant experience every time I go, that I will not return. There are many other rooftops in London, which offer the same view plus a nice experience.

title: Great view - remarkably easy to get in it seems!
comment: Came here midweek after having lunch in the Italian Restaurant on the ground floor. We mentioned we wanted to try the Radio Bar and they arranged for someone to take us to the lift and up to the roof. Very simple but this was mid-afternoon, midweek. Sat outside on the terrace - no hassle about being moved from table to table etc as mentioned in other reviews. Service was fine - not overly in your face. Cocktails about £11. Had several. Was getting busy by about 6pm and they clearly had a couple of corporate type groups who seemed to have reserved sections. I liked this place because of the stunning views. I think that's it really - there's no real atmosphere. I wouldn't queue or wait to get in here - or bother to book for that matter. It's just a bar. Fab view though.

title: Very good rooftop boutique restaurant
comment: Excellent venue for groups Meetings nice food Fantastic view of London Westend from roof Bar and services very good Very good location near Waterloo easy transport unusually fabulous internal Decorated lounge

title: Worst hotel I have ever visited. Mainly due to the roof bar which was discriminatory.
comment: I have travelled to over 110 countries and stayed at over 2000 hotels with bars. Initially I was impressed by the hotel. But after visiting this roof bar I had such a dreadful discriminatory time. I would never ever stay or return to this place.  I wanted to go to are toilet and went to to handicap toilets. On exiting I was accosted by security who barated me for using that toilet as I was not in a wheel chair. I stated the sign meant it was for use for anyone with a disability and that as I am disabled but not in a wheelchair I was allowed. The security then argued with me for another 5 minutes.  I have never been treated in such a aweful manner. I was subsequently told by hotel staff that they have frequent complaints from people using the bar. However the hotel management does nothing to rectify the situation.  Thus I would not recommend such a hotel to frequent.

title: Did not go in the end...
comment: Was very keen to book this place to have a drink on my anniversary. Tried calling them over 2wk and either -  1. Kept on permahold by the operator 2. Transferred by no response from Rooftop Bar and no voicemail 3. Told by operator that they are gone home and to call the next day Finally when I got through was told it was a min £50 per person spend for a table at the Rooftop bar - ok!!  But they cannot guarantee me a table outside - hmmmmm!!  And after 9pm it was an additional £75 per person spend - What a joke!!!! Ended up going to Bar 45 at 45 Park Lane... and had a great evening! Fabulous place, eats, drinks and service was very attentive!!

title: Don't Bother
comment: Radio Bar was recommended to us by the staff of The Delauney across the street, where we occasionally dine. When we arrived at the street door, the young man guarding it said brusquely that we would have to wait until the hostess arrived to usher us upstairs. We stood on the street for ten minutes while others queued up behind us. When the hostess finally arrived, she smugly explained that the bar could not possibly accommodate even two more people. She offered no information about how long the wait would be. Neither she nor the door guard was friendly or welcoming. So, we all know what's going on here: Keep a queue on the street to create the impression of popularity; Hire a supercilious staff; hope the hype will keep people queuing up. Who needs a cocktail and a view that badly? Unless you need the affirmation of drinking at the place of the moment, don't bother waiting in line. Find one of the many great places in London that will graciously welcome you to enjoy a relaxing cocktail. This place will be old news next year.

title: The views don't make up for the service
comment: Where to begin... Prior to going I thought it would be a good idea to try to reserve a space in the bar knowing that it would be popular, only to find the bar has serious difficulty answering the phone so could not find out or make a reservation. The website didn't provide any information to suggest booking either. Apon arrival I was greeted by the most unhelpful staff who decided to make up an admission policy seemingly on the fly and then hide behind 'It's full and you'll have to wait 1 hour'. My girlfriend, who had arrived 5 minutes before me was let straight into the bar, confirmed that the bar was empty. After much persuasion I was eventually granted 'admission'.  The disappointments and frustrations continued inside the bar... from the bar staff who didn't know the menu and forgot drinks orders to the front of house staff who where rude, unhelpful and more interested in walking around like peacocks then actually working. For somewhere trying to provide a 5 star service it falls shocking short of the service levels be expected. Overall a very disappointing experience and one which I wouldn't recommend or repeat.

title: Amazing!!!
comment: We had heard rave reviews about this bar so decided that we would head up, especially considering the weather was so good! We weren't greeted at reception so just headed straight for the lifts. After standing in the lift for a minute or two we realised that the lift did not seem to be working. After asking a passing concierge, we were told that we would have to wait for the hostess to take us up. Once she arrived we hopped straight in the lift and headed for the bar. (I would recommend booking as they don't seem to let people go up without a reservation-unless it's quiet) A soon as you walk out of the lifts you are in awe of the fantastic bar, balcony and most of all the views. You can see everything from the Heron Tower, The Shard, Tower Bridge and the Houses of Parliament! I cannot explain in words how stunning the views are. We were lucky enough to get a table on the balcony, all of which is pure white granite. The manger brought us a menu and asked for drinks. We ordered a bottle of cava for £64 - not a bad price considering the quality. The lunch menu had a good selection of food, from the usual club sandwich to octopus. We had octopus (£11) and white bait (£9) to start followed by a club sandwich (£11) with chips. I would like to point out that I think this was the best octopus I have ever eaten! The staff were attentive through out making sure that we we comfortable and had everything we needed. I think this is one of the best rooftop bars in London and one that I will definitely be returning to with friends and family. I would definitely recommend this bar to anyone looking for a bar with views, somewhere to impress a date or just somewhere to relax. A fantastic vibe, great views and realistic prices for the type of bar.

title: Turned away outside the hotel!
comment: So, London presents us with fine weather at last! Upon recommendation we made our way to the ME hotel on the Strand on Saturday, to visit the rooftop bar for a spot of lunch and/or drinks (group of 3 people). We were greeted outside the hotel by a member of staff, and promptly turned away, being told the bar is full and we can't even go inside to have a look due to health and safety! I mean PLEASE. That is such an insulting experience, I could hardly believe my ears. Not that it should matter, but all of us were dressed very appropriately for this type of establishment. Even if the rooftop bar WAS full, to not grant one a LOOK even, to see if it's worth coming back later, or offer to make a reservation for later, or offer us drinks perhaps indoors, because the bar is full... no, none of that. Just sorry you can't go in because the terrace is full and you can't even have a look (I expressly asked this question). What a let down and unprofessional reception. I won't be back and I will continue to tell my friends about the treatment I have received here. This all happened on the pavement outside the hotel.

title: Amazing view spoilt by very bad service
comment: The view is amazing but very very poor service: my friend booked a table for 7:30pm, they called her during the day to say that sorry but they had overbooked!! So advised us to come for 7pm and try our luck. We ended up having to queue for 30 mins downstairs. We managed to get a table outside but as soon as we ordered, the waitress told us that the table was booked for 9pm and therefore we had to leave at 8:30pm. We managed to almost finish our bottle of wine for that time, paid the bill, and only had a bit of wine left in our glasses by 8:30pm, but the hostess still came back to tell us we had to leave, even though they still had 30 mins before the next guest arrived. We ended up sitting at another table and when we left at 9:15pm, the guests still hadn't arrived. We tried to "complain" to the manager but all he did was defending their policy that you need a minimum spend to be able to get a table. So the view is great but definitely not the service!

title: Such a Shame
comment: I have been to this bar twice (well nearly twice anyway). The first trip was with work midweek and was greeted by rude and snobby staff at the entrance and again 30 steps on at the lifts. After persuading them I really was part of the work booking they seemingly reluctantly allowed me into the lift and to the bar. It's an incredible view (has to be one of the best in London looking back at the city). Drinks were good although overpriced. But you're paying for the view so fair enough. The second time I attempted to return with my girlfriend before dinner (booked STK in the same hotel). At 6:30pm on a Saturday I enquired whether we'd be able to go for one drink. I was cut off and asked if I had a reservation. As I began to explain I did not but that I was dining in the hotel restaurant and only wanted to pop in for one quick drink again I was interrupted and told to move aside. Move aside for whom? There was no one else around. London can be like this in such establishments but at least normally it is done politely. The level of rudeness and complete arrogance of the door staff completely spoil what should be one of the nicest new places in London.  Sadly from top to bottom the staff within the premises lack any sort of decorum or politeness.  Don't go unless you have a booking or are prepared to be treated like a spec of dust...

title: Great location with views, food and drinks.
comment: I had been lucky enough to see this bar before the hotel had opened and have been really looking forward to going. First thing to point out, which I have seen in other comments, is that the bar is accessed via an entrance on Aldwych rather than the ME Hotel entrance on the Strand (unless you are staying at the hotel). You are then escorted to the lift (which requires a hotel card so you can't get in without being escorted). Myself and some friends went on a Saturday afternoon, with a reservation for 3pm. We were told that to get a reservation in the evening would mean a minimum bar tab, and although it is a reasonable price (considering the cost of drinks) it was not something we wanted to do. On arrival, there were no tables outside free, but after a while we were able to get one on the south side overlooking Somerset House and the Thames. Fantastic views from the city, Docklands, South Bank, London Eye, Houses of Parliament, Buckingham Palace. Could not complain about the views, except maybe about the weather. Cocktails were very nice and a reasonable price (around £10), but beers and spirits were really overpriced in my opinion. The food was also well priced considering the location with a varied selection from burgers fancy finger food. After sitting for a while we discovered that certain tables could be reserved. This was not very well marked, and in the end we had to move a couple of times over the 4 hours we were there which is not exactly ideal. I understand that people book tables but it wasn't nice being moved, and we could see others were having similar problems being moved about. Overall very good experience, and I would go back again, but next time I will be booking a table outside for the duration of my visit.

title: ME - Roof top bar also know as Radio Roof Top Bar
comment: Sorry to say unable to repot on how this bar at this hotel was do to the way they screen people. We were dresssed bussiness casual and want to go for a view and drink aroun 5pm. (1700). We asked the person in charge how to get to the roof top as there is lots of doors and turns in the building. He refered us to the girl down the hall.. She looked us up and down and seem to be disppointed in our dress. Then she said "we are full and unable to accomade you" We asked if we could wait and she implied that we are full. From the street we could see plentey of area up on the roof but seems if your american and not dress in the suit and tie dont come to our resturant. Sorry as it was a hightlite to go to this bar. mj

title: Fantastic view
comment: Had a great evening in here. The highlight being under a cover on a bed sized seat, on the rooftop, overlooking the shard with a bottle of wine. The first look is like something out of buck rovers, with,a futuristic looking bar and the walls are actually cinema screens with jelly fish floating around

title: Shambles, very disappointed... Prepare for a rant.
comment: 4 of us arrived at 7, wanting to grab a few cocktails before heading home after a great birthday meal at the Savoy... Well that was the plan, so the rant begins... The doorman on arrival told us that we should have booked but to talk to the hostess to see what they could do, she wasn't there but a man with a clip board said they were currently full but if we were happy to wait he would add our names to the list and it should be around 1 hour wait, so we waited in the lobby bar... Ordered drinks (only 1 beer in stock was cold -draft was off) waited ages then the bar man came over and explained that the guy who had taken our order had disappeared downstairs so he needed to take our order again.  Sometime later our drinks eventually turned up. Cocktails were okay nothing to get excited about. After 1h 20mins one of our party decided to see what the wait was like with the hostess as we had not been updated... She who was now back - said it was highly unlikely that we would be able to go up and she didn't know why we had been told otherwise, they were full and we shouldn't have been put on the list.  Why she couldn't have come and told us that while we were sat waiting in the bar I don't know, they knew we were waiting as we were on the list... Annoyed with the service we decided to give up, we then got stung with a 12.5% service charge on drinks we had to order twice and then wait for ages to arrive. To make matters worse the waiter tried to discretly beckon up a group of 4 girls that had arrived sometime after us and were on the list after us... That just summed the place up... Need I say more!   We spent the rest of our evening at skylon, on south bank, great views, amazing friendly staff and wonderful cocktails. Evening saved.

title: Pretentious- all Style & No Substance
comment: Visited the Radio 'sky bar' at ME hotel for our wedding anniversary. Was told by the front of house staff that there would be a forty minute wait before we could go to the sky bar because it was 'at full capacity'. Waited 1.5 hours to be told that we were still no further forward on the waiting list even though other people were leaving/ entering.  After some polite chat we were permitted to go up to the bar only to find that it was virtually empty. The cocktails at £12 each plus service charge were no better than those on offer in the local cattle market for £3. The service was rather slow and staff generally did not look as if they wanted to be there. On exit we noticed a group of 3 young ladies being told that there was at least a 30 mins wait before they were permitted to go up because the bar was so busy. We questioned the front of house staff on this and were ignored and then fobbed off with poor excuses.  I've been to several 'sky bars' in the Middle East and Asia where the view, the drinks and service are reflected in the relatively high price of the drinks etc. Radio is average at best. All fur coat and no knickers I'm afraid...

title: great views
comment: for the amazing views i wanted to give this a perfect score, but having visited twice in 3 days had 2 totally different experiences. on Sunday we went at lunchtime and had a very very good burger each and a bottle of wine which with that bloody awful service charge was £55.00, but the service was very good, the young lady told us all about the history and had lots of time for us, on returning with friends on Tuesday @ 5pm was a different story, place was packed, nobody to take our drinks orders and had to got to bar and still pay service charge, not acceptable, need to have a booking system in place would rather book way in advance and know you are going to get a table rather than turning up and waiting, and to say after 9pm there has to be a minimum spend per person of £50.00 per person to book is ridiculous

title: Not the only rooftop bar in London, and certainly not the best!! Give it a miss.
comment: I recently visited the ME Hotel in London along with 4 friends as part of a deal - £25 for a 3 course meal at Cucina Asellina restaurant and a cocktail which can be enjoyed at the Radio Rooftop Bar. This was the main draw for us – great views of London with cocktails – perfect right?! Wrong. We were left greatly disappointed.    I got to the bar around 5:30pm with a friend and went straight to the rooftop bar to wait for the rest of our group. We ordered a couple of drinks and took in the views from the terrace, which are stunning. Another of our party arrived downstairs and they were told by a lady waving a clipboard that they were not allowed to come up to the bar as it was full to capacity. It was not. We had a table ready with a seat for her and, being a Wednesday night there were perhaps 4 people at the bar (max) and plenty of empty tables. We spoke to the manager and they brushed us off.   With that we headed downstairs (rather huffily) to Cucina Asellina for our dinner reservation at 7:30. I have to say the staff there are lovely and very attentive. We ate veal meatballs, baked aubergine, saffron strozzapreti… all very nice… but not amazing (I wouldn’t bother coming back and paying full price). Once we’d finished (and our huffy moods had disappeared) we decided to try the rooftop again for the friend that hadn’t seen it already, AND for the cocktail included in our deal. Our waitress checked that it would be ok so we paid up and headed for the lift.    Rude clipboard woman strikes again!!!!!! Fully aware that we were there waiting for the lift she let a group of people into the lift before us and then declared that there was no room for us and we would not be able to go up to the bar. The manager of Cucina was very kind and sympathetic but couldn’t (or wouldn’t?) offer us anything of interest. By that point we were completely hacked off and we ended up leaving.   In short, nice views (if you can get up there!) but perhaps Radio Rooftop Bar need to remember that they are not the only rooftop bar in London, and in my experience they are certainly not the best!! I’m surprised at the treatment we received from ME Hotel, with it being a new hotel. Wouldn’t bother to visit again.

title: great venue, beautiful balcony with views
comment: Radio Bar A contemporary design with a superb choice of cocktails and other drinks. Only dislike, staff slow not enough staff to mix, only one person making cocktails with a list to go through.. but when they arrived it was delicious!

title: A view worth waiting for, shame about the service this time.
comment: This was my second time visiting the Radio Rooftop Bar on a Saturday. First time I did not have to queue (was a over case day with random showers) but this time I did (was a sunny day).  Its worth either getting there early to skip the queue or to pre-book to avoid the wait. We only had to wait 20min before we was aloud up to the 10th floor to have a roof top view of London on a sunny day. The only bad part about this place is its service. We walked up to the bar to make eye contact with some of the staff and still be ignored. When I tried to get one of their attentions verbally (to see if we ordered at the bar like I did on my first visit or if it was table service) I was still ignored. Finally, I got the attention of a member of staff who sent someone over to our table to serve use. I would go back again to see if it was just an off day they was having, plus the view canceled out the bad service.

title: Confused
comment: We came on a Friday night looking to have drinks in radio. Had been told we may have to queue, but this didn't bother us as it was a special birthday night out. However then to be told that you can't go to radio unless you have booked and is best to book a week in advance. Haven't seen this on any website. And none of my friends have had this happen there before. Pretty gutted as had been waiting to go for a while. Staff not that helpful. Unimpressed really. Thinking twice whether to go bk. had a few drinks in stk. great barman. Nice cocktails. But all in all. Letdown ! When asked how to book. They had no business cards with numbers or anything on. So they said to pretty much sort it. Or ring the restaurant and get transferred. Not that professional.

title: Shockingly bad
comment: Be prepared to be greeted by the rudest staff that you're likely to meet in London. For somewhere that aspires for a 5-star experience, the treatment you get from those that work here couldn't be further away.  The bouncer on the door couldn't even lift his eyes from his mobile phone when we arrived. The best he could manage was to point at the pavement whilst grunting 'Wait there'. He was clearly a man of few words (and even fewer manners). Next, he aggressively asked if we had a reservation. Replying that we hadn't realised we needed one (it was mid-afternoon), he simply barked 'We're full'.  Having since read other reviews of this place, it sounds like such experience is commonplace. So it turns out this guy did us a big favour. So the one star is for that.

title: Will there be a chance of drinking on the Rooftop Bar without being a resident?
comment: The immediate impression of the hotel is fantastic - with the lobby, downstairs bar and restaurant looking amazing. However the purpose of our visit was to drink on the rooftop bar at around 5.30pm. I noticed a lot of people had the same intention and it was quite clear from approaching the lifts to reach the rooftop bar that a lady with a clipboard was checking to see if you were on the list. It was clear there was no chance of being able to visit the rooftop bar as as soon as we said we have come here for the bar. We were immediately told there is a two hour wait, so we decided to go for a two hour drink in the downstairs lobby bar called STK. After the two hours were up we went back to the lady at the lifts to be told there was again a two hour wait and that you can not book. Can somebody please explain how you get to drink on the roof top bar? The cynical side of me suggests the lady at the lifts with the clipboard was scripted to tell potential customers the same 'two hour wait' regardless of what time you turned up, and that if you were on the 'list' you were ok. I totally understand residents should have rights to use the bar, but surely there is a waiting list you can be put on, or you should be able to book ahead? I'd hate to think if you surpirsed someone for a date (as one website put it as being a perfect place for), that your date plans would be scuppered. Or you wanted to go with friends for some special occasion that best laid plans would fall through! May be its because it's new but I think some organised system needs to be put in place.

title: Roof top bar - great space - at time of writing
comment: We were on the Strand & could see people out on the top of the hotel so just popped in for a cocktail on a sunny day to try the bar so no views on the rooms. Without having really seen much about it beforehand, we assumed this hotel was part of a Spanish based operation because having stayed in a few boutique hotels in Spain that was the immediate impression (& all the better for it). To English eyes, it does feel a bit "over designed" but it is worth seeing. Getting to the bar was a bit complicated. Having gone straight to the lifts & realising we needed a pass to get to the top floor, we asked one of the staff who very helpfully retrieved a pass from the concierge & gave us access.
