It is lovely up there & again, on a sunny day, felt like we were sitting in Madrid. So noting management are looking at these reviews - it took an age for our drinks to arrive. I can't particularly blame the staff - it wasn't busy & there were plenty of them - it just seemed the barman was a bit overwhelmed by himself & doing a cocktail was a bit more complicated so took longer. Also not sure how access to the bar for non-residents will work when things are a bit busier. Do you queue at the lifts? Will return for lunch up there depending on weather - the selection didn't look extensive (statutory burger etc) but will try it. I'd go now though - could be a different story if it's busier.

title: London needs more of this....
comment: Turned up here completely randomly to meet some friends before for a surprise lunch for my partner. Had a few hiccups on the way in as the hotel reception is on the first floor and the chap on the door didn't tell us you needed a special key to get into the bar. Thus we had a few confused minutes in the lift but if you are going to get stuck in a lift this is the right sort of lift to do it in.  Despite this though and the fact it was drizzling, I've got to say I was immediately blown away. Its got the swank factor whilst being somewhere you can chill out and relax even with 2 hyperactive kids. Great, alternative vista of the Thames and what a roof terrace. The whole bar has an amazing ambience, definitely the closest I have come to Ibiza without getting on a plane.  Decent mix of clientele although we did have a few people turning their noses up at our young kids clambering around the place and a group of 4 people who should have known better pushed past us to get in the lift when we left. This is something the hotel though cannot control.  I have to say I am very surprised at the reviews criticising the service. Once we got in the bar this was perfect. All the different staff were friendly and attentitive throughout our stay.  Would have liked to try more of the food as my daughter absolutely loved the whitebait.  I will be going back ASAP. This will be a great place to spend a sunny afternoon with your mates, family or entertaining clients.

title: Disappointed
comment: My husband & I decided to visit the Radio bar on Wednesday, unfortunately a fashion show was taking place & we were unable to visit the bar. I had also made enquiries about reserving an area on Saturday 27th as I was celebrating my birthday- I was told there was no need to reserve an area as we were visiting @ 4pm on a Saturday afternoon and it would not be busy until early evening. My friends and I arrived on Saturday @ 4pm only to be told by the host that there was a 2 hour wait to get up to the Radio Bar!!! The host was unsure as to whether there was a policy in place!!! Many people were gathering in reception to visit the Radio Bar- clearly no policy in place, lack of communication amongst staff- very disappointed. 2 attempts at visiting the Radio bar- no booking procedures in place-would not recommend anyone visiting however great the reviews are!!!!

title: Shambles
comment: Having read the various reviews of the Radio Rooftop Bar, I telephoned in the morning to make a reservation. I was told that no reservations were taken until 9pm, but if we came along we should get a seat, or if it was full we could wait a short time in the hotel bar and get a seat once some became free. So - an hour and a half trip for the family - and met by a man in the doorway who referred us to the hostess. There was already an animated group with the hostess, who had done the same as me, and she was telling them that there was no room in the bar, as it had already been fully reserved. They had done the same as us and phoned ahead and couldn't understand how it had been reserved, when they were told you couldn't reserve. I got the same story, so asked if we could wait in the bar until a place became free. She told me that couldn't be done, but we should try and come back in two hours (we got there at 4pm), but couldn't be promised a place. There were groups of people coming after us, who had done exactly the same - so lots of disappointed potential customers. We did go back about an hour an a half later and again followed a queue of people being turned away. By this time the poor hostess looked shell shocked, didn't recognise me from our earlier visit and gave me the exact same line and told me to come back in another two hours. Very shabby treatment. We only saw the reception area, that looked very slick. We eventually went to Madisons Bar and Tapas grill that overlooks St. Pauls - stunning.

title: Don't bother
comment: I was told by the bar I was unable to reserve and so, when we turned up, they were so full that we had to go somewhere else. We managed to get in another time and almost wish we hadn't. Although the views are good, they are not the best in London and you can definitely get the same if not better views at a cheaper place. The staff are incredibly pretentious, rude and inefficient. The cocktail makers were a bit more friendly but the cocktails are expensive (around £12).  Will not be going back.

title: Stunning views, shame about the non-existent service 'service charge'.
comment: I arranged to meet some friends here last night. We had been told that you cannot make a reservation before 9pm. Needless to say when we arrived at the lobby at 6pm we were told 'sorry but the bar has been book for a private function'.  We went elsewhere and decided to try our luck by coming back after 9pm and after a 10 minute wait in the downstairs bar were told we could go up. The views were amazing, as were the lovely lounging chairs with warm blankets to wrap oneself in but the service was non existent. We ended up going to the bar twice, and the barman charged the 12.5% service charge for the privilege! (no mention of it being optional or a receipt stating as such, which I am sure is not legal) I have no gripe paying a service charge when there is good service, but when there isn't and you have to end up going to the bar yourself it is blatant profiteering.

title: Embarrasing Experience...
comment: Last Sunday I went for a drink to The Radio Rooftop Bar with my parents, who were visiting me in London, and my partner. It was a special day because I was indroducing my partner to my parents and he suggested to go to this place. It was our first time going to this place but we didnt hesitate to go as we heard about the breathtaking views that the bar offers. I have to say that the place is just amazing, very modern and elegant decoration and the terrace is just exclusive; the views are impressive; however, these good aspects were not enough..the service spoilt the whole experience. When we arrived, no hostess came to receive us, we waited for some minutes till my partner finally catched one of them. We were seated in a lovely table in the inside part in one of the corners, the only thing is that we were seated when the table was still dirty and with empty glasses from the previous guests. That detail just made me feel embarrased and disappointed. I would have not mind to wait a couple of minutes while they cleaned the table None of that was done. Not a good start. we waited 10 minutes to get the menu and 15 minutes to order. I asked for the table to be cleaned (that is not something that should happend in a 5-star hotel). After being waiting for around 20 minutes for our drinks my partner tried to get the atention of one of the waitresses who went to check what was going on with our drinks...she came back telling me that they ran out of one of the ingredients for one of the cocktails so I had to change the order. The drinks finally arrived after 30 minutes since we order the firs time, I think it is not a big deal to make two cocktails, a gin and tonic and a spresso...The cocktails were not wow and the gintonic came already mix (no tonic on the side). Nobody came to ask how was everything or if we needed anything else...poor service again. Our empty glasses were on top of the table for a long time, so we didnt even think about a second round. I left the place very sad and upset, my espectations about the place just fell down and the fact that I took my parents there because of my partner recomendation, just made us feel so embarrased. I do hope a change in the service for this bar because hospitality is not just about the place but the people, the service.

title: WOW!!!!!
comment: Planning a day in London to celebrate our son's 21st birthday, I was looking for a rooftop bar and chanced upon the ME London. The photos on the website looked amazing so I telephoned and asked to book a table on the rooftop terrace and to have a bottle of champagne on ice as a surprise. When we arrived and gave our name to one of the staff we were taken out onto the terrace where a cabana had been reserved for us, the champagne was on ice and four glasses were ready and waiting. My son was speechless! The view is unbelievable and the staff superb. We simply could not have chosen a better venue for our special day.

title: Poor service and mediocre views
comment: We visited on a Monday bank holiday. The service was very poor and there is no one to meet guests as you arrive. We had to ask for menus, there is very little staff, and those we did interact with were rude! We found people ordering drinks at the bar as it was the only way to get served. The views were not as good as The Skylounge, Hilton, Tower Bridge or Window's at Galvin, for a bar to charge the same amount as these two bars then I would describe this as shocking, we work in the city and have been to many bars and restaurants in London, this bar was a disappointment

title: Birthday spoilt
comment: I rang the to arrange my daughters birthday, as she wanted to go to the rooftop bar for champagne and cocktails, after many times of trying to speak to someone, I was told that I could not book, but it opened at 5 pm on Sunday, and would get a table, we got there at 4pm and was told to put our name on a list, we sat there waiting only to be later that we would not be able to go there tonight, despite other people being let in. I asked to speak to the manager, who had no idea how to speak to a very disappointed group of people. I can't tell you if the view or cocktails are good or not, what I can say is that the customer service was appalling We went off to the sky lounge where the view was amazing the service was exceptional and all the staff were first class, to the birthday girl, ME bar does not deserve anyone to spend their money there, clueless about service.

title: Truly terrible service from a "5 star" establishment
comment: We wrote the following letter to the manager of this hotel after a terrible experience one week ago and he has not even made the effort to respond: Dear Mr Gallo Having booked a cocktail in the rooftop bar and 3 course meal through Bookatable for last night, we were anticipating a memorable experience, and this was certainly the case, but for all the wrong reasons. We entered the hotel lobby only to be escorted back out into the cold to reenter 20 metres up the street to the sound of crashing plates and the sight of food spread all over the floor. It was not a good start. But worse was yet to come. We were ushered back to the lobby we had originally attempted to enter and were faced with a young inexperienced ear-pieced "host" who informed us with a superficial smile that there was no room for us in the rooftop bar, despite having reconfirmed our booking there 30 minutes previously by phone. No attempt was made to accommodate us nor were we given any indication of how long we would need to wait. We were advised to stay in the corridor and it was pointed out that the small print of the offer allowed for this eventuality. This did not seem an adequate way for a 5 star hotel to treat its guests. When we voiced our unhappiness we were met with standard call-centre responses such as "I understand what you are saying" and "I can understand your frustration" but no resolution or helpful advice of any kind. We asked to speak to a manager and instead were given another "host" who reiterated identical responses and maintained he had no power to help us, and lacked the imagination to even offer us a complimentary drink. By now we had been waiting for 30 minutes. We asked again to speak with the manager and decided to sit at the lobby bar and order a drink. Eventually another young inexperienced staff member appeared. He did not give us his name or job title and merely reiterated the same story, saying that someone would come and get us when a table was ready. Half an hour later noone had bothered to check on us, so we left in disgust having had our evening ruined, hungry and deeply disappointed by the experience. The lack of customer care was shocking and inexcusable, particularly for a 5 star hotel, and neither of us had ever experienced anything like it before. In our jobs as a journalist and a finance director we regularly stay at luxury hotels around the world. This is by far the worst experience either of us has had. Before posting our experience on Trip Advisor, we would like to give you the opportunity to prove that this was an unfortunate one-off lapse and we look forward to hearing how you plan to restore our faith in your establishment.

title: Loved loved loved the rooftop bar..
comment: We did not stay in the hotel so this is just a review of the rooftop bar. We visited a few days ago and found the views to be exceptional. I can just imagine that during warmer days this venue will be packed out. Although it was a cold day the heating was on outside and the seating area was nicely furnished.  The service as great with a lovely young man answering all our questions with patience and good grace. Swedish although i thought he was Irish... I noticed that people were ordering bar snacks which looked great! Too bad we only stayed for a brief while but I for one cannot wait to return.  I just hope it does not become to pretentious.... Good luck to all work there.

title: Radio Bar
comment: Looks like it's going to need Summer to hit before this venue becomes one...put our names down on the guest list...the hosts forgot we were there so didn't advise us when we could go up. The bartender upstairs in the actual venue was fab and knew his stuff, but the female bartender at the downstairs does not know anything about the art of free-pouring. Our drinks were undrinkably strong! Hopefully these are just growing pains, and that this place works out the kinks before summer really hits, as we'd like to go back and tryo out the rooftop terrace!

title: Such a shame some of the staff have poor customer service!
comment: My review is a very mixed review, we started off the afternoon in the lobby bar as the roof terrace was full we were put onto a waiting list and given a time of 35 minutes.The lobby bar is lovely great staff and great service, however the people in charge of the rooftop waiting list are not so good, we ended up waiting 21/2 hours to go up to the top, in the end the waiter in the lobby bar was so embarrassed that other tables were given priority over us as, they had arrived much later then we had into the lobby bar ( i do know that there is a guest list but I know for a fact that one large group hadn't reserved as once we were on the roof terrace I asked them!) he took us straight to the lift and asked that we be taken up to the top, and the guy who had the waiting list turned to me and said we are the people responsible for you entry to the roof not the waiters in the bar..... Once up on the roof terrace it was quite empty all the outside tables were empty and around 7 tables inside were free, we asked the bar man which table to sit at and was shown to a table with reserved on, we did question this and was told that they would need the table back by 9pm which was fine with us. we ordered food and drinks and was having a great time until one of the roof top waiting list people ( sorry not sure if the have an official title! ) came at 8.05pm and told us we had to leave the table, as the guests had arrived and wanted to be seated. we were so shocked we were not offered any other table or seating area. I think that the waiters and and bar staff are great and do a fantastic job, the other staff members are very poor. I don't actually think that they know what customer service is, We spent between the 2 bars over £300 we were so upset we paid and left, I did however refuse to pay the service charge as I felt we had been treated extremely poorly. I know its a new bar, hopefully management will invest in training there staff members, as for 5 star its very poor!

title: Only a review of the Rooftop Radio bar - terrible
comment: I wanted to write a review of the service I received here as it was so disappointing and the staff were so inadequate. As I had been warned the bar was "first come first serve", I arrived 45 minutes in advance of a party I was with to wait for a table. I was told by the hostess that it would be around 20-30 minutes, although she couldn't exactly say when, and she took my name down. I would like to point out this was mid-afternoon, not a busy evening. One hour later, I was still sitting in a cold lobby, the hostess had forgotten I was there and had not approached me or the other people waiting once to reassure us. I don't mind waiting, if I had been kept informed or thought that the hostess was in control of the situation - she clearly wasn't. We left in disgust after 1 hour 10 minutes of waiting and being ignored. In summary, its not worth the time wasted going here - there are plenty of other good rooftop bars in London with friendly and prompt service!

title: Amazing
comment: Went to the radio rooftop bar for drinks and snacks, the hotel is stunning, the view of London from the terrace is breath taking, definitely one of the best in London. Staff are wonderful, and you MUST try the wagu beef sliders, I have never eaten such an outstanding mini burger. Cannot say enough good things. You'll find the hotel down the aldwych end of the strand, it's the big building in the middle when the road forks.

title: Appalling Service -Terrible
comment: I would like to start with the hotel which really is beautiful in a perfect prime location in London. You can see the rate i have given as i am not a grumpy person. Reason i have given this place a terrible rate is because the lack of respect we were given, we were a group of 10 people with a mix of men and women, we wanted a chilled out night with a bit of talking and laughter as a friend from pakistan had come over and wanted to see how the night life was in london - i was recommended by a friend who said the bar area is extreamely wonderful on the roof-tops. As we came to enter in to go upstaires we were struck by 2bouncers and club manager who said he was the manager which i did not think he was and advised we are not allowed in as it was at full capacity which the time we arrived was 7:45pm which is very early for any bar to be full, we explained and begged to let us in as it was cold outside and our original plan was to come here to this 5 star hotel, but they were just being rude and telling us your not coming in 'so please stand away from the entrance' which i was hurt by that very comment. As we walked away i over heard what they said 'DO NOT LET ANY ASIANS IN' i was gob-smacked by this RACIST comment they made. I will never come back to this hotel and i will spread the word to my friends not to come to this place ever again. I will be sending a complaint letter to the manager of the hotel in the coming days. PLEASE AVOID THIS HOTEL - VERY BAD SERVICE

title: Worst Place In Lonson!
comment: Arrived at the hotel to attend a birthday party at the bar. The host had tried to book an area in the bar but was advised to arrive early as they do not take booking, the host arrived with a few guests and was turned away for no apparent reason, they also arrived early and although he had a suite in the hotel was still spoken to very rudely and was still turned away. The customer service was non existent as well as unacceptable, If you would like to have a good night in the city DO NOT GO HERE!

title: Five out of five, but for the 'host' of the rooftop bar
comment: Just visited ME London for the third time on 15th March. Previously just for drinks, but this time we ate in STK for a friend's birthday. We had been keen to visit the rooftop bar (it had been too busy on previous occasions) so we asked the bar waitress if she could reserve a table for after dinner. She had been helpful throughout, serving and recommending some great cocktails and confirmed a table was booked upstairs. We headed to the restaurant for a fantastic meal...great service lovely food and the sort of music that makes you want to stay until the early hours. Reasonably priced for the quality of food and wine. We had a couple of reasons for wanting to visit the rooftop bar...looked great in photos so were keen on corporate hire and a looming 40th birthday. So, we strolled along and met an apparently pleasant chap who was the 'host' of the rooftop bar. We said that we had a booking, made by STK restaurant in our name. At this point the attitude changed. This chap with the previously welcoming smile, decided to tell us "I don't think so, nobody from STK had been out to speak to us!'". He had no interest in listening to us. We tried to explain the booking, but to no avail with this 'host'.  In our years of staying in and enjoying the great service of many hotels and restaurants of equal and higher standing, I have never come across someone who has questioned someone's honesty in such a sneering way. The laugh of 'I don't think so' grated on me the whole way home. You would think the 'host' owned the bar/hotel. Goodness knows what business he is turning away. I will visit STK again and perhaps have a look to see if that host is still hosting again, before deciding if i will spend money in the rooftop bar.  His 5 minutes of 'jumped up....' manner spoiled an otherwise perfect evening for the birthday girl, I can understand that the bar has attracted a great following so early on, but a booking made within the hotel should be honoured or at least investigated and this chap's attitude is not one that I would wish to be associated with a corporate or birthday hire.  Anyway, we popped across the road for a perfectly friendly cocktail, albeit without the view, to placate the anger.

title: Terrible booking service
comment: I tried to book the new Radio Rooftop bar for a small party of guests on a Saturday night for a special event. The events person I spoke to was so unhelpful and unaccommodating that we are going elsewhere. Such a shame as the bar looks lovely. It has left me and my friends with a very bad impression and we won't be trying here again.

title: Spectacular Roof Terrace - Thumbs up to Radio Bar
comment: I will clarify upfront that I have not stayed here yet but have looked at the rooms on a special tour and would suggest that anyone staying in London with the budget should not skimp and jump in all feet and book a terrace room overlooking the Thames as its a view to gaze for hours at with a drink in hand. Those not staying should venture through reception and ask for access to Radio Bar ( access does require either a room key or concierge key but don't hesitate to be authoritative about asking to be swiped up to bar as this is usual practice) A big hint here is that due to popularity you really need to be in by 5pm as otherwise as things heat up they put in a waiting system in the lobby bar allowing access only when room available. The terrace has fabulous view - a real treat to see the sun set and have a few sliders - food very tasty too...This is going to be a huge hot spot in the summer - reservations can be made for bottle service so if you say you are goign to drink a few bottles of wine etc there is every chance you can walk in later and bypass ques.  Assellina the Italian restaurant is fabulous - good prices, great service and food cooked to order - we skipped desert to have a glass of champagne on the roof and coffee.

title: Excellent View and very stylish rooftop bar
comment: What a dramatic entrance lobby - the flower arrangement by the lifts was stunning and really showed up against the black marble walls. Everything is chrome and black. We went up to the Radio rooftop bar for some lunch. It was very quiet but the views were excellent. The outside area will be great in warm weather and has lovely seating areas with outdoor heaters. The service was good but our meal a little disappointing. It was rather cold when it arrived at the table - I am not sure where the kitchen is but if it has come up from the ground floor where the other 2 restaurants are then that might explain it. The waitress told us that the Salt Beef on Rye was rather dry so would we like thinner cut bread - the bread was thinner but the sandwich still very dry. I am surprised that the kitchen have not rectified this as the waitress said most people complained that it was too dry. The desserts were good but one came as the wrong order and had to be changed. Whilst the staff in the bar were very pleasant they seemed a little inexperienced and not to have the professional finish that one would expect in a hotel of this calibre.

title: High dining indeed!
comment: We had lunch. The sea bream was superb. The service was really friendly but slightly chaotic. The view is fascinating - take a Londoner to point out the main sights (I'm happy to volunteer for you). Will be lovely in summer to sit on the wide terrace.  A tip - check in at the lobby desk on the ground floor as soon as you arrive as they need to give you access to the lift.

title: Fantastic view shame about staff
comment: The rooftop bar is fantastic, the views are amazing, furnishings great and drinks good. Shame about the staff or their briefing. Arrived on time for a party but not allowed up to the roof until we could confirm our hosts were there. Unfortunately our super powers do not extend to seeing up 10 floors of a building so had to wait until our hosts arrived. In meantime our greeter thought it necessary to share with us that we had to spend £50 each. So no discretion there. The greeter was admittedly quite pretty but had no idea of customer service, basic manners or how to deal with queries. She chewed gum, could not count and I suppose was just thick. When we eventually were allowed upstairs the drinks took ages to arrive - suggest they take some bodyguards off security and get them mixing the cocktails as otherwise will take will take time to get to £50 each! Would love to recommend it but would be embarrassed to with the "clip board nazis", thick staff and the charges Was a great relief to go for dinner elsewhere and receive great service. Suggestion retrain your staff and until you really are exclusive don't act like you are

title: Great service and amazing view
comment: We visited the hotel on a sunny day to enjoy the views from their famous roof terrace. Usually we don't take time to write reviews but we had such a good experience that we wanted to share it. The cocktails were excellent, not too pricy, the view is amazing and above all, the service we got was quite unique (thanks to Adrian, the guest manager who was very helpful, professional and nice, putting us in a perfect mood from the start). Definitely a place we will recommend to friends and colleagues.

title: Very Disappointing!
comment: We were really looking forward to birthday drinks in the roof top bar on Saturday. Added bonus as it was a glorious day. Unfortunately you are not able to reserve an area. We arrived about 3pm hoping that the lunch time rush would have abated, but we were told that there was a two hour wait and we could have a drink in the downstairs bar. We decided to wait and orderd a bottle of champagne. After seeing several people come in behind us and go straight up to the roof bar, we were told we could now go up. We paid the bill before leaving the downstairs bar, but were changed an extra £10 on top of the price of the £80 bottle of champagne for service charge. If I have received good service I would have absolutely no hesitation paying this, but the champagne was just left on the table without an ice bucket and the water we asked for never materialised. So the service was in fact just for bringing over the the drinks. We expressed our surprise at the service charge but the young girl who served us said that there was nothing she could do about it as the manager wasn't available. Not wishing to appear 'tight' we just paid the bill and went upstairs. When we arrived upstairs, the outside area was busy, but there is also a very nice bar before you reach the outside area that was practically empty, so we have absolutely no idea why we were not able to go straight to the bar without having a drink downstairs first. The service upstairs was equally as shocking. We asked for water 3 times and it only arrived on the 3rd time (obviously the champagne arrived on time!). Nontheless, the views were amazing, and there was a DJ, giving a holiday vibe. The roof terrace is worth a visit (if you are allowed up there), but certainly not expect 5* service.

title: Stunning location and views, staff need a little more training..
comment: To all intents this should be much higher up the pecking order on TA. A stunning rooftop location, with views over London to die for. The food was ordered with a side of rocket and parmezan, quite how this relates to broccoli I am not sure, that added with a mixed up drinks order left a mixed opinion of this place. Would I come back, yes I guess I would as it is impressive to take people to, but mamagement, please take a note of the numerous reviews of your service, this is seriously letting you down..

title: VIP treatment
comment: We've been to Radio a couple times now. Each time the service has been great. Staff now knows me by name and I get treated like a VIP every time I go. Amazing cocktails and the food is a surprise. Much better than we expected in a lounge setting. Door can be tough, Reservations are recommended.
